Comments: Too often, iconic signature hotels prove to be a disappointment - this definitely wasn't the case at MBS. The hotel is stunning and the service was impeccable. We'd booked to have an Orchid suite so had the advantage of quick check in and access to the Club Lounge. On arrival we found we'd been upgraded to a Sands suite which was fantastic. Superb views of Gardens on The Bay and we even had a pool table in our suite. The pool was as spectacular as it looks in photos - and when we visited just before Christmas, it wasn't too busy. We easily got pool side loungers. The service in the club lounge was some of the best we've ever experienced. All in all we couldn't fault MBS and hope to return.

Great hotel to stay in if you are coming to Singapore for a holidays or even a short staycation for Singaporean. The service from the receptionist, porters, security personnel, cleaners basically every staffs who saw you, they will greet you with a smile. It is not easy to make every single staff in the hotel to do this.   The only challenge is that when you want to go for supper, the surrounding area had nothing much to eat as you need to travel quite a distance out and the hotel room price is abit high for some commoners to try it. To me why you paying this rate is because of the fantastic location and greats views you can see in the day and night, by over looking the Garden by the bay, Singapore river, esplanade,boat quay,clarke q etc..

Incredible place. Let us check in early and we had an amazing room on the 44th floor. Swimming pool was incredible and whilst busy (and the hotel was full) we always found a sunbed and managed to get drinks relatively easily. Breakfast was noisy but very slick service and lovely food. The sky bar on the 57th floor is great as is Adrift restaurant. The gym is well equipped with two Olympic bars and treadmills facing the city on the 55th floor!   Only bad thing was that we had to leave!

Being a Singaporean based abroad, it is rare that I ever stay in hotels when I return home.   We were treated to a night at MBS as a gift and we were upgraded to a city view room overlooking the marina bay financial district, the Fullerton hotel, the esplanade and the rest of Singapore's skyline.  The view was incredible.... The infinity pool provided an incredible experience that lived up to the photos I had seen and the stories I have heard from other people's experiences.   Will be back if we can. Won't be anytime soon. But would be an awesome experience for anyone.

Transit in Singapore for 1 night at the orchid suite :  Pros ：  1. Lobby looks great 2. Concierge services is good 3. Bellboy is good 4. Rise restaurant at lobby is good (plenty of choices) 5. Amazing scene at Sky 57 5. Bath pressure is good 6. Windows curtain is good 7. Sleep quality is good 8. Pool table in the room is good 9. Shopping centre next door 10. Attraction next door  Cons:   1. Living area in suite room is too simple as like a 3 - 4 star apartment.  2. Sky 57 is the worst breakfast experience      a. Lack of choices for breakfast (like apartment breakfast)     b. All the tea spoon hidden      c. The ladies serving like day dream, they not even can find a place, and finally we    need to show them the empty seat.     d. The only guy at the open area should have more…

Excellent check-in. Décor is starting to age a bit, but still maintained well and the huge Christmas tree was very nice to see in Asia during the festive season. Rooms excellent as usual. Deck on the top floor very crowded, but well maintained. View still phenomenal. Restaurants were very good. Bar crowded but good. Overall still an excellent choice, even if competition is offering other excellent places to stay as well.

Great hotel, excellent location! We stayed here for 2 nights and had a wonderful time if you don't want to explore the city or have been to Singapore before the restaurant choices at the hotel should cover everyone's tastes as well as the different bar scenes. The pool is amazing and one to tick off the bucket list, the shopping is close by and the food court in the mall had some nice choices. If you haven't seen the gardens by the sea it is well worth the stroll across the road.

We went to the roof-top pub in Marina Bay sands. The view from here was magical. There were interesting options for cocktails and super friendly staff. We did not have access to the pool, since that is open for people who are residing in the hotel itself.

Never stay at the hotel buy always one of my destination to visit whenever i am in sg beside ion orchard. Good priveleges for foreigners as well as loads of awesome exhibitions. Beside exhibitions, there is a casino as well as a theater so loads of stuffs to do here. U gotta make the mbs membership, it allows u to get discounts as well as collect points/dollars that can be used for loads of things, one of them is free parking/valet!! The current promo that they are having is 100 dollar vouchers for every 1000 dollar purchase (limited to 60 a day) till the end of 31 dec 2015...so i guess...my fellow shoppers....shopping spree time!!

This place is a joke. I'd booked it for my husband's birthday as he wanted a nice family photo in the infinity pool. We lined up to check in for about 30 minutes! Then we lined up to get a seat by the pool. Then we lined up for the tiny jacuzzi with about 50 people jammed into it. You line up for the elevators, for breakfast, to check-in, to check-out, and pretty much everything else. We felt cattle being shunted around in here.There are crowds literally EVERYWHERE!  The Infinity Pool has a pretty lame and sparse menu so you'd better enjoy Club Sandwiches. For what you pay here, you'd receive amazing service at pretty much any other hotel. The upside was the room - we were on the 45th floor and the view was amazing. Done it once, won't be coming back here again...

The hotel is excellent, service is excellent, the buffet lunch in the ground floor restaurant is very good value for a hotel meal. Free access to rooftop garden and pool, saves you a visit to the eye Ferris wheel. Views from either side of hotel magnificent.but garden side lets you view nitetimeshows of floowwoer garden from comfort.Access to shopping mall and railway under cover. You could spend almost your entire holiday in airconditioned comfort if you stay at marina bay sands. Loved it so much, have stayed twice and my wife hs been 3 times

The hotel is not cheap.  However, the general feeling was the hotel operated like a mass production service.  Check in took a long time (30-40 mins), the main attraction (infinity pool) was overloaded with people and I mean over loaded (I live in Hong Kong). In reflection, I think the whole purpose of the hotel itself was for people to stay there and get a selfie in the pool, and sure there were magnificent city views. Also the lifts were constantly full.  We stayed on the 33-34th floors in Towers 3 and also rooms in Tower 2.  It could take up to 15 minutes to get down during check in and check out times, breakfast etc... Not the relaxing city getaway we were hoping for, instead we got a battle and much too busy experience for a price that we would never pay for again.

The best experience out of all my precious Hotel experiences. Expensive but a great value for money Infinity pool is a Must and a lifetime experience .. Take-care you cant access the pool unless you are a n Hotel Guest.  .  Casino was so Nice  Mall and restaurants were elegant and really nice covering all the varieties

Awesome!   It offers great view of the city, top of the line amenities and quality service!   Simply the best in Singapore!   I love the spacious rooms and comfortable beds.  I stayed here with my Manulife PH team and we received a warm welcome. Nice treat to the Manulife family.   The Filipino staff are usually warm and welcoming.   If you have extra money, you may want to stay here. But not recommended if you are on a budget.   Just enjoy the night life in the area and watch the water and light show every night!

If MBS is a multi star hotel, I doubt it worth it, even I am a Singaporean. I will find Pan Pacific or Oriental or even Westin Stamford be a better choice.  It's a pricy trap or I should say a pricy stay for tourists. Shopping alone is a bomb, dining is a killer. Prices are at least double or triple from the outside given the same plate of food that you may find outside.  My worst impression was checking out the valet cashier. In house hotel guest supposed to enjoy flat rate 12$. Check out timing was at 12 and the valet counter was freaking packed, long queue. Was charged extra for the late car checkout. The cashier replied me that I was late, and I pointed out please see your queue. I'd checked out already. Cashier said, sir your waiting time in the queue wasn't that long…

Excellent view of The Gardens by the Bay from Bay side room, if you are looking relaxing time, must drinks Margarita in the pool, Sky park (Infinity Pool). Room service was exceller to. Near Mall and Museum. !!

Splendid infrastructure and amenities.  Did not managed to head to the roof due to bad weather.  Very posh and established.  Wandered to the casino just to have a look see but was confused and amazed at the layers of security.  Had to check in a knapsack but was told I had to finish the water in my water bottle. Had to check passports close to 6 times including checking in my bag and on the way out.  Other than that, nice establishment

Service from the staff has to be commended. The guys at the concierge were quick and efficient. The front desk staff were courteous. The waiters and waitresses at Sky on 57 were also very polite and courteous. The only comment i have for Sky on 57 was the loud instructions by the chef that can be heard in the dining area overlooking the city. The room we had was great, overlooking the Gardens by the Bay.   Access to the mall is very good. Lots of good places to wine and dine. Overall a good experience for me and the wife.

The room has a good overview of gardens by the bay.. Me and wife totally love it. Wanted to give a surprise to my wife as it was our wedding anniversary, I approached a staff named shiying who helped to surprise my wife with a Swan decoration with rose petals on the bed after we came back for a swim.. appreciate what she have done for us. Will definitely come back for stay vacation in the future!!

Central. Near Gardens by the Bay and Bayfront mrt station. Room service was excellent. I called at least 3 times, every time it arrived within 15mins.  Big, spacious and very clean room. With great views. Will go back for another staycation.

Stayed in the family suite which was amazing. The room is spacious with a king sized bed, two single beds, sofa settees, balcony, ... and a beautiful view of the Super Trees at the Gardens by the Bay. The swimming pool at the top of the building is breath-taking. Only downside was that the water in the pool is icy cold. Got to be really brave to take the first plunge and after the body adjusted to the temperature, it would be ok.

Will give this hotel a top rating if not for the LONG queue to check in and check out and incident at the rooftop pool where we cant find any towel when they suddenly closed the pool due to the storm. The staff told me and my family while we are still wet to go down to our own room to get the towel and dry up there as they cant give us the towel due to the towel booth is closed. I cant believed the staff dont have any spare towel in the storage room or staff room.

i have to wait for more than 2 hours for the room to be ready, the hotel last July was jumpacked! room has nothing special but its really clean! my room has a balcony facing the garden which made me satisfy. the pool was not as i expect it to be. i couldnt deny the fact that the hotel facade/ structure is very mindblowing.  note: it is a busy and crowded hotel so i would not recommend it to someone who's looking for a relax and quiet environment.

Be it the Gardens by the Bay view or the City view, even the most basic room is worth it. Spacious and has all the necessary frills to get your going.   The service is commendable. Quick, prompt and courteous.   Love the TWG tea selection.   Only issue I had was with the wifi, whereby you have to log in every time you enter the room, which is a hassle. The pillows could also be firmer.

awesome location if you have a room facing the lake! you can see the mer lion, and the laser light show from the french windows that run from wall to wall in the upper storey suites. you can request for a higher storey when you book or when you check in. i felt it was a waste of time to sleep while staying there.  but on the flip side, it is one of the most expensive hotels in singapore

We stayed in the club rooms which included a spacious room on the 20th floor with exceptional views of the the City as well as the sea, access to the breakfast, tea and afternoon drinks at the club house located on the 55th floor, and to the infinity pool on the 57th floor.   If you are a foodie you will enjoy this package as they change the menu for tea every single day. There are a variety of choices for all meals and the chefs are very creative. Drinks were included which meant a variety of alcoholic beverages including champagne.   The Room was comfortable although the bed was a bit too stiff for me. Complementary tea and coffee was available but all items in the fridge were priced. Be wary of taking any drinks from the fridge as they use a sensor to detect if any drinks…

Positive Feedback: - best infinity pool  - friendly staffs, great customer service - clean room, comfy bed and pillows, spacious room - modern hotel design   Negative Feedback: - expensive but worth it lol

We were encouraged to visit Marina Bay Sands by other visitors to Singapore but our experience was disappointing.  The complex is amazing from a distance and promised much.  Unfortunately on our arrival the Sky Bar was closed due to poor weather, but we were invited instead to the Club lounge, also on the 57th floor.  The views were expansive, but not that different from other viewpoints we had visited in Singapore.  The Club Lounge was open- but most of it was enclosed in scaffolding due to renovations taking place.  We were ushered to a narrow balcony, with a small table and no stools.  Having come this far we decided to order a drink- a beer and a Sangria came to $48!  A bit pricy at a stand up bar!  Anyway been there, done that- can only imagine what it costs to eat there!

If you can, get a room that allows you access to the club.We had a city view on the 49 floor it was spectacular. This hotel is exceptional and very unique.All the staff are amazing and made our time here very special

Honestly, I was expecting much more in terms of bedrooms. The building is something that deserves a visit as well as the pool, but to stay there is quite expensive for the experience since the rooms are not better than other offers in the town. So, if you can visit the pool try this alternative instead paying high amounts of money to sleep there!

Love the infinity pool but was very busy, really wasn't meant for swimming, more just for photos and a good view! The sky bar is super expensive as are the shops and food below. I was upgraded to a suite which was stunning and really enjoyed my stay here.

This was our 2nd stay here and we were just as impressed by the design, architecture, facilities and excellent service provided. Yes it is expensive but at least you feel that you got what you paid for and afterall luxury by it's very defination is expensive. The higher floors have less street noise and better views. The views from either side of the towers are amazing. Visit the infinity pool at night to enjoy the lights of the city. Treat yourself to at least a couple nights here. You know you are worth it.

The best hotel I stayed in ever. Simply, you can enjoy every moment and every place in this hotel. The restaurants, the pool, and shopping mall and even the loopy are above my expectation. The room, reception, and staff were unbelievable, you are in the right place.

Overall, our stay was okay. It was easy to check-in since most of the people responsible for it are Filipinos. One thing though, we paid so much money for the hotel but the room we got was kinda disappointing. It was small for the price. You would get a much more spacious room with breakfast buffets for much much less. Well, I can't blame them. We pay for the name of the hotel.  I enjoyed greatly the infinity pool. IT WAS AWESOME! Especially during sunrise and sunset. Although I had fun with the infinity pool, this is a one time deal for me. I would allot my money to something different rather than staying there again. If I become rich that's when I'd probably come back. Haha

The hotel is enormous, lush plants, rivers, cascades, bridges, various restaurants for all tastes, Casino, Museum and the most luxurious designer shops are ready to part you from you money and entertain you.  The rooms are excellent, with superb views and the staff are discreet, very polite and pleasant. The Infinity pool at the level 57 is a magical experience, view, palm trees and all, but the restaurant next door, is not really suited for the ones without a head for heights.  The price for your stay there is appropriate for the quality of this unforgettable place, which I strongly recommended.  I actually returned there soon after, just to enliven the experience.

Amazing as always. I think I have not written a review about it yet. So here goes...  I really hate the crowds here but their product is amazing. The view especially with the garden by the bay christmas special!  Staff are clearly overworked with the enormous crowds coming in but I think they are doing a great job!

If you spend any time in Singapore, spend at least one night at the Marina Bay Sands.  We had booked the Premier room with 2 x double bed of our family of room.  The room size is quite decent.  The hotel itself is massive and quite a bit of walking to do within the hotel itself :-) The Infinity Pool on the rooftop is marvelous.  Hang over the edge and view the skyline which is breathtaking.   The hotel is pricey but for our family of 4 it was worth it and part of our Singapore experience.

If you go to Singapore you have to stay here at least one night.  Incredible hotel.  Nice rooms.  Good food. Great location - park nearby for running and mall across the street has food court with decent local food.  But it is the swimming pool that makes this truly unique.  Nothing like it anywhere else.

First of all, the location is Great for going out and shopping. One thing that I appreciate is when the hotel management and talent recognise you are return guests, a small thing maybe but it shows that they appreciate your patronage enough to remember you have been before. This was my second stay. The check in was quick and easy, rooms ready upon arrival. The pool was my next stop where i spent hours each day! What a gorgeous pool!

Standard rooms are decently spacious, not the very best, the upgraded rooms we got were very spacious. Hotels is very clean, staff are friendly and professional, gym is nice big size and spa is great. Infinitely pool is amazingly beautiful. Breakfast selection is really really wide, with decent number catering to vegetarians. Very costly thou I must say, everything from the rooms to additional child for breakfast to the spa etc

If you have the opportunity to spend a few days at this hotel. It is amazing. I was there for a convention. So sorry for the ones who could not book this place. Great rooms, amazing services. The pool on the top of the world looking over downtown Singapore. OK, pricey say the least but we'll worth it. The gala facilities, awesome! Certainly the place to stay in Singapore.

The price really reflects the luxury! Escalators will take you right into a designer shopping centre. The infinity pool is magical at night! The rooms are so spacious... I'm sure I could have held a small party in the bathroom! The bell boys are really friendly and helpful and were so grateful for a tip. The hotel holds a light show every night and it's well worth watching. People were in awe of it. If you're looking for cheap eats and a more authentic vibe, then I highly recommend going to the Makansutra!! (Approx. 20 mins walking distance from hotel) Our taxi driver absolutely insisted on taking us here as opposed to going to China Town.

The Orchid suite is enormous and very comfortable. THE swimming pool certainly has the wow factor and is enjoyable when not very busy, especially thanks to the provision of a separate area for families with children. The marina/city views from the 24th floor are spectacular and truly unique. The club facilities on the topmost floor provide the few privileged executive guests with an oasis of quiet and calm and spare them the breakfast queues.  The restaurants are expensive and one can, in all honesty, eat better at the hawker stalls either on the food floor of the attached shopping mall, or, even better, at the open air ones at the other end of the bay by the National Opera. The hotel is an architectural conundrum. It is certainly impressive, vast, and has many other unique…

This is such an incredible Place to be. We were lucky and got an upgrate for a Suite in the 54th floor for free. the poolarea is amazing. If you go to singapore you NEED to stay there. This is an absolutly must do!

This hotel is busy and crowded, but the rooms are beautiful and the higher you go up the towers the less you hear. Our room was large and spacious with a great/relaxing bathroom. The bed was big and comfortable. Wifi is not included in the room and costs 20SD for 24 hours. You can get this refunded if you join the rewards scheme, but the desk isn't always open. The hotel is ideally located for the mall and casino but there isn't direct access to the Gardens By the Bay. The pool is stunning but crowded so it is lovely to go and see but isn't somewhere to spend the afternoon relaxing. All in all it is worth visiting but I wouldn't go back.

This is one of the more populare stays in Singapore. Their pool is world famous and over look the whole city. There are many pros and cons when you visit the most popular hotel in town. If you hit a day when it is not over crouded you are in luck 💞

We enjoyed staying at Marina Bay sands Hotel. Rooms are very clean. Room service twice a day and very good. Free wifi everywhere and you will have access to the sky park and the rooftop pool which is hell of an experience. The only negative point was that they didn't let us in the Casino, because they check your passport and certain countries passport holders are not permitted, which  was very very disappointing and to me a racist manner.

Visit MBS every year but my family still get excited whenever we plan our stay for the weekend.Sill prefer the room facing the sea with stunning view especially the night with fire work & magnificent skyline.The rooftop infinity is amazing,we just love it.Room service is abit expensive & we decide to rent a refrigerator & buy our beer & wine,food from cold storage which is located in the mall & chill our night in the room.Looking forward for our stay next year......

A staycation at MBS as a bday surprise for hubby. The rooms are very spacious. We were very excited about the infinity pool but it feels like you are at a tourist  spot super crowded with people!! They should have a swimming pool for people who actually want to enjoy a nice swim. For budget travellers, need to book much much in advance to get a value for your money.

I stayed at this hotel as I was attending a conference in Singapore . The hotel is amazing and has spectacular views from the amazing infinity pool, the room I had was a suite and very spacious and the staff are very attentive even though it is a huge hotel . Breakfast in the morning is very busy and you will have to cue to get into the restaurant which is a little annoying , but I would recommend a stay there as this was the only fault.

I left this hotel speechless. Staying in a City View room I could not have asked for anything more perfect. The View was amazing, the room was spotless and the staff were extremely friendly. This hotel truly made our Singapore adventure amazing. The pool is of course the highlight of the resort and we did spend most of the time gazing over the city from there. Thank you Mylene for your excellent hospitality.

We just had one night here as a stopover point en route to New Zealand. Chose the hotel purely on the brochure pictures of the infinity pool on the hotel roof. Our flight got into Singapore at 10.30am and we therefore arrived at the hotel around 11.30am - well before the normal check-in time of 3.00pm. We chose to pay an upgrade cost to have a city view club room (which we could have immediately) and this was well worth it. The benefits associated with the club room (which was huge) included afternoon tea,breakfast and evening drinks and canapes all taken at The Club on Floor 55. The service throughout the hotel was very good but we thought that the staff who served us at The Club were exceptional. The pool lived up to expectations and was fairly quiet during the day but a…

I had been waiting to stay in this expensive hotel and finally gotten my chance. The building structure with a ship on top of their three towers is of course the most attractive thing that would caught anybody's attention. The Infinity Pool was beautiful yet short, however it's not so bad, afterall it's for staycation, not expecting a large pool for Olympics.. Lol. However they have limited number of access to the pool per room then.  Reaching to Marina Bay Sands is convenient by train at Bayfront MRT Station. The shopping mall known as The Shoppes is also easily access through the connection and if you have loves for Brands then The Shoppes is definitely for you. There is the Gardens by The Bay which is also accessible from the hotel through a bridge. Beautiful place to go…

While we didn't get the full experience because of the forest fire (the sky was full of smoke), we had a great time at the Marina Bay. The pool and the bars on the roof are a must do. The overall complex is very luxurious. The restaurants are all good and the staff very friendly.

Visited MBS again this year . As usual everything seemed perfect from Valet Parking / Checkin to Dining and room service. The only blooper was a torn towel (it had a big big hole , not to be missed ) , I didn't complain though. But I was definitely shocked to see it. Apart from that breakfast buffet always remains my favorite . I only wish that they had same spread at 57th as at rise. Further I think they need to be a bit particular about not allowing guests to jump into infinity pool , with T-Shirts and Shorts on. A proper swimming attire should be a must. All in All enjoyed  great hospitality and a pleasurable stay.

Such an awesome hotel,amazing views from the stunning infinity pool on the 57th floor.  It may be expensive but it's worth every penny.  the staff are amazing and can't do enough for you,the poolside staff remember your name and ask about your trip even if they haven't seen you for a couple of days. Such a relaxed atmosphere,can't fault it and I can't wait to go back. The must place to stay

This had to be one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in yet. My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights there for our anniversary and it was one of the best trips we have done. I will say this place is not for those looking for a budget vacation by any means. I also strongly recommend getting a club room with a city view as it really makes it worth while.  The infinity pool on the roof is everything it is hyped up to be with an amazing view of the city and just an experience like no other it is definitely worth staying in this hotel just for that alone. There are tons of restaurants throughout the hotel that are also fantastic. Along with Spago by Wolfgang Puck, which has amazing food is on the rooftop as well. I'd strongly recommend their Angus Beef hamburger.  As we stayed in a club…

Even though you cannot access the infinity pool, Marina bay sky deck is a perfect place to view the skyline of Singapore. Visit there during the evening hours between 5:30-7:00 pm as one can enjoy the beautiful sunset and amazing views of the Singapore skyline.   Visit to this deck would cost you $23(Singaporean) but its worth it. You can also sit on the sky bar and order drinks, bit pricey but good for an experience. If you decide to go to the bar please make sure you don't wear shorts or slippers, proper attire is required!

This is my second time in this hotel and it was even better than the first. On my first visit didn't really have the time to enjoy my stay. But this time I did. The room was as amazing as before a bit smaller but still quite bad g. With this time the bed facing the amazing view of the bay ( witch is a better set up than previously. The bathroom was extremely clean and amazing the bed so comfortable. The pool and the staff there always as amazing. The room service and breakfast m the room was amazing ( but they should add an additional chair to the room ). Just a wonderful stay in that amazing hotel.

I spent two nights at the Marina Bay Sands in a city view room.  I am definitely glad I paid extra for the city view -- it was awesome!   I can't imagine staying for any period of time more than 2-3 nights given the price/cost/benefit.  While the staff were exceptionally attentive, there were still delays in reception, checkin/checkout (there is probably an online/sms/etc way to do it), baggage check, simply due to sheer volume.  The hotel feels a bit like a factory as there are loads of people around.  The pool is beautiful, and there is plenty to do in the area (for example, see the gardens), and the hotel is also connected to an MRT station.  I had a great time at the hotel.

One of the best hotels concerning location, facilities (shops, bars, restaurants, gym, casino), rooms and ofcourse the swimming pool and skydeck. That infinity pool is one of the largest and best pools I have ever seen. Really amazing!

This week I visited MBS with my family and thoroughly enjoyed two nights / three days stay. The hotel had so much to offer us – great view (both city side and garden side), location with easy accessibility (taxi, MRT, buses), adjoining to tourists places, shopping malls & food joints, plenty amenities (both within the hotel and in-room), humble and helping staff; last but not the least – the infinity pool which makes you swim at top of the world!

Staying at Marina Bay Sands was one of our holiday highlights, in particular having breakfast on the roof - the western/eastern buffet includes an a la carte menu choice. I chose the 2 hour slow cooked eggs and was initially regretting my choice when they appeared so watery and with the tiniest portion of ham but to my great surprise it was sensational, a real foodie delight.   Best views in Singapore - we watched the evening hi tech light show from our room. However, it would be even better from the roof with a cocktail and fresh oysters. The night time views are absolutely stunning.  Large luxurious room (no bathtub). Excellent service. We only had 1 night but loved it and would definitely stay again for longer (2-3 nights) and try more of what is on offer.

i love the pool most in that hotel, the view is amazing, rooms are comfortable and the service is brilliant.  Singapore not my favorite city but the hotel is worth to come back again. the breakfast offer is big but to expesive if u need a small breakfast. in the area u wont find anything for lower budget. otherwise a top hotel

If you want to experience a unique pool on top of the building & have 360 view of Singapore you should stay here for 1 night but I won't recommend for more.  Because with very high price but not included breakfast is a huge mistake for a high quality hotel. The quality of the room is just ok compare with that price.

No question, the views from the rooftop and its pool are stunning. But you have to expect a very industrialized product facing serious quality issues: delays at taxi drop off (one of 5 lanes to give you an idea of the scale), waiting time at check-in and elevators, bathroom smelly, toilet not perfectly clean, little insects in bathtub, slow sink, sand in bed (has to do with the name, I guess), no furniture at all on balcony, access to rooftop secured like London tube (don't you dare to forget the 2nd keycard for the 2nd person). To wrap it up: for one night in life it might make sense due to the rooftop. Not one day longer.

We stayed here on our way back from Australia to London for one night. It is  clearly a high end hotel, and the room was amazing. We had a late check out so spent most of our day by the pool- an amazing view over the City. I did at time feel the pool staff were a little pushy about buying drinks. We had lunch at the pool restaurant instead of by the pool, and the food and staff were very nice. The hotel is huge, and it is impressive how it is run... But I am not sure I could spend more then a few nights here. It felt constantly busy (which you would expect), which was fine for one night but maybe not for a longer stay.

Standard Hotel Rooms are similar to other Five star hotels, Just to experience the Infinity pool I chose this property. Pool experience is awesome, You can enjoy the Singapore city from the Pool and have few cocktails on the chair. They have few resturants and clubs on the roof. We got garden bay view, it was breathtaking. like we are looking at a fantasy world. You need to have key card to access the Pool. so each guest should carry the card always. Hotel has a big mall down , you can enjoy the shopping. They have supermarket also down. Chek in time was more than 20 minutes. Bed sheet and pillow covers had bad smell.

Top class hotel in prime location. Book a room overlooking the Bay Gardens above the 40th floor in the 'Club' section. This gives access and entry to the infinity pool. which is spectacular. Rooms and suites on this side give unlimited views of the Straits. Room was very comfortable with every facility.

The ease in check-in, check-out,  cleanliness and privacy in this prestigious hotel is admittedly some of its good points. And though it's not our first time in Marina Bay Sands for shopping and dining, the first time we stayed in the MBS hotel somehow left a negative impression to us. Early this year, we decided to stay in Singapore's most luxurious hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. The suite assigned to us was impressive, tidy, comfortable, with the great view of the Gardens by the Bay, and having complete amenities that you can expect for a S$600-800/night stay. A complimentary cake for the celebrant even made an added positive point to our already good impression with MBS. But the fond memories of having experienced the above plus a good dip and breakfast by the…

MBS is something everyone should experience for a night. But in the end, it is still a hotel. The famous infinity pool is scenic, but after 30 minutes, the initial "wow" factor is gone. The rooms are nice and spacious. The amenities are plentiful, but quite expensive (if you take a taxi, you can find better spas for half the price). The service is also good.  The reason for the 3 rating is the price. Everything was a 4: service, rooms, food, etc. But it is one of the more expensive experiences. You should do this once. But if you want true luxury at the same price, you should take a short trip to Thailand or Bali. In the end, you are paying for a unique experience in an iconic building in one of the more expensive cities in the world.  When you do stay, book a package. The food…

The hotel is BIG. I had a nice room, balcony and view. I will say that the breakfast buffet on the main lobby was not that great. Too busy and the  food was not that flavorful. One of the draws is the infinity pool, which is nice. However if you go mid day and onward, it will be packed. Clean rooms and service was good.  Plenty of restaurants, but pricey, but if staying there I doubt that will be a problem.  I liked it, but would stay at a smaller hotel next time around.

I stayed with my 2 kids in one room, room is big and modern but lacks warmth, had to call a few times to get the 3rd bed in the room. Bathroom is big and nice but let down by lack of power from the shower. Sky gardens and pol are very nice as is the food. Check -out was a nightmare, takes too long ....at one stage for 10 minutes just one lady behind the desk.....at 12.30? Not good. Overall experience bit mixed...good and bad things....however for the price you expect more.

Okay so I was extremely lucky and got to stay in the presidential suit. As I'm sure you can imagine it was fantastic. Huge! 3 bedrooms. All with en suit bathrooms with the master bedroom having a 'his' and 'hers' bathroom (yeah there were 2 bathrooms to this one huge bedroom all the bathrooms had jacuzzi style baths and huge showers, my favourite though (which freaked me out at first) was the automatic toilets; the lids lifted and fell on their own on a motion sensor, they flushed on their own and the seats were heated! there were a bunch of other buttons I didnt play with, but when I left and came back to reality the toilet was absolutely the thing I missed a surprisingly big amount (haha). there are 2 living rooms and a giant round dining table a karaoke room study 'gym' - a…

Landmark hotel in Singapore at a central location. It has several attraction within and around hotel. However the highlight is Infinity pool on roof top giving a breathtaking view of the city. Near by shopping mall and casino are must to visit

Stunning hotel but not like any 5 star I've visited before - due to the high number of guests checking in and out constantly it's very impersonal. The pool is definitely the highlight - would recommend getting up there for sunrise as it's stunning and a very surreal experience. The gym is also great and the staff in there were lovely.   We arrived at 6am and weren't able to check in early however were given access to the pool area and our bags were stored for us. They also held our bags for checkout which was helpful.   Glad we stayed there for the experience but most likely won't be back.

We stayed here for four nights on the start of our round the world trip.  We had a club room on the 49th floor facing towards the city. The room wasn't ready when we arrived at 10am but we were given wifi access and cards to go to the pool if we wanted. The view from the room was amazing being so high up and the room itself was massive. Couldn't really fault it. Housekeeping were very good too. The club staff we very friendly at morning for breakfast and at the 5pm-7pm canapés and drinks. Lots on offer and the champagne was free flowing. The staff were very attentive and remembered your name.  This hotel though is all about the pool. It's breathtaking. We went mostly at night and it wasn't that busy but still warm and the most amazing views. Nobody is really swimming - unless…
Marina Bay is one of the reasons I want to return to Singapore. It's an impressive display of architecture combined with the given natural beauty.

The hotel is the best thing in Singapore. Not only the hotel but everything around is perfect. The prices follows the luxury and the infrastructure, they are high!! I recommend 2 day in The Marina Bay Hotel, is enough to join the pool and the attractions around!

I stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for a work conference, and it was a great location. Very busy, and a not cheap, but I would definitely stay here again. The highlight is of course the infinity pool on the roof, which just has the most amazing view of Singapore. They pool is very long, and there is an adults only section near the entrance above Tower 3. At first the pool seems very busy, but what you actually find is a lot of people only come in quickly for 15 mins, take some photos and then move on, so it's actually quite easy to find a lounger if you want to lay out and relax. The breakfast buffet is about $40USD, but it is a feast! So much food to choose from, and the shopping centre connected is full to the brim with amazing store.

Top floor is amazing as one can see the from the hotel photo and need not have to mention. One pays a high rate for the swimming pool and view. Excellent. Would recommend when one plans to use the hotel and hotel area. If going for the first time to Singapore as a tourist and will be out most of the time than can plan for your next visit unless one is loaded.

I travelled in Asia for 4 months and decided to end my trip here. It was awesome! I checked in early, and took a swim in the infinity pool. I ate a lovely dinner at the restaurant and went to the endless chocolate bar!   The room was breathtaking with a window from top to bottom. Loved it! I also explored the Gardens by the Bay, the Shoppes and Clarke Quay nearby.

We usually avoid such hotels, but this one was a must during our trip to Singapore. Although a tourist hype, the place is actualy comfortable and really nice once you're in the guest areas. Rooftop pool is almost always packed, but also a must.

We stayed in Tower 3 on the 46 floor. Magnificent views from the room and from the infinity pool make this hotel worth staying at least once in a lifetime. WiFi works well, requested an extra blanket and got it in 10 minutes together with  two extra bottles of water. No tea or coffee provided, though there is a kettle in the room. If you don't want to leave a deposit of SGD 200, tell at the reception that you are not going to use a minibar. Wonderful experience.

I recently stayed at the Marina Bay Sands hotel for 6 nights in October. I was commissioned to photograph at a Conference and the hotel charges were paid for by the client. When I checked out, I insisted on obtaining a statement from the hotel confirming that there were no extra charges during my stay. After insisting, they eventually supplied me with a printout saying: ‘TOTAL CHARGES - 00.00’. 5 days after I left, I checked my MasterCard Account and saw that £92.07 had been debited from my account by the hotel. I immediately emailed them for an explanation. 3 days later they replied saying "we do apologize for the delays and inconvenience caused" and that I will be credited with the £92.07 ………. there was no explanation whatsoever as to why this mistake had occurred.  They also…

We chose to stay here for our last night in Singapore and it was the highlight of our holiday. We were kindly allowed to check in early and were also upgraded to a city view room upon arrival. The room was gorgeous offering a lovely view and exquisite facilities. We were also able to explore the Gardens by the Bay, the Shoppes and Clarke Quay nearby. Staff were friendly and provided exemplary service. The infinity pool on the 57th floor was breathtaking and made our stay at Marina Bay Sands relaxing, romantic and memorable.

Everyone knows about the MBS infinity pool. You have to be a registered guest to access it, so I decided to splurge and stay here for one of my five nights in Singapore. The view from up there is amazing, especially at night! The rooftop bar turns into a lounge/mini club on the weekend. They charge a S$38 cover for entry on the and ladies initially get in free, but from my experience it's not worth the price. I had a king room overlooking the Gardens by the Bay, and it was slightly larger than your average hotel room. Service from all employees was wonderful. Both the casino and the mall attached are huge and you will want to spend some time walking through both. All of the food and drink prices are expensive, so be prepared for that. The gym was large and had new equipment.…

We stayed just one night here but were blown away by the room that we were given (the receptionist, Elaine, was kind enough to let us check in early which made a huge difference to our trip) and the views of the Gardens On The Bay from the 40th floor were stunning.  The lobby area is a vast cathedral of light and a constant hum of people passing through make it a wonderful people watching spot ... easy access to the Bayfront Mall, Event Plaza for the amazing Light Show and MRT station make the location perfect and add to this a large room with gorgeous bathroom and dream bed adds up to a great stay.  The famous infinity pool on the 57th floor is not for the faint hearted but truly breathtaking and free entry for guests is a huge bonus.  The poolside service is a little hit or…

A really awesome hotel all round, the architecture is amazing and facilities incredible.  We had a city view which looked over the lake onto the central business district and it was quite simply the most incredible view we have ever had from a hotel room. Easy access to the shops, casino, spa and not to mention the infiniti roof top pool and sky park. Simply astounding.  The only negative was that the skypark is not run by the same people so even though you are a resident the bars and restaurants at the top treat you like a person that has walked in off the street. So be sure to book a table, otherwise you have to stand and have a drink, in the rain potentially, like we did.  If your prepared to pay the price you will not regret it for short stays. I think a longer stay, when…

This hotel is gorgeous. I like skyscrapers and this one really sets itself apart from the other places I've been to. The infinity pool is one of the best in the world. Definitely worth staying at just to experience the luxury it provides.

Booked one night in this amazing hotel! Booked in advance so we were sure we had a room. If we didn't do that, we had to wait for a long time.  Stayed on the 52th floor with city view. What an amazing hotel! Top notch. Living like a celebrity, walking around in you bathrope and matching shoes.  Very friendly and polite staff. Adress you wtih Sir or Mam. Ask you how your day is. One night is to short for living like a god in this hotel.

A huge complex with endless restaurants and shops. The rooms are in a pleasing international contemporary style; the Orchard Suite was very roomy with high ceilings and a great view. Some ideas seem straight out of a handbook on supermarket marketing though, which frankly does not add to the experience, but overall a professionally run temple to consumism with some pretty unique features like the rooftop infinity pool.

An amazing hotel, with everything you could need! Singapore was a great place to visit, but I think this hotel made the trip!! Really excited to go back, and will be spending more time by that incredible pool!

My partner and I stayed at this architectural marvel of a hotel. Upon arrival, we were greeted very warmly by the friendly staff. Check-in was a breeze. We even got upgraded, for free. The rooms are very tastefully decorated, and are very spacious. The pool on the skypark is to die for. Incredible views. Overall, fantastic experience. Definitely worth every penny.

We opted to stay at the Marina Bay Sands as a splurge at the start of our trip. Stayed here for a total of 3 nights. The hotel is simply amazing yet very expensive... but I think it is worth it for a couple of nights! Rooms are quite large and offer beautiful views of either the city or the bay (we had a bay view). Bathroom is lovely, althought water pressure was a bit of an issue from the shower, but that would be my only complaint. The pool.... this is what you stay at this hotel for! Absolutely stunning pool area on the top of the hotel, gives new meaning to a roof top pool. The view from up there is breath taking. It is a very busy place up there for obvious reasons but we never had any trouble getting a lounge. Cocktails and food is very expensive, but that's the price you…

As you can guess main high light of this hotel is the pool. Even with cloudy weather or rain you can't not be impressed. Was on our honeymoon and got a city view up grade which is always nice. Room was massive and had amazing views.

Went to Cairns to visit my sister, and decided to break up the return journey with a visit to Singapore. Had already seen a programme on the Marina Bay and were determined to stay there. I know the exact type of room and tower I wanted to stay in, unfortunately our travel agent screwed that up, and on arrival we were told that that was not the type of room that had been reserved for us, no matter, withing a minute the fabulous girl on reception had found the correct room, but with a $400 dollar extra charge which we did not mind. The room, even the porter when he arrived with our bags said ' what a lovely room' The room overlooked the city and the lake, really nice. The pool on the roof was amazing, the service extremely professional, after just one visit, the next day the…

If your budget will stretch a little, this motel is a must do, if only for a night. Spacious and clean room, early check in and a late check out was offered on checking in. Found all staff to be pleasant and helpful, couldn't  fault the buffet breakfast. The roof top pool is a must experience, but not your typical lay back resort style pool, a ground level pool and shade area would have been nice. Coffee making facilities in the room but no fresh milk provided, my only complaint.

Amazing hotel, amazing view, amazing place to stay. Only draw back we found was room service as it was slow. And the entry gate isn't like a 7 star hotel it's very normal like a 3 star facilities are great. Over all worth the money paid. The pool is great and staff humble please do stay here at least one night if you are in Singapore

Stayed here a couple nights in May 2015. Comes with a heavy price but if you can swing it, it's worth it for the view at night. Marina Bay is electric and is a stunning sight from your window. Pool is popular and gorgeous. Very efficiently handled from check in throughout my stay. Convenient walk to Marina Bay, Arts and Science Museum, and Super Tree Grove. Wonderful memory.

We stayed at MBS for 2 nights on our way back to Sydney from Europe and London. This hotel is amazing. Its huge. Three towers comprising some 2,500 rooms. We stayed on level 46 in a city view room. The room was huge with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. The view is amazing. The bathroom was huge with a stand-alone bath and a shower big enough to swing a cat. The bed and pillows are very comfortable. The infinity pool is terrific, but busy. The entire top floor area behind the pool is so relaxing and is a great place to enjoy a drink, up high overlooking the city. The hotel is amazing but its the staff that make you want to return. They go out of their way to make your stay memorable. The staff clearly enjoy working there and it shows. Highly recommended. Will…

Staying at marina bay sand hotel for relaxation for couple of days I would say hotel services is good but have to pay additional S$100.00 per person for swimming in the rooftop pool which the last time I go they do not restrict at all which mean to say one room is entitled to two pax for pool and some other stuff the third pax onwards is chargeable. It is a good hotel to stay in but is quite expensive in certain way

From the moment you check in you feel special.room on 38th floor was great. Had all we needed and more. Breakfast was very good with great waiting staff. My highlight was the infinity pool on the 57th and the reason for staying here. Did not disappoint. Watching the Singapore skyline light up at dusk was terrific... even better when it's from the 57th floor pool! Bucket list ticked!

well it was on my bucket list and I will be forever grateful I included it its expensive but if you are smart you include The Club package as it provides b/fast afternoon tea,  and canapés at night with beverages/wine/spirits/beer and as we all know the beverage side of things in Singapore is very expensive but this package is definite value for money and the rooms that come with it are superb we asked for a balcony and were given a suite on the 28flr which was really quite excellent but me I need a balcony so eventually they succumbed although they could not understand why but anyway it was great we got the garden view and we loved it at night with all the lights .Ah the pool what can one say it was fantastic both day and night80 floors up and all the view you can want with bar…

This was our 3rd trip to Singapore and our 1st stay at Marina Bat Sands. It is more expensive than others but well worth it. The location is great as most attractions are walking distance and the Subway is at the basement so travel is very easy. All staff will do what they can for you and their attitude is great. The pool is fantastic as are teh views. Drinks are a little overpriced up the top at the pool but other than that we recommend staying here as you will not be sorry. Wifi is provided and can be access anywhere in the hotel! I will be here again on our 4th trip!

I was enjoying a night with my friend birthday celebration for holiday. Pool was great, Room service and housekeeping is absolute fantastic and efficent, However front desk was on one of the worst service i ever encounter through a lady who spoke with attitude problem and cheap accent at tower 1 when my key card wasn't working hence was ignored when i stand in front of her out of all the front desk that was busy.

We stayed in the room with bay view on fl 26. I think it could be the best view enough for the Garden by the bay too. Very comfortable beds. The swimming pool on top of tower 3 (fl 57) is smaller than I had imagined before I came but it has an amazing view indeed that's facing to the city, got smoking area facing to the bay view also!!! Should try both day and night swimming there. I did enjoy my time there.  From tower 1 you can easily get to Bayfront MRT. There are 2 ways to get to Garden by the bay: 1. Between tower 1 and 2 there is a skyway connecting to Garden by the bay (best choice), 2. Underground way from Bayfront MRT (I like the walls here so much).  In my experience, you should visit Garden by the bay in the morning to get better shots with the beautiful MBS Hotel…

This was not a great business hotel, lots of day tourists walking through the lobby just to see as well as late in evenings coming from the various clubs. It is just to big to get nay sense of individual attention that one would expect. Service is great but overall experience lacks and is below expectation.

We stayed here on the last night of our trip having come from Pan Pacific Orchard. Luckily we were able to check in early (around 1o'clock) with 2 of the 3 rooms we booked receiving free upgrades. We had a huge (but unnecessary) balcony, the bed was big and extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was done out nicely - however no bath tub. Of course the pool was the standout feature that convinced us to stay here in the first place and I wasn't disappointed. Up to the 57th floor (!!!) and I was definitely not prepared for the view, i'd never seen anything like the juxtaposition of the pool next to the panoramic city views - it was amazing! The pool was very clean, though the water was cold that didn't stop us wading in once during the day and once at night to get our obligatory…

We stayed in a club room towards the top of Tower 2, with the city view. The room was very large, with a great bathroom with free standing tub and a seperate walk in shower and a seperate toilet. The rooms main window goes from floor to ceiling and the curtains automatically open every time you enter the room, which is really quite cool, especially when you have the view over the city. The breakfast at The Club is really very good. There is pretty much everything you could wish for. There is also a great view, whether you sit on the city or the sea side of the tower. Of course, the infinity pool is not to be missed. It is just amazing to look out from the 57th floor over the city while taking a swim. This is really quite unique. There is also a souvenier photo service, if you…

We have a staycation at the Sands during the first week of November.  We decided to take the Garden View as it came with a small balcony.    The hotel was accomodating with our request for early check in and for a high floor.  Checking in was a little slow as it was pretty croweded. The front desk staff did what need to be done and was a little impersonal.  We got to our deluxe room and the view of Gardens by the Bay, the Barrage, and the sea was amazing!  The room was very clean, modern and well thought out.  The Bed was very comfortable.  Bathroom was clean and luxerious, but the water pressure for the shower was a little low but that is due to the Hotel's green initiatve.  If you stay at the Sands, your must head to the Infinity Pool!  We went at night (which is less crowded)…

The location is amazing, next to a shopping mall and the views are great at night.  but the rooms are old ! they need be refurbished, the sofa in the room is Old and looks dirty! i think they never changed it from the day they opened the hotel. the linen and towels are old ! the duvet is so thin and it looks so disgustingly old.  this is definitely not a 5* hotel and not worth the money. on the other hand the pool view from the top floor is amazing but there are so many people at the pool that you wont be able to enjoy it! there are 2600 rooms in the hotel so you could imagine! it look more like a shopping mall full of people rather than a 5* luxury hotel. Forgot to mention the pillows! HORRIBLE! and the linens were not even ironed properly. the management should  spend some…

we were a group of 6, stayed only here for a night. spacious room the rest of the group slept on extra bed obviously, but the bed is not well proportioned for a big-size room. the bath is spacious too. don't touch what's on the fridge bcause automatically it will charge you. they are very strict with access to pool. I can't say anything much of course, it's beautiful especially the view from our room, but I don't like busy hotels. very far from everything even when you just want to buy something from the next building. Make sure you have everything you need before checking in unless you want to spend too much from room service.

This hotel is just amazing! Before visiting it we have, of course, heard and saw a lot about Marina and we got high expectations from it and of course the reality succeeded all of them! The pool is so clean and the view is amazing. Everything was great, I could not think of anything negative about MBS. We stayed at MBS in 2012 and I could just never forget about it, I really have to visit it again because it's just one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at!

Beautiful hotel inside and out with even the standard room being very nice. Service was also great and efficient. MRT station is literally under the hotel so it's easy to get there, and gardens by the bay is also connected, so there is plenty to see. The pool is as amazing as you would expect, it can be hard to get a seat at times and pretty much everyone is just up there to take photos and selfies!  As you would expect, everything in the hotel is expensive, but the Sands shopping centre is just next door where there is plenty of options for food and drinks.  Worth staying to enjoy the pool and the marvelous views, but don't break the bank staying any longer and try different parts of Singapore. Would recommend to anyone who hasn't been and would definitely go back if I had the…

On my last holidays I stayed at Marina Bay Sands in Singapore to check the hotel service and of course the infinity swimming pool, which is the reason why too many people go there just to stay overnight and enjoy the highest swimming pool on the world. The check-in and check-out are really very organised and the staff are very polite. They start any conversation asking you sorry for any delay, even if you didn't wait any second for the service. The bedroom is a 5 Star Hotel bedroom, you can find everything you need for your stay and have a very good night sleep. The Gym is just a hotel gym equipped with basic fitness equipments, mostly treadmills. If you wish you can also pay and enjoy the hotel spa service. At Rise Restaurant, the breakfast is amazing. A little different from…

May be good for the business traveller but we had 3 little ones with us including a new born. No complaints on service or the rooms (which are big). It's just the sheer scale of the building and how it's layed out that you almost feel like being at a busy airport terminal or a train station! There's nothing personal about your stay. Yes the pool on the top floor and the location with gardens by the bay at your doorstep is great but think again if you got kids with you. We checked in for 3 nights but checked out after the first to move to Shangrila and there we found all the personal attention and kid friendliness that we were missing here!

the hotel is really beautiful ,perfect pool ,rooms are vry nice ,perfect view ,many restaurant to eat ,but do not expect a 5 stars services ,it is kind of las vegas service but it is very expensive ,, the hotel is full with tourist ,so it is not a must to offer best services ,but it is a must to visit hotel ,i really like it it is my 5th time staying here ..

Got a High-level room facing The Garden By the Bay. Great scenery. Room was spacious and toilet big and nice. Have dinner at the Satay Club which was a long walk from the hotel but the walk was worth it.

Excellent stay, beautiful room (deluxe garden view). We were fortunately allowed to check in early, bonus!! Quick IMPORTANT tip. We came straight from an apartment so had a bunch of stuff to put in the fridge. We didn't read the sign on the fridge...oops...In the mini bar there are sensors under all the food and drinks and you are auto charged immediately for anything removed. We had to do a bit of quick talking to concierge to explain that we hadn't just eaten and drank everything in the fridge in the first 10mins!!! The pool of course is awesome and we got to keep our keys as a souvenir. We stayed on the 34th floor which was great and we were able to get the same view of the city/marina just but walking across to the lift where there is a massive window. Another thing is that…

We had a splurge and stayed two nights in this hotel so we could swim in the pool as only guests can swim. The pool was a little cold but the view was outstanding. We enjoyed breakfast in the Skybar each morning-smaller variety of food than downstairs, we were told, but plenty to keep us happy! We had an 8 PM  flight, but despite 2 requests, we  could only get checkout extended to 1 PM. Room 4908 in tower 3 was lovely - up high and in the corner. We loved that the room curtains opened automatically when you put your key in the power slot. The Internet was very slow and kept dropping out-disappointing for a hotel of this class. This is a very big, very busy Hotel-spotless  and very impressive. We enjoyed the experience but wouldn't stay again -  you can get better value and…

Everything is super expensive here so bring plenty of money!!! Room was great but so it should be with a $500/night price tag. No extras though, no fruit nothing which is a bit sad. Out TV didn't work 3 days in a row so had to have the Technician come and sort it. We ate at 3 Celebrity restaurants; Pizzeria & Osteria Mozza & Spago, all great dining experiences food wise however very very expensive. Mad prices!!! Service at Spago was poor which was disappointing. Pool has great views, fairly crowded though. Very touristy and busy on the lobby floor. Had High Tea at Jin Shaun Lou which was appalling, average food and shockingly slow thick service. I am surprised a restaurant of that poor standard is in the building. Would only recommend staying one night if you must go............

Wonderful luxury in the heart of Singapore! It's connected directly to the MRT and a taxi ride costs around $15 to the airport.   I stayed for my birthday and Amit at check in used his initiative and provided us with a free room upgrade. The room was enormous and had a brilliant view of the gardens by the bay (even more spectacular at night).   Everyone at the complex was knowledgeable and friendly (except inside the casino)  The pool of course is a highlight. They bring you drinks and food. I stayed there all day! It was just a view of Singapore that could not really be matched anywhere else. (Again, spectacular in the evening). The only weird thing is that no food is served until 10am - but you can have cocktails!  Another highlight is the gym. It's located a couple of floors…
Worlds longest rooftop pool. Worlds highest cantilevered viewing deck. Has a Wolfgang Puck Spago on top as well as a multi meal and nightlife bar Flight & nightclub Cie la Vie

First impressions during check-in were not great. The lobby was crowded and noisy, and the lines for check-in were pretty long. I felt like I was in the lobby of a regular resort not unlike those in the neighbouring islands. For the price of the room, it is also strange that the check-in time at the hotel is unusually late (3pm), while the check-out time is unusually early (11am). I found out later that guests are allowed to check in earlier (I cannot be sure how much earlier), but this was not conveyed to us. It may well be that the late check-in time stated is meant as a form of crowd control, but I do not think this is fair to guests who are unaware and may just be milling around waiting for 3pm, especially given the amounts that people are shelling out to stay here.  Having…

The hotel is amazing! But the wait time for the key was super long! We waited almost an hour before we got our keys! We travelled as a family from HK and we have 13 people. We booked several rooms but all of them are in different towers, I stayed in tower 3 with my mom. It was a very pleasant stay, our view was stunning! We were overlooking the Singapore Garden! We also really enjoyed the infinity pool! I like the idea on only the people who stay at this hotel can access to the pool. Its already very crowded! Overall it's a very nice experience and we stayed there for 2 nights! It has a casino in the mall just right beside the hotel so you can do some gambling before resting in your own room~

Just finished our stay here for 2 nights on route to phuket from australia. 1st bit of advice don't hesitate to get a taxi from the airport to here as taxi's in singapore are probably the only place in the world where they're cheap and clean. We only paid $15 singapore. Secondly the advice i would give is go for the cheapest room and tag the buffet breakfast on. We paid for a really nice view on level 49 and it was amazing, but we spent most the time outside the room and up on the skypark at the top in all the bars and restaurants where the view was amazing. The only time we were in the room was to sleep. Overall this hotel is incredible and next time in singapore we would book no where else.

Was gifted this room as a wedding gift about 4 years ago. 2 nights of paradise. Room was nicely spaced, high bed, view was AWESOME. Pool was magnificent, we had the chocolate buffet at level 57 too. Jacuzzis were good but always taken. Good things comes to those who wait ;)  Checkout was a breeze with the drop-key option. Will be back.

The hotel is located at a location that you can't wait for. The Hotel is amazing & awesomely created. Has 3 Towers. Beautiful Pool & View from the Observation Deck on the 57th Floor is killing. Has over 100 brands & restaurants at the Shoppes. A must  stay & watch once in a lifetime.

The hotel is very big and impressive in many ways, from the spacious reception and foyer area, to the well appointed rooms which have an amazing view either over the city or out to sea over the light garden. Take a swim in the infinity pool on the roof with the most amazing views of the Singapore harbour. We only stayed one night as it is not cheap, but a great experience that you do once in a lifetime.

On arrival I was just astonished at the sheer scale of this hotel.  As one of the porters said, 'it's like three hotels in one'.  We arrived early (3.30AM) and whilst our room wasn't ready, they did their best to try to find a solution.  Alas to no avail.    So we witnessed residents rounding off their evenings as well as those getting up early for breakfast.....I've never witnessed a busier hotel lobby/breakfast restaurant.  That might well put some people off but they are uber-efficient and the queues seem to be dealt with really quickly.  That said, we chose breakfast in bed.  Much more relaxing and in comparison, worth a little bit extra for a peaceful start to the day.  When we were given our room at about 12.30, it was worth the wait.  We booked a city view and they gave…

They could not deliver the 3 twin rooms that were booked months in advance.  Two rooms had extra beds provide, hardly room to move, nothing else available, place definitely overcrowded everywhere.  The infinity pool and Sky Park were a hit with our teenage grandsons.  Housekeeping staff very helpful with extra amenities when needed. Summary of hotel bill looked OK.  On returning home I checked our Mastercard only to find that we were charged twice for our stay, in other words overcharged us by $7,000 - still trying to get them to credit this huge amount, really spoilt an otherwise wonderful experience with my family.

It's definitely worth spending a little bit extra for a city view room - the view from the bed is unbelievable. Swimming pool needs no introduction, and the first time I walked on the 'deck' it was impossible not to smile with amazement.   Negatives: -Room itself is nothing special -Long queue for the check-in process, feels like an airport -Swimming pool a bit cold

With a morning to spare, I decided to visit this local attraction. Built on land reclaimed from the sea, this is the most amazing place. The viewing deck dwarfs the Singapore Flier. The views are stunning over the whole of Singapore and the Straits. The gardens are amazing and I would regard this as the best attraction in the wonderful city.

overnight here for 3 nights during ITB Singapore. Room is really big and it is real pleasure to stay here once in a life time. Connected to shopping arcade and promenade. Roof top is free for hotel guest.

This is a hotel you do not have to leave  On club level you get a big room with a big bathroom with a bath  Included in your room is Breakfast, afternoon tea & happy hour but get there early  Top shelf drinks and they do not hold back on quantity  Pool is great but shallow all over

The views were stunning from all places of the hotel. The furniture is old, bruised and battered for quite a new hotel. The bathroom looks old-dated. The hotel is very crowded. The breakfast 'room' on the roof is too small for all guest. Simple breakfast. Great nightclub and great spa!

If your only going to be in singapore once then it worth a stay just to say youve been. Pool is amazing, view that cant be beaten. We had 3 people in one room and the third had a foldout bed which was a little disapointing but was still comfee

We decided to treat ourselves to 2 nights here.  Firstly check in took over 20 mins, you felt as if you were queuing for a ride a Disneyland! Having said that the staff member who checked us in was very polite and tried very hard to make up for this fact.  The room itself was very nice, huge bathroom, clean and tidy. However we had one full day without any hot water!  The main attraction being the pool for this hotel was mightily disappointing. Not enough beds by far and ignorant people left wet towels on beds for hours which were never removed and therefore not allowing people who actually wanted to relax there, able to. Food and especially drinks were very expensive by the pool. Only saving grace here was that they were hot on no children in the adult area. The view is great…

Spacious rooms, big beds, duvet covers, awesome views either the city, gardens by the bay, or merlion, you wont go wrong with booking this hotel even once in your life.  The staff at the front desk is very polite even there's a crowd waiting to check in.   Weekends are quite overcrowded.   The infinity pool is superb. With just the right amount of temperature, you will enjoy this experience be it at the morning, (they open at 7am) until 10pm in the evening.  You can enjoy the view of Singapore at night, and you can watch the OCBC light show at GBTB at 0730 PM.

Marina bay perhaps is the most iconic building now in Singapore...that's why the price is a bit overpriced for such normal luxurious hotel. The beds were really comfortable but the bathroom is normal. The hotel is really really huge that's why I don't feel exclusive despite paying 300 dollars for a night! The infinity pool though was a lifetime experience :)

Absolutely stunning views, especially from the skypark, had the pleasure of staying on the 51st floor and being able to see the laser show from the room gave us a spectacular view. If you visit Singapore, this is a must stop. Totally worth the price for the stay.

This hotel is huge with 3 towers... Each with 57 floors. The check in terrible as with any large hotel. The break fast queues are unimaginable. But the rooms are large... I had good view of the bay.the infinity pool and the deck on 57 th floor are great. The mall with casino is a great attraction.

Good hotel! Rooms are spacious and well maintained. Staff is clear about all they speak and they are polite too. And its infinite pool is AMAZING. However its to expensive. Its food is healthy and delecious too. Even if someone say me that its a bad hotel I would thing he/ she is a abnormal person.

Given the looks of the hotel and the presence of infinity pool, you may definitely want to try this hotel. However, in my personal opinion, the infinity pool is a bit of overhype and extremely crowded. Apart from being on the 57th floor, I don’t see much to it. However the hotel is as grand as it can be.  We stayed at Tower 3 of the hotel. There are lots of shopping options in the basement of the hotel. The Cloud Forest, Gardens by the Bay and other attractions are close by.  Even though the hotel has around 2500 rooms, check in and check out are not that time consuming.  It is little funny to note that the rooms are separated at places just by planks (may be wooden). You can hear the phone ringing in the adjoining rooms and bathrooms. I could even hear people talking from…

If you want your wallet to be raped by all means. Its $100 a person to get more than 2 keys per room. Hotel very overprices! No no no! Worst money i have ever spent! They charge for every little detail.  Im sure for oxygen as well! No no no no don't do it

Among tons of luxury/high class 5 stars hotels I ever stayed, this is the worst experience I ever had. The cheapest room cost around USD330 but the service is just like 2 stars hotel, maybe even worse.  Marina Bay Sands is known for its infinity pool and great view. Indeed, it's amazing but that it. I choose to check in MBS for the first day of my Singapore trip. But it totally ruined my first expression to Singapore. I can't tell what kind of service they provide but please don't suffer it. It's not worth of it.  Here is the story..  Due of Singapore Airline suddenly changed my flight to ETA 4:30am So I was exhausted and really want to take a rest upon check in. I reached MBS around 7:30am and was trying to ask what time can I possibly check-in in a polite way The only answer I…

The Marina Bay Sands is one of the symbols of Singapore. The building is iconic, the infinity pool view well-known, and the Marina Bay area itself full of world class shops and restaurants. If you're coming here you should be prepared for a Disneyland-style experience: tons of tourists from around the world all here for the same experiences you've come for. It's not a boutique experience in the slightest. All of that said, the Marina Bay Sands is a must-stay for anyone who is a hotel fan... this is one of the premiere properties in the world. You have to see it to believe it.   Despite the crowds, the hotel is very well managed. Staff from top to bottom are exceptionally friendly and well trained--Singapore hospitality on another level, for sure. From the concierge to the towel…

Marina Bay Sands, so what's the fuzz about. Well, beside the world's highest infinite pool, there are more to it. I stayed in the premium view room for three nights and enjoyed every moments.  Pro: - Number one on the list have to be the infinite pool. It is just amazing and glorious. Not a lot of people swim in it because everyone just care about selfies there.  - Location. It is in the centre of attraction with a casino and a huge mall that aim for the rich as well as the not so rich. Really nice  - Service was excellent as I would expect in a five star resort.  - No sign of wear and tear, still like a brand new hotel  Con: The price might be on a higher side, but you pay what you get.  Other than price, I can't think of any other negative thing about this hotel. So go and…

What can I say about this Hotel???? Fantastic, stayed in Tower 2 on 26th floor, large room with all you could want in it, very quiet, clean and spacious ,great  view of the gardens, very attentive and helpful staff there at all times, had dinner in Rise Buffet on Ground floor, plenty of choice and all cooked to perfection. Rooftop infinity pool is to die for with views to match. Not cheap paid 18 S dollars for 2 small bottles of Fiji water by the  pool£9 in our money.... a bit steep, but hey only here once. Hope to visit again. Enjoy.

Had a staycation here, though the queue for checking in is long, but it is moving fast. Hotel is very accessible, near MRT(Bayfront), within shopping centres and walking distance to almost anywhere! Also near attraction visits(SG Flyer).  Room was facing Gardens by the Bay. The view is magnificent! Balcony was big enough.   Swam at the raved about Infinity pool. Can't deny the view overlooking the buildings in Singapore. But be prepared as it's crowded in the afternoon.  WIFI connection is also fast!  Only thing is that the toilet door cannot be locked and there's no bidet in the toilet. Fridge is also full and is chargeable if we remove an item by the sensor! So can't put our drinks inside but there is additional $10 charge if you want to rent the mini fridge.   Overall…

It's bloody expensive but your trip will just not be complete without a night here. Sure, you could stay somewhere else and pay the ~$20 to visit the Skypark instead but you'll always be wondering about that infinite pool.   It really is worth it, especially if you're lucky enough to score an upgrade. The first time we stayed here we got a huge apartment which was probably as big as my house.

We stayed here to celebrate my friends birthday. The room is spacious. And the beds are quite big compare to a normal hotel that we have stayed in here in Singapore.  The facilities and amenities in the room are quite new and modern. Its a bit pricey but its worth the lay for the experience.

The Marina Bay Sands gives you everything you've paid (a lot) for - stunning rooftop infinity pool, luxuriously large and well-appointed rooms and staff who cannot do enough to help you.
