We arrived at 7am on the day of our check-in, and although our room wasn't ready, our bags were checked and we were given passes to use the spa, gym and rooftop infinity pool immediately, which we were really impressed by - the rooftop pool is the best place to get used to the buzz of Singapore!  It's amazing, but very very crowded and so it can be a bit difficult to enjoy the lovely facilities as much as you would like. That said, it's an awesome place to stay and I'd highly recommend it.

Stayed here two nights and loved every minute of it. Our room was on the 40th floor in tower 1 and faced south with a fantastic view of the Gardens by the Bay. The room was huge with an equally huge bathroom that included a large free standing bath tub, massive shower room, separate toilet and twin vanity. The infinity pool on the 57th floor was stunning in every way, and during our stay, we were pleased it wasn't too busy so finding a good poolside spot was easy. It was hard to imagine you were up that high as it had a beautiful beach resort feel to it and was beautifully lit at night, such a lovely place to be. We found the hotel staff very friendly despite the hustle and bustle, this is not a place to visit for a quiet tranquil stay. Restaurant prices were exorbitant as to be…

Brilliant service, great hospitality, beautiful view, exquisite food options and mind blowing infinity pool clearly makes this one  of the best hotels in Singapore.   Roof top club Ce la vi - one of the best clubs in Singapore offers a great option to party till late (almost 3am on weekdays and 4.30 am on weekends) They also have casino on the first and second floor and a premier lounge on the 3rd floor.  A must visit- for non Singapore resident doesn't have to pay any fees to enter the casino )

Amazing hotel, so much more to it than just the room!!  Pool was amazing with breath taking views of Downtown and beyond, as far as the eye can see.  Everyone very friendly, and will do whatever they can to help you.  We had a city view room, which was lovely!! Great sized room and bathroom.  The hotel and its grounds (which go for miles) are a piece of art.  We stayed for three nights, and would of happily stay longer if possible.  Banyan Tree Spa facilities fantastic ++++ Would highly recommend!  You can tell the pool is the main attraction and is luckily restricted to hotel guests only, although its always busy, not a pool to relax at. Also, the main lobby/ atrium is alway very busy ++ as this is open to the public.    These aren't complaints, just observations.  Brilliant…

Hotel is amazing and gives you a feeling you will never get in other places, the rooms had an amazing view and the service was out standing. staying at the hotel will allow you to get to places like the roof top pool and more, not sure I would stay there on a business trip, the hotel provides so much it is hard to work :-)

This hotel is wonderful. The view from the room is amazing. The location is great and the food at the breakfast buffet is delicious. The mall and casino are attached.  Cabs are plentiful and even with the crowd--hotel is huge--it was quick to get them. The pool is a must see.

Fabulous service throughout. Received an upgrade on checking in, to a suite and my room overlooked the Gardens by the Bay. Stunning room and view. It was a very thunderstormy night, so I sat in my living area sofa, glass of wine in my hand an watched the Garden's light change colour with accompanying music in the night. I hadn't seen anything like it before. Had room service, a steak and bottle of wine, which tasted absolutely fantastic. It added another $100 to my bill on checkout (pre-tax). Had a manicure and pedicure onsite, which set me back another $100. Lobby area is absolutely packed.  Overall, I enjoyed it but its an indulgent stay.

This was one of the best hotels I've stayed in, the view from the top and the pool was amazing and all the staff very friendly. The wifi I'm areas apart from rooms wasnt great but the views make up for this

Ok there's cheaper hotels and you may be thinking will I or won't I? Even if it's a one night stay in a cheaper room it may be time to cross this one off the bucket list, you deserve it!  The above may sound like an advertising spiel but that was the though process I went through before deciding to stay here. We had to change our plans from a Bali trip due to the volcano and flight cancellations. We always wanted to return to Singapore and after going through the stressful time of changing everything at the last minute I was ready for some indulgence - this was it.  Check in was at 3pm however we arrived at around 11.30am with the idea of looking around first. Our bags were whisked away as soon as we left the cab and were met at the entry. We were told the bags will be in our…

Welcome to Las Vegas in Singapore!! This is and make no mistake a Casino hotel in every way, a money making and people processing machine. It is an inspiring architectural sight to see inside and out, walk through even if you don't stay but not relaxing for me, just too busy. The shopping Mall it sits above is huge, clean, shiny and priced as one would expect but worth seeing. Check in and out times are strict, but thats ok, it was expected, very well explained on check in and pool keys are provided and bags looked after if you are early which we were allowing us to explore. There are plenty of helpful smiling staff to guide you to the right area too enhancing the experience no end. This was an extravagant wish list option fulfilled and we stayed in a Club Room Suite. Our room…

Welcome to Las Vegas in Singapore!! This is and make no mistake a Casino hotel in every way, a money making and people processing machine. It is an inspiring architectural sight to see inside and out, walk through even if you don't stay but not relaxing for me, just too busy. The shopping Mall it sits above is huge, clean, shiny and priced as one would expect but worth seeing. Check in and out times are strict, but thats ok, it was expected, very well explained on check in and pool keys are provided and bags looked after if you are early which we were allowing us to explore. There are plenty of helpful smiling staff to guide you to the right area too enhancing the experience no end. This was an extravagant wish list option fulfilled and we stayed in a Club Room Suite. Our room…

If you are visiting Singapore then add MBS to your must see list. It's one of those places where you get lost in magnificence. An engineering wonder, a ridiculous masterpiece and that's just the architectural part, there's so much more to do.

Relatively expensive hotel and the service was lackluster. No bell man until we tracked one down at the counter, check in line was almost an hour and had no personal flavor to it at all. Check out impersonal as well, but at least fast since we could drop the cards off without waiting in line.  The pool view was amazing and maybe worth it for a night but even the pool area had wet and dirty towels all over it, no one was cleaning up.  There was lots of upsell everwhere too, food, pictures at the pool, etc.  Location is ok but not as centrally located as other hotels.   Rooms were large and nice with good views.  Overall, if you want to go for a day in the pool and a nice view go for a night. Otherwise not worth it.

Excellent service. I stayed in Tower 3 and enjoyed a breathtaking view of the bay. The room confortable, large, with a confortable bed and a living room and huge bathroom. Warm lighting and fresh smell. Breakfast buffet with many choices and spacious venue. Infinite pool worth the trip!

Stayed in this hotel for a week as part of a conference. My wife joined me there as well. The hotel is massive, impressive, sometimes overwhelming, beautiful, full of selection and full of people. There are something like 60+ eating options in the hotel and connected shopping center and events center. The shopping center has stores that are primarily on the higher end of the range, but also has some more budget-friendly shops. The roof-top pool and bars are WORLD CLASS for the views and the experience.   If you goal is to spend time seeing sights in Singapore, this might not be the best hotel because it is a bit removed from the city. Singapore is not a big place so nothing is too far, but there are other options where you can walk outside the hotel and be in the city. This…

Stayed 2 nights in tower 3. Wow, massive room with amazing bathroom. Room over looked botanical gardens.   Great location with direct access to the marina area. Shops & restaurants next door.   Pool fabulous.   Dined at Ce la vie and food was great. Bar area with live music too!  Overall great stay in iconic hotel

Although it is a while since I stayed here, I am compelled to write about it as I am still overwhelmed by the space. The hotel is big, in fact, its like three separate hotels bridged together by what looks like a boat on the roof. Great dining spaces, shopping and bars fill the huge lobby which takes a good 10 minutes to walk along.   The bedrooms are clean, a good size, with excellent amenities and views. The rooftop club/bar is great for drinking whilst admiring the skyline and lights across Singapore. The pool is where it gets crazy, it is in an infinity pool to eclipse all infinity pools. With 55 floors to get to the top, you literally feel on top of the world and its a little bit scary when you get to the edge and look over.   I had some room service whilst at the hotel,…

The only place to stay in SIngapore, it is the top in the city, it is The City!!! Amazing pool  skypark with an unforgettable skyline, luxory hotel with superior rooms, big shopping center and great show in the evening!!!

My wife and I stayed at the Marina Bay Sands as the first stop on our honeymoon.  The booking process was relatively simple and we were able to arrange a club suite room.  I mentioned twice during the booking process that the stay was part of our honeymoon. When we arrived we checked in and our honeymoon wasn't acknowledged by the check in desk, at each other hotel we stayed at this was at least done which is a small but nice touch that leads to a positive experience.  We arrived at the room and within the information in the room a honeymoon package was advertised which was disappointing because if I had of known that this was available it would have been somethingI would have purchased. This was the exact reason why I mentioned that it was a honeymoon booking during the emails…

The place is very clean , amazing view and  have very friendly staff make your stay very special. Easy access to lots of shopping places as well direct access to the subway. amazing breakfast buffet on the ground floor.

Bumped a lot of x-colleagues  here which makes me feel home. A different kind of city hotel which brings an excellent view of Marina Bay and Kallang River, extraordinaire buffet at "Rise" restaurant with International spread. Kudos to Food and Beverage team for GREAT service.

If you come to Singapore do yourself a treat and stay here. Even though is a very big hotel, the service is very fast. Chec in and check out are pretty expedite. Is connected to a big mall with great restaurantes. It has a good bed and great amenities. The gym is spectacular and the infinite pool is an experience by itself. The views from restaurants the sky walk are wonderful. I recommend the hop in hop off bus. There is no traffic in Singapore even when raining so I suggest to give it a try. Also to walk around the city. Is very safe and not that big. Also suggest the botanical gardens and any show you can get because is a great destination for international musicals and events.

I visited Marina Bay Sands with my boy friend. I just love the worlds longest elevated swimming pool. It soars silently towards the heavens, arriving in a heartbeat. when I woke up at 9 the hotel smelled something different you will feel like you are in heaven. Row of palm tree looks so amazing. The endless up and down along a black line, stroke, stroke, breathe. Turn and repeat. Awesome experience of my life..........

Click & Book immediately.  Do not worry about looking at any other hotel.  This hotel is immaculate and central to everything.  You will be staying at this iconic building with a spectacular view, unbelievable infinity pool and being able to walk to the Marina Shoppes and Gardens by the bay.  If you need to go anywhere else, getting a taxi is so simple from the hotel.  It was a pleasure staying at here and I will be coming back in the near future.

The views here are magnificent on either the garden or city side. Obviously the higher floors are better. The pool is fantastic with attentive and courteous staff.  It is a huge place so not a feeling of warmth but with great rooms, great pool and great views can't ask for much more. When you do need to engage with staff however they are very friendly.

Suite room was really awesome!  Nice view of Gardens by the Bay from our room.  The staff was also very courteous and helpful. In-room dining was just ok. The food, as expected, was expensive. Infinity pool area was a bit crowded.

My wife and I stayed here for one night (her birthday) as part of our trip around SE Asia. When we checked in the woman taking care of us asked if it was our first time, if we were celebrating anything in particular, and I told her that it was my wife's birthday today. She immediately went to work upgrading us to a suite, which was totally unexpected! (and awesome).   Needless to say, my wife was extremely happy - the suite (located in a corner of Tower 3 on a middle floor) was beautiful, clean, had great views and amenities. But I feel the best attraction is the outdoor infinity pool on the rooftop. Absolutely stunning, especially at night when the crowds die down. I do wish that the poolside service could be a bit better, as some of the attendants didn't seem to be paying…

what a beautiful place to stay! I spent the first 5 nights of a business trip to Singapore at the Marriott, which was another great hotel, but wanted to try the Marina Bay Sands because of all the great reviews. It truly is an amazing hotel. The pool alone is reason enough to stay there. It's a nice touch that sections of the pool are "adults only"!

I'm seriously unsatisfied with MBS' Car Management Department.  Reason being, the staffs are simply treating us with an extremely poor attitude. They  are so irresponsible! To the extent that i find there's a great need to specially name out their names to prevend anyone who's coming to MBS in future will face the similar problem given by them, to me.  The first staff's name is MR Aw Beng Seng (known as Steven on his name tag).  On the 9th of October 2015, due to some unluckiness, i encountered some issues with the redeemption of the parking coupon with the use of my MBS lifestyle member card. Thus, some staffs assisted us to approach Mr Aw (who was said to be the main in-charge at that point of time on that day) instead.  After much questioning by him (with a bad attitude and…

My wife brought my kids for a swim and my son had a minor accident outside the pool area. He stepped on a small object which was not even and had a splinter on his foot. The lifeguard on duty was not able to remove the splinter and the hotel did not have a doctor on duty to assist. He was sent to the lifeguard and then to the Security but none of them could assist in removing the splinter. I cannot possibly imagine that an international 5 star hotel cannot help my son on a small splinter and he had to be sent to a private hospital to get it removed. The cost of the accident was not paid by the hotel and my wife had to settle this on her own.  I strongly hope that the hotel can look into this issue and ensure that the lifeguards are more trained to handle and resolve these…

My daughter and I splurged at the MBS this month and were lucky enough to be given a room upgrade to the 39th floor with city view's.  We were a last minute booking having signed up to the website deal that offers cheaper rates so the upgrade made up for the odd booking process we experienced.  The email with the website offer came two days after I signed up, with an offer that expired on the sign up date (2 days prior).  In order to honour the rate I was asked to print, scan and email back a form to authorise credit card payment.  I'm not sure how many travelers have capacity to print and scan forms on the road, but they ended up holding the booking for me for payment on arrival when I pointed this out.  Pool was magnificent.  Crowded and wifi was limited on the roof but we…

Arrived on a Tuesday, fast check in to a club room.  Architecture in lobby is fantastic.  Inclusive Club afternoon tea and breakfast was very good with a wide selection, with views north and south of Marina.  Had seen reports of a jam packed pool although in the afternoon and 1st thing in the morning (6:30am) that we went, there were only a few people and at one point I was the only person in the pool ;).  The mall is literally off a side passage from the lobby as is the MRT train links.  Was initially reluctant to pay the money for the club upgrade seeing was enough for the room already, however was completely smitten with an iconic Singapore stay.

The hotel is fantastic, you can do so much inside the hotel itself! High-end shopping (all expensive and mid-range brands i could think of), food tripping, etc. The location is good as well; it is near the Singapore Flyer, bay area and food markets. But my most favorite is the pool! Oh by the way,  they are very systematic...from the moment you check-in,  breakfast buffet, pool entrance and the fastest check out ever.

Stayed 2 nights at MBS bridal suite. The room is big and clean with an excellent view of Garden by the bay ....night view is superd! Room service is fast and staff are polite. Dining staff are also very helpful. To sum up, our stay is great!

The staff was very friendly and helpful. They upgraded us to a city-view room from a garden room for free since it was our first stay and provided anything that we needed throughout the whole stay. The rooms were SPOTLESS, and the infinity pool is well worth seeing!!   The check-in process, however, made you feel like 1 in a large herd. It was a bit frustrating, but getting to the room made it all worth it.

came back again , perhaps the fourth time ... upgraded to a suite   Best hotel in the world ! One of the best swimming pool in the world .. Gardens by the bay is a rare treat   Employee Wangelin Sum is superb in customer service ...

had heard a lot about the Marina bay Sands hotel...so it was a must visit....well every thing about the hotel was grand...  Have a few reservations though: 1) the hotel being a tourist destination feels tooo crowded at all times. 2) the adjoining shopping plaza adds to the crowd.. 3) the roof top on the 57th floor gives an awesome view and on weekends you will find half of singapore on the roof... :)  Good parts are: 1) the restaurant on the 57th floor 2) the casino... big and spacious with smoking allowed inside on the base floor.

Booked direct on the website and was around SGD300/night (not including brekky). The pool was fabulous but the water is a bit chilly for me, so I stayed in the warm jacuzzi for a long time. Room has lots of amenities and the view was fantastic. Check in was very easy, flight arrived very early at 5am, couldn't check in yet but they let me go to the pool and stay there. I got my swim gear from the suitcase and enjoyed myself until the room was ready. Try and ask for higher floor :) the gym was awesome too, overlooking the bay. Would definitely go back next time I am in Singapore.

Okay, yes, this is a spectacular hotel.  The view from the Skypark is incredible; you get to see all of Singapore from the top for S$23 if you're not a guest.  Okay, that's it for the praise...  Being a gambler from Vegas and Atlantic City, I came here for the casino.  Love my slots; however, they didn't have any of the slots I've always played.  Plus, the first machine I put my money in, didn't work; had to wait over an hour just to get an attendant.  Even asked over 10+ staff people to help me; they were all as useless as a doggy bag with holes.  And as I was writing this awful review on Tripadvisor I finally got an attendant to get my S$50 back; this was a sign that I was not going to play here ever.     And the only time I got free wifi here is when u r a guest; I was able…

Dear Marina Bay Sands,  I must give my deep gratitude to your Security Team.  At 04:00 am, me and my wife have forgotten a bag (with money and documents) in a taxi in front of your hotel. These men gave us a great help finding the taxi driver on phone by searching the veicle on cameras and he came back with the our bag.  They was very kind and full of courtesy and professional.  Thank you for choosing your team so good and see at the next trip.

We checked in about 7pm after a wonderful stay at Hard Rock Sentosa. We were expecting big things of this hotel. We clearly hadn't done our research and it wasn't helped by Expedia not advising of the local taxes to be added. This could not have come at a worse time as we'd just had problems with our cards being cloned/froze. Also we'd not had to pay anything in Sentosa so this was a massive surprise. Check in took a while and I'll be honest, I didn't feel welcomed at all. Was not what I expected. We were in tower 1 - getting to the pool was a right palaver! The only good thing was the mrt station being a short walk away as there was nothing else here for us. I wouldn't recommend this hotel and I wouldn't stay again. The view from the Skypark is just as good as the pool.…

The rooftop experience and the views from the rooms are stunning and top notch. The club staff were also very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this to anyone travelling to Singapore - but would recommend you consider limiting your stay to one day and night - and bask in the full rooftop experience.  The price of the room was not reflected in the service of the hotel staff (club lounge staff excluded), nor in the quality of the amenities. You can only swim in the pool if you are a guest of the hotel-so I felt over a 5 day period we were paying too much for the pool facilities. We didn't use it every day so didn't get value for money.  Also, if you are travelling with children, the pool (while stunning, amazing, and worth a visit) is quite small and crowded with adults - if…

Enjoyed the stay , good conference venue, can enjoy theatre if interested, entertainment available, difficult to get early check in or late check out... Branded shopping available , can walk around if wanted, infinity pool view is amazing especially at sun rise and sun set,,,,stayed in this hotel 3 times for the same conference and found  similar service every time..2011, 2013 and  2015

Marina Bay Sands is an architectural curiosity that parallels Singapore.  With skyline pools and restaurants, plus a range of five star eateries, basement shops, casino, food stalls, this is a city in itself!  Handy to the airport, MRT, and the river district, this is an excellent hotel option for your Singapore visit.

MBS, upgraded my room, from Club, to Suite. My wife, was totally 'stunned', amazed, delighted..  My 2.5 year old son, enjoying running, playing in the room for hours, and reluctantly went to bed.  The environment was marvellous, room was PERFECT! staffs were friendly...  Will go back again, that's for sure! My wife is a frequent traveller, and now, MBS is at the TOP of her list.

Marina Bay Sands Hotel is one of the landmark in Singapore. The hotel was great with nice view and infity pool overlooking to the city. If you love swimming in their infinity pool you must check-in in this hotel because the swimming pool is exclusive for the hotel guest only.

It was my 2nd stay but I wouldnt go back again. The pool was infested with a lot of people (typically from one country), and therefore there was no place to soak in water , nor to have a peaceful time. I saw a cigarette butt in the pool as well. Wonder how did it even happen?

As a couple we spent 1 night here on our 5 month trip around Asia & Australia for a little bit of luxury & as my partner is an Architect we were both very interested in this structure .. We stayed in Tower 2 with a Garden View .. We thought as we were in the Infinity pool looking at the City by day & evening in the bars .. It was nice to have the Gardens by the Bay & the Singapore Straights view with all the different ships & cruise ships .. Also we watched the Sun come up with that view... Strangely enough the rooms with the Garden view are cheaper... We had breakfast in our room with the patio doors open looking at the early morning comings & goings of the Straights.. Just wonderful .. The only negative for us was that whilst relaxing by the pool the music being played was not…

Returned to the hotel prior to a cruise in celebration of our 42nd wedding anniversary. This is the 3rd time there all of them being around our anniversary date. The past two times our celebration was not even mentioned despite it being noted on the booking. This time however they not only acknowledged it but went above and beyond providing us with an upgrade from a club room to an Orchid suite and delivering a beautiful cake to our room. Staff were friendly and the room was beautiful. One point worthy of note is that since our last visit the Club has since early this year been moved from the 57th floor overlooking the pool area to the 55th floor so be aware of that if you are booked in a room that offers the club privileges. I feel the move has lessened the experience and the…

Positives:  Relatively large rooms and great views on both sides of hotel. Negatives:  Check-in slow with longer lines than in airport security checks, you even have to stand in line (14 minutes) for breakfast, service attitude indifferent, the hotel does not accept some major credit cards (Diners), the rooftop restaurant was closed for a private function, the upper deck pool was overcrowded and no deck chairs available ... in our view not worth the high price of the room cost.

Stayed over the weekend for a family staycation.  It was smooth sailing from the moment we stepped into the lobby. We were appointed a butler, Sam escorted us to the room.  The sands suite was luxurious! 150 sqm with separated bedroom, 6 seater dinning, living and bathrooms. The floor to ceiling view perfected the mood. Espresso machine with wide election of teas were offered.  What surprises me was that the suite house a sizeable soundproofed media room! Great for a movie night with quality sound system.  The room also double as an extra room for my kids.  The club lounge offers great afternoon tea with fantastic view. We fondly enjoyed our breakfast and lunch at Sky57. The food were beyond our expectation.  Thank you Sam for arranging a birthday cake for my wife. It was a nice…

It is incredible, the structure the services, casino, shopping centre, and a tube station several restaurants with fantastic food and chefs. The rooms, spacious and acceptable decoration. The swimming pool incredible! It is a different experience on a hotel. It is Marina Bay!

Stay at tower 1 level 45, facing the city view. lucky the haze was gone and was able to see the amazing singapore night view. enjoyed the time while staying at the hotel, free wifi. hotel in room service was good. swimming pool was crowded though as usual.  MRT and shopping centre is just down below.

Beautiful hotel to spoil yourself. The pool is everything I had heard. Unfortunately the smoke fron the Indonesian fires was annoying but didn't detract completely from the view. Views at night from the sky deck and pool are simply exquisite. You just don't need to leave the complex. Shopping, food and relaxation is all provided. Staff were extremely helpful and organised tours and even advised where I could get a better exchange rate. Our room was large and the bed was very comfortable. I especially liked that the linen was not changed every day unless requested. They were serviced every day however. I would stay there again in a heart beat.

The hotel without any doubt is luxury as soon as you step in and so is the whole complex. The view on the upper deck pool is amazing and breath taking views of Singapore   Yes the place is over crowded all the time as it is a place for tourists, casino, exhibitions, etc.... And hence the high price  The rooms are standard nothing wow compared to the price but the view and facilities are great if you are there for a relaxed trip in Singapore . Certainly not for business as you won't have the time to use all of them.  The staff are very helpful and will assist you all the time.  The free internet in the hotel is vey slow and can be almost dead sometimes which means you have to pay.  Great place and with the money

The room was amazing with a panoramic view . The infinity pool was spectacular with views across the city and a unique experience .  The club facilities and staff were fantastic and overall Marina Bay Sands was brilliant  throughout our  week long stay Highly recommend this Hotel

Room: Quite large with amazing view  Location: easily accessible   Amenities: Lavish  The best thing about this hotel is the Rooftop Pool which was pretty crowded in the evening. Though the best time is to enjoy the pool in morning with scenic views.

Love this place. Such a groovy building. Terrific service, great views, adjacent to one of the best shopping centres in the world. Kid friendly, buffet breakfast best I've ever had. But the pool. Oh the pool. Now that's a pool. 150m infinity edge pool on L57, looking over the city. Magnifique.  Faultless.

Booked the Premier Room  with garden view for One night on the 12/11/2015. It was a surprise for my husband's birthday. The staff expedite the check-in by directing us to the VIP check-in lounge. There we were served by a staff named, Ms Asuna, whom gave us the keys to our 44th Floor!   Filled with excitment we went to view the room. It was clean and spacious. The bathroom came with a bathtub and seperate shower as well. The bathroom has marble floorings and looked classy. Not forgetting the view from the balcony was stunning! It was quiet as well, we could only hear the horns of the ships from the nearby sea.   The room came with cable TV channels, so I assure you will not be bored. The room also has free wi-fi.   We headed to the infinity pool at the 57th floor. Though there…

This is a typical casino hotel. If  you want a luxury classy experience stay away from it. Its is a mass processing plant of (mostly chinese) gamblers and their families. Everything is massively overpriced; e.g. the breakfast is $50 pp. The service is mechanical with no personal touch. The rooms are OK with the nice views at the higher floors. Showers are OK, but the bed is wobbly, so if you are a light sleeper your partner is guaranteed to wake you up a few  times. The cost of laundry of a suit, some shirts , etc was $350  The best feature of the hotel is the rooftop pool, but over the years this has changed from a more luxury exclusive area to loud screaming music with bars that easily extort you $100 for few beers.  I have asked my travel department to put this hotel on my…

for the price paid , the suite was amazing! luxuriously overwhelming!  piano in the hall, spacious rooms,  bath tubs walk in wardrobe.  not forgetting inroom ktv and inroom massage corner and gym corner.

I returned to the Marina Bay Sands hotel, staying at the club level room. Reservation and check in are both Super efficient despite the high volume of guests given the hotel size. Guest traffic was Organised and managed well to Ensure minimum wait.   The infinity pool was our number Favourite and always the key highlight of the stay. And even if there's nothing else worth returning for, this is the best reason enough.  The gym was well equipped, large and airy and has a very nice view out to the city. My friends who are gym experts also commended the facilities.  But I'm kinda disappointed with the club after relocation. The older location on the 57 th floor to me was nicer and more cosy with better views of the garden as well as the pool. But service wise was better than…

I didn't get to stay here, but have been invited to hangout/party in their suites by friends on 2 occasions. The suites are awesome. Overly generous in size, has all that you can possibly ask for, and a great view. I don't know how much my friend had to pay for it, but I'll bet it costs a fortune

I am very happy to stay in Marina Bay sand from 9th Nov to 11th Nov 2015... very nice hotel..excellent staff ... perfect location ....perfect food....kids enjoy a lot....Infinity pool on 57th floor..amazing ....One of the best hotel in my life.... defiantly come again next year ....

To be honest, the only reason why I booked this hotel during my birthday is to experience how exhilarating it is to be on top of MBS and enjoying the view while half of your body is dipped into the pool! Lol It was really awesome.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel as a bit of a treat for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Upon checking in we advised it was for our wedding anniversary and we got an upgraded room which was absolutely fantastic - we loved every minute at this hotel, the pool was sensational and it was quite sad to ever have to leave. The reason I can only give them 3 stars is because after we checked out we noticed our invoice had numerous charges for the minibar! WE DID NOT USE THE MINIBAR!!!!!!! We moved some of the cans out of the way so we could cool some bottles of water and for some medication! We were totally unaware that the fridge has weight sensors in it and you are automatically charged for moving the items.  Had they have noticed that we put all the items back and not charged us,…

Was passing through Singapore on our round the world backpacking trip and couldn't pass up on the opportunity to stay at this fantastic hotel and treat ourselves for one night. Queue for check in was a tad long but went down quite quick with a lot of people around trying to speed things up. We got to our room, changed and headed straight up to the pool to get "the" shot in the pool. To our disappointment the pool was closed due to bad weather but was later reopened. Pool can get crowded with everyone wanting photos but is still pretty impressive. Room was spacious and had all the luxuries you would expect from a hotel of its kind. Lots of restaurant choices although we was disappointed in our choice of Bread Street Kitchen. Would love to return here, hopefully for more than one…

We stayed for the first time at the Marina Bay Sands hotel for 2 nights prior to a stay with friends. After shopping around online, the best deal is to book directly through the hotel's website! They'll match anything but it was the best price anyway! We chose to add an option of the club membership. We have a 2 year old and a 4 year old and arriving around midnight we were warmly welcomed and a quick check in and they had everything in place. This maybe due to a very thorough pre-arrival email and confirmation sheet they requested? The hotel room we had was a 1 bedroom corner room on the 49th floor (the highest residential level). It was huge and beautiful. In reality given the size of the rooms we probably only needed a regular room? A fold out sofa was great for one child…

Was told if we wanted to go to the top of this building to take a lift to the 57th floor and go to one of the bars for a drink. This is what we did and had a pleasant time sipping on a cocktail (not cheap but worth it for the experience) and admiring the view. Also was able to see the infinity pool although access is only for hotel guests

This is a great hotel, stunning to look at, excellent service and great rooms and facilities. The rooftop pool is amazing and great views all round. Highly recommend and really convenient for the convention centre

Apart from its iconic infinity pool, even the basic rooms were equipped with all the luxury amenities. They gave us a room on the 37th floor overlooking the Gardens by the Bay. The view was stunning from there and from atop too. The breakfast spread was huge, offering varied options. Unfortunately, the cheese and chocolate buffet offered in the restaurants there needed prior reservation so wasn't able to try that. This is worth a stay atleast once.

Stayed here for one night.  Let's start from the positive points: - View from the rooms and the pool (though the windows are a bit dirty) - Great if you are going for a performance or conference in MBS and of course you are visiting the casino  Negative points: - Amenities like shower gel, shampoo etc looks and feel cheap - Location not convenient if you are visiting places other than MBS, long queue for taxi after show and long walk from MRT - No turn down service for a 5 star hotel - Arrived at 2:15 pm and was told no rooms available. Went back at 3 pm, despite being the earliest check in time, no king size bed available - Many drink items in menu not available from the bar on 57th floor - Earlier than normal check out time at 11 am  Overall it feels more like a 4 star than 5…

A really great hotel, with the best infinity pool I have ever seen anywhere in the world. Rooms are good, with good network connectivity. Room service varied and reasonably priced. Location is great, transport is easy (whether walking, taxi or the MRT, of which there is a connected station). Downsides? Well, I am quibbling here: on-premise restaurants are expensive (although you're better off exploring Singapore for food anyway), and there is no lounge / seating (I had a number of hours to kill between checkout and heading to the airport, and there was nowhere I could sit down and work).

Our stay was super good. The receptionists and other staff were friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was fine - I like it. Room was fine too, spacious and clean - we got a deluxe room city view. I requested for a cake because it was my partner's birthday back then, and they delivered one. Everything went well during our stay! A bit pricey, but definitely worth it. Thumbs up!

Marina bay sands	 Stay for nights:	3	 ,Checkin experience: 	5	out of 5, ,Room Size:	4	out of 5, ,Lifts:	4	out of 5, ,Amenities in room:	4	out of 5, ,Air conditioning:	4	out of 5, ,View from hotel:	4.5	out of 5, ,Service:	4	out of 5, ,Food:	4	out of 5, ,Cleanliness	4.5	out of 5, ,Conference rooms	5	out of 5, ,Lobby	4.5	out of 5, ,Value for Money	4.5	out of 5, ,Checkout Experience	4.5	out of 5, 		 One should stay at this hotel atleast for a night, Infinity pool is just awesome

The hotel has a grand ambiance, very quick and supportive check-in, check-out.. But the wifi connection is very unstable and needs signing in continuously as there are a few plans although they are FOC

This is my first time staying at MBS since I usually stayed at IHG(Platinum Elite) or Accor (gold) chain hotel but since during those period the room was not available. So I thought I gave MBS a try and see what the fuss about. I mostly travel to Singapore on business at least spend 15 nights a month.  Stayed at room 4681 from 04th Nov - 07th Nove 2015. Check in was very pleasant with so much information given by the Front Office which is a vey nice touch.   Everything was perfect until I turn on the TV the night before my checkout date. I checked on the billing status and to my surprise there's a charge for restaurant bill that I did not take which is Sky on 57. Immediately I phone the front office regarding this matter and i was told the FO manager has been notified and I can…

i dont know if we were just lucky, but our experience at Marina Bay Sands, is so much different to so many reviews I read on here.  We loved every bit, we had a garden view room on the 30th floor in Tower 3.and the view was amazing, the room was spacious and perfect,the bathroom very luxurious  We even had a little balcony we were checked in early, bags bought up swiftly and an hour after check in , a lady came to the door, to make sure we were okay and if we needed anything.  The bed was super comfortable, and housekeeping perfect,  We had no problems getting a bed at the pool, even though we were there on the weekend, we went to the both during the day and at night, plenty of beds and plenty of space.  the pool is actually a bit overwhelming, it is so breathtaking,  We ate at…

Wow, what a hotel. 57 floors across three blocks. The size is unbelievable.  When we first checked in, we had paid for the cheapest room, which at £225 wasn't exactly cheap. We were allocated a garden view room on the third floor. We were very disappointed about being so low so I asked to be higher and said I didn't mind paying slightly more. We were offered a city view room on the 53rd floor for an extra 53 singapore dollars (£25) and I didn't hesitate. You are already paying so much that extra bit gets you so much more.  Onto the room. Huge. Spacious. Clean. And the view... Wow! I've attached pictures as words can do no justice.  The main reason we wanted to stay here like a lot of others is because of the world's largest rooftop pool on the 57th floor. It was incredible. We…

I went with friends to celebrate my friend's birthday. We got a room with a really nice view (room 1011). This room is not city view but it looks to other side which is Gardens by the Bay. Room was big enough for us and we could ask for an extra bed for a child which was basically as big as the other twin beds we had. Bathroom also very nice and spacious but has no bathtub. This was in a basic room (can't remember room name). We were just there for a day so we didn't really want to splurge beyond that room (originally around SGD400plus). Luckily a friend's mother has a membership and we got a better deal.   Service was okay. We asked for a birthday cake to surprise my friend but it took ages to come. But anyway it was a sizeable cake and it was delicious.   The hotel has easy…

We stayed here for 3 nights in a premium room with the breakfast package.   We were on the 47th floor with views of the Marina. Rooms are generously sized and sice we were celebrating a birthday we were given a slice of cake with a candle after our room was serviced.  Whilst rooms are serviced daily...turndown service is only given uppn request. I found this quite unusual for a 5 star hotel.  Firstly the check in process surprisingly was really smooth and I was quite impressed. We had a VIP check in so we were taken straight from our cab to the room.   Thats where the impressive service stopped. This hotel is like a train station. Do not go here if you are after a relaxing holiday. You step out to a packed lobby with long ques at check in. The breakfast at sky on 57 is very…

I've got no idea why this place would get negative reviews. Hotel is outstanding in every aspect. Huge well appointed rooms, amazing facilities, restaurant and pool and very friendly staff. Yes it is expensive but the whole experience is worth it. Only negative was the smog surrounding Singapore affected the view from the infinity pool.

Gigantic hotels and resorts tend to be somewhat soulless and fails to make a guest special. Not MBS, though. From check in to how friendly and helpful the staff are. We were there for a week that just flew by Amenities are excellent. Accessible as it has a subway station and the shopping arcade is amazing. Restaurants are fantastic and nightlife quite vibrant We loved it so much we decided that our first trip abroad with our newborn son will be to MBS in February It's a unique destination in an amazing country  P.S. For a little more book a grand club room with city view. Out of this world

We stayed here for 2 nights on our way from London to Australia.  What a great hotel - restaurants, shops etc at your doorstep! We had a grand club room - massive, stunning views and great decor. Service was faultless, staff happy to help and nothing is too much trouble! Can't wait to return!

Hotel check-in took us around an hour which is unacceptable but since we were offered a good upgrade we took back our happy faces. We Booked an Orchid Suite overnight and was immediately mesmerised by the view. The suite was a vast space of luxury and comfort fit for a picky traveler. The infinity swimming pool however was a disappointment because it was too overcrowded with guests taking selfies. Lots of activities within the hotel premises but if you plan to go elsewhere. MBS is easily accessible thru taxi or MRT.

business trip with my son   stayed in a grande club suite  large hotel but could not provide two single beds  room other than this was fantastic, check in was long winded  and not that helpful even with the prices they charge  staff at breakfast were fantastic  shame they dont promote some to front desk.   pool was the highlight.

Obviously this is an amazing hotel with world class facilities. But to be a world class hotel it is missing one vital ingredient. Guests will pay exorbitant tariffs if they are made to feel special. A quality hotel is where you are met with a welcome smile at the door, your cases whisked away to your room and you are escorted to your room with advice on how to use swipe cards and the features of th hotel. You are usually greeted with a treat, chocolates, fruit or wine and fresh milk for a cup of tea or coffee. None of this happens at the Sands. Instead you will easily be lost in a mass of guests and will need to find your own room. When you arrive you will discover you will need to pay for a fridge and high speed wifi. There is a small bar fridge full of overpriced drinks, a can…

We were suggested to stay in this trendy hotel which has a nice view frm the 58th floor. Surprisingly when we were checking in, we were upgraded from Deluxe room which i booked for  nights, to Sands Suit on the 19th floor (Tower 1) with 145 sq.m. and a pool table inside. It was huge! We had a garden view. The room was nice and clean, though it was really huge. Thanks to coffee maker, i enjoyed a coffee every morning. They had a nice choice of bath accessories. However, breakfast in not included-(. Come on, guys! For that price - breakfast in not inlcuded? One time stay. Wouldnt choose it again.

I booked a superior room (city view) approx paid $450 inclusive of tax in usd per night. stayed for 4 nights.  -rooms are nice and big (but having able to try different hotels in singapore in my past visits its practically a standard sized room for singapore hotels.)  -no bathtubs for superior rooms (seeing how the bathroom looks makes me consider rooms overpriced)  -breakfast is good .. but make sure to come early as you will have to fall in line since its a huge hotel expect to cue longer (note:i paid extra for the bfast since its not included at my rate yet.)  -love the beds beddings and the comforters.  -beware of the mini bar and fridge since it has a computerized detector that will charge you automatically if u move anything in it.  -swimming pool at the top has a nice…

The swimming pool makes all the difference, the room was really big but without any style, pretty ugly and old.  The swimming pool was amazing , i wasn't disappointed one second, the view on the whole city is so nice.  The service was excellent also.

The Marina Bay Sands was a must when visiting Singapore and I don't regret it. We booked 3 nights for our honeymoon and it was our finale and much more than what we expected. Just some tips for people going to book. we booked a deluxe city view. It was lovely to wake up to in the morning, however I would have been happy to wake up on the other side also with a view of the Gardens by Bay as it tends to be misty some times. Also as you know the infinity pool is the highlight and to get the true experience and enjoy it practically to your self I highly recommend going up at 6.30am -definitely worth the early wake up call . Its too overcrowded any other time of the day. Breakfast of $43 was overpriced and you can grab a lovely breakfast in other places for half the amount. We took…

We've been going to Singapore many times over the last few years. My husband's family celebrated my father-in-law's birthday by staying at MBS. It was a very pleasant experience. The only downside to the place is that there's always a LOT of people, but if you don't mind that, then great! If you're looking for less crowded accommodation, then this might not be for you. I like that it's near the ArtScience Museum, which always has great exhibits. All in all, great view, good food, excellent service.

The best hotel ever to stay even though it is very very expensive.  Superb Infinity Pool, friendly staff.   Superb GYM with all facilities.  Perfect location and the view. Once in your lifetime everyone must stay there

What can be said about the pool except WOW! This is an incredible view and an amazing concept of an infinity pool that overlooks the city. I was a little sceptical about the price for a casino. How wrong I was. I cannot stress enough, the pool is truly worth the price- even if it is just for a night or so.   The room is spacious and distinctly "asian" in appearance. Plenty of marble and gold but very comfortable and clean. There is a big balcony on most rooms which strangely do not have any outdoor furniture on it. We had a great view of the gardens which at night were spectacular. The hotel has amazing facilities including a great gym and fitness centre, plenty of amazing restaurants and one of the most efficient check out processes I have ever witnessed. This hotel, despite…

Nice hotel. Rooms are spacious. The only downside is the number of mainland chinese tourist at the pool area n everywhere else. They are loud, they like to squeeze and don't understand personal space.   Food is not bad. There are many restaurants available. First floor, there is Jin Shan n Rise(buffet) or you can walk towards the shopping area where there are nice celebrity restaurants or even a food court

I took my family here to celebrate my birthday and it was a bad choice!!! It's sooooo busy, crowded, unorganized and overpriced!!! The only good part was the hotel is connected to the mall so that's handy.  I guess if you were a gambler, you might like it.

This hotel is an icon in the Singapore skyline and with its spectacular infinity swimming pool it is a one-off must do.  It is a very large hotel in all senses, and that is the main reason it only gets a 4 from us. It is too large to give you the intimate feeling of a staff knowing you and your needs.  Everything works just fine everywhere in the hotel but you can't stop feeling that you are only a visitor, and only one out of a thousand.  The room, a deluxe room with city view, was spacious and had a decent sized bathroom. The view was also ok, being at 21 floor you had an ok city view but lower floors would struggle to have unobstructed view.  Ce La Vie bar on top floor has a fantastic view, it's crowded most of the time but you will get your chances of taking pictures every…

I stayed at 8th floor of Tower 3 with Gardens by The Bay view last week.  We checked in from Tower 1 counter. The check in area was not impressive and did not reflect luxury as many other 5 star hotel did. There were people dressing down, dressing us, or even with wet bathing suits around.. And no welcome drink or even no staffs offering help for our luggage. I think the bigger hotel, the less service, it was not because they were poor manner, but mostly because out of hands with so many in/out guests. The check in was simple though, since we made bed & breakfast booking thru their website.  The highlight of this hotel, to be honest, was the infinity pool. It was so packed with people in the afternoon, but a bit less in the morning.  The room itself was standard, I would not say…

Great hotel and service. All is very nice looking very good room. Slept in tower 3 view to the marina bay -not the sea. Great view from 40 flour. But....Shops and restaurant very expensive :(. All them If meals are not included go out eat well and cheaper by high.

When you're in Singapore, you must stay in Marina Bay Sands. The pool is simply amazing. Wow! Also the room was so big with great bed and big and nice bathroom. This was the best hotel experience in my life.

While I cannot fault the hotel - Great rooms/bathrooms, very attentive staff and an amazing view from the sky deck/pool, I felt this hotel lacked any soul. It was simply one massive three tower monster with hundreds and hundreds of  people everywhere you looked. Swimming pool was completely overcrowded. breakfast buffet was good but again exceptionally busy as the restaurant would have easily seated 300-400 people. Most mornings had to queue for up to fifteen minutes to be seated. The large scale of the hotel prevents it from feeling luxurious which is would you would expect here given the price of the rooms. If you are looking for something a little classy, intimate, luxurious and value for money this is not the place for you.

Having stayed for one night only after a cruise, I made sure to take full advantage of the hotel, the inifinity pool and the exclusive lounge on the top floor (for an additional fee) where I was treated like a VIP.  The hotel is something out of Star Trek and so much going on from a quiet coffee in the lobby to the beats on the roof garden.  Amazing night views not to be missed!

This hotel is perfect if you like to gamble and needless to say for the stunning sky deck and pool. However the lobby feels like a market at times due to it being overcrowded and the rooms are average. It feels like one of those mass convention hotels. Does not feel cosy or luxurious.

I stayed at this hotel with friends during the Grand Prix weekend. Immediate first impressions where that the hotel was luxury with high standards and helpful staff. The rooms where clean, spacious and had lovely views. Staff where always willing to help when their services where required. Only downside to this hotel is that it is very expensive and during Grand Prix weekend you have to stay for a minimum of 3 nights. The infinity pool on the roof was amazing with some jaw dropping views.

Visited Singapore in Feb  so this review has been long due . Stayed there for 3 Nights with room being on 54th Floor over looking the botanical gardens.Room was very spacious and had serious amount of tech built into the rooms to control all operations which I loved . Now coming to best feature property had to offer INFINITY POOL on 96th Floor Covering all the 3 Towers The view of Singapore city below was spectacular .We stayed in the pool till it was lil dark to see all the lights of Skyscrapers.Great food and one of the Lagrest shopping Malls that I have seen .

My cousin from Sydney and I stopped over for one night on the 20th.  All my complaints : - no proper automobile approaches for all three towers    Tower 3 has a very haphazard approach, cars were honking while we were trying to       get our bags    none for Tower 2  - no one to greet you, nor any porter to help with luggage at Tower 3 !!  - not enough concierge for the spread out floor plan of the hotel  - the computer system was down !    OMG, the hotel is less than 6 years old  - front desks at Tower 3 completely empty on the 21st morning     BIG time OMG !!! not even a proper person to direct, if not run the guests' needs to            the next Tower  - hotel lobby is like an outside public street     there were high school students running up and down the escalators into…

In fact, I love it so much I didn't leave it.  Everything about it is fabulous.  Room, staff, ambience.  Perfect place to unwind and relax on your way to anywhere.  We chose to break our trip home from Europe to Australia with two nights at Marina Bay.  Pretty sure we've kicked the jet lag and what a place to do it.  The Club Rooms are great value with all the inclusions and just love a night time swim in that amazing pool.  We have been here before and I'm sure we will return again.  Pretty sure this is my favourite hotel in the world.

Marina Bay Sands is enormous,grand and as busy as a small city.Hundreds of people in the foyer at all times.To walk the foyer of the 3 towers is like being in a large shopping mall.Nothing here is cheap from accommodation,drinks and food.We had an upgrade at an extra cost with magnificent city views.The rooms are spacious with floor to ceiling glass windows.The top pool floor is open early for a swim and to take in the amazing city views.We really enjoyed our few days here,check-in to service was fantastic.MRT is easy to navigate around town,very cheap and gets you to all the top tourist spots.

我們在金沙住了一晚，大部份的時間都待在壯闊的空中泳池 來新加坡一定要造訪的景點，偉大的工程! 美中不足的是要避開每年10月，印尼的火耕季節讓新加坡天空佈滿霾....可惜 We stayed 1 night there, spent most of our time at the pool it is a MUST see place when you visit Singapore we went on this Oct, the only thing to complain was the bad weather the sky was covered by haze most of the time....sigh... other than that, it is really a nice hotel, amazing architecture including a convenient shopping center right beneath and quick access to the gardens by the bay.

this has definitely been my high light of my trip to asia.  This hotel was more than i expected.  We stayed in tower 2 on 34th floor overseeing the city view.  Wow is all i can say.  Fantastic room, the infinity pool and skypark was a site to remember.  I ended up staying in the entire time instead of exploring the city while i was here.   Worth every penny.  To save on high speed wifi you can opt in and sign up for a rewards card which they later waive the $20 fee.

This is the most costliest place in Singapore and is consider to be a Las Vegas of Singapore.  However, for tourist, it's a photo op location. One should not miss the free fountain show which is remarkable in evenings. The brand stores are amazing. I would say it's a different world in Singapore.

I was lucky enough to enjoy the hospitality of some friends who were staying at the hotel.  I am not sure what the room cost, but, I know it wasn't inexpensive. On arrival at Tower 1, I did walk up to the front doors and expected them to be automatically.  Once I realised that they weren't going to open by themselves, I reached out 'pulled'... and hoped no-one was watching... hee hee. The concierge desk was very helpful and we used them again about 4 times after our arrival.  Thanks boys and girls, you helped make our stay very enjoyable. If you are staying, why not join their club?  It is free and you can get some great discounts... our bonus was a discount at the Theatre.  We thought perhaps 5 or 10%, but, believe me when I say it was heaps more than 30%.  Score! I had thought…

I was very satisfied with my entire experience with Marina Bay Sands from my booking to my check out. After making my booking online through the hotel website, I was contacted by Jasmine Sin and Jeraldine to coordinate the details in preparation for my arrival at the hotel. This greatly put my mind at ease and made my check-in process a complete breeze.   I was warmly welcomed to the hotel and walked to the concierge desk by Jeremy Cheah, then greeted cheerfully by Cheryl at check-in. To my surprise, she informed me on behalf of the Premium Services team that I would be upgraded as I was celebrating my birthday at the hotel. I was extremely delighted by this point and if that wasn't enough, the team had also arranged for a birthday cake and a complimentary bottle of champagne to…

Wow really says it all - what an experience this hotel was! Myself and my boyfriend had been travelling for 3 months backpacking round south east Asia and this was a massive treat for us. We mucked up our reservation by a night and when we tried to change it unfortunately they didn't have a room of the same standard for the night before so we paid a bit more to upgrade and now I can see why it was an upgrade!!! We were in tower 3, garden view in the biggest hotel room I have ever been in in my life. When we checked in from the start every single member of staff was so friendly and helpful, due to our room we got a free afternoon tea, free canopies and drinks for 2 hours that night and a free breakfast the next day. The food was unbelievable and worth the upgrade 100%. The pool…

Best hotel on singapore i really enjoy there and best swimming pool have execlent view. The staff was frindly and helpful . The food is international so you can eat a lote of thing .                                                                                             They have shop mall with the hotel and alote of resturante there you can see what u need and u like to eat

The Orchid Suite is nice.  Perhaps a bit of overkill in size, but having views over both sides of the building is one of its greatest features.  The sleeping area is huge.  The beds are firm, the Nespresso machine is a nice inclusion.  Views are stunning, both by day and night.  The standard of cleanliness maintained in our suite, cleaned by the excellent Zhen Long was second to nothing I have experienced before.  The added Club Experience is a brilliant feature well worth the inclusion in the room price.  The Club is an excellent venue for enjoyment, with free flowing Piper Heidsieck from 5pm to 7pm, or whatever else is your drink of choice, within reason.  The hotel is large and crowded.  The lobby especially and we tended to avoid it where possible.  The pool is very well…

were immediately upgraded, check in was quite smooth, the room was very spacious with wonderful city view. Nicely located with casino and shopping center under it. Went to the pool and sky park, great experience but honestly extremely  crowded up there in the pool and at the skypark. Recommended to stay here, especially if one like the casino, as no need to get in the long taxi que afterwards, just walk back to the room :)

Just visiting the Marina Bay Sands. It's very upmarket, with designer rooms, designer malls & designer attention to detail. It's USP is its magnificent rooftop pool area with stunning infinity pool overlooking the harbour of Singapore. I've only seen one better, the Hotel Caruso in the Amalfi Coast.  The suites are very plush, with the most comfortable beds - we managed a full 12 hour sleep after our partying excesses in Singapore, which has now crept into our top 5 cities to visit, along with New York, Istanbul, Barcelona & London.  Things to be aware of at the Marina Bay - breakfast is extortionate - cost us best part of £50 this morning when we thought it was included in the price of our stay, which is extremely expensive anyway. Also the rooftop cocktail bar, whilst having…

This place is not only a landmark, but a beautiful one. We didn't actually stay here, but made a point to visit it anyway. We visited the 57th floor and got to experience the breathtaking views of Singapore. The Hotel itself s stunning and looks like an amazing place to stay.

Iconic.  Typically impeccable Singaporean service... spa - one of the best massages I've ever had... casino - no where like it Ive ever been... sic-bo heaven.... shopping... better than any mall I've seen in the US... rooftop - everything but especially a day at the famous infinity pool... just watching people take endless selfies is worth it... gym - horridly hot... 85 degrees... but loved every minute of it.

We stayed at Marina Bay Sands for 4 days and 3 nights as a staycation for my mom's 40th Birthday. We booked an Orchard Suite for the 1st night as my mom decided to invite her friends and have a small get together. IT WAS AMAZING! There was enough room for everybody, a large dining table to eat together, and a pool table to just have fun! It was also great that there's a separate wash room for the guests as I almost stayed in the bath while my mom host her party. 😂  We then transferred to a Deluxe room which has an amazing view of the city lights! Our suite has a view of Gardens by the Bay, which then was only starting to set up a light deco. It was beautiful.   The room service and housekeeping is excellent. We even had a personal butler on our first night. They respond very…

I travel to Singapore frequently on business. I usually stay at the Intercontinental Hotel (Bugis) or Fullerton Bay Hotels and have also stayed at the Mandarin Oriental, Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Raffles, and Regent.  Compared to other hotels, the Marina Bay is more of an integrated resort than a luxury hotel.  Because of its size, all of the procedures, systems, service, etc... is very standardized but at a very high level.  The food quality, for example, is top notch, but you wouldn't be expected to be greeted by name at the entrance.  For business travelers, it's a great in-and-out hotel that guarantees that you will be having the same 5 star quality level each time and the rooms and facilities are all very well kept. I haven't had any complaints about any of the services…

I had a great stay as iconic as the property itself. This property has 2500+ rooms and so please expect the lobby to be busy and crowded. I had the fastest check-in and check-out in my life here! They have great staff, very friendly and very swift, all very well experienced. The guys at the concierge were very helpful. My room was upgraded and I got an early check-in. There is metro station nearby and so easy access to all major parts of the city. Gardens by the bay is just opposite to the hotel. I enjoyed the breakfast very much due to South Indian dishes. I went to the sky deck and pool, it was so busy, the wagyu burgers were very tasty. The weather wasn't great due to haze. Rooms were cleaned everyday and I had to inform my room attendant to take-it-easy! I would highly…

Very nice staff who are efficient and service minded. A very big hotell, our room was very ordinary, but with a fantastic view over the city. Crowded in the lobby, crowded in the lifts, crowded at the rooftop pool. A bit to crowded for us. Will book a more quiet hotel next time.

It became one of my favorite hotel, unforgettable experience and memories. I stayed premier room with bath tub.  Very spacious bathroom and luxourious.  Would choose this hotel for my next singapore. Would miss the view from the infinity pool , top of the building.

Spent only one night as a bit over my budget. Still I wanted to try it and the money was well worth it. Huge in every sense. View was great in the bay. One of the best view money can buy. Room was also very nice.

We've been there twice. I love their infinity pool and jacuzzi. Its very fun staying here with the family. Love the place. The morning view is a breath-taking moment. You'll appreciate the whole marina area when u're on the top.

The best hotel in which I have  stayed till now the greatest thing which I like is there big spacious swimming pool the best in the world and big rooms staff was very polite and  helpful with recommend  this hotel to stay

We booked the rooms a half year before we went there so they weren't that expensive. Nevertheless we got great rooms on a high level and a nice view. Of course we visited the infinity pool on the top which was the second best pool I've ever seen (first is Bondi in Sidney ;-) ). The food and drinks on the roof are a bit too expensive in my opinion but good. Overall i can highly recommend the Marina Bay Sands, it's a once in a lifetime experience

I went with my mum and sister for one night to experience to pool. As they didn't have twin beds anymore we got an upgrade as an excuse, which totally made up for it. Somehow they didn't register my payment which was a bit of trouble as we had to figure that out. Anyway the upgrade made more than up for it. Overall the staff is very nice and the sms check in is very convenient. And of course the pool is absolutely stunning, even there are quite a lot of people. It's a pricey but great experience.  The only thing is that the restrict the wifi, which is a bit ridiculous for such a price.

We loved our stay at Marina Bay Sands.  We were in one of the club rooms.  We used the club for breakfast which was good.  The main reason we stayed here was for the pool view.  It was just as nice as expected and we spent time lounging around the pool to eat.  The pool was pretty busy most times and everyone was taking photos.  The pool was fairy cold though so it was more take a picture then get out.  The hotel was near the gardens, ferris wheel, and duck tours.  We also walked around the bay.  In order to get to the night safari and Sonesta we had to take a cab.  I also picked the hotel due to the casino.  It was nice and offered a variety of games.  I didnt spend much time there though as I had better luck at the Resorts World.  There is an entrance to the casino near the…

Stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon. Our flight arrived early and unfortunately we were not able to check in to our room until 3pm, which was very disappointing after a long flight. They did offer us cards to access the showers and pool although as we had limited time during our stopover we were hoping to be able to check in to our room.  If you are looking for boutique, personalized service then this is not the hotel for you as you do feel as though you are just another guest. The hotel is very large and takes quiet some time to get from check-in counter to the elevators to room, so not recommended for guests with mobility issues. Location is great as a short trip down the escalators in the main lobby is a shopping complex which then leads out to the bay and…

awesome hotel in singapore..huge hotel with modern amenities..must visit place in singapore..best location best service best food..rooms are huge,neat and clean.had fun with family.we had stayed one night but later we felt should stay one more night.

We had a layover in Singapore on one of our flights during our honeymoon that we were spending across Asia, so we decided to try this hotel and we were surprised from the begining with the free room upgrade that we received because of our honeymoon, we got garden views and few details in the room, like chocolates, strawberries, coffee.. etc.. The staff during the check-in /out was very fast, helpful and efficient. The pool is amazing, you can find some trash on it (leaves of trees), nothing important, but it's a detail ;) Surely we'll comeback soon.

I stayed here for 2 nights, with my wife on my visit to Singapore this August. The hotel no doubt is too classy and made beautifully with an amazing infrastructure, and real helpful staff, but the downside is, that its too over crowded.  The hotel is known for its infinity pool on the top floor. Most of the people who stay here, just do so to experience the infinity pool, but the truth is, its a waste even trying to get in, because most of the time its FULL of people. Forget swimming, you cant even enjoy the view from the top properly. Overall its a good property though.

Amazing 2-night staycation over my boyfriend's birthday weekend. Great assistance rendered by the staff at MBS, from pre-arrival, to check-in and during the stay. Special mentions to Nur Izzati for helping with the arrangements to receive a cupcake surprise delivery for my boyfriend; Vance, the staff who served us at check-in who offered a complimentary upgrade to premier room as part of their efforts to make us feel welcomed and loved, and he took quite abit of time during check-in to find a room with superb view, just for us; Xi Na, the service staff for housekeeping for meticulously helping us to re-arrange the messy items we left on dressing table and in the bathroom. On the first night of the check-in, we were also surprised with a slice of complimentary chocolate mousse…

I booked this hotel to round off our Singapore vacation and make use of the fantastic pool. It was not cheap, but worth every cent. The hotel was enormous, the biggest place I have stayed, but so efficient so felt quite at home. We arrived around mid-day. The huge lobby was packed, and anywhere else, could have been overwhelming. The queue at reception was not too long, but as soon as we joined, we were asked for our details. I produced the booking confirmation, the gentleman checked and then escorted us to another desk where we were seen straight away. Although we were a couple of hours early, one of our two rooms was ready so we were able to leave all our cases there and got temporary pool cards.  We were shown to our room by Madurai who was most helpful and showed us where…

Unbelievable hotel, an amazing view of the bay and its financial district, across a really nice park next to the river. Complex with mall and convention center. Pool at the top of the hotel is a priceless experience. Good quality of services and food. It worth due to the location.

We stayed at the room facing gardens by the bay and the view was fantastic. Although the swimming pool was full of people taking the pictures, but we still enjoyed the atmosphere very much. The food with room service was also delicious, we ordered one pizza with sausage. The only suggestion we would make is that it was a little bit difficult to find front desk if you arrive by the MRT because the area was too big. All in all, everything was good and above satisfactory.

Only stayed one night but absolutely amazing! Let us check in early and go to our room meaning we got the most out of our 1 night stay as we could access the amazing infinity pool! Bathroom was huge, lots of towels, robes and slippers! Amazing view of the city with a sofa area to relax! The service was excellent at the pool, free clean towels, table service and helpful friendly staff! Highly recommend! View from the pool is incredible!

Spent one night at MBS... Wouldn't do it again and I don't recommend it. Paid almost 700 SGD, for a double room, no breakfast. Compare rooms, amenities, but especially service and staff to any other five star hotel in town and you'll pay half the price for a true luxury hotel experience.

We wanted to visit and enjoy this amazing hotel, i felt it was like a market crowd at the entrance checkin counters could have  been done in a different way .staff were very helpful  we had a nice time just having a quick view   For. Tourist a best place

I have stayed many hotels across the globe and ofc Singapore. So far this is the top. Check in was swift, you cannot expect to receive personal touch like other smaller hotel but receptionist went above and beyond. Rooms were sadly...normal, i stayed 2 different rooms none had balcony (there might be different room category which i did not have chance to stay). Its spacious, great amenities, huge bathroom but bedroom is a bit boring. Pool on top is exquisite, you can spend whole day up there after busy day. This will be a top choice for me, highly recommend

The Infiniti Pool at the rooftop is amazing. You get a bird's eye view of Singapore. Have a beer at the poolside cafe and they serve awesome Turkish sandwiches. The pool gets  a bit crowded with guests in the evening.

Stayed this hotel while on business in Singapore and i must say the facilities and the management was wonderful. I loved the attention to detail and taste they had in the food. I did not have the chance to experience the infinity pool but had the chance to see the pool with its spectacular view. Sometimes i wondered if all the humans in the world is here, its very busy but i can see the management well handling everything.

My stay here was September 2014.   It was amazing! The views were spectacular and I spent every afternoon at the infinity pool. I would say it's one of the best infinity pool I've been to. Very relaxing with views across the city.   Highly recommend it.

I was to be attending a conference at MBS so it made sense to stay close to the conference. The conference facilities across the road were excellent. So are the shops. The casino is OK, nothing brilliant, just a casino.  But the hotel itself? The rooms are OK. The food at the main Chinese lobby restaurant was also quite OK. In this respect, MBS is a very good hotel.  But the lobby and main area resemble a railway station, with people running everywhere, pushing trolleys or suitcases, long queues etc and staff that on more than one occasion were not helpful. It really detracts from the MBS experience.

Family stay in this giant hotel. It's actually too large. Very unpersonal, long ques and long waiting for check in. The room was pretty big with nice view of the marina. A bit dark interior. Nothing special. We really enjoyed the rooftop pool. They even have a photo service at the top.

We came for a 3-day work conference in September and the first thing that strikes you is the sheer scale of the place, our conference had 1,500+ delegates and just one of about 4 or 5 similar size conferences taking place at the same time, yet service was fast, polite and efficient and we never once during our stay felt the place was crowded or that we had to wait for anything. Cocktails on the roof terrace on the first night gave a quick crash-course in ignoring you're 57 floors up and just enjoying yourself whilst being careful not to drop your phone, handbag or shoes lest they bounce off the floor, under the bannister and into the air (not a hotel for people suffering from vertigo!). The infinity pool is just as amazing and out of this world as it looks on the website. Not…

I’ve never been one for staycations, but I finally capitulated, seeing how SG50 (Singapore’s 50th National Day) would only come once in a lifetime. So lucky me managed to snag a last minute booking in a Club Room of Singapore’s most iconic hotel. Yes, what better way to watch what was billed to be Singapore’s best National Day fireworks yet. All from the comfort of a personal room with a front row view of the explosions.  Celebrations aside, I’ve had the pleasure of staying in a fair few other club rooms around the world, and the honest truth is that the experience (or lack of) is quite underwhelming at the Sands. Perhaps, this is simply the quality one gets at a casino hotel. I won’t bore you with the specifications of the room (room 4051, if you must know, and you can find…

This is an iconic symbol and architecture marvel. from the minute you step in to the lobby, throughout your stay. I just wanted to snap pictures all the time. the interior design, the elements everywhere are just amazing. I did manage to talk to the stuff and they are all extremely friendly and helpful. Staying in the hotel without visiting the Skypark is like having a dinner without the dessert. Magnificent view of the city from all direction, must see at day time and night time. Yes, the bar drinks are expensive but what do you expect from 5 stars hotel, the drinks are delicacies. I found it a bit strange that you need a passport to get in the casino, what are they trying to control? and even stranger that they do check your passport again when you get out, this is really…

a very impressive, enormous hotel. amazing architecture. huge. well appointed rooms, impressive bars, good restaurants, spa and gym. and of course: the rooftop swimming pool and ce la vi bar/nightclub. service is excellent. adjacent to the hotel is a large shopping mall, inclusive of some fancy restaurants. didn't check out the casino. if in Singapore for business or private travel, one of the hotels to stay at...
