Iconic hotel in a lovely city. Luxury redefined in this hotel in all senses. high end modern tidy and neat rooms, spacious with lovely beds and wonderful toilet. infinity pool is astonishing. highly recommended.

Had a fantastic one day stay at Marina Bay, booked a club room and got an upgrade to a suite which has fantastic view on 53rd floor.  Included is afternoon tea and evening drinks and food in the club as part of the package, along with access to all the facilities and the wonderful skypark and rooftop pool.  Only issues are for such a large size the service can be a little slow, reception checking in and out took quite a while and after booking the hotel limo service the driver didn't know the car features or functions (other than driving it) and didn't know the area very well which caused us to request a refund on the lost time.  Overall i'd certainly stay again for a special occasion but plan my trip a little more to make use of every single facility to get full value for money.

We booked this hotel as a few of our friends had been for drinks in the sky bar and sung its praises. We thought that we would treat ourselves for the last night of our holiday and booked a standard city view room.   On check in we were greeted by a lovely gentleman who took our bags and then the lady on check it was very smiley and welcoming. Upon checking in we were asked if we were on our honeymoon (unfortunately not and we were laughing about her rubbing salt in the wound). A gentleman called Vance came over and offered us an upgrade to a suite and of course we accepted it with open arms.   When we entered our suite(!!) I was just gob-smacked, it was amazing - it had a pool table, in the room, a pool table! It was so amazing. We had a gorgeous view of the Gardens by the Bay…

From the minute we got there, all the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Waited to check in for about 2 minutes and we were lucky and scored a free suite upgrade. The room was easily the best I've ever stayed in and the view of the Gardens by the Bay was amazing. The Infinity Pool didn't disappoint, a great view (obviously) and the service was even better. You can also check out in your room if you're paying with your credit card so you can skip the line.   I would definitely stay here again.

Check in process was smooth and efficient, the staff member did find us a double bedded room on a very high floor, kudos to the staff but I unfortunately couldn't remember his name. Room was spacious, big and clean bathroom with large bath tub, and oh the stunning views of Marina Bay and the city skyline!!!. Definitely worth the visit. Guests also are granted free entry to gardens by the bay and also the infinity pool and also the observatory deck. High recommended.

It is a beautiful hotel, perfect pool, a symbol known in the entire world. Nothing to complain about this.The only thing that probably is not on everybody taste is that it is a very touristy hotel. Everything is aimed at make you spend and doesn't have the soul of a place that can make you fall in love with it.

we were just having a long lay-over from yangon on our way back to manila and decided to while the time away by visiting this place. it was huge. had we been given a longer time, we would opt to discover more places and shop for more items. all restaurants were full so we opted to dine at the food court w/c was buzzing by hungry tourists. will definitely go back & explore longer next time.

We had a joyous and memorable wedding celebration at MBS hotel and convention centre. We could not have asked for anything more as it was perfect! During the past 2 days of our stay, we encountered most of the MBS staff being very friendly and they never fail to smile and greet. We want to thank these special staff who made our stay so memorable.   1) Premier service team- Cheryl welcome us with lots of enthusiasm and gave us a detailed tour of MBS. The rest of the team was also very friendly despite us asking so many questions.  2) The flower uncle- Roger was very sweet. He decorated our room with heartshape petals when he knew it was our wedding.  3)Butler team- While walking back from the swimming pool along the corridor of our room, my wife felt faintness. Lydia was very…

The skydeck at marina bay sands has a small charge to take the elevator to the top but really well worth the effort and cost,the view is great taking. You do not have to be a guest of the hotel or bye a drink to visit the skydeck

Built by the same owners as the Las Vegas Venetian hotel, the commonalities are plentiful: large hotel with 2500+ rooms, attached casino and large shopping mall, ice rink, food court, theater, restaurants - it is a resort in itself. Connected directly to the Singapore Metro (station: Bayfield) and across from the beautiful Gardens at The Bay, you don't have to venture out very far to be entertained. The most stunning feature is the rooftop: as guest you have access to a stunning infinity pool on the 56th floor with great views, awesome pool service - and always crowded. The hotel is clearly a major destination for tour groups and convention goers, and seems to be always full and busy. Rooms are spacious, and of course the higher up the better the view. Don't miss out on the free…

Iconic feature of the Singapore skyline, home to possibly the world's most beautiful view from a pool in a city. But the experience of staying there was underwhelming, and I felt very much like a number -- and the mission was to extract maximum value from me. My room was nothing special -- it felt like a 3-star room in a chain hotel that just happened to have a beautiful soaking tub. Carpet was grimy and stained, well overdue for a change. Both my water kettle and iron stopped working on me -- they delivered replacements, but it still cost me valuable minutes on already-rushed mornings. I was staying there for the sake of convenience because I was attending a conference at the Sands. But by the time you elevator down and wind your way through the casino and mall to the…

This hotel, is a one off. Architectural the split into 3 towers with an amazing infinity pool spanning all towers in a kind of boat shape must be unique.   The hotel is excellent , rooms a very hight standard and the central bar/ meal area very nice - and frequently has classical musicians providing a nice ambience. I realise this is common in SG but it's still nice. This hotel is also opposite the largest and most famous high end shopping mall in SG. At the back of the mall is access to the lake, free evening shows with lasers etc mounted from the hotel shining over the lake. A the 3k Olympic walkway around the lake is a lovely trek with longer options available.   It's part hotel part cultural experience.

If you can afford to stay there you will love it but as a visitor you feel like an intruder and wonder if the aloof staff are trained to spot the aliens.  Have a wander but beware -drinks in bars are very expensive  -if you would like to enter the casino you need your passport (not just a photo)

This is my 2nd stay at MBS.  Stayed here from Oct 20-24, I was attending ITB Asia and due to its proximity to the convention site, it's for the convenience why I stayed here.  If it's a personal leisure travel, for the room rate my company paid -- would choose a boutique hotel and get a suite, and privacy perks.  The place is massive and the staff lacks that "service from the heart".  Reception staff works like robots.  The cue line for breakfast would take you 20-30 minutes before you get seated.  And when you are in a rush for your 1st meeting of the day with your heavy bag and high heels - it was not pleasant to start your day.  If MBS could just further improve that personal touch they are missing and render that to each single guest not only to their VIPs, it could had been…

You cannot leave Singapore without staying or at least having a drink at Marina Bay Sands. If you are staying only one night (as we did), do splurge yourselves by staying in the Club level. It may cost a little bit more, but it worth every cent.  Club guest have a VIP check in, which will save you an hour or more of your time in comparison to general check in. We’ve arrived just before 1pm and the queue for check in was 50-70 people. How happy we were to find VIP check in without any queue at all.  Also Club guests can enjoy complimentary buffet breakfast, afternoon tea with canapés and deserts, evening canapé hour with great variety of canapés, cheeses, cold meats and endless drinks (soft and alcoholic) and of course best views in town. Restaurant staff is great, they make you…

This hotel is architecturally interesting and provides a welcome addition to the Singapore skyline. It was unfortunate that the haze was so thick because the views are probably outstanding. The best part of the hotel is the rooftop area with the amazing infinity pool, the observation deck and the restaurants. We spent a part of every day lounging by the pool and enjoying excellent service. The rest of the hotel has a "Las Vegas" feel to it with all of the celebrity restaurants, the high-end shops and the adequate rooms. I'm glad we experienced MBS, but I don't necessarily need to return.

Very nice resort, with lots of excellent shopping and great restaurants ... Just don't forget to leave, otherwise you will miss the essence and charm that Singapore has to offer in Chinatown and elsewhere!  Hotel rooms were great, infinity pool is a must visit and rooftop bars too.  The staff is very attentive to your every need, from check in to room service and pool side servers.

After seeing this from the helicopter camera from Formula 1 on TV I just had to stay one night and I am not disappointed. I was lucky and got a room upgrade and stayed almost at the top of the building. The view was fantastic and the room bigger than my small apartment :)  The Skypark with the infinity pool is very nice. Very crowded when not raining but that's expected. I recommend it and I would love to stay again if I'm in the area.

My supposed luxurious experience started out with waiting in a long queue that took over forty-five minutes just to check into this hectic hotel. The lobby was a mess of tourists, employees and guests - you could barely get around. The suite that we received was nice, but not as nice as the price tag would lead you to believe.  Let's talk about the pool area - basically the reason you choose to stay at this overly-expensive hotel. I tried to make the best of the gloomy days I had during my stay at the MBS and purchased a ridiculously expensive cocktail from the pool bar (22 SGD). I could barely enjoy my cocktail with all the crazy children running around unattended. The children were even in the "adults only" area! What a joke! Then upon check out after a couple days at this…

Despite the fact the haze in Singapore is not good.  That did not ruin my stay-cation here.  This is definitely a place to have fun, eat really good food, play some cards or slots, whatever your fancy is, relax at the spa or pool.    Service was and A+ from the moment we came in the door.  This busy hotel is not short on Hospitality.  From the front desk agent to room service, to the restaurant server, they are all trained so well.  I find that hospitality in Asia is not what I experience elsewere in the world. I feel that it is lacking in many ways by not anticipating needs, being sincere, or actually going the extra mile to help a guest.  I DID NOT experience this here.  It was first class all the way.  Do check out the pool area.  Now you may have to ignore the ridiculous…

Room are spacious and every bit you expect from a 5 star hotel. I stayed in city view room and the views are amazing from there.   The best part of the hotel is the infinity pool at 57th floor. Its breathtaking.   There is also some Jacuzzi at 57th Floor and is fun too.  Check in is at 3pm so if you arrive early you can leave your baggage with the concierge and go the next door shopping mall or the casino.  Breakfast is not included in the normal package so book accordingly.  Worth for a day.  Bhavesh

Booked a staycation at the Orchid Suite, Marina Bay Sands Singapore and it was a pleasant stay for us.   My family of 4 enjoyed the spacious space and the room was facing the Gardens by the Bay. The suite offers a theatre room, a huge round dining table for 6, a separate bedroom with attached bath and it offers a lot of space for the kids to play. The staff are very polite and profession in their service and the butler service is excellent. Will plan for our next staycation at MBS!

The staff make a massive difference in this hotel so kudos to them and their management teams! The service for me was outstanding!  Stayed here in one of the suites for a few nights. The hotel lobby is like an atrium to a mall or entertainment village in tower 1 but check in was seamless considering the number of rooms and people they have going through there.   The room itself was great, everything you need and spectacular views even through the haze.  If you are scared of heights the room has floor to ceiling windows which are great, but can be difficult if you don't like looking down from the 50th floor.   They even have the option of replacement fridges for a small fee if you don't want the mini bar service.   Restaurants are great in the hotel with some with great views. …

What can one say about this beautiful hotel.  Perfect in every way.  Our check in was very easy, our rooms very spacious with everything you needed.  The breakfast in the breakfast room was the best we have ever seen.  Staff were excellent.  The sky pool was amazing.

The hotel and property is unique. Between the Skypark, the attached mall/casino and entrance to Gardens by the Bay, there isn't a hotel like this. Checking in is fairly smooth though there may be some time wait depending of the number of people checking in at the time. Tip, be aware of which tower you're suppose to check in to. You may be given a room in a different tower from where you checked in. The service in the lobby is world class. Bell hops are very attentive. The desk staff was very friendly.  The room was gorgeous. Very spacious and well kept. Our room was facing Gardens by the Bay but we also had a view of the marina from our bathroom though it is only a window next to the bath tub. The balcony was also spacious. Barely any noise from the street can be heard. Overall…

We stayed at Marina Bay Sands in Tower 1 for 2 nights (which was definitely not enough in order to see everything in this city). When we arrived our rooms were not yet ready, so we spent some time walking around in the hotel area and also had lunch there. After that our rooms were still not ready, so we were upgraded to a suite in the 50th floor! We couldn't believe our eyes when we first stepped into our room, it was huge (330 sq m, which is a lot even for 4 persons) and the view was breathtaking (we could see both the city side as well as Gardens by the Bay). The interior not only of our suite but also of the whole hotel was amazing, the infinity pool a little bit crowded but with an incredible view and the hotel staff very very nice. And of course a must-see: the light show…

Went to MBS to celebrate my son 1st birthday at Orchid Suite. Nice view of Garden Garden By The Bay from the balcony. The room is superb and big. The ambience is nice and cosy.  Parking is not a problem as they provide free valet service for inhouse guest. The pool was nice and the view is great except for the haze.   Recommended!!!

Great stay at the Sands . It's just a metropolis. Everyone was very helpful. Great views from Tower 1 57 Bar. It's a must if you in Singapore.  I would recommend this to all if you want to spoil yourself for a day or two. Book direct with the hotel for the best rate.

The staff are exceptional - but then again that's just the people of Singapore - and the rooms are gorgeous. The view is breathtaking... I was on the 48th floor looking over the Gardens on the Bay and it was a sensational view. Overall, it has all the things a good 5 star hotel has and we experinced VERY good service.

It is all about the view. There are always some important ingredients in a great experience. I can't review the food, I can't barely review the drinks. A ginger ale remains a ginger ale but I can review the view at the Marina Bay Sands. That's awesome!

We stayed in marina bay in September - and WOW - What a stay. We arrived very early in the morning on a Monday - Having flown 19 hours I was so ready for a shower and a change of clothes but given the time I was not expecting our room to be ready I was ready to check in and be told to sit and wait in the beautiful lobby. However on arriving at the check in desk not only was our room ready but we were upgraded to a room on the 52nd floor. Now Me and my other half have been looking forward to this holiday for quite some time - It's been planned and carefully booked throughout and when I opened the door to that room I could have cried, after months of building up the dream holiday in our head it completely blew me away. Everything from start to finish at this hotel was perfect. We…

We stayed in a suite on the 22nd floor of Tower One with a city view.  This came with a complimentary cocktail hour with food that could certainly qualify as dinner and a breakfast/brunch buffet at Sky On 57.    The Good: 1.  The Pool is extraordinary - huge, well tended with gorgeous views.  The bar and snack service is efficient and attentive.  The pool opens early and doesn't close until 11PM. 2.  The food, both complimentary and that for which we paid additional (room service,) was excellent.   3.  The suite was large and well-appointed.  The Bad 1.  The drinks at the pool were quite over-priced.  They were good, but they were not generous with the alcohol, especially in the mixed cocktails.  (I'm being kind.  Twice I almost suspected there was no alcohol present at all.) 2.…

I checked in Orchid Suites @1500 dollars/night, so I do get a very nice room with great view and the swimming pool was also great. Apart from this- everything is very poor. Check in requested was 1 PM(early check in) I reached there and after spending 30 minutes in designated express line for suite i managed to communicate with front desk. Room was not ready so they took my mobile no. with promise to call at the earliest possible time. No call came till 4:00 PM(even after usual check in time of 3 PM passed). I again stand in Queue for check in and after 30 hrs managed to communicate front desk and he took another 20 minutes to give room.  During stay, Fridge was not working, there was power failure, staff had no coordination. The Hotel is Overcrowded  no personalized service,…

I have never been much of a long-haul traveller. I have tended to stay within Europe, being British means we have so many interesting places with a very short plane ride. This year I felt I definitely needed to stretch out and see something different. I used Skyscanner which returned some interesting destinations for the dates I had in mind, the best one being a bargain flight to Singapore which really piqued my interest. I had remembered about the Marina Bay Sands from a documentary of it's inception and development, the idea of actually seeing it was all I needed to go ahead and book the flights. I never expected to actually stay at Marina Bay Sands, but by being cautious with the budget we did indeed spend three nights at this colossal hotel. Spending six night's previously…

For the price you pay you expect the house keeping to properly clean the bathroom hair on the floor and sink was not cleaned properly really disappointing as was expecting really good things but unfortunately did not meet expectations. Check in times were very long

After seeing the spectacular rooftop pool you sadly experienced the best that this hotel has to offer. This hotel needs to shape up big time. If you still plan to stay here you better prepare for some serious queueing. Queues at check in, queues for breakfast, queues for check out. MBS is BIG, but unlike the best hotels in Las Vegas that compare its size, they haven't figured out how to combine size with great service. Not a recommendable place to go. A far better alternative is the Mandarin Oriental hotel at the opposite side of the bay.

I don't like this hotel. Poor services. Bad staff attitude, especially the staff from the Philippines, they will be nice to you, if you are white. Their service sucks. Room also not good and up to the name standard.  Went up to their Ce La Vi, nothing great as well there, sulky face everywhere for their staff, except for floor staff. The ushers at the door has the most sulkiest face. Check in taking more than 30 minutes per guest, even there is no large crowds. Basically nothing is good about this hotel, that is my 2nd impressions.  Even if I am sponsored to stay at this hotel, I will not stay again.

One of the busiest hotel in singapore i believe, however staff is very friendly! The video check out is one of the best things they could have done to ensure swift check outs.... The room view is fantastic overlooking the splendid Gardens of the Bay and are huge, Clean and Modern....  For me as a business traveller, it is the most convenient hotel to stay at, as the convention is just connected to the hotel. There's plenty to do & look at (Casino & up-market shopping, or eating/drinking). The views are fantastic (ours was of the Gardens of the Bay) Breakfast was incredible & fresh & tasty. The pool is the main attraction & the views very impressive, day or night. The famous sond and laser show happens at the promenade in the night and is best viewed from merlion. I found the…

This place is incredible. We were blown away with the Casinos size and the amount of people lining up to use tables.  It is worth showing your passport to have a look inside even if not betting.  After the Casino we headed up Tower 1 to Sky Park. Instead of paying an entry fee just to get to the top of Tower 3 we decided to have a drink at the top of Tower 1. There is no need to pay to use the famous top floor as a beautiful cocktail is approx the same price at the restaurant. Level 57 is best to visit when the laser light show is on and the light show at Gardens By The Bay. We also shared some tapas. Delicious!!!  This will only allow access to the back deck but really it is better anyway. Only residents of MBSands are allowed to swim in and access the pool anyway.  Definate…

Stayed here few times,always good,typical 5 star hotel,good service,friendly staff,good rooms,good shopping.Pool is always a must when in Marina bay, ces't la vie for a night out is a must when in Singapore too.Perfect for couples,holidays with friends ,wont advice it much for family vacations too overcrowded for me.

Stayed here for 2 nights. Upon checking n we were upgraded to a Club room which was very nice. The hotel is large and includes a large mall and casino complex. There are lots of restaurants in the complex encompassing a huge range of cuisines. The infinity pool n the 57th floor is amazing! It is strictly for hotel guests only. The staff everywhere are very friendly and helpful. Our only disappointment was one evening we up to the Skydeck to have a drink and both rooftop bars were closed for or at functions. There is so much close-by do do and the MRT is right there so easy to get around Singapore.

WOW!! What a amazing experience it was.  My family and I arrived to Marina Bay Sands hotel by the bus about 9 pm. When we went to the check-in counter the clerk welcomed us and started the check-in process. after 2 minutes he told us that we got a big surprise and he couldn't tell yet. Also, he told us that we got one room instead of two.  We got keys to one room on 51st. floor. we didn't know nothing and we went to the elevator. and then we saw the big surprise : The Presidential suite. The room consist of 2 big Bedrooms, 2 restrooms with huge Jacuzzi hot tub, Big living room with piano, kitchen, small gym, massage room and private karaoke room!! I can't describe the view from this room - like the pool on 57th floor you can see all Singapore. We didn't want to leave the room,…

Best view from Nice Pool in Singapore. Everything seems like perfect except one thing. Maybe its just my fault. Bcoz I didnt know if i touch drink in fridge, i have to pay all even i didnt open or drink it. And i took all of it to see ( just bcoz of curiousness) Well, I was so surprise when i got bill. When i came back room to take that things bcoz i paid all of it but fridge blocked T.T Ok.... It was funny experience in my birthday . Anw, I dont know why u guys do that in 5 stars hotel.

Stayed for 3 nights in the junior suite.  Plus points: 1. Infinity pool - no doubt the star attraction! Offers stunning views of Singapore  2. Room - very comfortable and modern with panoramic views of Singapore  3. The shopping arcade in its basement- handy 4. Spa - very good service albeit expensive 5. Location - fantastic, in the heart of the city and right next door to the lovely Bay Gardens  Less good:  1. Check in can take a while  2. When asking for small complimentary bottles of water from housekeeping in the middle of the night they asked us to buy them. Given they only offer two small bottles of 500 ml and we were staying there for three nights in a rather costly junior suite, that attitude was outrageous  3. Whenever we needed something it would take a while to get it

although its the busiest hotel in singapore i believe, never seen the staff are without a smile on their face! Rooms are huge. For me as a business traveller, it is the most convenient hotel to stay at, as the convention is just connected to the hotel (avoiding the haze). Glad to know that it will be the official hotel for itb asia the next 4 years! Hooray!

You would love the every bit of the hotel with pool to night club and casino. It's fun to explore all part of hotel. It's too big and can get u lot of walking. The service are good with friendly staff. The pool or the skypark is awesome . It indulge you thru out the day without getting sick.

My wife & I stayed here in September for 3 nights. Although we arrived from Dubai at 9am, and there wasn't a room available for us (usual check-in is 3pm) the staff quickly checked us in, looked after our bags, offered us seats & refreshments in a very comfortable waiting lounge. We had a room at 1pm (2 hrs early). There's plenty to do & look at whilst waiting (Casino & up-market shopping, or eating/drinking). The room was huge, clean, modern PERFECT. The views are fantastic (ours was of the Gardens of the Bay) Breakfast was incredible & fresh & tasty. The pool is the main attraction & the views very impressive, day or night. We found the nightly lazer light show was best viewed from the Merlion. Overall, thie best hotel I've ever stayed at. It's not cheap, but it's worth every…

Marina Bay Sands is simply the best. Visit it once in your life.  Visited first week of October we headed up to their Skybar called Cie La Vie. You can go directly at the bar and order your drinks. Cocktails are at 24 sgd. If you want to have a table near the edge of the bar theres a minimum order of 500sgd (not unless you had dinner at their restaurant then you can just transfer outside) If youre not up for the expense. Just try to order cocktails as theyre the less expensive one.

The best place I have seen in Singapore.the best view of the whole city from the top skypark and to the amazing towers.the shopping experience is amazing.so many tourists come to this beautiful city..

We recently stayed in the Marina Bay Sands (MBS) for a couple of nights in a cityside Orchid Suite as part of the celebrations for my 50th birthday.   From the outset, don't expect personalised service at MBS. Your adventure commences after making your way across the chaos of the hotel lobby, to then join a 100m check-in in queue. 15 minutes or so later you will get to the front desk, where they won't be able to find your reservation. 15 minutes after that they will find your reservation, and in our case, the room was ready.  Finally with key in hand we headed to our room, which was approx 1km away from the check-in desk which is in tower 1, and our room was in tower 3 at the opposite end. You can look closely at the architecture on your walk, as it is truly a marvel to look at…

A vast hotel with almost everything one would require for a holiday or business trip.  My wife and I stayed there three nights in a suite with our two children (ages 3 and 5); the pool on the roof was a massive hit - and had a huge wow factor!   The food was brilliant and a night out was a similar in price to most other hotels in the Marina Bay.

I was at MBS for a company banquet and we had the banquet at their massive ballrooms on the 4th floor of the convention hall.   The meal had 7 course, with free flow of beer, hot Chinese tea and soft drinks - Opening course to the 7 course banquet: Cold dish platter. The highlights: Scallops were plump, spring rolls were crispy. Smoked duck was alright.   - Wok-fried prawns, sliced chicken, asparagus and capsicums. I don't usually like asparagus, but it's done really well. Sauce is good.   - Double-boiled chicken soup with shimeji mushroom: Soup was tasty and the chicken in the soup was tender and soft. Other ingredients – scallop and mushrooms were bland.  - Braised mushroom with broccoli in oyster sauce: Lots of cut broccoli blanched and topped with braised mushroom and sauce.…

Comfortable beds and large bathroom. Great service. Breakfast and evening cocktail at the club on the top floor was nice. Stayed on top floors facing the Gardens By The Bay and the view was spectacular.

An excellent hotel, beautifully designed, perfectly set to to take anyone to newer heights of hospitality. The elevation, the view and the ambiance is in parallel. The Sky Park is the peak of excitement. Service good and value good

A beautiful property with stunning view of Singapore on one side and Garden by the bay on another side. The infinity pool is amazing my kind da just loved being in the pool   Location is also easy access to all places as connected by metro  Service is of high standard the staff is always smiling

We stayed at Marina Bay sands for 3 nights, very expensive but it was worth it, loved the room, we had a premium room overlooking the Marina Gardens it was spectacular at night! Room was big, bed was very comfy and bathroom was big with a big stand alone spa and rain shower. Hotel is so big cannot believe how busy it was, the Pool was the best except we had Haze for the 3 days so our photos are not the best!  Shopping is too expensive for the average Joe, but we took a taxi to Orchard Road where we went to Lucky Plaza and bought our souvenirs from there really cheap. One night we went to China Town and had the BEST  Chili Crab ever.  On the last night we went to the Hotel Casino, and won $900 dollars on the poker machines so we were very happy! Very nice place to stay would…

1. One of the most organised hotels I have ever visit 2. The personnel is profetional and very well trained  3. Big variety of restaurants and large choice of food to taste 4. Breakfast is perfect  5. The rooms are comfortable with very nice view 6. The swimming pool was the highlight of my staying there 7. Try the butter and bread pudding - delicious

I think you can get better service for the price of this hotel. It's really massive and, but considering it's a hotel with capacity of over 3.000 people, the service is great. The pool is probably the best I've used in my life, with an awesome view. Breakfast at the top floor is also great, delicious food with great views. If you can, it's really woth it to pay a little extra to stay in a high level room, because the hotel is all about the views. When I go back to Singapore, I will be definetely be staying there.

My husband booked us into MBS as a birthday present for me, as we are currently living in Singapore.  We decided to book a club room, as we'd already decided to have breakfast there and that combined with the afternoon tea and canapés with cocktails/champagne in the club lounge meant the club rooms were good value.  We were checked in by Vance; he was really nice and helpful. Our room was on the 25th floor, tower one overlooking Gardens by the bay. It was a gorgeous and very spacious room with a long balcony which we watched the supertrees show from (at GBTB).  It has a huge shower and a good sized bath.  We spent a lot of time relaxing by the pool on the top of MBS. It was very busy by late afternoon, we couldn't get sunbeds by the pool which didn't bother us as we prefer the…

Have stayed on The Fullerton, but this tops it all (and if you want access to the pool, you have to be a guest of the hotel).   Try to get access to The Club on 55th. Here you have breakfast without the browds, afternoon tea and evening snacks!! And the best view you can imagine. Worth the money.

Marina Bay Sands has been the icon of Singapore and will always be.   It's a sure place to go whenever you visit SG.   Apart from the world-class service, what i love the most is the architectural designs inaide the hotel. It was truly breath-taking.   Make sure you jump into the infinity pool at the top of the hotel. One of the beat city views you'll have while in Singapore.   Enjoy the patisseries as well, those are simply jaw-dropping.

This is an incredible hotel.  It's worth a trip just to look at the design and architecture.  A buzzing icon in the incredible city of Singapore.   We travelled as a family (with 4 & 8 year old) in October 2015.   We opted for a suite with city view, as we like a bit more room when travelling with children, and also we were only staying for one night en route from Malaysia to the UK.  The room was massive!  Plenty of storage space, lounge space and large bedroom and bathroom.  Perhaps the only additional thing I would have liked would have been a separate wc in this size of room.  The suite contained a sofa bed which was suitable for our 2 girls.  We were also offered additional beds, and we could have had a few extra beds in there and still had loads of room.  Lovely dining…

Must stay hotel when in Singapore at least once... very unique and iconic landmark with astonishing views of Singapore. Good location, obviously you can not miss three big & tall towers. Plenty of transportation options with MRT station connecting to the hotel and affordable taxi price to get there from anywhere in the city...   Everything is kept clean and up to 5 star standard. Good facilities and good quality of products. Staffs are exceptionally friendly and helpful with good local and product knowledge.   A lot of restaurants in the hotel complex but quite expensive and overpriced.   Roof top pool on 57th floor is just impressive. Amazing experience to enjoy the view of Singapore. Must to do when in Singapore, Highly recommend it!   Almost everything was perfect and had…

My husband and I stayed 3 nights in the hotel and we chose it mainly because of the pool.  As we were on our honeymoon we were given a room with a king sized bed overlooking the Gardens by the Bay, so the views were absolutely spectacular, specially at night. The room was big and pristine clean. The hotel provided slipers and bathrobes that could be taken to the pool. At the pool there was also a towel concierge which meant that we didn't need to worry to carry anything with us aside from the room keys (necessary to access the pool as it's for guests only). The pool is open from 6am to 11pm, which allowed us to enjoy the city during the day and some night swimming at night. All the staff were very helpful and polite. The moment we arrived they took care of our suitcases and let…

I stayed at the marina bay sands in October during the Sibos week. I must say that this hotel definitely exceeded my expectation in terms of grandeur, efficiency of service and overall feel good experience.   The Sibos conference is intense with over 2000 demanding bankers staying at the hotel. I must say that the hotel showed its customary singapore efficiency in managing us. The concierge would pick up the call on second ring, my breakfast would be served on time in my room everyday, the room would be serviced on time perfectly.....being from service industry myself I can appreciate this esp knowing how busy the hotel was during this time.   The breakfast spread was elaborate with multi cuisine, the infinity pool is a great experience and one of a kind. I had been upgraded to…
If you visit Singapore you must have a drink at the sky bar, the views are amazing and they have some excellent wines, a must do!

The hotel was very good the room was large and fantastic views the only flaw was the crowd. It was very busy especially at the pool. But all on all very good stay and great staff. It was like a transit airport we stayed here because it's meant to be an iconic place but really if I visit Singapore again I would stay at mandarin oriental and just visit here for one day only

This is an exceptional and luxurious landmark hotel overseeing the Marina Bay of Singapore. The architecture is quite astonishing. The three towers are built in a x-shape, and support an impressive top terrace with swimming pool across the 3 towers. Despite the impressive construction, the surface on the top remains limited; so it can be a bit more crowded. Not really for people with a fear of heights. The hotel and its surrounding shopping area and restaurants are very expensive. After a couple of days, you have seen it all and probably spent the money you were planning to spend. We were unlucky that there was a serious haze at the time of the visit, limiting the view from the room and from the top. Most materials in the hotel are of very high quality. The rooms start however…

During our trip to Singapore we stayed in 2 different hotels and spent 2 nights at Marina Bay Sands mainly because of the famous swimming pool which only guests have access. The hotel is beautiful, has an incredible architecture, but in the middle of so many people, there is no special treatment and for a couple on honeymoon, we were a little disappointed... No one even offers to help you with your luggage, you need to ask. It seems silly, but when they saw a woman, I think it should be natural to offer help. I recommend the experience because of the pool, it is worth for at least one night, but if you want a warmer reception, Marina Bay Sands is not the best place.

1. Too crowded. As you may imagine this is a destination in itself. The infinity pool is filled with people at any given time. 2. Owing to the large number of visitors the attention from the staff is poor. They are often too busy at least to smile and the hospitality is not great if you compare with SEA tourist hot-spots like Thailand/Bali.  3. Food is nice. 4. Not worth the money. 5. Haze!! Although it not the hotel's fault, the haze minimizes the views and makes it impossible to breathe some fresh air. The haze was at dangerous levels when we visited.   If your expectation is to see the architectural landmark, please stay at a nearby hotel and pay a visit to the MBS observation deck for less than $30. If you intend to visit the pool, unfortunately you have to be a guest!  …

If you want a bit of wow then this hotel has got it. Very grand, very big and very nice. Everything about the hotel is very good i don't need to say any more. It is connected to the casino, a shopping mall and the subway. You can walk from the hotel around the lake and there are many place for eating and entertainment. Spending a few days in Singapore and want to get away from the Orchard Road boredom then this is a great alternative.  I definitely recommend this hotel.

Probably not the best hotel in Singapore, but was attending a conference at the Expo and five minutes from the bedroom to the Expo floor was a real benefit. Rooms are very comfortable and have all amenities you need. I had a room facing the Gardens at the Bay and would recommend trying to obtain a city view. Good bars and restaurants in the complex. Infinity pool is a plus and good gym. Price was expensive SGD550++ and not the best value for money, but location on this visit was everything. Would certainly return on a personal basis at a more reasonable price.

We booked an average room in tower 1 facing the gardens by the bay and on checked were surprised by the friendly service and a huge surprise to an upgrade to a beautiful suite on the 14th floor in tower 3 facing the gardens. This suite had a huge separate lounge area and 2 balconies overlooking the gardens by the bay and the 2 domes. Huge bathroom with wonderful bath and bath salts supplied. Massive king size bed and an amazing amount of storage space. Nespresso coffee machine and a kettle to make a cup of tea. Check in time is manic at the hotel, but if you are patient and polite you may also be upgraded.  Brandon at the Lifestyle Rewards counter extremely helpful and very friendly.   Vincent at the check in counter (members lounge) was warm inviting and very very polite. We…

The only reason to stay here is for the sky park.  The pool is excellent and the views are amazing.  Unless you are a millionaire I would not recommend ordering any food or drinks as a $10 bottle of Australian wine was $70 and a $40 bottle of scotch $250!!!!  Talk about mark ups.  Certainly nothing the average person could afford.

We were a little nervous at staying in this hotel due to the volumes of people, but we were pleasantly surprised. Don't get me wrong, a lot of people stay here - it's just serviced very well. We stayed in tower 3 facing Marina bay on the 44th level in an orchid suit. The view and the room were both spectacular. Although the haze was quite bad while we there, the view was amazing. The room itself was spacious and very clean. We had access to 'The Club' for breakfast and cocktail hour/s included in our nightly rate, boy was that good value! We had free drinks here 3 out of 4 night stay and were so full from the incredible 5 star quality canapés on offer, we didn't end up eating dinner.  The pool is, well it's the iconic pool that everyone has a photo in. Yes we did take multiple…

It is a luxury hotel indeed. We stayed here for 3 nights, and I regret it. I should have stayed here for only 1 night. Why? because this hotel is very expensive and we are out all day for the tour. We are not able to experience well their amazing places for activities.  I should have allotted my 1 day spending it to the hotel. This is not just an ordinary hotel, they have exquisite bar, infinity pool, observatory deck, spa, and more. Staying here is enough to enjoy.  it is very clean. Courteous Staff and services. Superb food. Amazing experience.  Again it is expensive but it is worth it.

Its a very nice stay. Very nice swimming pool, great experience to swim at high roof. Infinity view from swimming pool its a very difference experience, can view singapore high building of financial hub. My childs are very enjoy to stay here. Good location, great services, high security, good food, very nice view from our room at night time.

My wife and I visited this hotel for two nights in the beginning of September. We booked a Premier Room but were upgraded to a Suite on arrival.  I have read here in TA that the service in this hotel might feel impersonal. But we were approached all the time by name and could feel a very attentive treatment by the staff that was always eager to help.  Yes, it´s true, the place is huge. But let´s be honest, the hotel itself is a tourist attraction. It is without a doubt the spotlight of the whole Marina Bay area. The Gardens by the Bay, the Shoppes and the Singapore Flyer are surrounding the hotel. And if that is not enough, the hotel boasts probably one of the most impressive swimming pools on Earth and certainly the best view of the Marina Bay.  We stayed our first two nights…

If you arrive at Tower 1, the main entrance, you may feel the stress of the staff trying to keep the traffic in front of the hotel under control. Quite a challenge actually. Then you will feel like arriving at the check-in desk at the airport, with a long queue in front of you. We eventually did not wait for too long, but the check-in process took at least 15 minutes, very unusual for Asia.  Our executive room on the 49th floor was a bit smelly as we arried (the air is very humid in Singapore). We asked if they could do something and withing minutes they brought an air purifier which helped. The room was quite large, with a beautiful view over Singapore. The bed is excellent. One negative element is the lack of storage space. As we were traveling for two weeks we had a lot of…

Situated right on the seashore on "bayfront" area, this location has a lot to offer....starting right from Merlion statue, Fullerton Hotel, Wonderfull light show(check the timings in the evening), OCBC Gardens(again, the timings), The observation deck( 3 towers, 57th floors, fantastic view of seashore, ships, gardens below, light show) and shopping at the basement of Marina Bay sands hotel. In fact, staying at this hotel has its own advantages in accessing the premium floors. Then on the other side you have the helix bridge, Singapore flyer and other attractions.  You need two well planned evenings to check out all the attractions here. Then this place is very close to Chinatown and Little India , just in case you want to club the visits that can start in the afternoon. You can…

I guess my disssapointment set in as I was expecting a fantastic room and service. Room was on a high floor and that was the only highlight.  Rooms are very basic in every way. Extremely dissapointed at the cleaning which took place only after I called late in the evening when I returned from a days work. Unacceptable.  Laundry I have never arrived on time and had to chase...I boil it down to being  a large hotel that hard to keep up with the standards one finds in other places. Staff need to be trained and the help desk one calls need to be more aware of the challenges clients face. One gets blazed with the roof top however what's beneath if dismall...with what one pays it was the worst place I have stayed in based on quality one got.

we had the best room it was in tower 3 and had very close view of the gardens by the bay, the trees all had beautiful light show at night time, the pool was magnificent although very crowded and a little noisy especially at night time the rooms were vey well appointed and we found the staff very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast buffet was awesome.

You cannot beat how spectacular this hotel is and it is worth to fork out some more money to get one of the Orchid Suits that are in the higher floors with the view across Singapore Bay and the City. Just absolutely stunning. The rooms are just very high spec, floor to ceiling windows lets you look across the city when you go to bed or wake up. Living room and bathroom just out of this world. The Skypark with the bars, Restaurants and the pool just stunning. It is one of my most favourite City Hotels ever and there is nothing bad to say about it but you got to have one of the Suites as that means not only do you have the best location, you as well have a different check in as this being a large hotel and a lot of weekend tourists, it can get very busy indeed.

From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we were made to feel like a VIP.  Our room was on 4th floor facing the garden. Perfect as we saw the light show that night. We watched this from our terrace.  The bathroom was very luxurious. The pool level was beyond expectations. We walked through the shopping mall and had a lovely meal at a french restaurant. Would love to come and stay again.

Checked in at the giant lobby which is as busy as a train station in Jakarta. For the price paid and expectations to the hotel, waiting 15 in line to check in is unacceptable. Floor 45 city view and access to the Club. The room was nice but with a strange smell, like somebody had been smooking and the housekeeping had used all their sprays. How ever we decided to stay in the room as is had a great view of Singapore city. The room is big with king bed and a sofa section plus a desk. Big windows to enjoy the view. The breakfast in the club good with great service. Afternoon tea had a lot of choices and was a pleasant surprise. Cocktail hours are very short and after 7 pm there are no more access to the club! That's not acceptable by any hotel standard and especially not with the…

I had visited this hotel magnificient architect  hotel  when i was in singapore. The entrance is huge with many shopees of all brands more than 50 restaurants, theatres, museum, and casino amazing gorgeous hotel. There are lot many cafe shoppes too Bean Bistro  is where i had good Hot capuccino.& rise restaurant lunch buffet is where i had lunch . At the sky line awesome swimming pool with sky restaurant... Worth and must visit in singapore.  Regards Sri (stunningshri@yahoo.in)

Stayed at this hotel. Beautiful hotel very clean n 1st class std. The infinity pool packed with adults n children for a swim. Easy access to shopping mall n casino n restaurants to wet one's appetite.

Beautiful hotel in the centre of the city.  My family and I stayed here after a few days on Sentosa to visit some of the places nearer the city centre.    Everyone stays for the pool and it doesn't disappoint (particularly at night) but other than that the hotel is similar to many '5 star' resorts.    A mini fridge cost us 10 dollars to rent for our stay as we couldn't put anything in the fridge provided.   Very nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay, but will probably look to stay at other nearby hotels next time we're in Singapore.

We only stayed one night as we could not afford more but the experience was great! I've never stayed in a place like it! The infinity pool is incredible, but watch that if you want a drink inside the bar next to it, there is a dress code (however you can order drinks poolside). The views from both sides are amazing. They offer everything you could think of, from tailors to babysitters. And the room is huge! Definitely a great place, you could spend all day on here if Singapore wasnt as amazing in itself.

This trip was a lazy weekend getaway for the family. away from work. We were impressed with the view. The service was great though food and services were on the high side. The bar in the room has a sensor ,so be careful if you intend to place something in there and remove (temporary) some of their items. We did and the bar got locked. The hotel graciously allowed us to use one shelf and did not charge us for the items which we did not use. Around the Hotel, we have numerous shops, luxurious and up market. There is also a train station (MRT)  which will take you out and you can do your shopping . And not forgetting the "Casino", which is all linked to the hotel. A short walk will bring you to the Foodcourt as well. Prices here are price reasonably but a far cry from our Hawker…

My husband and I stayed for 3 nights ..... not long enough to see all the sights and truly experience this magnificent hotel! Our room on the 40th floor was large and luxurious, with rose petals on the bed and floating in the bath tub.. very romantic! The shopping center adjacent to the hotel was world class with every brand imaginable. The first night we dined at Jian Shan Chinese Restaurant.. the service and food could not be faulted. The second night we dined at CUT - truly amazing food and service! The third night we dined at SPARGO on their opening night ... this is fine dining at it's best! A truly memorable experience! Well done to Vance and his team!

Yes, similar reviews to others.  The price was average, to be expected for the sky park attraction they have. The service was below average, unfriendly, unwelcoming, bad vibes, they seemed moody. I hardly talked to any of them because of their stance. All I did was ask a direction to somewhere to one of the staff and was given a stare. My room was small, and not sound proof, I could hear people outside waiting in line to go into a bar. But on the positive, as is the reason most people stay here.. The skypark attraction, is beautiful, and a breathtaking pool and view. In the end it was worth it

We spend 3 nights at club room on the 41 floor. As you can expect, the best thing about that hotel is the swimming pool on top of the roof. It was really amazing!!! The hotel is nice and clean. The view is also amazing!!! But don't get fooled - you pay just for the architecture and for the famous roofpool. All other things are about average! I booked a club room on the 41 floor and it wasn't what you expect for that price!!! You can get sooo much more for your money at some of the hotels nearby.  I booked a club room for 2 adults and a child 7 years old, but when we arrived it appeared that the club for our daughter is not included in the price!!!  We travel a lot and it is the first time that we have to pay extra for the child when we have a club reservation!?! There is nothing…

Marina Bay Sands is THE ULTIMATE hotel in Singapore!  I remember not going out during my entire stay! I just stayed at the world famous pool located at the roofdeck from morning til night and savored each moment.  The rooms are unbelievably big and luxurious!

The rooms were clean and staffs were polite and helpful. Loved the infinity pool and the shopping mall there. The shopping mall had almost all the brands and there was a gift shop for buying souvenirs. Access to metro and other sightseeing places was really convenient. The only thing which disappointed me was the food options for vegetarians. Otherwise everything was perfect.

I check in into the hotel during a holiday in Singapore & check in was fantastic.   When i reached into my room i was expecting a luxurious room as Marina Bay Sands would serve its reputation, but when i entered the room they looked like any other normal 4 star room ,ofcourse they stood out thanks auto curtains & Spacious room with spacious terrace. but the overall room feel was 4 star. When i booked in Marina Bay Sands i was expecting something like Venetian ,Macau rooms.  Marina Bay property is Humongous. its so well planned & so well executed that you forget about the room & get hooked on to the hotel. that is exactly what happened with me.   After check in i went to the Infinity pool & feel in LOVE . what a exquisite beauty. it was mesmerizing & made me feel so relaxed…

We could only afford to stay one night but it was definitely worth it. This is a luxury hotel with superb service but is also very friendly and welcoming. I was treated like a VIP even though I don't look like one! I'm sure every guest is given the same treatment. Only stayed here to swim in the Infinity Pool and wasn't disappointed - exceeded our expectations.  Although the pool area is busy everyone is happy and relaxed and enjoying the amazing views, which are even better at night. Most people were taking photos and there were lots of GoPro's but it didn't feel invasive, just good fun. My kids were asked to take videos and photos for people. Pool not just for the beautiful people - all ages and shapes represented. There are plenty of pool lounges, warm towels are provided and…

If you are expecting quaint and traditional go to Raffles, this is big, brash and Vegas in Singapore. It's a great hotel with some superb dining and it's definitely worth staying if you book a club room with access to their lounge. Great service but the big problem is this... The crowds, the rooftop pool is without doubt the highlight but NO ONE is swimming or enjoying it , they're all taking selfies, I travel the world and have never seen so many bloody selfie sticks uuurgh!! Stay one night, have your swim, take your selfie and then book into the Fullerton or Raffles

This is a spectacular hotel and everything is "grand" about it, with the infinity pool at the rooftop beeing the icing on the cake. Good, spacious rooms, extremely friendly service at all areas. However, it is a large hotel givng it a less personal and luxurious feel in my view (compared to luxurious boutique hotels). The gym is tiny for such a huge hotel and get very crowded at certain times.

Free wifi access, free entry to infinity pool, great housekeeping staff. Book the premier room and it was awesome, i stayed on the 40th floor and the view is spectacular at night. The room was big and i really like the way the room look. I was here to celebrate my gf birthday and guess what?! They gave me a complimentary cake for celebration! Awesome!!!

Right from the time I saw the building from the MRT near the airport, I knew my stay here would be special.   I stayed here for a night in a Premium "City View" room on the 41st floor and the views afforded from the room was nothing short of fantastic. As you slide the key into its slot, upon entering the room, the curtains automatically open, giving you a panoramic view over Marina Bay and the city beyond. The room itself is quite large, by asian standards and the loo, proportionately so. The loo had a stand alone tub, a separate shower, commode and his and her washbasins. Adequate lighting all over.  I had been forewarned to ask for a "city view" room as the other side of the hotel gives one views of the harbour and the shipping activity.   The best part, however, is the view…

The most amazing place I've ever been in my life and I've been to some lovely places! Came here to watch the f1. food, drinks and staff were all amazing! The restaurant on the roof is out of this world and the shops at the bottom are even better! The pool was lovely and clean and very spacious! Would love to return hopefully for the honeymoon!

We arrived later in the evening, after some trouble finding our booking we where given an upgrade to a suite ! Lovely room with ample space for our family of 4, beautiful amenities. The only downside was the Haze which was wide spread and covered our view (not that the hotel can control this). We loved the Infinity pool ( found the state of water not 100% could do with keeping this as pristine as the rest of the hotel). Concierge were very helpful in getting one of bags open, the room service breakfast was good but not great. Enjoyed our stay would stay again. I think if you go expecting 5 star you may be disappointed - this is a large Motel with many guests, you go for the architecture and the infinity pool and you will be pleased you went.

The iconic infinity pool is worth the stay just by itself, especially if you are luckier than we have been and there is no haze to block your view of Singapore. Still, a great facility.  Check-in and out was smooth and the staff efficient. Room service a bit slow at times. We recommend a room on a high floor with a view of the city.  Breakfast expensive, we did not go for it. Lots of options in MBS shopping area. Coffee and tea facilities in the room could be improved.  I might return, the location is great and well connected by MRT and the "shoppes" are great.

This isnt my first time in MBS however I didnt get to review them. Everything was perfect! Sure the hotel is always crowded since it is most probably an iconic building & landscape in Singapore. Check-in was pretty quick, they have several counters located in each tower. Since it was crowded we checked in at the VIP service desk(mom told me to, and we didn't get rejected). We booked a club room for 5 nights and that includes breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktail. The breakfast was good with great variety except that it doesn't change everyday. Evening cocktail was the best, free flow alcohol, luxury canapés with finest ingredient like foie gras, caviars and crustaceans. Seriously I can even pass a day without having to buy another food just like a full board hotel.…

(+): Iconic Singapore Hotel Great city view pool Mall integrated  (-): Too expensive  Average room design for 5★ iconic hotl No ecowasher/jetwasher closet A bit noisy room as use common material of window Better choose premier room if stay more than 2persons

We stayed here on our last night in Singapore, mainly because of the infinity pool on the 57th floor! It didnt dissapoint! We would never usually spend so much on 1 night in a hotel room but as we had the whole of Sunday afternoon free, we thought a good way to spend it would be at the hotel...we wanted to get our moneys worth! We sure did, the room was so cool and the blinds open up everytime you enter! The bed was huge and the whole room was immaculate. We spent most of the afternoon/evening at the infinity pool, swimming, taking pictures, enjoying the view and drinking cocktails...also got to see the laser light show! You can only visit the pool if you are staying at the hotel and it is definatley worth it.

Well this is the second time around that i've check in and it was an amazing experience once again.I had a breakfast at club lounge which is previously at 57th floor.I still remember one staff and hope she recognize me. Mirdy gave us an excellent and friendly service.Sincere and warm smile.Variety of food is very much appreciated.Definetely to come back again.
I stayed in the Marina Bay Sands for a few days for a conference in April 2015.  The hotel is nice, but there are not too many facilities.

The rooftop sky bar wthin this magnificent building was disappointing and a let down by our experience - other bars were prepared to adopt their cocktails to our taste and service was with a smile. In contrast we did not have the atmosphere or service we grew to expect from the rest of Singapore. Other than the views, our expectations of this bar were reduced by the experience - expensive does not mean quality.

Great Location , Heart of the city, Room size is sufficient big with balcony, Ultimate, very big, Great, highest swimming pool in the world, Good Jacuzzi, Breakfast is good,only I suggest that they should give 2 liter drinking water per person, overall enjoyed a lot & I think that I'm giving five star first time to any property

I expected more of a hotel with such a high price. I have been to many good hotels in the past, but this one is just the worst one. I was staying for a few night and had a suite. I had to wait more than 30 minutes for check in, the breakfast ( 60sgd) was terrible, super crowded and I had to wait before there was a table. I see a lot of positive reviews, but these people probably never stayed at Ritz or Shangri-la. The pool was good, but drinks start at 25 sgd and the pool is just 120 cm deep ( not really possible to swim. Also, if you wish to eat at the hotel, reserve a few days in advance

Had to stay there for a conference. The hotel room is very impersonal and the service is really poor. You can feel that the hotel is all driven by the casino tourists. The architecture of the building and the stunning view from the top floor is really the only reason why you should have a short stop there.  The lobby is really noisy and packed as a railway station at peak rush time.

Just was a bad time to visit with a lot of haze caused by the forestry fire in Indonesia. It is a very busy hotel, but check in was a breeze. Very courteous staff.  An upgrade to the higher floors in the 50 range was worth it overlooking the bay.  Rooms were spacious with free wifi. The infinity pool was relaxing if you head out early enough with less of a crowd.

Clearly a must visit for all. The sky deck gives an amazing view. Make sure you go there late in the evening as you get a much better sight of the Singapore skyline. The shopping options are expensive, but worth a browse. The casino is also a must visit.

I wasn't sure what to expect of Marina Bay Sands as I'd heard mixed reviews about it prior to going. I think to put it in perspective, we have to remember that it is an enormous complex - over 2,000 rooms, which is going to give the hotel a certain feel.  The good:  1) That infinity pool. One of the big drawcards of the hotel, and yes it is as amazing as advertised. As many photos as I'd seen online, I was still blown away - it is simply stunning.  2) The hotel is visually stunning and impressive to look at - just standing at the base of the towers inspires a sense of awe, the sheer magnitude of it. It is also conveniently next to Gardens by the Bay.  The bad: nothing happens quickly. As mentioned earlier, the hotel has over 2,000 rooms. Whilst the rooms themselves are clean and…

Went there for a family staycation. It is a very busy hotel with long Q at the checking in and checking out counter. Chinese Tour group shouting across the lobby. Kind of the very chaotic feeling and I personally does not like such feeling when I check into any hotel.   The mini bar have sensor in it so for everything that is being remove, it will automatically charge to the bill and should you need another frigde, it is a cost. They will only provide 2 bottle of mineral water. I tried calling asking for another 2 bottle and was rejected right away with no reason given. Should they have some standard answer since it is a 5 start hotel.   Room was clean after noon. We went out for breakfast and when we return, it is still not clean. went for swim and it is still not clean when we…

Unfortunately, we arrived in Singapore when it was hazy. Taxi fare from Changi airport to MBS was SD25. We checked in to MBS pretty early in the morning and were ushered into the Checking In Lounge (where there are sofas, coffee & tea, water). Our room was not ready yet at the time so we were told to come back around 12 noon for the room. However, we were given key cards so we could use the facilities (including going up to the restaurants and infinity pool on the 57th floor). With great location, on-site casino,  shopping precincts, food court & MRT station, it felt like you are in its own little town! City view room is fairly large with floor to ceiling window opens to the city, unfortunately due to haze, the view was not great at the time. Overall cleanliness was excellent.…

We did not stay at the hotel but went to see the lights come on in the bay at dusk. We enjoyed not only the view but the service and the dry Singapore Sling was a delicious accompaniment to our fresh oysters and ribs. Lucas, the bar manager I think stopped by to talk to us and it was great to hear some advice from him

Ok, the infinity pool is clearly impressive, the rooms are also great especially the ones with the city views. The spa on 55 is also fantastic, but the sheer size of the hotel makes the service completely unpersonalised including room service which is basically a call centre fielding requests.  It is difficult to be here and relax. The pool is heaving with people, they decided background music was necessary so softly played chart music can be heard across the pool area, and choosing a restaurant to dine in, is a monumental task where trying to physically visit each one may take you more than a couple of hours (the website is probably the best as the in-room documentation was slightly out of date - no mention of the latest Spago on 57 for example).  For me a hotel needs to be a…

Had a really disappointing experience with this Hotel. They have a surcharge for Additional Adult in room for which they provide rollaway Bed but they don't confirm the extra bed until you check in. Doesn't make sense as if you are accepting additional adult it is only reasonable to expect confirmed additional bed! Otherwise during check in if no bed is provided where does the 3rd Adult sleep? On the floor? I can understand this practise for child under 12 who do not attract any surcharge!

Great building and the only reason i visited is to experience the infinite pool and it worth the experience.  Staff were great, checkin and check out were fast and smooth.  The room was modern (a bit tired and old furniture) with a specious toilet, breakfast was not good despite the wide range of food.  The location is not central so you have to take transport (metro / taxi) to get to orchard road.  The attached mall is nice and there are some nice eateries in and out.  Very close to the garden by the bay.  The only reason for me to stay in this hotel was the pool and i am not going to stay in it again.

Awesome place with night lights show which is a must.  However  there's a fee to get to the  very top of the place to view Singapore.  There's an infinity pool there which is only for hotel guest of course.  Shopping is all high end fashion house like Dior, Chanel, Prada etc.  there's a very good food court there.

I highly recommend to stay in this hotel. Be sure to spend time in the pool on the roof. It is imposible to get out of it)) Perfect view and nice atmosphere! Impressions are unforgettable. Rooms and breakfast are good as well

This is by far the most overrated & overpriced hotel I have EVER been to!!!  For $700 a night the premier room is so basic, with not even a DVD player & the decor is drab & breakfast is NOT included ($48 extra each). Staff are so impersonal & rude & pool is tiny with hardly any chairs. Don't bother coming here it's a waste of time & money!
Impersonal, overpriced, no breakfast included, isolated location, unfriendly staff, poor room cleaning. Good pool. Suggest you try elsewhere. Outrageous room cost. No sense of 5 star

It's amazing and wonderful place that couldnot miss when come to Singapore. There is the show every night. That is so magnificent about the music with the colorful light in every huge trees. So much enjoy with this show.

Very good hotel in Singapore! Amazing views, it's an architectural wonder and the infinity pool on the rooftop terrace is spectacular. The Gardens by the Bay area is very beautiful and we enjoyed our day there very much. We had avery big deluxe room on the 40th floor. Good service! I highly recommend this hotel for you!

The hotel design is spectacular. But it is a victim of it's own success, crowds everywhere. Huge foyer and atrium as you walk miles to the different towers a few chairs would be appreciated. Due to the size of the hotel there is no sign of any personal service.  The pool area is only for the views and taking photos, although the staff were attentive and plenty of towels available, it was not a place you would consider spending a relaxing time. I was disappointed that the pool itself closed at 8pm. We were very relieved to be given an early check in. Therefore avoiding the huge queues we noticed later in the day.

excellent location, excellent views. Great view at night at the infinity pool. the buffet at the restaurant offered a lot of choices and very good. rooms were comfortable and clean. Easily accessible to the shops and attractions around.

If you don't want to step foot outside for any reason while you're in Singapore, you should stay here. It's hot so I totally get the desire. It's cavernous with 3 separate towers all connected by the ground level and the rooftop where there is a spectacular infinity pool and restaurants. It's also connected to a massive mall with stupidly high end high end stores.  Oh, and there's a casino.  Some misses with the hotel - it's big so plan on hiking it to everything including breakfast. The bath products were very disappointly lower end with an unpleasant sweet smell. You're one of a gazillion guests and you can feel it.

not bad to stay here,  very good staff and services. nice and clean room with good view, specially access to rooftop pool and easy access to casino.  but the negative point is cheap lobby style (look like 3 stars). don't expect too much at the lobby. and price too expensive for what it get.

We stayed in this hotel on 28-29 September just to visit the infinity pool while staying in Singapore and we had high expectations based on the comments and the photos. However, it was a disappointment for us, due to below mentioned reasons.   First of all, it is a HUGE hotel, which means it is very crowded and as a guest you do not feel yourself special. As it is very crowded, imagine the pool area. At any hour of the day, the pool is full of people taking selfies constantly. It was an issue to find available deck-chairs during our stay. The pool looked much smaller than in the photos, maybe due to the crowd. We did not enjoy it at all... Given that it is a very expensive hotel and the aim of our stay was just experiencing the infinity pool, we were not satisfied.  As it is a…

book at there and try to get from highest floors. The view is amazing at all. The rooms are comfortable and clean. But as everyone know the best thing is the infinity pool. Go to pool at night and get the pleasure of great Singapore view.

It was a fabulous way to end the trip with fantastic view at night and being in the infinity pool, SkyPark and awesome laser show. Easy access to Marina, Helix Bridge, Merlion Walk, Art Science Museum, Gardens and So many things with shopping mall connected to hotel.Nice to be there but too busy hotel

We stayed at MBS for the F1 and everything about our stay here was memorable.  The welcome and check in were fast and efficient, to make it even better we had a free room upgrade to a suite ( even tho it was F1 week ) this totally blew us away as the suites are mightily impressive and we just could not believe our luck.  The whole complex is a vast expanse of shops, bars, theaters, casino and other options to suit all tastes.  Our first port of call was the Skypark and the world famous infinity pool.....it really is a WOW moment when you exit the lift to see it panoramic views across the pool and Singapore city, although very busy we managed to secure a couple of beds pool side, ordered some drinks and watched the sunset as the city came to life....whilst taking the mandatory…

I have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions now but this visit left left me disappointed. My previous stays have all been incident free and enjoyable. the staff have always been very accommodating and the room service punctual and good. However, on my latest visit the hotel failed to give me a wake up call as requested which resulted in me missing my international flight. This was  basic request request which should have been met. Reluctant to stay again.

My first impression is that it is a very touristy and not a classy hotel because the lobby is teeming with people. But once I was in the safety of our room and enjoying the view then I felt that we are indeed in a luxury hotel. Other than that, the price of the stay reminded us. Lol. The only food I tried were stuff they were serving at the pool area which is always crowded. Just ok, my club sandwich could have been warmer. But nothing beats the sights from there especially on a clear day.

The infinity pool, on the 57 floor, is definitely amazing. However, the room is standard and there isn´t anything to justify the high price charged.  The check in/check out is efficient but it lacks the human touch. Finally, they gave as connecting room and we had to endure with all the noises from the other room for two nights. After I went to the reception they promptly changed us. The question is: why give us a connecting room in the first place when we are a couple? Why not reserve those for family and relatives?

Staying here in September when the F1 race is on certainly made it a very expensive place to stay even by Singapore standards. It is really hard to justify paying the exorbitant rates even though the infinity pool is truly amazing. The views are fantastic especially at night and being in the infinity pool on the Sunday night when the actual F1 race was on and looking down on the race was an amazing experience. The whole hotel and the actual experience of being there is very reminiscent of being in a Las Vegas hotel rather than a Singapore hotel which I feel is to its detriment.  Having wanted to stay here for the last few years I am glad we have experienced MBS but there is so many other great hotels in Singapore I doubt if we will return to MBS.

Luxury for sure at this hotel. Easy access to casino, botanical gardens and adjoining mall. Of course all very expensive, but that was expected. Infinity Pool was spectacular & view but considering the amount of tourists up there, overrated. Customer service good. Chocolate and cheese buffet was a lovely experience. View from room was nothing short of amazing.

This hotel is an excellent,good standard accommodation.It has excellent views and great service such as friendly staff in the reception and the buffet. In my experience I was lucky enough to stay in the presidential suite and it was marvellous even though it is abit costly. Even a normal room has astonishing views. This whole hotels is shaped as a boat on a building.The swimming pol and the higher deck is the most exciting place you should go in the world.

Its a master peice in hotels,The dream hotel to stay.The view from thw 38th floor is mesmerising.Talking about food and service it exceeds the expetations and marks the higest standards in the industry.

I think the best thing about this hotel isn the pool. We stayed one night just so we could try it out and it was really nice but thinkign about the price of the one room for one night, you could get a nicer hotel with friendlier, warmer staff than here. The rooms were clean and large and comfy, the bathroom was great, and the staff were friendly. However it was very busy all the time, as you would expect as it has become a tourist attraction aswell, and the pool was also full a lot of the time.  I think its great to try one or 2 nights but for the money you spend you could stay somwhere else much nicer!

Great spot to sit and watch the city lights come to life. The laser show was pretty awesome, although the haze kind of ruined the impact of the light show, but still stunning and definitely worth waiting until 8pm to see it! Best view in my opinion is from The Helix Bridge looking towards Marina Bay Sands and the skyline. The southern side looked crowded from where we were so we were pretty glad we opted to stay near the bridge

We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our honeymoon and it was fantastic from start to finish. When we checked in were on the 4th floor not too far above the foyer and the road but asked to move higher up and were promptly upgraded to a suite on the 47th floor. The room, the view and the staff were nothing short of excellent. The highlight is a trip to the SkyPark and the infinity pool. There is something surreal about watching the city lights from a swimming pool 200m above the ground at 10pm at night. Not cheap but worth every penny.

Russian-speaking manager Aleksandra at check-in was very helpful.   Absolute comfort within the room and in every corner of the hotel. Unforgettable show in the theatre (Michael Flatley's Lord of the Dance: Dangerous Games).  Nits: Only 2 AC sockets in double room. Not enough for average number of gadgets per person.  Repair/construction works in SkyPark made access to the pool problematic from Tower 2. All restaurants and cafes at the roof shut down too early.  Summary: DO NOT book for 2 days: plan for longer stay or you will not be able to see and feel all wonders there!

The view from the pool. Amazing. But it feels like the hotel is resting on its laurels when it comes to the usual Asian comfort levels available in other Singapore 4 & 5* hotels.
