The American management style really shows through with the lack of care and attention to what could be a superb experience.   Upsides. The Pool. That skydeck is just amazing. The infinity pool is a real treat. The rooms are large (Suites and club rooms) and well appointed.   Downsides. The finish & Public areas. From paint that has been left to run on visible steelwork & broken tiling to a lobby that's more like a noisy bus station than a luxury hotel. There's just a general lack of comfort here for the price.   The club lounge was a bit of a disappointment. Again, lovely view, but lack of comfort and…

If one can afford, than this is one HTL not to be missed when in SIN... Everything about this property is above 5* growth from the arrivals to departure.... The staff are well mannered & obliging & willing to go the extra mile for any assistance required... All rooms are tastefully decorated with quite a few amenities with beautiful views of the ocean or the city... The prize possession is the Infibity Pool on the 57th floor overlooking the city, can only be visualised if one has visited it... The views are stunning & the entire layout is superbly decorated. The HTL has a high-end luxury mall attached with shops of luxury designer brands all adorned in the hugely decorated mall... The HTL also has the access to Gardens by the Bay, which is a must visit if time permits... The…

I'm really not sure how to rate this monstrosity of a property so this will be a few facts that may help you decide on the length of your stay.  This is a high priced hotel and worth staying for a couple of nights but not more and only if you are trying to impress yourself or someone else. If you are looking for a comfortable bed, drive right on past. The beds lack initial quality and aren't improving with age. All of the surfaces and furniture are low for style which means lots of bending over for anyone over 5' 4". Dresser has very little room and the mirrors are poorly placed .. as in not by an electrical outlet so you can dry your hair. It has some cool features like automatic drapes but they only opened about half of the available window view. We arrived during the…

We normally stay at the Hilton on Orchard but we had seen MBS through its development so just had to stay there.  Checked in early evening so no problem. We had a 5th floor room in tower three overlooking the gardens. No problem with this location, view was good but we found that the noise from the highway was persistent.  The room was spacious and I did like the power sockets which catered to all power plugs. Take care with the bathroom floor, no shower door can lead to water on the tiles causing a slip hazard. There was black mould on the bedroom ceiling and the fridge had not been cleared of the previous customers food, for a 5 star hotel at this price that is not acceptable. There was no fresh milk, just milk powder for tea, again not acceptable at this price.  Plenty of…

We got the lift to the 57th floor and had a (very expensive) drink in the bar next to the infinity pool that's enough to scare years off anyone who doesn't like heights! Staff very friendly and even offered to take photos of us with Singapore views and the pool in the background. The views are incredible but the smog is very bad at the moment due to the fires in Indonesia and the photos look very grey.

Everyone should stay here once, the hotel is enormous on size and experience. There are so many rooms and people, amazing views, access to a lovely shopping centre/casino - its all part of the deal.   Clearly, this is a very impressive hotel and a wonderful experience to stay here. Maybe because it was our second trip  - it did feel like it had lost some of its "amazingness" lustre. The changing of lifts to get to the pool (if you stay on a low floor), the security to get into and out of the pool area, the very limited menu at the pool and lines to the restaurants and check in/out. It was a bit tiresome by the end.  It is huge hotel (2500 rooms)  and with so many rooms and people these things are to be expected. My tip -   Stay once for a night or two - enjoy it for what it is.…

Stayed here for 5 nights before flying to Bali. Read many reviews around long waits for check in/out. They must have sorted this as we didn't have any waits at all.  Room was on 30th facing gardens and the bay - great views.  Room was large and stylish - very pleased.  The iconic "highest infinity pool in the world" was fully utilised, 06.30 swims let you see the sun rise and it felt like you were swimming in the sky.  Downtown MRT is under building use Bay Front stop. For s$3.60 return,  in two stops you can be at Telak Ayer MRt which is where Lau Pa Sat is. Go the other way to Bugis , to be near the Arab Street.  If you love luxury shopping the malls under the hotel are a must.  See my review of Rise before you eat there.   Light show on city side is fantastic 20:00 hours. You…

Crowded with alot of PRCs ,if u check in during weekend, it's quite happening at night ....but the rooms are very pleasant and spacious especially the washroom :))))). For those who intend to visit Singapore. ......1 night stay is good enough.

We spent one night at MBS, during the F1 race, thus the price were even more expensive... Nevertheless I would recommend this hotel. It's one Of the symbol Of Singapore, the infinity pool is just amazing with top view on Singapore skyline.There are a lot Of people, but this is expected with such a big hotel. Service + check-in is very good, staff helpful. Rooms are very comfortable with everything you need, and even the garden view is to recommend. Gardens by the bay very beautiful by day or night. I would not stay more than one day, cause Of the price, but if you are going to Singapore you should Troy it once.

We stayed here for two nights. The rooms and corridors are so quiet that you feel you are the only person staying here which is very good considering there are over 2000 rooms here. Housekeeping was outstanding and room service very good. Not a thing to complain about. One of the very Best infinity pool of the world is the main attraction with big casino & best shopping mall of Singapore. Garden by the Bay is very near by, The Art & Science Museum, Singapore Eye all are near by.

We arrived in the hotel in a taxi from the airport which was reasonable.  Check in took a while as it was busy but we were soon checked in and in our room.  Our room was very high up and we took the club executive option.  We had a balcony and superb views.  The rooms were lovely and large and had everything you needed.  We used the club lounge at every opportunity and made the most of it.  In fact we didn't need to eat out of the hotel because the club lounge was amazing.  The breakfast was superb, the best I have ever had.  The staff are so sweet and helpful, they remember your name, what you like and dislike, very attentive.  The afternoon tea is just indulgence and delightful.  The canapés and cocktail session was the best with food that you wouldn't find even in the best…

Paid almost $600 for one night and given 2 key cards and everywhere require the keycard to unlock. even going toilet. it feel like a prison unlocking door everywhere u go. a third person would costs u again $100 for a key card which is totally ridiculous. a huge hotel that got nothing to offer other then that pool. even that now access is restricted with all the stupid gates etc.

If you want to see beautiful view of Singapore, this is the best choice! The pool is amazing, the breakfast is super delicious and the staff are helpful! I stayed here with my family and it's all their needs. The hotel itself has access to bayfront mrt which make us easier to travel around Singapore. There are bus stops too in front of the hotel which connect to many famous destination in Singapore. me & family love everything about this hotel.

We stayed her for three nights and besides being the busiest Hotel with so many people everywhere I could not fault it. The rooms and corridors are so quiet that you feel you are the only person staying here which is very good considering there are over 2000 rooms here. Housekeeping was outstanding and room service very good. Not a thing to complain about.

Wanted to stay in the Marina Bay Sands because of the pool. Really liked the hotel and whilst I was in one of the less expensive rooms on the lower floors it turned out to be an advantage because of the haze. I overlooked the Marina Bay Gardens which was lovely. The hotel was very nice and the service professional and very friendly. However, personally I would not stay there again as it was far too big and it felt like a place you cannot escape easily. There are 2500 rooms, a lot of bars and restaurants, a giant casino and an adjacent shopping mall. It felt like a hotel owned by a Las Vegas chain. Even the pool was so crowded and full of people doing selfies or searching for free sun loungers. Of course I did my selfieas well but left soon afterwards. A real treat but too much…

Although the digs were spacious, modern and comfortable with great views, I found the vibe to be vey pretentious. On the roof top pool it was selfie central on steroids, yuk. To top it off they hold $200 for 14 days which is a bit rich if you didn't touch the mini bar.

If you want to experience Singapore's amazing view then stay here! The view from the roof top pool or from one of the roof top bars is worth seeing!!  The hotel itself is positioned in a great location with hundreds of shops and eateries directly below. The facilities are excellent, rooms are clean and staff very  My only tip is to request a higher floor room, if you don't you will be disappointed . friendly.

Have had the pleasure of staying at several nice resorts, hotels around the world.  Certainly not the most well traveled.  However, this was an amazing experience with some advice.  To stay at Marina Bay Sands is to be part of a skyline, a structure which is now so iconic it is helping define the modern day Singapore.  A fantastic location with incredible access to the Marina, to the city (Orchard) and the airport.  Surronding are the Gardens, the shopping, the nightlife and restaurants.  Amazing!  And the pool...there are almost no words to describe this incredible engineering accomplishment.    The service throughout the hotel is absolutely the very best and I was thoroughly impressed.  From the room cleaning staff to check out...top, top quality.  So why 'only above average'.…

We stayed here on the last night of our three week Asian Adventure. It was definitely a fab way to end the trip.   We upgraded to a high floor, orchid club room. The view was SPECTACULAR and well worth the money.   The icing on the cake however was the pool. It is definitely an experience. We caught it on the sunset and stayed in it for an hour or so after. THe evening lights are just amazing.  We even caught the laser show on the harbour below. What an experience. I don't think you could have asked for more.   The rooms were ok - ours was big, but worn. It had a Las Vegas feel to it (large amounts of people passing in and out) however I suppose that is par for course.   The shopping area is great, the MRT is under the hotel. For a longer stay, I preferred our hotel on Pickering…

This is the best one when compare to all other hotels which I have lodged so far.  The casino is grand.  The restaurant just too nice.  The infinity pool in 54th floor is a signature in Singapore.  The huge shopping mall and connected to every where which is unbelievable.  A hotel must go when travel to Singapore.

Stayed in a suite for a few nights, and I must say it was one of the best hotel experiences I've had in Asia.  Great views with amazing furnishings and bathrooms. Room service was on point and efficient.  Obviously priced in the high range but of course this is Singapore and it's definitely worth the money when compared to other options. The MBS complex is self-contained and has almost anything you would need including dining, nightlife and shopping so we didn't end up leaving the building the whole time we stayed.

It's a giantic hotel as you need to really see it to comprehend that. For example, when you first enter to the hotel, what you see is the check-in (registration) queue is as long as a passport control queue in a busy airport. Somehow we were taken to VIP-Registration lounge, which even took more than 15 mins. waiting.   We wanted to pay the deposit cash in USD (like we do in many other hotels, where we later on pay our bill with local currency and take deposit back in USD),  which was accepted but mentioned that the return would be in Singapore Dollars only. I found it odd that I'm paying the deposit to an international hotel, and the hotel is trying to make profit out of it with their dead exchange rates. Other options are paying it in Singapore Dollars (which we didn't have…

MBS is quite hard to review.  As a general overview it is an iconic & impressive building in its own right, & if you are in the city but not staying at the hotel the views from the Skydeck are awesome as long as the air quality is good. The lobby is huge, & quite imposing. We arrived by taxi & were immediately welcomed & our luggage tagged by the bellboys. The luggage tagging system is very good & is electronically matched to your name/room.  My best recommendation is to book the best you can possibly afford. We booked a grand club room & found it both huge & excellent - & it wasn't even a suite!  Club rooms or better have their own check in at Tower 1, which gets you sorted much sooner than the big queues for 'normal' check in. We found the check in staff to be friendly &…

I had heard a lot about the infinity pool at the Marina Bay Sands and that was the principal reason why I had always wanted to stay there.   There can be no denying that the hotel is an excellent hotel. We had a lovely lovely time there and the entire stay was an experience in itself. The pool, which was my star attraction was a fun place to spend time at. Our room had a balcony and the rooms have an excellent view. One can spend hours sitting or standing in the balcony and gazing at the sea. I am uploading a picture that I took from my room's balcony.  The hotel provides a plethora of activities which can cater to people of any age group and any wishes or vices. The hotel is attached to a grand mall, a LV Showroom, a food court, has an in house disc/club, a large number of…

Spent 9 Nights with my Wife & 1 child at Marina Bay Sands over the school Holidays. Rooms where nothing special but nice. The Club Room was brilliant and defiantly made the stay at this Hotel. I would not stay their again unless I had use of the Club Room again. The Pool is amazing. Overall it was above my Expectations and would defiantly recommend it to others. Good location and personally I thought that the Marina Bay Sands Shopping center was the best in Singapore. Did not
Amazing day & night visit to MBS!! My only gripe is one cannot go & see the awesome swimming pool on the top deck of the MBS if you are not client of the hotel. Thanks.

I'm a little indifferent towards this Hotel. This is an aesthetically pleasing hotel and  luxurious in its presentation.  If you enjoy mega hotels and indulgence you will love it here.  It was interesting experience to try but not my cup of tea. The infinity pool was a bit of a circus. More on that later.  We stayed for three nights in two interconnecting rooms with amazing views that were maximized by floor to ceiling windows.  The bedding, furniture, and finishes were top quality and the comfort level of the room might make you not want to leave.  The amenities were exquisite and promptly replenished when needed.  Great selection of in-room tea and coffee too(no Nescafe to be seen).    Check-in was an experience. Lots of instructions given to ensure a smooth stay.  We were at…

Probably one of the most luxurious hotels stays of my life. Absolutely amazing and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Singapore. Has its own casino and shopping mall attached! The infinity pool and incorporated restaurants are breathtakingly amazing! A must if your visiting Singapore.

From driveway to check in was a breeze. The view from the infinity pool was breathtaking where 90% of the people are taking photo rather than swimming. The observation deck provides a great view of the city night light and garden by the bay. The room & bathroom are spacious and clean.Will definitely be back here. The price is also beyond typical hotel.

I went to visit this hotel. It is one of the landmarks of that great city. You can have an amazing view if you go up the building. There is also swimming pool on top if you want to relax in a water.   I really recommend visitors to take one step and visit it.

Stayed here for 3 days. The hotel is nice room is nice and the pool is another level and just staying for the pool is worth while but for how much you pay I would not recommend. The staff are far from helpful. The breakfast baring in mind how many guests they have is beyond basic and not much choice. If you are staying here I would only recommend for a day to use the pool. It's not worth the £300 plus a night.

My husband and I had been so excited to stay here. We lasted an hour before checking out and back into the Fullerton. The service was shocking from a poor check in whereby nothing is explained to a lack of signposting leaving us wandering round aimlessly before we can even find the correct elevator. The first room we check into is dirty and a note hand written in Chinese says "to wait for cleaning" or something! the windows had all been left open and when Singapore is experiencing a haze issue very unhealthy. We move rooms (no apology or upgrade) and we ask for some additional complimentary water to make feeds for our baby. We are told no and they will happily send some up at $4 +. Now I'm sorry but when you're paying $1000 or so a night I expect to be given some bottles of…

If there is ever a hotel that is just too big, this is it. But yet, our family couldn't get adjoining rooms (which we specifically requested at the time of booking which was confirmed). Their excuse was that the guest of one of the rooms was checking out late...  But wait for it, we couldn't even get 2 rooms on the same floor when we checked in!!!!! 3 towers full of rooms but still we couldn't get 2 rooms together???   This resulted as a major inconvenience for us for the whole duration of our stay, my husband had to share with our 1.5 year old and I had to share with our newborn. We had to run between the 2 rooms constantly as you can imagine with any young families, husband was on the 27th floor and I was on the 12th.   Another major inconvenience was that your key card…

Marina bay sands is a must do in Singapore for one night to see the pool and the view. And the rooms are nice, the location good. The pool is fun, but it is not relaxing at all, because everyone is taking pictures and selfies all the time, so you can't profit of it.  The staff is very unfriendly, the restaurant on the top is not really good, the breakfast is in a way to big area and not enjoyable. The service is bad: 20 minutes waiting for Check-in, no one who takes care of the luggage at arrival.

amazing building in singapore, the view from top is amazing and really make you amazed. the elevator is super fast. the room is clean and spacious. the house man did not speak english so hard for me to communicate. I got a nice view from my room which facing to floating football field.  one thing for sure, management should thing how to improve the hotel from inside (the people) and the outside (building) such as maintaining and developing.

I spent time or visited  5 stars hotels in Europe or USA, including Las Vegas, that i adore... Dubai not yet, but next, i hope.... Well, i cannot imagine a more overwhelming experience than the infinity pool in Marina Bay Sands! For me nothing can beat this experience, not yet at least! Amazing megaconstruction, genial architectural idea, great feeling to actually be there, up there, in this amazing infinity pool, with Singapore down there....! Probably the rest, like great rooms or apartments, great service, great view, great shopping area, etc, one can experience somewhere else too, BUT NOT the infinity pool! I am grateful that i could do it!

My husband and I stayed in the hotel last week and it was nice. The hotel is expensive but worth the price for a short stay. We loved the infinity pool and the restaurants there. The room was superb,I liked the bathroom alot. The restaurant Adrift was excellent and served some very good cocktails. Staff was friendly and supportive.

There can be no doubt that this property has a lot going for it. I have stayed here previously and enjoyed my experience which is why I chose, once again, to try it out and, in doing so, took a friend with me who was visiting Singapore for the first time.  Physically, the property is stunning and is undoubtedly an icon of the Singapore skyline. Of course, one of the problems associated with being so big is that it lacks the warmth and personal touches of other hotels. The lobby is quite clinical and does not make for a great first impression. That having been said, our check-in experience was good with little waiting, although this no doubt had something to do with the fact that we were arriving at around 11pm.  The room was a good size with a lovely balcony overlooking the…

I have read mixed reviews about Marina Bay Sands and I beg to differ the negative. I'm glad I followed my heart and booked 2 Orchid Suites in celebration of my daughter's 21st birthday. Check in was smooth as few days before my stay, I had submitted the pre-arrival planner. Upon my room arrival,  was greeted with birthday cakes, fruits and chocolates. The friendly Ms. Tze Wei (MBS Guest Relation Officer) attended to my every needs. The birthday celebration attended by friends and family was a blast. MBS night views was a stealer. Was granted late check out and had our breakfast @ The Club on 55th floor. There, my daughter was serenaded with birthday song and cake. Mission accomplished, especially to see how happy the birthday girl was. All these will not be possible without Mr.…

Marina Bay Hotel is a very big hotel with 3 towers of hotel. It is a work out itself especially for the ederly. Although every tower has its own lobby, it is a work out to walk around the lobby especially for the ederly from one end to the other end. But the only connection to the mall is by the tower 2.

For anyone going on a budget should keep money to stay in this hotel for atleast 1 night . The hotel is like a should not miss attraction. We were lucky to get a room on 50th floor . The check in and out timings are 3.00pm and 11.00 am. There is a huge rush at 3.00 for checking but the staff handle it well. The staff at entrance will take care of your luggage so that you go for registration without your luggage . Even when in queue the staff will start the registration process . They are very courteous and explain every thing well. The room decor are top of the line . However the bathroom door doesnot have a latch. When we asked to the hotel . They said it's designed that way . It's a bit inconvinient when there is a family with children in the room . There is a fully loaded…

A fabulous hotel.  Large rooms.  Views of the City or Bay.  Every facility you could need.  The Skypark offers fabulous views day or night with bars to wash down what you see.  A swim in the pool is a must do whether you are a guest or not.  It is not cheap especially during an event (eg  F1 GP).  Indulge yourself just once.

I have been to many hotels with spectacular views and this is by far one of the best. we were upgraded to a club room on arrival, the check in was smooth though the lobby area was busy and somewhat congested. staff were efficient and courteous. We asked for the city view overlooking the bay area, and the first thing you notice when you enter the room is the VIEW, it is a wonderful sight and from the windows you could also see the laser display in the night by 8pm i think, that further adds to beauty. the other side had the garden view overlooking Gardens on the bay, i would imagine the view there to be spectacular as well especially at night.  Everything about the hotel is great, the infinity pool, the sky park with even more amazing views, the gym and the room service are all…

It's an iconic hotel I can't imagine coming to Singapore and not staying here,  at least once!! Pool does get busy, drinks and food are expensive.  We had a city view which was amazing in the evening, but the garden view looked great too as the gardens are all lit up in the evening.   Room was huge with all mod cons.  I can't say this is the best hotel or best service we've ever had, but there is nothing to complain about and it was well worth the money just to be in an infinity pool on the 57th floor staring at the Singapore skyline ( pool is open to residents only) don't forget your waterproof camera and your selfie stick !!

It was expensive especially because it was a summer visit.  The cost was worth it because we had a great experience.  We spent half of the day saturday at the pool. The hotel has a photographer that takes pictures and you purchase them for a large fee.  With such a big hotel you would think the service would be lacking, it wasn't.  The pool staff was amazing, front desk, and the doormen.  Our room was big enough and well decorated with a large bathroom.  The hotel is large, but when you are in your hotel tower it seems like a regular sized hotel.

My daughter and I stayed for 3 nights , we had amazing experience at the Marina, the Infinity  pool is amazing my daughter truly loved it. Great way to spend our summer vacation.  Just a few Recommendation - movie selection on TV was not great., Also please improve your shower. Room service are quick , Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast at Restaurant  is super!

Eight nights at a conference and exhibition in an extraordinary location. Dinner at Sky on 57, the rooftop bar, spectacular views over the bay, the gardens by the bay, and much more.  This is an expensive location with opportunities to spend even more, so be prepared - there are cheaper locations in Singapore. However the rooms are superb, service levels are excellent, the food is very good, and it's definitely worth the visit.  The bathroom, beds and in room ambiance are very good, and the only in room downside is the frankly ridiculous wifi system which asks for constant logins and daily refreshes. Definitely the worst thing about the hotel.  A word of warning: it's a busy location. The lobby and internal thoroughfare can be like Grand Central Station, and if crowds bother…

The suite that we had was very spacious, there's plenty of room for the three of us. The bed was really comfortable. The highlight of our stay was the pool at the skypark. Towel are always ready for you and you can even order some cocktaill while sitting on the poolside. The overall experience is really great. I might come back if i ever get back to Singapore.

If you're the kinds who eyes luxury hotels during your stay in Singapore, you should highly consider Marina Bay Sands as one of your top choices. Stands true to being a 5 star hotel, amazing breakfast spread, spacious rooms, quick room service, good food! Their infinity pool on the 57th floor deserves a special mention .. you should hit the pool 2 hrs before sunset & hang around till around 7:30-8pm. Its mostly full & finding a good seat can be task..  The casino is also good .. they have a connected mall inside for luxury brand shopping..   Make sure you look up for a good room in advance.. one with their garden facing view..

We had a very nice room on the 51st floor overlooking the city. The bed was lovely and comfortable with good quality linen. The bathroom was very dangerous when wet! I did the splits coming out of the shower so ended up putting the towels on the floor so we didn't slip over. My real bug bear was the tea/coffe situation... 2 cheap sachets of instant coffee and 1 of each different flavoured tea bags, bizzare choices for a 5star hotel but worse was the expectation that it is acceptable to put coffee mate in tea! Why was there no fresh milk supplied? Very disappointed after all our room only cost $750 for 1 night!! Unfortunately our view was very hazy due to the illegal Sumatra fires and we had a very quick swim in the fantastic infinity pool but our eyes were smarting and we were…

In truth we only stayed here initially to get access to the skylark, and the infinity pool in particular. I suppose it didn't disappoint, but the pool area was consistently busy even late at night as people were getting night shots from the pool. However, I have to say thanks to the hotel staff who upgraded the room for us, to make our last night on honeymoon special. The view from the room was amazing, with a view across the marina. We didn't have breakfast included, what there are coffee shops across the road in the Shoppes centre. There are also food court outlets there, if you didn't want tho eat in the high end restaurants.

Well this hotel was amazing ! Me and my friends only stayed here one night but will definitely be returning here. The hotel is rather large so you do feel quite small in comparison to all the people staying there. The hotel is easily reached by the MRT , you have to walk through a hall of designer malls to get to the hotel. Reception isn't clearly marked out. The room we were put in was fantastic , looking straight onto the gardens.   The room was amazing , so big and even had usb chargers. Only thing I didn't appreciate is that the bathroom didn't have a lock. We were on the 40th floor. I believe there are 57 rooms in total   We ordered room service and they were quick to deliver and the food was amazing.  ***the infinity pool**** absolutely makes this hotel, it is unreal. A…

Such a wonderful property and service . Enjoyed each and every moment in our stay . Unfortunately TV was not working as the cable was not properly plugged . Have seen some staff accessing the FOH elevators while their at duty . But we loved the place and meals . Wanna come back again . Such a nice property on earth.

Cost is $23 per per and they try to sell you a tacky photo for $50 but the view is outstanding even with the haze from other parts of Asia that is currently covering Singapore.   56 storeys up, what a view.   Perhaps next time stay here and try the infinity pool

Along with the Burj Al Arab this is a hotel "wonder of the world" and a must try even if just for one night to expereince the iconic roof top pool.. that's what it's all about. A Vegas style hotel with shopping mall in the basement all pretty good value too!

Everything about it is so professional and high classed, but still an extremely fun experience. There will be a lot of business goers but mainly just fun adults enjoying their time. Everything from Gardens By the By through to Marina Bay Sands, and then to the Shoppes is so well maintained and clean it is a completely different world. With great views day and night, a fun pool where no one actually goes there to swim (more for photography), this hotel is filled with buzzing and excited guests, experiencing a rare but uncontrollable bubbly feeling right at the peak of Singapore's most famous piece of architecture.   Everything from service staff to sleep quality is tops.  One thing is that dining options are limited to high class and expensive foods which are quite good, however,…

what a fantastic hotel. efficient staff, great rooms, brilliant location. amazing views. will defiantly stay here again when i return to this amazing city. great tube links to the hotel as well and shopping on your doorstep.

Stayed here with my wife and 2 young daughters 4/5yrs old.   Positives: ------------- Nice sized room on 1576, with fold out sofa, girls loved it. Complementary access to sky bar and pool on level 57. Nice and close to the general lobby and small lift transfer to get to the 22nd floor to transfer lifts to 57th floor.   They greeted us well on arrival, although it would have been nice to check in between12-3pm, but we had to wait to 3pm.  Check out time however is 12pm, making up for late checkin time.  Breakfast in the first restaurant downstairs was good value ~$40 per head and from memory our two girls are free and as many barista coffee as you could drink.   Most of the restaurants in the mall seem to charge back to the hotel room.  Good view.   Negatives: --------------  We…

Stayed here for two nights and were given a balcony room overlooking the gardens by the bay. We were a group of four and the room was amazing - very spacious. When planning this trip I was expecting that we would all be put into one small room however our room was huge and had two bathrooms including a bath and make up table. We also had a balcony which was also really big and a huge sitting area where we could look over the gardens. The view from the top is amazing however the pool can be slightly crowded at times - but in saying that we were always able to get a banana chair quite easily.

The hotel and staff were excellent. We booked for premier room but when they found it was our anniversary they upgraded our room to orchid suite room with a great city view plus a complimentary anniversary cake! THANK YOU!  The hotel property was modern & beautiful. The infinity swimming pool on top of the hotel building was amazing and the view was spectacular. The buffet breakfast at Rise was superb with many selection of food. The location of the hotel was convenient, very close to the mall, restaurants and local attractions. Thank you MBS for making our wedding anniversary a memorable experience!

Upon arrival, it was first class, check in was seamless. My companion and I were waiting to check in, a customer service officer took us over to the VIP check in. I asked could we have a nice room with a view, (we booked a standard room) not expecting to be upgraded to a suite. Our room was (city side) 53rd level, Tower 3.  The room was huge, the view was amazing, although the view would be good from either level. The Sky deck was totally unbelievable.  Location was very good, link to the MTR, ample shopping. Everything was first class. The Sky deck was outstanding.  Will be returning in the near future.

The hotel is massive and has a big multi level shopping mall connected to it. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. The highlight is the roof top terrace and pool, stunning location and views. This is an expensive hotel so one would expect the best service and quality. Mostly this is the case but there are a few issues. We received turn down service only once out of four nights, we had to ask for the room to be serviced after being out all day with the service request light on. Some areas are dirty and mouldy, not what you would expect from such a prestigious hotel. Some of the seats in the breakfast restaurant are very stained, they look terrible. Overall the experience was very good but there can be a lot of improvement, considering the cost.

Marina Bay is a great place in Singepore with the beautiful Marina Bay Sands hotel. You can go to the top floor for free to have a great view of Singepore. You can pay entrance to use their pool and enjoy the sunset with a cocktail while swimming.

Wonderful hotel with very comfortable rooms and stunning architecture. Beautifully designed building but it loses a star for having no heart, no management giving you a feeling of being a special guest, no lounge area, no comfy sofas in the lobby to sit and  enjoy a cup of tea or a gin and tonic and watch people go by. The main bar is separated from the lobby on a mezzanine level. I found myself going straight up to my room instead.  We enjoyed our stay overall but have felt more welcome in other grander hotels.  Good points   Room comfort Amazing bathroom with masses of counter top space and a huge walk in shower.  Balcony to dry your wet clothes (it rains, there's a pool and we were there for a week) Quick room service Excellent breakfast in room Plenty of lifts (you need to…

Magnificent view over the city skyline from the rooms and especially from the famous infinity pool on the roof which manages to be comfy and cool at the same time. Staff was very attentive, friendly and competent.

If you are looking for a good quality hotel, Marina Bay has it all.  Easy access via tube/train/taxis. With so many interesting places to look at around the Bay you will want to stay longer than planned!

Very good hotel,Good spacious rooms,excellent rooftop pool and Night club is there at the top floor which is quiet good. Hotel and city view from top floor looks really beautiful at night. Must see & stay property in singapore.

this is the hotel where everyone wish to stay just for a night. this hotel is the heart of singapore. it has in build metro station. it has a pool on the roof top and an observation deck on 57th floor.

Family stayed for one night in two rooms.  Rooms were both spacious, with nice bathroom amenities.  One room had an ordinary view overlooking the shopping centre, while the other had a fantastic view of the Gardens by Bay. It would be worth asking for a room with a view of at the Gardens - it was spectacular at night. Check-in counter was huge and well staffed, making check-in quick and efficient. Horizon pool was awesome, even though unfortunately during our stay thick smoke was blanketing the city because of fires in Indonesia. We ate in the shopping centre that adjoins the hotel, which was good and more reasonably priced.

This is an enormous hotel! - And unfortunately they are poorly equipped at the check in  desks to cater for such crowds of people. We arrived late in the evening (it was quiet at this time) but we still had to queue for 20 mins to check in. Once checked in no-one offered to help with taking our bags to the room. Basic information was not relayed to us either - once we got to our room we had to phone down to ask where is breakfast served? What time is breakfast?   Rooms face either the bay or the city.  We went for a bay view room, which had stunning views across the "Gardens by the Bay." The room itself was average - a decent size - but it had a faint mildew whiff to it.  The best thing about this Hotel is the Rooftop Pool! It has stunning views across the city. Due to the music…

The rooms are spacious & the amenities are in good condition. Nice view of the city skyline especially during the night. At day time, hotel guests can travel to the top floor to take a peek of the 360 view of Singapore CBD if you move 1 floor higher than where the infinity swimming pool is located. Overall a modern & luxury stay.

Hotel location: 20-25 min can ride from the Changi airport and located in Marina south. Taxi fare will be around 25 dollars.  Hotel access : there are three towers and all are easily accessible, if you don't know which tower you are in ( unless it's stated in your booking) it's a short stroll to each towers.  Hotel staff : excellent staff, upon arrival greeted with a warm smile and all the staff around the hotel were very pleasant. Pool bar staff was very busy and they did their best to get the menu orders as quickly as possible.  Check in process : when we arrive it was a very busy time in the hotel and even though we waited for a little while, reception was quick enough to get us in to a room.   Hotel room : we stayed at premier room with city views (see photos) on the 43rd…

3 of us only stayed for a night and booked a family room with consist of a queen bed and 2 x single beds. Quite pricey as expected but the entry to the infinity pool made it worth while. The view from the pool deck especially at night is unreal.

We had a room in Tower Three on 50th floor. Great views over the bay front gardens. The room facilities were excellent and the room a good size for a city centre location but the room lacked character and for me, overall, the hotel felt like an impersonal cash generating machine! We were there at a very busy time because of the Grand Prix and the room rate was very expensive. I would say that generally services in the hotel worked ok but like a machine, no personal touches.  The breakfast selection however, was excellent. Although the exterior of the hotel is very modern and exciting our room was very classic. Could have been in any good hotel anywhere in the world. Somewhat surprisingly there were no real touch of luxury but the bed was very comfortable. One major concern for…

LOVED, LOVED LOVED this hotel. Saying the pool is spectacular is an understatement and although it is very busy I still feel it is worth the experience. Great location for shopping and walking to nearby attractions like the cloud forest. Wouldn't hesitate to go back!

Stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend in one of the premier rooms. When you stay in a 5 star hotel you always expect a lot, and I'm usually disappointed, but not here. You pay for luxury and you get luxury!   Our room was amazing. HUGE bathroom with large free standing bath and spacious shower. The coffee in the room was really good, but the mini bar was super expensive (14 dollars for a can of tiger?!) so we bought our own from 7/11! The view over the gardens was lovely. We were on the 44th floor and had no complaints what so ever.   The pool is amazing, obviously one highlight of staying here. It wasn't overtly packed like a lot of people have mentioned, and there were plenty of times where we were the only people in one section of the pool (it was the F1 weekend so I…

Wonderful rooftop pool. Nice room with balcony. Modern hotel.Close to all amenities. Walking distance to great attractions. Great walk around Marina Bay. Lacks some of the old world charm and magic that some other established hotels possess.

Great hotel and location. Very pricey area but that is expected since we were there during Grand Prix weekend. My only complaint is that the pool was way too busy with people putting towels down on chairs even though not being anywhere near the pool. Other then that, this hotel is great. I suggest getting a room on the 34th floor or higher to avoid having to change elevators to get to the pool.

This is a 5 star gig, but felt like a 2-star guest. A really impersonal experience: the rooms are good, clean, fresh - everything you would come to expect from a big name hotel. But was just not feeling it, for my first ever staycation in Singapore. Had a couple of teething problems: the headboard light wouldn't switch off, and no engineer came to fix. The cleaning staff do not speak English, so difficult to communicate with them. We got locked out of our room, despite the late check out. The 'spectacular' pool (which it is) was ruined by drunken revellers from C'est La Vie - 'bombing' across the barriers with wine glasses in hand. Terrifying to watch. There were small kids were in the no-kids zone (not policed). A really average experience, also marred by the extraneous…

Being working in Hospitality industry,that too in a luxury product ,i wanted to give my family an same level of experience which till a certain extent they did had at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel- Singapore. From the time we were dropped at the entrance we were welcomed by the most smiling face bell boys who helped us to deliver the bag to our assigned room. The reception at the lobby three was absolutely hassle free. The checking process was as smooth and professionally handled by the staff and especially i would like to recommend Mr Bryan Cheong the duty manager, what an gentleman, Must say a true asset for the institution. Mr Cheong made our checkin so smooth and made us feel welcoming. The lobby was busy with guest going around and it was an absolute positive atmosphere. The…
I attended a confetence at Marina Bay. The place is clean and busy, I saw a lot of people also on same activity as me, but different conference. The decorations are spectacular.

We want to say very very thank you to Geraldine! We stayed just one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary and Geraldine made it all the more special. The hotel is unique in its kind, the infinity pool is less crowded in the early morning and at lunchtime. Thank you for the great experience.
This place is unique in that Marina Bay Sands has a high end Mall an amazing hotel with a swimming pool on the 57th floor. Excellent plants and so on.

This is the new icon / landmark for Singapore and a great location. The hotel is stunning as a view and even more so when you head in. There is plenty for everyone to do and enjoy, from the gardens, to the pool and restaurants.

This is a great place to visit even quickly if you have a 5 hour layover at the airport. There are shuttles that will run you there or taxis. It's very convenient and well worth it. Go to the top to have a drink and look around. Drinks are expensive of course, but go for the sangria pitcher and share with your friends. Beautiful views, and afterward you can go to the tree forest just below connected by bridge. Two great tourist attractions in a few hours. Well worth it!
stayed at the 52nd floor presidential suite , a luxurious and sprawling one with a wide view of the city skyline and river. the iconic hotel has a museum ,mall , casino , and the skypool.

This was a bit of a treat. We had 3 nights in a club room. Huge room with everything we needed including a comfy sofa to sit on and a beautiful bath. If we did want to let fresh air in (not that the air feels that fresh in Singapore!) the huge balcony doors did the trick. We were on level 6 which did mean that there was quite a bit of road noise but the bed was so comfy the noise soon retreated into the distance. Loved being able to go up to level 55 for our included breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktail hour. The staff were lovely, remembered our names and coffee order!

Nice room,nice service,nice view,nice pool, It's perfection!!!(also nice price,but its worth it after all) Located at the center of downtown,u can reach it absolutely easily. Hope i can be there again w/ my husband for our honeymoon next year ;P

It was always a dream to one day stay at Marina Bay Sands and we weren't disappointed at all, the rooms are amazing from the wow moment of walking in your room the first time to having your blinds automatically open to show he amazing views, to the size of the rooms and how luxury they are. This resort is amazing, the skypool is unbelievable an experience I will never forget. We stayed on the 39th floor with a city/bay view and it was WOW my only disadvantage I would say about the location is everything around you is so expensive in regards to shopping and restaurants. We will be back for sure.

Stay in the Club Room or above and everything about this place is exceptional. This was a 'take off the bucket list experience' and we were in an Orchid Suite. It is now back on the 'bucket list' and we WILL be going back.

My wife and I went to this F&B outlet with friends. It is located on the higher floors of the Marina Bay sands building and as such has fantastic views of the Singapore sky line plus also the bay with the assortment of ships. The food items are cheese and chocolate plus high quality coffee, so its not place you go for dinner and expecting a steak! What it is a amazing place to catch up with good friends, admire the views and enjoy a great arrangement of cheese, followed up by an assortment of chocolate that even had my chocolate fanatic wife in a frenzy!     Highly recommended as a must do to anyone visiting Singapore!

We preferred to stay at this hotel as a honeymoon couple because of the famous infinity pool. Hotel is clean and view from rooms is great but: 1) pool is really really crowded - not peaceful as in pictures. We did not swim. 2) we felt like entering a business centre not a hotel. Nothing is personal does not feel like a hotel. 3) check out time is 11am even with late check out it is 12.

Stayed here for a week. 47th floor, tower 2. Great view over looking the city and the bay. Rooms are well presented, and offer everything you'll need....5 star. Hotel seemed to be very busy and full and yet every staff member encountered are friendly, helpful and very professional.  Highly recommend staying here.

This hotel has become as iconic for Singapore as Raffles, but it couldn't be more different.  This is ultimate glitz.  The staff are great, friendly and helpful, but the sheer volume of the place works against them.  We stayed in a club room with a view of the Marina Bay and city.  It could not be more spectacular, worth the visit all by itself even if nothing else worked.  But for the most part, it all does work, just not as slick as it could be.  An exception is the Club Lounge.  It's been moved down from the roof to make way for a new restaurant.  The offerings throughout the day are wonderful, and the staff makes it something special.  However, it is set up more as a restaurant, and not so much as a lounge.

Our room was amazing! The moment we walked through the door, the curtains automatically opened and showed us our amazing view on the Gardens by the Bay. The room was large and the bed was nice. The Infinity Pool met my expectations but around 7PM it was freezing cold, but less crowded than in the afternoon. You also have a great view on the city lights of Singapore. The gym at the 55th is also worth the visit; lots of good equipments but I expected it to be bigger. Overall, anyone that visits the MBS, should stay at least one night.

The hotel, the pool, the views, everything is amazing. I would recommend to add the extra for a club or grand club room because the breakfast on the 57th floor, plus the afternoon tea and evening cocktail hour are a great investment.

Stayed here for two nights in September.  Rooms get four out of five and the pool gets five out of five.  Service in the bars and restaurants is also great. However general guest services is really poor. For example when we stayed there was an issue when my guest account was blocked. Apparently we had been enjoying ourselves too much and the hotel wanted a down payment for the account to be made in person at front desk.  First time that has happened in a life time of travelling, and nobody seemed to deal with my follow up complaint on this.  If you visit Singapore, stay one night for the pool access as this is for guests only but stay elsewhere for a better experience.

The room was beautiful but the overall service and experience was less than acceptable. For a premium hotel, there needs to be some serious work done on training staff in the essential skills of customer service. I would be unlikely to stay here again or recommend to anyone

This is a hotel complex that has it all under one roof - hotel, good restaurants, casino...(I'm not a fan of the type of crowds this draws in).  So you either love it of hate, this ain't no romenantic boutique or historical hotel,  if you know what I mean.    But worth a visit once.  My biggest gripe is that you cant reserve the city view rooms.  Their room types are mixed city and container port views, so its a 50/50 change you get the right view. Same price...only decided at check in.  maybe thats changed now, but you better check to avoid dissapointment.  Pool now well known and now a destination for tourists!  Yes its worth a dip in the night when its quieter and all the day trippers have left...

When visiting Singapore you must stay here! The infinity pool on the 57th floor is amaaazing and the only way to swim there will be staying at the hotel!  The food market, the shops, the rooms, the casino, everything will make your visit to Singapore a memorable one! Friendly staff and luxury 5 star service.

Its really comfortable and hospitable as it offers a luxorious touch to its hotel rooms . The hotel lobby is exquisite and really spacious to accomodate for all of the tourists. The food is top of the class and also offers a variety of cuisines to choose from. Would stay again next year if possible !!

We stayed in this hotel for 3 days after a cruise. On approaching we were in awe it looked spectacular. Stepping inside it is absolutely huge.  Check in took quite a long time but the staff were very pleasant.  We had 3 rooms between our party.The rooms were huge and were very well appointed. They even had electric curtains which automatically opened and closed with your door key. We were on a high floor and had spectacular views over the gardens and the city. The city views give you the chance to watch the light show from your room.  We didn't use the hotel restaurants as we thought they were overly expensive, but beware you are in an expensive part of town.  We couldn't wait to use the hotel pool but unfortunately were left a little deflated. It is extremely busy and people…

Its expensive, don't get me wrong....around $20 USD, but TOTALLY worth it.  If you get up there at the right time, they do a light and sound show of the "botanical gardens" below that is great to watch.  Just go up for the view....trust me.

We stayed at MBS for 2 nights recently and it was absolutely amazing! From the smooth check-in process, (where they were kind enough to let us check in early as we had 2 young children with us) to the sensational service from all staff (certainly not understaffed at this hotel!) to the breathtaking infinity pool on the rooftop, and the restaurants. We can't fault one thing. The rooms are very spacious and beautiful, the views are priceless and the service across the whole hotel is impeccable. We had breakfast at the Rise restaurant on the ground floor, which was a buffet, there was heaaaaaps to choose from, the only thing that wasn't amazing was the coffee? The following day we had breakfast at the rooftop restaurant Sky on 57, that was sensational! it was a semi-buffet and we…

We stayed on floor 42, the first thing i remember is the electric curtains opening to the amazing view of Singapore bay. I have been up and stayed in many skyscrapers around the world, but this is the closest you get to that utopian idea of architecture. It does totally shut you off to the rest of the world, mainly because it takes so long to get out of there especially if you go through the mall, but also of course the sky garden. We had the largest selection of food at a buffet I have ever had, and the quality was incredible considering the choice.

The hotel looks great, very clean and comfortable, nice personnel, willing to help you at every moment, the room is very modern, bathroom great and  the infinity pool is the cherry from the top. I wish I can come back here as soon as I can, there are still plenty of things to do here that I didn't get the chance.

Airport pick up,in room check-in,room nice,hotel PERFECT location  to many restaurants,shopping,museums,all walking distance to hotel !!!! But the very best thing was gorgeous rooftop pool !!! Xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.    Xxx.

Staying at the MBS was an amazing experience. From the relaxing rooftop infinity pool, to the 5 star quality room, 10/10 service it was an experience I will never forget.  There is nothing that could have made my stay at the MBS any more enjoyable. I will definitely be coming back!

This place was chosen purely for the pool but this was probably the biggest disappointment. Sure it is pretty spectacular, engineering wise. But unless you like feeling like you are packed into a sardine can good luck swimming. Room was nice, bathroom huge. Shopping amazing (if you are a millionaire) but I think I'd rather stay at a more boutique style hotel than something so commercialised. If you are a drinker, which I'm not (cough cough) many restaurants with many different cocktails to drink through. All in all a lovely place but I'm sure singapore has more to offer.

Arrival 1040pm. No doorman or bellman available to welcome or assist with luggage at porte corchere taxi drop off.  Had to pull open the heavy doors to get in. Lobby was packed.  Check in was fast. The ladies at check in desk were abrupt and rude to guests making enquiry about checking out and taxi booking to airport.  I was taken aback.   Room Overall comfortable. Balcony was stained and not clean... there were some dried leaves on the floor.  Air cond was making noise but quickly fixed after making a call to the service desk. Lady at service desk and the engineer who fixed the air cond were very nice.  Special mention to the daily housekeeping agent. Good job!  Breakfast  Plenty of choices. Staff were very attentive  and able to provide personalized service on the very next…

The outlook of hotel is one of the icon of Singapore. However, the rooms are very ordinary. No effort has been put in to properly maintain the rooms. It is more like a business bed & breakfast hotel. You do not feel relaxed and on vacation while staying there unless you only need a bed after your business meetings or after spending a long time in the casino. The plus side is that it is very accessible to town and there are many malls nearby.

We stayed here at MBS for my husbands birthday , the rooms are spacious , breakfast is wonderful. But Like everyone is aware the highligt is the swimming pool. The only negative I found was the lobby area as you do not expect a crowded common passage for a 5 star accomodation. One time recommended

I was lucky to spend a week here for business. The hotel is great, rooms are spacious and offer fantastic views over the Singapore skyline or the gardens and ocean, both amazing. The highlight of the hotel is the infinity pool on the roof, you're way up, swimming and relaxing with the Singapore skyline as a background - jawdropping, really. Great gym with same view as well with superstaff.

We stayed in the orchid suite for 2 nights. Great view from the room over gardens by the bay and the sea. The room looks good but is lacking on certain basics such as a place to plug in the hairdryer where you will be able see the mirror for styling purposes and sufficient hangers. In addition, for the amount charged per night, I wish the hotel could have at least given me a pillow case in good order. The one I had had several holes in it. Time to change the bed linen?   A note to mothers who are breastfeeding and may need to express and store your milk - you will have to pay for rental of a mini-fridge. The cost is nominal at $10. The in room mini-fridge can't be emptied as it will auto-charge the items removed to your room bill.  The service is business-like and lacks warmth…

I had a room on the 49th floor city view. The view was of course breathtaking, the room was very big with two doublesize beds. The infinity pool on floor 57 as well as the bar and the exploration deck were the pick of the vacation.

The main attraction is the infinity pool at the top of the hotel. It looks like a waterfall in 200m height with the city skyline as view. It has extreme opening hours from 6am to 11pm everyday. The view is stunning on the day and in the night. There is a towel concierge for new towels all the time. The pool is 150m long and there is an adult section without kids. There is additional a warm whirlpool. When I was staying there, there it was not crowded and there were no waiting times and very friendly staff. The prices of the drinks (served to your seat) are typical for such hotels (20SP$ for a coctail).  Beside the pool, there is free a gym with great view which even opens at 5am (and closes at 11pm) with hot pool, sauna and hamman.   My room was large with a great city view and…

1-star only is a harsh judgment. But the point is to attract your attention. View is magnificent and service is near perfect (we had a Club formula: waiters are just super good). These are the only good points. For the rest: it's a touristic industry. A Disney land (you'd pay 500€/night). Charmless international hotel. Getting a bit old anyway already due to intensive use I guess. You hear your neighboors receiving SMS, spitting and pissing. Swimming pool is like a lunapark. I'd rather say selfie-swimming pool. Impossible to find a couple of seats due to over-affluence. In fact we didn't even get in. Not fun to fight for a spot. You present your access card for the lift, the access to the pool, the food, well... Disneyland. Almost 3k rooms. It had to be an industry. we could…

We got in early and was just planning to leave our bags but the front desk guy cheerfully announced that a room was ready for us. That set the tone for our stay in this magnificent hotel. My only issue is the buffet breakfast. It was kinda chaotic out there which is not aligned to our overall experience of the hotel.

Nice place. Nice room. Awesome swimming pool... I loved it... I will be back.. Promise. It s the best of Singapore i ever know. This trip is unbelievable.. And for the breakfast is really good. Many kinds of food. I hope this comment can give a reason for you to visit Marina Bay Sands.

What a hotel! Stayed in a club room on the 47th floor Tower 2 with a view over the Gardens by the Bay . Beautiful room - huge bathroom with separate shower and separate  toilet room- magnificent big bath. The bed and linen were heaven to sleep in.  Club room provided full American breakfast, delicious afternoon tea and drinks in the evening (2 hours of drinks and nibbles so no need for dinner)  The infinity pool is great very crowded but there is an adults only section for those that don't like having ankle biters splashing around them. Good bar service at the pool but expensive. As a hotel guest you receive access to the Sky walk which gives expansive views over Singapore. You also receive a discount at the Art science museum. A short walk through the hotel to the Gardens by…

We loved our stay and our room was wonderful apart from the toilet getting blocked! But it was fixed straight away. We stayed on the 42nd floor with views of Gardens by the Bay from our balcony, stunning. Breakfast was included daily at The Rise restaurant which was an amazing buffet. We also treated ourselves to dinner there on a Tuesday which was Seafood night and had enormous oysters which my husband- an oyster fan said were the best he tasted. A stay at Marina Bay Sands is a holiday in itself with a casino and the most fabulous shopping malls! The staff at the hotel are so friendly and ready to assist when needed. You also get access to the Sky Infinity Pool- breathtaking! Go on treat yourselves!

One of the must visit hotel in Singapore. The hotel fully lived up to its brand and repetition. We were on a family holiday trip there and booked a Club Room with a Kings size bed. We have 2 small children and the reception upon confirming our number of guest upgraded us to the executive floor where she said they can arrange an soft bed for the children. We were absolutely delighted! Overall the hotel service are great at lobby and on Club floor. The view is magnificent on both side wether you are looking at city view or garden view at the Garden by the Bay. The world famous infinity pool is a must visit, if on a clear day, the view is absolutely fantastic! Food in restaurant and Club floor very good selection. Only the free tea buffet for Club floor member is a bit…

We had Breath taking views of the sky gardens from our room on the 4th floor,  the hotel was obviously very nice and clean, u dnt even need to go out when ur staying here..  The place has everything, the hotel is connected with a very beautiful mall called the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands. Also connected to the hotel, is an amazing theatre and a museum. And then there's the Skypark observation deck.    So do request a higher floor. And it should all be great

Staying at Marina Bay Sands Hotel is one my dreams which has come true and I believe that is of other visitors worldwide. The hotel provides you with what you wish when stay in a hotel. Around the hotels you could also find all things, from shopping center to culinary sites as well as amusement and casino. When you are to come to Singapore, I bet you should try to stay at MBS.

Marina Bay Sands is adjacent to world class  Marina Bay Gardens. The hotel with roof top pool overlooking the high rise of Singapore, is 3 towers of luxury. Large rooms overlook either the city or bay, huge reception/restaurant mall to luxuriate in air conditioned luxury, gorgeous roof top infinity pool. Marina Bay Sands has a walkway direct to the Gardens where there is a platform to view the nightly light show. No taxis needed.

Stayed with friends for 3 days 2 nights. Fantastic view and service by staff. The infinity pool, obviously is one that stands out as a plus for the stay. Shouldn't miss it. Pricey, but well worth it. If one is looking for indulgence and aome self pampering, this place, is perfect for it.

We recently stayed here when we were lucky enough to have a holiday in Singapore (my first time!!). The lifts and hallways were looking a bit banged around but I guess that's to be expected as the occupancy rate is very high indeed. The service we received was second-to-none from the moment we arrived (door held open by and business card given by one the very lovely door man on duty), checked in (we were early but received a text as soon as our room was ready), asked for information at the concierge desk and checked out. The room was very nicely appointed and I loved the way the curtains opened to reveal the amazing view when we put our door key into the slot. We had chosen a room with a garden view which was cheaper than the city view but I would thoroughly recommend doing that…

This is definitely a luxury hotel. It has everything in it from the fabulous rooms, fitness center, spa, restaurants, shops, casino, park, sky bar and my favorite infinity pool. This is a hotel like no other. It has reasonable price if you compare it to other hotels in Singapore. You will get a great view of the city day and night. It is very accessible to wherever you wanna go in Singapore. I love the 8pm light show of the hotel that is best viewed from one Fullerton side. The infinity pool will make you feel that you're on top of everything even if the building isn't the tallest in the city. I like the fact that the water isn't very deep for Asian like me. The room is spacious with a great view of the botanical garden. The bed is nothing but comfy. Looking forward to my next…

Have a very pleasant stay. Friendly,helpful and poise front office staff. Clean and elegantly setup room. The Infinity Pool meets the expectation though the air quality in the Casino can be further improved. Will definitely recommend and return for stay in future.
Superb views from this new iconic hotel - go to bar for a drink - restaurant extremely expensive - £300 for 2 courses for 2 adults and 2 kids and not particularly nice

The hotel is a masterpeice of architecture and technology , especially the Sky Park & the Infinity Pool at 56th floor .  I would suggest a better organization especially in the reception department especially during check-in & out which looks very chaotic and very rushed without that care and that warm welcome typical of 5-star luxury  Instead the front desk staff seemed very cold and inaccurate in giving all directions of a hotel so big Also there were renovations going on Sky Park which made it very uncomfortable being in the pool

i have tried at least 6 different types of rooms ranging from the very basic to the likes of the Orchid Suite. The pool, although situated at 57th flr may seemingly be breath taking is perpetually packed. many occasions I couldnt even get a place to get a tan. The staff performance overall has dropped. unless you are planning to splurge at the casino or the shoppes at the bay, there are other alternatives and definitely not so costly.

My wife and I stayed here for two nights in August. What a nice hotel and the Infinity Pool is amazing!!! The Skypark views over Singapore are wonderful! Although our room was on a low level (2nd Floor) and only had views of palm trees. All the staff are very helpful and friendly and the hotel is a sight to be seen inside and out.......

Could not recommend this hotel more, from check in with Cheryl V who immediately acknowledged it was our honeymoon and upgraded us comp to a Suite  which was out of this world with views of the Singapore skyline on one side and the gardens by the bay on the other side, The room was very nice and bathroom huge. Everyone was very polite and helpful, the swimming pool was incredible and location not too bad as well, mall attached, mrt attached, taxis easy to come by and relatively cheap, bars in reach and restaurants plentyful

Marina Bay Sands gave us a great start to our honeymoon when they upgraded us for free to a deluxe suite on the 42nd floor with amazing views over the sea and the Sky Garden. The infinity pool with is breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline is almost indescribably and the hotel itself, the huge shopping center next to it and the extravagance and size of it all is something to be experienced.

This has to be the best swimming pool in the world. Music by the pool can improve. adult pool is separated; that's a good thing. Hotel rooms are above average ad very quiet, you cant hear anything next door or hallway. We stayed at 33rd floor facing the garden.  The good thing about this hotel is you have 3 breakfast places to choose from; well 4 if you have the club access. Great service all over the property. Perfect hotel if you are in Singapore to party with a big group.

Marina Bay Sands is truly an architectural and engineering beauty. We fell in love with the building and infinity pool a few years ago and have wanted to stay at the hotel ever since. The infinity pool is as amazing as the pictures, and the rooms have wonderful views of CBD and the marina. We can't find a fault with the room, which is tastefully decorated and colour-coordinated. The bed is comfortable, and there is very good insulation; we slept like babies. The bathroom is beautiful and private. We would definitely stay at the hotel again the next time we're in Singapore.  The only downside is the quality of service, which is definitely not 5-star. The check-in was pretty slow but wasn't unbearable. The most unacceptable part of our stay was that we had to pay cover to visit…

I choose this hotel as we wanted a stopover to relax and read by a nice pool. It was so busy with hundreds of people wanting to take photos and not enough sun lounges and too many restaurants. The lifts to and from were always full and sometimes had to wait. We visited once and then decided to give it a miss as it was too stressy. Check in, we also had to wait but had a lovely friendly reception. Our room was fine with all things that we expected for this price. Check out was quick and also very friendly staff. Be careful as the mini bar has a sensor when you pick up a drink. ( but it is not a problem to get it taken off your bill) It was good to see but wouldn't stay again.

While this hotel stretched our finances, it was well worth it. From the magnificent views from our Premier room through to an amazing roof top infinity pool, this place had it all. Without a doubt five star throughout. We wanted to spoil ourselves with something special and we weren't disappointed. Additionally, the location in proximity to the Night Gardens and the river really topped it off. Very highly recommended if you can spare those extra dollars

Staying here was superb, the hotel suite was fantastic and the building is amazing. The construction that went into this thing is pretty impressive. Check in was fast as there's a separate section for suites and club rooms. There are a lot of restaurants to choose from to eat in this iconic venue, however only the two on the top level actually have a view of any kind. The more time I spent in Singapore the more I realized outdoors and views are rare compared home.  The hotel for it's size did feel very full, and you do have to book for everything and wait for service and elevators to go anywhere. It's so big I was on hold to get to house keeping for over 5 mins, definitely a first for that. Club access includes complimentary afternoon tea (cookies, and tea/coffee), evening…

The location is great, with a complex of restaurant, shopping mall and casino. The room is ok but the bed is comfortable. You might have to wait for a long line to check-in and check-out. The best part is the infinity pool which only allowed for hotel guests.

Fantastic hotel, the only drawback is the anmount of people checking in and out. The rooms are big and clean. The breakfast is amazing, you get everything from all countries. The swimmingpool at the roof is epic. The best hotel I have stayed at

My friends live in Singapore and they took me here for afternoon tea and champagne at the rooftop pool! They regularly visit but for a first timer wow just wow! This is the life and the ultimate in pampering! If you ever visit Singapore you must must go! And the designer shops are heaven! Spent 5 hours in Louis Vuitton!
Great hotel for location, rooms a little small but didn't really matter as we didn't spend much time in them.  Food was good, service very good - if possible ask for a room with a view.

The hotel looks very opulent and grand but the service is very personal and courteous. The staff are efficient and happy. We stayed in an Orchid suite and the room was beautiful and spotlessly clean. The restaurants are amazing. The hotel is accessible and the light shows are very entertaining. The infinity pool is the icing on the cake.

Stayed one night in a room on the 40th floor - Tower 3 that smelled like a bathroom. Ordered room service the next morning - which never showed up. Called but breakfast went missing. Mentioned all this upon check out - staff not really interested. Back to the Fullerton.

I took my partner here for 4 days with the plan to ask her to marry me. On day 2 i couldn't wait any longer. The level 57 infinity edge pool was the location. After a nervous swim up with the ring in my hand and one of the best views I've ever seen i popped the question and she said yes!  Our time at Marina Bay Sands feels like a dream. You pay a premium for this but the outlay was worth the experience. I'm not a 5 star hotel type of guy but im glad i did this. The whole complex has absolutely everything you need. If you didn't want to see the sights of Singapore you really wouldn't have to leave and you'd never be bored!  The pool is amazing but get a chair early as it's always packed. The view is mindblowing. It really is, dreamy, can't stop staring mindblowing!  The…

If you really wana know what it feels like being pampered, this is the place for you. Good food, loads of activities, classy amosphere, grand, and serene!!! A must visit place !!! Loved the shoppers at marina bay, almost every fav brand here welcomes your stay!!!

You can enjoy a panorama view of Singapore landscape.As a narrow long shape of the pool, is really hard to accommodate large pool of crowd.I believe this is most crowded hotel swimming in Singapore.if you don't mind to squeeze in to the pool, you may have a beautiful floating in the sky photo shot in the pool.

We were there for a conference. The facilities are great and the hotel is fairly new. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the food tastes great in general. I like the Infinity pool but it is usually crowded and the bar on the rooftop is excellent. The only issue is the check-in and check-out counter, the line is typically long. Love the room service, must check out their laksa on the in-room dining menu.

Great hotel, great location. Helpful staff, rooms adequate. A tad expensive but a pool and view to die for. So much to see and do locally. Gardens by the Bay is a must, fab light show during the evening.  Love #singapore
We stayed at the Ritz Carlton our room had an amazing view on the Marina Bay.. It is a very nice spot .

We booked a family room for our business trip, fortunately, when we arrived at the hotel for check-in they mentioned that we got a free room upgrade to suite room. The room encompasses a 1 bedroom with King size bed, bath tub, 2 t&b, sala, and pool. We got the whole group so happy during our stay in SG. Definitely one for the books!

A brilliant hotel in an amazing location, centrally located and near most of the top things to do and see in Singapore.ther is a shopping mall in basement where you can buy lot of things like watches clothes etc also there is a metro station unden the hotel. swimming pool at the top gives beautiful view  of the city.

I have never written a hotel review because I have always believed that for the most part, you get what you pay for and if you are not paying for service then you are paying for the location or convenience. My husband and I love to travel and have stayed in everything from cheap hostels in remote places to overwater bungalows on private islands. I feel like we know what to expect and are always very realistic, positive travellers. I am just so blown away that this hotel has passed as a '5 star establishment' based on everything we have seen. My first hotel review couldn't even wait until we left, I am writing it from my bed at the hotel!   The hotel has 3 towers and 3 small check in counters. We tried to find a staff member to ask which tower we should head to but couldn't find…

Getting there:  I recommend taking the MRT from Changi Airport to Bayfront stop (Circle Line). The train stops right beneath MBS mall, hotel and convention center. It's really accessible and love the convenience.  Check in:   I arrived at the peak of check in time, It was complete chaos and there were just tonnes of people all around. It was loud and noisy. Felt like a fish market. Didnt quite like the crazy check in atmosphere. I would prefer the conventional hotel environment which is more organized and personal. Our receptionist was very helpful, friendly and great though. That was a great balancing factor.  Room:  It's a basic hotel room setup. The bed is absolutely comfortable and the duvets were good. Nothing special about the rooms. Just like every other 5* hotel.  …

Our stay at Marina Bay Sands was - as our expectations accordingly - simply sensational. The hotel holds really what is promised by the appearance and the site. A gigantic 6-star complex in which everything is offered, what you can imagine, including a wonderful musical theater, a world-class casino and a shopping area and all this in a hotel. The highlight is certainly the Skydeck on the 57th floor on which provides the huge infinity pool with view of the skyline of the financial district of Singapore. There are probably not many more exclusive beach clubs as these, because hotel guests r denied access. Onlookers there are massive. The restaurants on the property are worth a visit, though expensive, but the quality is right.

PROS: A brilliant hotel in an amazing location, centrally located and near most of the top things to do and see in Singapore. So much to do and see and most things are connected to the hotel (Art Museum, Helix Bridge, Gardens etc) EXCELLENT customer service! I was in a club level room so had access to the lounge- EXCELLENT service again- catered to my vegetarian and vegan family. Infinity pool!! CONS: None!!  Highly recommend staying here. Yes might be a bit pricey compared to other hotels, but you will get so many add-ons it will be worth it!
