Taxis to Sentosa Island, Chinatown, Little India were in the $10-15 range and everything was walking distance.

MARINA BAY SAND is really place to be for bussiness travel and luxury one you can find all TOP BRAND what you need the have it.  Its really paradise for woman , SHOPPING PLCE Shop till you drop.  when you stay at marina bay sand you can free to use the sampan ride just show your room key

I'll start by saying I agree with a lot of the negative reviews here;  On entering the Hotel it's more like a shopping mall on opening sale day. The check-in process is a nightmare, I had emailed in advance as my wife was 7 months pregnant and we had travelled quite some distance and they still screwed that up. The rooms are at best OK, although my pregnant wife loved the bed for some reason. The breakfast has lots of options if you walk, queue and battle your way through.  If you have ever queued hours to travel to the top on an impressive building and then spend 15mins enjoying a view but wondering was it all worth it?  Please be assured the time to check-in, the general hustle and bustle of the hotel and the slight disorganisation is worth every second, minute and hour you…

Stayed at this hotel for two days with my husband on a business trip. The location is set apart from the rest of the city, so you are a bit of a captive to mostly overpriced stores and restaurants. The best part, of course, is the pool! No one can say this place is not spectacular in sheer over-the-toppedness. (New word!) It's Vegas-style in Singapore. Lots of lights and bells and whistles. I found it kind of chaotic and busy. If you want to shop and gamble, then this is the place for you, although you can stay somewhere better and still do those things. You will get discounts at "Marina Bay" stores and attractions if you stay here. Not a bad incentive. The rooms are good, but not great. We stayed at the Westin on the other side of the water and it was a better location and…

There is only one pick up and drop point for all the tower. As we got down we had entered huge long lobby. Totally spacious but check in counter were small as compared to people check in hotel for stay. Staff was quick and helpful. Rooms are spacious with amazing Garden By the Bay or Singapore City View. Skydeck is always full visit anytime of day. But as one of the amazing view to the city. As evening comes Skydeck is all deck for the eve with people for drinks or for pool. Only issue come is to Indian Vegetarian People as there is low option available on menu.  But one must stay there to enjoy the luxury to fullest.

It's a huge complex lots of designer stores our room was upgraded and it's very nice our view was really good especially at night we were facing the gardens this hotel is next to a main road and you can hear traffic we are in tower 2 6th. Floor getting around this place is interesting good luck with that. We have just stayed at rasa Shang gri la and our breakfast there was amazing so breakfast here was very poor in comparison considering it's more expensive but location I guess, no latte machines or personal service a lot of guests were looking and sounding disappointed too we had to pay an extra $52 for our 2 kids so glad we took them down to TOAST in mall we got them peanut butter on toast and milo x2 for $10. The pool is weird very small deck space good luck getting a lounger…

What can I say.... Where do I start!!! Singapore in itself is so advance. The hotel is fantastic, concierge service, 3 towers shoppes bars restaurants you name it they have it!!! The view from the rooms are spectacular! The lights curtains etc all controlled by remote!! Walk in shower great, lots of detail to things like USB ports around the room..   To come to marina bay sands you really don't have to go anywhere else as there is lots to do... So long as you have the MONEY!!!   Casino was my favourite- British passport holders need not pay entry fee!  Would definitely stay there again

It was a great hotel but was marred by the infinity pool access. My 12 yrs old daughter could not enter the pool as she was denied entry at the gate. We had only 2 room cards which only allowed me and wife to enter.   So what can my 12 yrs old daughter do? Gate staff said she need a room card to access as she is 12 yrs old but when I went to enquire at Front Desk, I was told to pay about $100+ per night for additional room card!!!!!  Pay that amount just to use the infinity pool ????   And now reading about Room deposit of $200 per night, I was also charged $400 immediately on my credit card but refund process takes 14 working days ???? Why does it require 14 working days ???  Most hotels I have been to take the most 2-3 working days and there is no need to call and ask. But…

As we entered the hotel, we were met with a train station like queue at the Check in counter. And there the experience started. The hotel was huge, the room was huge and the pools were huge. But all the public spaces right from the reception to the pool was crowded. Yet the hotel had a machine like efficiency to it. The service was quick and efficient.  The views from the hotel was beautiful. Bathroom was huge with separate wash, shower and toilet areas. Being a Muslim, this was a negative as there was no water in the toilet to clean ourselves after using the toilet.  The pools were beautiful but was swarming with people (at least a few hundred people at a time) by the time we went for a swim in the evening, the water had turned dirty.  Apart from the opulent ambience and the…

There is nothing much to say, its absolutely splendid and stunning. Me and my girl friends gather for a short staycation pampering ourselves once in awhile (which is a must!) overall facility is a double thumbs up. Room service will arrive very fast few minutes after you hang up the phone. Kudos to everyone!

I was initially disappointed when I was being given a room that is different from what I booked. Credit goes to the front desk officer for doing something about it and upgrading it for free as soon as she saw my discontent. The new room was just perfect. One of my favourite hotels in the world, for sure.

We decided to stay at the Marina Bay for the swimming pool of course and to celebrate our anniversary in a special place so we reserved a junior suite but when checking in, we had a wonderful surprise. : thanks to Dylan at the registration desk we were upgraded in a Sands suite : almost 150 square meters with a dining room, billiard table, terraces overlooking the gardens and the ocean. We had also access to the Marina Bay Club. Usually these places are quiet but considering the number of rooms (2 500) the Club is very big and busy but well organized with an efficient staff. The swimming pool ... amazing of course almost 150 meters long overlook the city at the 57th floor but overcrowded especially during week ends. If you are not staying with children, there is a part of the…

Where to start….. After returning to Sydney, I have not stopped speaking about Marina Bay Sands. After my feedback to my friends and family, they have all confirmed they are very interested in staying at Marina Bay Sands (MBS) in the very near future. Upon arrival by taxi, we were greeted with exceptional customer service by the MBS taxi service team. They opened the door, took our bags down and offered to take it to our room. With all the humidity, the team were still more than happy to work and were still smiling AND their professionalism never stopped. I have stayed at hotels such as Four Seasons and Sheraton (not saying these hotels aren’t great) and I have not seen such great service. Upon entry, to the hotel (we entered through Tower 1 – Main Entry) you are just held back…

We booked one night at Marina Bay Sands because we really wanted to experience the swimming pool. We have no regret, we fully enjoyed this amazing experience. At first we hesitate between Garden view or City view. We booked Garden View but we have been upgraded to City view. The view from the room is awesome. Afterthought, I would definitely recommend to take the city view. The room is very big, clean, very comfortable.  Of course, the best is the swimming pool on the rooftop. Simply amazing. One of those must-see place. You will be amazed by the view, both during the day and at night. Of course, you will have to share this experience. The swimming pool is always crowded, but it is still worth it.   I did not enjoy the club and the bar at the rooftop. Service is average,…

Two bedroom suite (Singapura) plus two normal rooms for family. Firstly the room, huge suite, lots of extras that you would expect plus the great view that MBS is famous for. Have stayed in normal rooms before but this was a completely different experience. The difference is the dedicated butler that is there to make sure that every detail is looked after. We were there for a special occasion and the two butlers were just fantastic. Every little detail was looked after and everything was so smooth - checkin to checkout.  Fantastic experience. Pool less crazy (but still busy) then last time.

I stayed in the hotel with my girlfriend for one night, although we booked the basic room we got an upgrade to a suite on the 44th floor. The whole experience in unique, not cheap for sure, but it is worth to try once in a lifetime. Amazing panorama, lavish breakfast and the infinity pool the you can access any time during your stay. A must in Singapore!

Best hotel in the world. Every view in Singapore is drawn to this hotel so staying in it was spectacular. Our view was the garden by the bay view on the 36th floor. I would recommend this side as opposed to the city side as you can see the City views from the amazing infinity pool at the top of the hotel or the gym so enjoy something different from your room with a balcony. Press the gold service button on your in room service and all your needs are answered very quickly. It has a shopping centre & casino. Definitely one worth putting on the bucket list.

Marina Bay Sands! It is my best favorite hotel that I never have seen such a beautiful scenery from pool located at 57th floor.  I could check in early in the morning because there are 2500 rooms, so huge I surprised. I go to the pool every day, the pool staff are very friendly to me.  Mango juice is good taste on the pool side.  I recommend if yoyo go to the pool early morning around 7 am is the best because it is not so crowded.  There is a show every night on 7 pm and 8:30pm. Do not miss it.  It is so wonderful.

It was my second time visit. The service level was even decreased. I had to wait at least for 30 min for everything.  We have two rooms and we found out that one of our children was playing a very dirty slipper he found under the bed after we entered room. I had to wait for 30 min to make a complain about this and when i talked about it, the receptionist asked me "what do you want me to do? with very arragant attitude.   I asked to change to room and he said he wilm change the room as same type for higher floor and asked us to pack our bags and bring them all to the first floor by ourselves.  I was speechless. I asked to change to better room as a compensation for my time and energy and he frowned and get us the room in different tower. I felt he treated me as a very troublesome…

This is the type of hotel which is far more breathtaking looking from the outside in.   The pool, bar and restaurant on the rooftop are amazing and be light show and structure take your breath away but these elements only weigh up the standard amenities and rooms within the hotel, unless you are prepared the spend thousands per night!   Nice for the experience but I would rather stay in a hotel on the marina bay to appreciate MBS from the outside.

We knew we were going to be staying in an impersonal huge hotel (2500 rooms!) so we were not expecting a great deal of service but actually the hotel pleasantly surprised us.  We were greeted very well and our cases taken off us and stored until check in later in the day very efficiently.  We checked in and all was good and we were upgraded to a better room with city views.  They provided a free bed for our son and we were not charged breakfast either for him....a nice gesture.  The check out was also efficient although I could see that at times there were large queues checking in and out.  There are a few niggles such as why aren't there any comfy chairs to hang around in in the lobby?  Why is there no milk in the rooms for tea (I had to pay $8 for some milk??).  Overall I…

We checked in to celebrate my 50th Birthday on top of the world. We went for the pool  but discovered so much else.  Everything about this place is massive. Check in which mostly happens in Tower 3 is like being in a big airport. There are two check in counters - one for their suites and one for other rooms. From about midday until 4 pm in the afternoon there is a massive queue for check in. Despite the size the whole resort is relatively simple to find your way around.  We requested a suite the faced the bay. We got way more with our lounge and bedroom facing the bay and our bathroom overlooking the gardens and the ocean - so awesome. The lounge was huge with a sitting area, four seater dining table, flat screen TV, guest toilet, desk, mini bar and Nespresso machine. The…

Was looking forward to my stay at the Marina Bay Sands. It's an iconic building to say the least. Checking in was pleasant enough as there was a line up. Locals and tourists alike were staying at this hotel which is fine. Also, tour groups from mainland China seem to dawn on this hotel too as part of their tour package I guess. The lobby was like a marketplace coupled with the crowds going to and coming from the casino.  Front desk were kinda friendly...it seemed to me like it was a put on rather from the heart. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable.....and quiet. Room amenities and toiletries were more than adequate. Had a sea facing room with the Gardens by the Bay in view as well. House keeping were efficient and pleasant, I think they are the unsung heroes of most hotels.…

We first arrived yesterday the lines were not that bad.  The people working here all seem very nice, the Hotel feels a lot like Vegas.  Very Massive, feels very loud and very expensive.  The hotel offers the club level service, not worth the extra charge, the meals at the club level were mediocre at best, the service up there seemed very lost with all the guest.  To be paying over $1k per night the service is not in alignment with the expense nor is the quality of food.  We decided to stay here only two nights as others on Trip advisor suggested not doing more than 2-3 nights, advice well taken.  We went up to he pool area, my wife forgot the Sun Screen to bring with us, we where shocked to discover hotel sells sunscreen for a HEFTY price of $50.00 Dollars, yes $50.00 dollars. …

Stayed at MBS for the 4th time and it is going to be the last! Every year the service becomes worse and worse. There was a problem with our reservation for second time and we spent 2 hours at the front desc arguing after an 18-hour flight! The management doesn`t expect people to stay for more than 2 - 3 nights and they won`t make you feel welcome again A part of the iconic sky park was under reconstruction, the infinity pool was crouded all the 14 days we were in the hotel. Although a great part of the staff were kind and helpful and breakfast, tea and drinks in the Club at 55 were good, we are not going to stay at MBS next year!

We spent three nights in Marina Bay Sands last week. The room is with a king size bed and  an extra bed for three pax. However, housekeeping only topped up all the stuffs for 2 pax. Then, I called guest service for 1 more bottle of water. She told me it was chargeable. I asked receptionist and one of the staff in lobby. They all told me 1 more water bottle was chargeable. The most important thing was I already explained clearly to them that my room was for 3 pax, but only provided us with daily necessities for 2 pax.I was really angry because I paid for 3 pax, only 2 pax of necessities were given everyday. When I checked out, I asked the receptionist again. She told me that it shouldn't be chargeable as our room was for 3 pax. I don't understand why the staff here didn't listen…

We stayed a few days on our way back to New Zealand after 8 weeks travelling. We came for the pool but enjoyed so many other features.  Check in and checkout were fast and easy as we were not a peak time. The service was very good and staff were friendly and helpful.   When we were at the pool we found the service to be very good. Vermar (I think that was his name) offered great drinks and food service by the pool and added to the pampered experience. While it was busy, we enjoyed the pool experience. Anyone wanting the pool to themselves should not be here.  Our room was very large with city views, the bathroom excellent and the whole complex very clean.  We found the heat of Singapore a little overwhelming so found it refreshing to be able to cross to a great shopping centre…

Perfect stop on way back from Europe to Australia , the view from the rooms are stunning and the pool is out of this world plus the hotel is located close to most of the main attractions. Vermar at the swimming pool was great, he gave us advice on what to eat and drink and was spot on. Even the cleaner Jia Jia was so friendly and accommodating, the staff here are world class.

The most popular place to be visited when you are in SIN. Fenomenal architecture in high construction. Good to come with family and small group. The place is clean and comfort for all travellers age. Don't forget to bring your camera to capture your memorable visit.

We spent my birthday at the Marina Bay Sands in July...the best place to have spent a birthday!!  The moment we pulled up to the hotel, it was first class service all the way. We were just overwhelmed just stepping into the hotel foyer, it's nothing like we've ever seen before that left us speechless.. We were taken to the "VIP" check in, where everything was explained to us, then offered a drink in the Lobby Bar and Lounge, before being taken up to our suite. Which was located in the 2nd tower on the 45th floor with unbelievable views.It was immaculate. That afternoon we explored the hotel's luxuries, featuring the Sky Bar, Observation Deck and  Sky Pool. That alone was worth the trip, it was mind blowing and something that we've never experienced before in any hotel. The hotel…

Booked a club room for a two day stop over. I travel a fair bit and use hotels a lot, but never stayed in such a brilliant hotel as this.   I have been in a few huge Vegas hotels, but the Marina Sands beats them all, I say this as I know they are affiliated.   From check in to check out, the concierge and the club level team, my stay was perfect.   I had a room in tower 2 on the 43 floor looking out to the harbour with the most spectacular view. Who need curtains. We breakfasted in the club lounge as well as for afternoon tea and again for canopies and drinks and can honestly say the variety and quality of food was outstanding. The staff were awesome, always remembering my name and addressing me with politeness and interest, keen to make conversation and to ask my requirements. …

I love that place! For the view, food and especially for the concierge! My husband had his b-day at the time when we arrived and concierge was really helpful in organizing the cake and candles and everything. He was even watching what my husband was doing at that time to make sure that this will be a surprise.   Definitely a good idea for accommodation!

This hotel is just a massive tourist factory. The rooms are average, food is awful and it is far too big and lacks any real luxury or personalised service. I wouldn't go back - looks good from afar but really just a big tourist attraction and not an enjoyable stay. Too many fabulous hotels in Singapore - this isn't one of them.

The Marina Bay Sands Hotel is right in the heart of Singapore if one is looking for an experience. The hotel itself is good but the views from the very top are spectacular in every direction. The pool on the top is also something to see. Alcohol is expensive but you can just have a coke and get the same amount of pleasure. The ground floor level is like a very busy railway station with literally hundreds of people milling around. Shopping great.

Alhought singapore dollar high rate now but if come to singapore must visited here, best place to shopping, and have fice star hotel, nice view, good price, have cassino area, large park, and near to go another place, i wanna go here again and again.. And this is photo me and my mother of law and sister too.

If you want the best of the best you have to pay for the best  however this would have to be the best place we stayed on our trip yet  if you want to be treated like royalty get to the Marina bay sands. This place has amazing views and service highly recommended.

Three nights in the Club with great room on 42nd floor facing the city. Service brilliant everywhere in this vast complex. Rooftop pool experience very dissapointing due to hundreds of guests all of the time. Getting a place to sit virtually impossible. No special area for Club members which was surprising. Many many guests in dressing gowns and slippers in lifts. Wet floors in lifts common. Not in line with the overall standard of MBS. Club lounge excellent in food,drinks and service. Probably needs to be larger. Not available to members at all times unlike other high end hotels. Access to casino needs passport both entering and leaving.

The Marina Bay Sands is an impressive architectural structure, sitting on an outstanding section of real estate overlooking the Singapore Financial district on one side and the outer harbor on the other side. The hotel offers sweeping views, awe inspiring internal spaces and access to some of the finest amenities that Singapore has to offer (shopping, dining, gambling, museums). Unfortunately it does go all the way to delivering the goods, and for the price paid one expects just a little more polish on the edges. The check-in/check-out process is agonizingly long and the cost of dining anywhere in the hotel is over the top. Love the view, go elsewhere in the city to spend your hard earned cash on shopping, dining and drinking.

We stayed two nights at Marina Bay sand hotel on May 23-25.2015.Well the room was nice and big but the hotel does not have an Atmosphare of a 5 Stars Hotel.I think that it is because of the Casino inside.It makes things busy and noisy like in Las Vegas.The room for  around 600 Singapore dollar does not included breakfast.So it was a bit too pricy.BUT the pool is AMAZING....well to tell the thrue we only booked this hotel because we wanted to swimm once in that amazing pool.We wont go back again unless the price will go down.

We just returned from a fantastic 3 week  holiday which included 6 nights in Singapore and 3 exquisite nights in The Club Rooms at Marina Bay Sands.   After a lot of consideration we decided to stay in a city view Club Room (2 adults and 2 kids 8 & 6). We felt the club rooms were really great value for money. We found the service was exceptional and personable. We chose a city view which we were very happy with because when you go up to the Club Rooms for breakfast, afternoon tea and canapés at night you can choose a window seat looking out to Gardens By The Bay or the city. So you end up with the best of both worlds anyway. We swapped our view each time, it was brilliant.  We found all the staff at The Club  to be exceptional, charming, personable, welcoming and professional…

We spent 6 nights at Marina Bay Sands on our Honeymoon. The service was impeccable from everyone at reception, concierge, bell desk & in room dining. We felt like royalty and like special guests.. They upgraded us from the room we had booked in tower 3 to a bigger room with a bath tub in tower 1 at no extra cost & everyday when we arrived back to our room from sight seeing we had a animal made out of towels with a happy honeymoon card. The in room dining serviceman laid your napkin on your lap, poured your coffee and always ask before doing anything. Very professional. I would definitely recommend staying there if you feel like lashing out. Be careful of the laundry service they provide, it was quite costly but our clothes came back like new and all in their own bags, ironed and…

Went there twice, stayed in premier room with city view @ 32nd floor and deluxe room with garden view @ 29th floor.  Premier Room – Twin beds @ Tower 2 - You are welcomed with fantastic Singapore city view when you opened the room door!! They are using auto opened curtain, the views is smiling to you once you opened the door - I love their bed, I do not want to leave the bed at all. It is so soft and comfortable - Their beds are big, more than super singles. And there is day bed near the window, to enjoy the day view and night view. - Had a great time in their big bathtub, and their bathroom is HUGE, one big bathtub, one big space with 2 basins, hairdryer, various of toiletries, and big mirror, 2 inner rooms inside the bathroom – stand shower and toilet  Deluxe Room – King bed @…

The most popular place to grab a drink, for good reasons-it has the best view of all the city lights and is a highly popular place in Singapore. All foreigners, visitors and expats frequent the rooftop bar which serves moderately average drinks. If you want to visit the sky view platform, you might as well just grab a drink at the rooftop bar so you don't have to pay the fee.   KailaInTheWorld.Com

if ever you want to enjoy your stay in Singapore, MBS has it all.. I often travel for one/two nights to Singapore and MBS could fulfill my every need from a relaxing room and good hospitality. Not to mention the perfect pool where you can see the best views of Singapore and a place where you can enjoy a night out with friends at Kudeta. And it also has the best food, I mean it you can find everything around this hotel from the most expensive meals to the cheap ones at the food court inside the mall connected to this hotel :)

This is the dominant building on the Singapore skyline and the top couple of floors are accessible for spectacular views over the city and surrounding seascape. You can pay s$11 to go to the viewing deck but a better option is to go to the bar on the floor above (free) and spend the money on a nice drink. Relaxed and comfortable and the service is second to none. Well worth a splurge

excellent , superb . great break fast. amazing swimming pool. suits to every group members. Members were not ready to come out from swimming pool. all enjoy a lot.  hotel is value for money. Still need to improve support staff.

Very cool!!!! Beautiful building and beautiful view from it... For visitors like me it's allowed only to visit the bow of the vessel but it's okay for first time - I checked atmosphere. Next time when I'll visit Singapore I think I take the room for a few nights for sure.

The pool has amazing view but too crowded.The room is just OK compare to the price.So easy to walk to the Helix bridge and Garden by the bay.The bridge at night is very beautiful and romantic.You can just walk pass The shoppes.

The structure is incredible, composed of 3 towers joined by a skypool on the top. the Rooms are large, clean and quiet as well as overlook stunning views of Singapore. The skypool on the top is an experience of life! Good balance between price and quality offered. Reccomend!

I have been there with my bf..We  stayed here for 3 nights.I was very happy with the room hotel, it was a great designed with a lovely furniture, and it was very clean.There are a nice breakfast...But service was just OK...a bit disappointed!!!!

The pool. What more can you say about this pool other than it looks exactly as you see it in pictures. Just stunning. But, they do make it difficult for you to get there. You cannot access the pool before you've checked in to your room or after your check out time. So really, if you're staying for 1 night, you'll only be able to swim after 3pm. The rooms are luxurious and large. The free wifi was fast, too. We had a room with a view over the Gardens by the Bay, so the view was lovely at night. Because the hotel is SO large, it can take sometimes 10 mins of walking from your room and down to the reception, even longer if you're walking to the casino or shopping centre. It was definitely an experience and am so pleased I stayed here - but the pool...this made my experience.

Perfect view from above, you can see the beach and Singapore city, enjoy the ambience and see other tourist, as well as gambling in the club. Everything in here is all about holiday and forget your routine for a while.

I stayed for 3 days and was swept off my feet. My room is facing the garden's by the bay and was so relaxing - the tranquility that you would love to find in a hotel room. The bird's eye view in the swimming pool is exhilarating, showing off the business district of Singapore and on the other side a beautifully created garden. Though the pool got very crowded, I enjoyed my days drinking while soaked in the sun. Traveling alone could be both interesting and boring at the same time but I never feel alone as the service was great and the staffs and even managers are engaging. Thumbs up for Dax and Marecon for a great customer service.  This is definitely a "must visit again" hotel. Not just a place for slumber but a total destination to go for.

My husband and I only got a chance to stay one night here. Singapore is such an amazing place and getting to sit up at the pool area and take in the views was great. I hope some day we get a chance to come back and stay longer at this hotel. It's pricy but worth every penny!

Have been to Marina Bay twice before but didn't find anything interesting beyond the normal lineup of high end name brands. But the opening of this Gordon Ramsey resto called Breadstreet made me go back. And I was happy I did. Food was fast and good, and service flawless.  Truly lived up to his name. The pork and the toffee pudding were good, and so were the rustic bread. Ambiance was great. You have the choice to sit outside and relax by the bay, or stay inside. Truly  lived up to his name. Incidentally in this visit, i found more affordable or mid- priced shops open. So my visit to Marina became more productive and worth repeating now.

This place is just amazing. The infinity pool is the best view you could ever have in Singapore.  Staff makes sure you are happy and they offer an upgrade for first time visitors. It's pricey but it worth it for the experience. If you are not a guest, you can't go to the pool.

We stopped here on the return leg of our trip to the far east. It is a hotel that is a work of art, stunning to look at and a phenominal structure. We had 2 club rooms for the one night which cost over £800.  I know that Singapore is expensive, however this place is certainly not worth that much.  The rooms were very average, not luxurious (we stayed at the Fairmont on the way out in club rooms - far nicer), the club lounge was nice, however we had to wait until a table was available as it was so busy. quality of food was OK but not excellent, just average.  The amount of people around was the killer for me - the pool (which to be truthful is the only reason why you would choose this place) is too overcrowded with very limited seating/sunbeds around the pool. it simply cant cope…

Went really for their famous infinity pool and it was well worth it. The rooms are nice and clean, we got the bay view of the merlion which was nice. Cause the hotel is so big walking around feels like you’re in a shopping mall, didn't like that. We went to Sky on 57, they had great service and the food was real good. Very romantic setting. If there was no infinity pool this is a very average hotel.   The pool is a must obviously awesome views, nice and relaxing in the Singapore heat. Make sure you go up early cause it will get busy. We went up early and by the time we were leaving it was getting pretty busy up there. Saw Richard Branson by the pool doing an interview too.

Stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for anniversary. My fiance and I were mighty impressed, especially with the gorgeous infinity pool. We spent our first afternoon by the pool, swimming and chilling, admiring the sunset. Only issue was, it does get a bit crowded! There are free drinks available.   The room was spacious and new. Especially love the bathroom; very clean and bright. We had a view of the ocean so the day view was beautiful.  Service was excellent. Conveniently located above the MRT and an easy walk to the Garden by the Bay.  Lovely stay and would definitely stay here again (for special occasions!)

I booked Marina Bay Sands Hotel in Singapore as a staycation and a gift to my parents who were both celebrating their birthdays in August. From the time of booking till we checked out, the staff were polite and accommodating all through which made the experience a very pleasant one.  We were given a room on a high floor, facing Gardens By The Bay. The views were absolutely stunning, and personally, more amazing that the views which faced the CBD (even though prices for the rooms facing the CBD were more expensive). The rooms were very clean and spacious, and there was a balcony (albeit small) that we could access. Because the staff knew that my parents were celebrating their birthdays, they were given a complimentary birthday cake, which was a very nice gesture.  The only small…

I stayed here with 2 friends in a standard room which meant we had to pay €100 for a night. The room was okay but definitely not worth €300 a night. However, the infinity pool on top was amazing! When we visited it, it wasnt so busy at all and the views are amazing.  Overall the hotel itself is overrated but for us the pool made everything!

We were in Singapore for a family holiday celebrating my husbands 60th birthday.  On a previous stop over we had decided we would stay there for one night if we ever came back just to swim in the Infinity Pool.  So we booked in for one night before the rest of our family arrived.  It was the most expensive swim I have ever paid for but worth ticking it off our bucket list.   We booked a deluxe city view room and were upgraded to a premier room so that was a bonus, the room was nearly as big as our house.  The view was to die for especially after the sun went down with all of the lights.   We decided to wait until the morning to swim in the pool as it was absolutely packed when we checked in at 6pm and right up until it closed, so we headed up there around 8am, there were a few…

I was very happy with my choice, i booked this hotel for the iconic pool on top and we were not disappointed. Everything was super: the pool, the room, the view, the service. Everything else was said already, the hotel has so many reviews. If i will travel again to Singapore i will book again this hotel

Enjoyed my second stay at this great hotel in August, three night stay before a Madive holiday. Enjoyed the grand club suite room, excellent accomodation and service all round! We had a late checkin and were surprised to receive a special birthday cake for my special lady, delivered at 10 pm at night. Reception had picked up that it was her birthday the day prior to arriving, from passport details. A very nice surprise. The hotel location, so close to the Flyer, Skygarden and other attractions is vey handy. We took in a show at MasterCard theatre and enjoyed a while in the Casino, all onsite and so easy. Marina bay sands remains my favourite Singapore hotel, club rooms are great value if you can afford the bit extra! And of course the pool, well worth a try.

My wife and I visited this hotel for 5 nights.  It is an amazing structure, both beautiful and useful.  The pool on the 57th floor is a sight to see in itself.  We stayed on the 48th floor and the view of the sea was wonderful.  The room was always very clean.  It is large but not huge.  I'd say more normal.  The breakfast buffet was great, but very crowded.  Lunch and dinner were good but not anything to go out of your way to do.  It is in a great location and city busses take you everywhere.

located at the city center,hotel has a very nice pool with great view of the city..  walking distance to some of the attractions like garden by the bay and just across the harbour bay front. since the hotel is so big expect to be so busy and crowded everywhere around the lobby, pool area and restaurant too.  over all it a great experience to stay here and a bit expensive.

We had a family weekend escape in Singapore and purposely chose this hotel for its iconic rooftop infinity pool. The pool didn't let us down with spectacular views. However, the pool is slightly too small for the amount of guests that this hotel can host.  Check in and check out process is very fast, rooms are nice and big. One thing that isn't quite work out for us was our room keys are constantly not working and we had to wait for someone to open the door for us each day when we return to the hotel.

I just don't know where to start! We had to fly back via Singapore and booked 2 nights at this hotel as it looked so amazing. We weren't disappointed, it more than lived up to expectations and price. We booked a club room and ended up on the 44th floor with an amazing floor to ceiling view of the skyline which was amazing. The room was huge, with an enormous bathroom with a free standing bath and separate huge shower and 2 sinks. The bed was huge and comfortable and we had a sofa and armchair too. Check in was immediate with a dedicated check in line, and Alice on the desk was super helpful and friendly. We ate at the buffet restaurant Rise, which had excellent choices and quality, again with superb service from the staff. The pool was a slight disappointment as it was crowded…

When i went there, exchange rate was 2.8 plus per SG dollar. Place was great but unfortunately haven for expats and foreigners only. My SG friends told me they never like going there because of overpricing for everything. With 3 plus per SG dollar today, its no wonder my fellow malaysians not going to its casino anymore and business no longer good like last time. Overall, still a great place 4 walking and window shopping with family.

We stayed for a night from England to experience the Infinity Pool, as my son and I are both swimmers.   1) Visitng at 4.30pm: We went to observe the pool first without swimming. The pool was packed. It was difficult to move around. It wouldn't have been an enjoyable swim.  2) Visiting at 7.30am: The following day, we got to the pool early and the pool was much peaceful. We managed to swim for a few lengths before the crowd with selfie sticks and cameras started to arrrive.   3) Behaviour: It was interesting to swim on the rooftop, yet you need to learn to avoid bumping into people. A lot of people in the water were not swimmers. Some of them were rather loud or too enthusiastic with their selfies.   4) Water clarity: The water was cloudy.  5) Hotel Image: Many people would wear…

Marina Bay is definitely one of the best hotels in the world. The moment you enter the hotel, you're in complete awe of the enormous property. The infinity pool is worth dying for and the casino is one of the biggest you'll ever see! Fantastic experience!

The hotel is crowded, long queue everywhere. Staffs are rude and a lot of restriction even for hotel guest. Hotel service worst than 3 star rated hotel. Definitely don't live up to 5 star hotel level! Restaurants are pack with people, minimum spending even on accompanied children. Not family oriented, obviously not children friendly. restriction even at the swimming pool, what kind of 5 star hotel on world they are living on?

Had an incredible and memorable one night staycation with my family at MBS for birthday celebration. The service was impeccable right from the moment we reached the hotel, check in till check out. It was a great experience staying in MBS.  We booked the Orchid Suite. We requested for an early check-in, a high floor room, king-sized bed and a non-smoking room and I was very pleased that all my requests were acceded to. We were also allowed to check out by 12noon the next day instead of the usual 11am, which gave us more time to enjoy breakfast and admire the amazing city skyline. A complimentary birthday cake was placed on the room's dining table, which I thought was a sweet gesture from the hotel staffs. We got to see the astonishing view of Singapore's skyline from our hotel…

Surprisingly, the pool size is much smaller than what i expected from the pictures. The property is huge and ceiling at lobby area is endless. We went out a night for the famous chili crabs, taxies are expensive, but they are mercedes.

A wonderful staycation for X'mas celebration just that it's a bit pricy.   The whole setting of the room is just cozy in class. Good for family stay as well as couple. Excellent location, you have shopping centres all around.  We booked two Deluxe rooms and got a connected one too. Four of us with two king size beds.  The room that i had had a couch and a wonderful view of the Gardens by the Bay. Big TV, bathroom was big too. They even had the usb point for your phone beside your bed.  The infinity pool was crowded as usual. We spent hours up there despite the weather was gloomy. The view was just good and best if you went during August period during Singapore National Day, splendid view of the fireworks as well as the aerial display. No kidding on this.  It's a must go stay…

My wife and I stayed here during a 3-day stopover on our way back from France. While the wait for check in was only about 5 minutes, the process itself took about 10 minutes since they claimed our room had not been pre-paid by our travel agent. The onus was put on me to contact my agent and have her contact the hotel, resulting in time wasted sending/receiving emails and talking to the front desk during out stay. The hotel had received the payment a month before we checked in.  Regardless we were given a wonderful room with great views. The hotel and shopping area is so huge you need a map to find your way around but walking throughout the complex is an experience in itself. Drink and food is very expensive but the food hall had dishes for under $10. The infinity pool is amazing…

Great service and views. Reasonably prices considering the location and room that we had.   Pool gets very crowded, which I guess is to be expected. We had breakfast included - largest buffet I think I have ever seen! Huge variety of foods from all over the world.  Room was lovely and well kept. View of the bay from our window was awesome (especially at night). Bathroom was gorgeous,  with a large shower and freestanding bath.  Would definitely stay there again!

We stayed for one just night in the cheaper type of rooms. It was simply amazing.   The room was huge, with and living room separated from the dormitory. The bathroom had both shower and bath.  The room had a long balcony along the dormitory and the living room with amazing views towards the Garden Bay.  The swimming-pool was fantastic. The views are the best of the city, specially at night. It opens from 6 am to 11pm, so you can make the most of your time of your stay. The swimming pool is big enough to not feel crowdy  The hotel is connected directly to the metro station and to a large shopping mall.  The staff was nice and helpful  Don´t lose the chance to stay in Marina Bay Sands if you are in Singapore. In spite of being expensive it is an unforgetable experience. Highly…
Another must visit place. The tickets though a bit expensive for the Marina Bay Hotel, but worth the money

When we first stepped into this hotel, we were amazed by the scale of this hotel, but also annoyed by the crowd and noise in the lobby. The check-in process took longer than we expected (about half an hour). Like everybody else, we enjoyed the swimming pool and the amazing city view it offers, it is beautiful both at night and day with distinct tastes of Singapore skyline. However, there are certain things we found inconvenient in our room, such as the shower, there is only one rain forest type of shower head which gave us some trouble when our 3 year old kid took the shower, this type of shower is not suitable for very young children. Basically this hotel is more for adults. Maybe it's because it is the summer vacation time when we stayed, the breakfast area was full of people,…

Decided to treat ourselves after two months backpacking. The room was everything you expect for the money but at the end of the day it all about the pool which lived up to the hype, coulda spent days just sitting up at the edge and at the bar drinking and eating.

Since it has been a landmark in Singapore, it has been flooded with tourist especially during SG50 period. The hotel still able to maintain its high standard of efficient check in/out service, valet parking and room cleanliness. The pool was packed with tourist during our stay.

My now husband and I stayed here the night we got engaged last September, and couldn't have wished for a better setting for such an occasion. We chose one one of the club rooms (not a suite) and it was definitely worth paying extra for. The room itself was enormous, with views (from the floor to ceiling windows) overlooking the entire city skyline, and it's own dressing room area. Included in our room was afternoon tea in the club house, and cocktail and canapé hour in the evening. The food was delicious, and there was so much that we could have gone the entire day without eating any meals! The staff couldn't do enough to help us, and we're all so friendly. The next morning we also had breakfast included, again in the club house on the top floor, and this was also great. We made…

Its worth spending so much for the sheer pleasure of its magnificent pool. The room is nothing extraordinary and is pretty decent. Service is excellent. The hotel building itself is an architectural marvel and the best view of the hotel is offered from right across at the Gardens by the Bay. If possible, ask for a garden view room. For a city view, its much better to try out the Singapore Flyer.

This is the only hotel where you will see people roaming in bath robes. Because this is only about the pool...and its awesome. ..take the city view cause when you walk in the room and the curtains open you see the city with a full window view...tht s when you realise you are in a magnificent place...when you sleep keep the window shades open cause when you awake you will see the city. The rooms are massive and they also give you an extra bed. The bed is wonderdul and so is the spacious bathroom. The mall and the food court below are massive and have some good options.  The check in and check out was smooth.  Beware of the photo con at the pool...expensive but good clicks... We stayed for nearly a whole day in the pool and it was worth it..... This is an experience that one…

My Family (Mum, Dad and daughters 4 and 8), stayed here for two nights, after the weekend of Singapore's 50th Birthday Jubilee. There was a queue to check in, waited about 15. When we'd checked in the room keys are 'old school' credit card type, not that it's a big deal and the checkin assistant did comment that the system was being upgraded. When we entered the room we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the overall bathroom and room, although the fitout and décor was nothing flash, or that you wouldn't expect from a lesser star or older hotel. Our room faced the city which made for magnificent views out to the city and front row seat to the nightly 10-15min laser show over the lake, but I can't image the garden views would be bad either. The rooftop pool has amazing…

Room was luxurious, everything was perfect! The pool and upstairs area were indescribable - I could not recommend this more. Absolutely beautiful! If you're in Singapore, spend at LEAST one night here! Oh, and the free WiFi was about 50mbps download - insane!

I stayed with a friend at Marina Bay Sands for a week in early July. From Check In to Check out, the experience was one of the best.  Our room was on the 51st floor facing the city, and it was an amazing view.    The room was huge, had an Orchid Suite, with separate living, bathroom and bedroom. The rooms were very clean, the bed was very comfy, the space was great.  Enjoyed a number of facilities at the hotel, and all were a great experience. Especially the rooftop pool, an amazing pool, so don't forget your camera for some perfect pictures.  Breakfast on the 52nd floor of tower two was brilliant, loved the choice of food. The staff were excellent, and Ramana was amazing, she went out of her way to help get tickets for us to the movies, and suggest places to visit, such a great…

Apart from the pool, the main drawcard and reason why we booked this hotel, overall it was a disappointing hotel stay which was a shame as it was also a birthday celebration stay. It was also disappointing to discover the pool are was being renovated (as well as some floors it seemed) and the 360 views promised were not available. Room rate discounts or at least notification pre/upon booking would have been helpful at the very least. The staff are unhelpful offering conflicting information, if not rude as were many of the hotel guests but that itself could be because of the way staff treated you. We had a club suite but then found out we couldn't use the club room for some reason...our keycards informed the staff at the counter of this.  Many times we were told conflicting…

well - the best part of the property is the Sky Park in the day Swimming pool at the top  in the evening and night Sky Park bar at the night Of course - the hotel Casino is must go. Rooms are OK Service is OK Stay once is recommended

I just love their swimming pool :) "Infinity pool".  It is situated at the last floor( 57th floor) and you are just afraid not to fall down because it is so high and you can see there the amazing landscapes of the luxury city. There are also a very big shopping centre with luxury brands :)

I stayed here for one night.. I originally booked a garden view room but the staff suggested that the city view is better so I moved to a room in the 37th floor. I should say the view and service is well worth the money.. The skydeck and the infinity pool are amazing but it gets pretty crowded at times. The light show at night is a must see. It's free and it goes for about 15-30 minutes... The hotel it self has few fancy restaurants but if you want something casual walk to the shopping centre next door which has a massive foodcourt with amazing food.

My husband I stayed here back in June on our Honeymoon and we cannot reccommend it enough! We opted for a Grand Club Room with a city view and it was definitely worth the extra money as the views of the marina and city at both day and night are brilliant! Our main attraction to Marina Bay Sandas was the skypark and it certainly was not a letdown - if staying here, make sure you use this facility both day and night as it is a completely different experience!  I have to say that the breakfast I had while at Marina Bay has to be up there with one of the best breakfasts I've ever had - such a great selection of foods on the buffet plus a good choice of dishes from the menu too, the French toast is by far the BEST french toast I have ever tasted! Looking forward to returning one day,…

The intent of our stay was to relax for four days before returning to Austarlia. The infinite pool, sun and bar looked amazing on the internet. Unfortunately the pool was overcrowded during open to close times which wasn't at all relaxing. If you are looking for a place close to the city that is reasonably priced it's not this place. The room was great. The prices for food and drinks was over the top.

Well, there's no doubt this hotel is special but one look from that pool and the experience is even more jawdropping. Dusk is amazing as all the building lights start to come on.  The breakfast buffet downstairs is also excellent and caters for every need.  My only criticism, albeit minor, is that sometimes there was a fair queue for the lifts, otherwise the stay was perfect.

Our 1 night stay was such a treat which we had really saved for. We were able to check in early which was fantastic and the check in procedure was smooth despite quite a big queue. Our room on the 33rd floor has a beautiful view over the Gardens. The room was huge and had a gorgeous bathroom.   My only negative about this hotel would be the swimming pool. It was seriously overcrowded with many children in the adult only area despite being asked to leave by life guards. I was disappointed about this due to the amount we had paid for the night as I didn't feel it had a very exclusive feel.

The hotel is nice when you can come up at the top floor, else, it is boring and expensive and too many outsider tourists. We stayed for three nights and booked for executive room and since our flight was delayed, we got a room in 2nd floor which is very disappointing, with no view rather than a busy road outside the window. The sink doesn't work, so we have to call at 2 a.m to fix the clogged sink and the toilet is not working properly as well, the water runs continuously even after you have flushed

The room was warm and comfy, service was good, albeit they did become a bit sloppy sometimes. the best part was the view from the infinity pool at the sky terrace! the casino access and privileges were good. We had some room service and food was decent.

I didnt stay in the hotel personally but for my relatives instead.  Booked e premier room garden view and was allocated room on 34th floor facing gardens by the bay - spectacular view of the garden as well as the surrounding.  Very spacious room.  Spacious bathroom has both bathtub as well as standing shower. As the Kids went to the pools at 3 different timings - wasnt so crowded even though it was on weekends (as compared to my first visit!).  The garden and city view from the cafe near to the pool is spectacular too!    Early and online booking gets you a much more cheaper price (if you miss it, that's it! thats my experience :( ) will book again only if i can get better rate - not worth to pay S$1000over for one night stay!

Its an amazing View with great photo opportunities but beware anyone that thinks you can get close to the Infinity Swimming Pool as you will need a telescopic lense. The only way to get close is to be a guest in the Hotel. They take your photo before you go up in the surprisingly smooth & incredibly fast elevator then superimpose them onto views of the whole area Very nice but not cheap.

We came to the hotel for one night! It was very busy with a longish que to check into the room! And you had to check out at 11 which I think is quite early! Although after speaking to the lady on the desk who was very helpful, told us we could check out at 12!  The view from the pool is incredible!! We paid a little extra for a city view in our room which was definitely worth it!!  The gym is awesome and was extremely quiet when we went! Also the sauna and hot pool are worth a visit too!  I wish we could have had more time there to relax and enjoy all the facilities but I guess we will just have to come back again soon!   Definitely made our visit to Singapore a memorable one!  The light show was amazing! We watched it from a boat in the bay! Incredible!!  Thank youuuu

Beautiful hotel but a little overcrowded especially the pool, it is beautiful especially the night view but don't think about swimming in the pool, we can barely walk across to take picture. Room is clean and has luxury linen and towels. One of the best customer service.

Nice place! Modern design and very cozy. A complete set to spent a night. Very nice pool and great view, especially during the night. It's a good place if you are a cityscape photographer and best city lights view during the blue hour, golden hour or during the night.

After six stays at MBS our seventh stay still held nice surprises. This time we were welcomed warmly by the Premier Services department where Miki, Jeraldine and the team made our stay delightful. Of course, the hotel is already wonderful with its stunning rooftop pool that we have brought our baby daughters too time and time again.

Spent a fantastic three nights here with three teenage kids who LOVED the rooftop infinity pool. Even after 72 hours (most of it spent up there) you can't tire of the spectacular view particularly as night falls and that gobsmacking panorama becomes an awesome skyscraper light show. You do jostle for position in the pool and on the terrace for space around this time. On occasions it felt every single occupant of the three towers had relocated to the roof complete with selfie sticks and go pros.....Still who can blame them! The rest of the hotel is pretty staple city centre five star with large bedrooms, nice showers and wall to floor windows. The whole feel in the hotel is similar to an upmarket Las Vegas resort with themed celebrity endorsed restaurants and huge communal areas.…

I was excited to go back to Singapore after a long hiatus. Last time I was in Singapore was 2008 and I stayed at Mandarin Oriental, Marina Bay Sands was just a dream then...I guess it should have just stayed that way. I really wanted to stay at the Marina Bay Sands because of the pool area and bevy of restaurants in the connected mall and casino area. I was very disappointed. The arrival was like coming to a poorly planned airport, chaos and no organization for traffic. You enter through an anonymous glass facade to be greeted by an equally massive void space with no clear wayfinding on how to check-in! We had club rooms so there was a separate checking, but we were not told nor was there clear signs! So we waited in a long line to check in. Got to our room, granted it was big,…

Marina bay is basically an area & a five star hotel..An amazing scenic view from the top of the sky park..Pool view is also superb..You can see Marina bay almost from all places in singapore..A heart of the city..

I was been in Sinapore in november and I stayed in this amazing hotel! It's the biggest hotel when I was been! Very smart, very beautiful, with very large and open space!  The room was ok, very nice, maybe too expensive for this kind of room.  The bathroom maybe was better!  The best place it's the big pool on the top, you can go there and have relax behind pool, or inside the hydromassage!  Very good experience, amazing view of Singapore!

I emailed the hotel before we arrived to let them know that my GF was having her birthday the day we arrived and was hoping for a cake or something a bit more special for her (as if the hotel wasnt special enough already). The hotel said a cake wouldnt be a problem and we would have it when we got to our room. We checked in at about 9:00am as I had a busy day planned but no room was ready at the time, no issue, we left our bags and went out for the day. We came back at about 4:00pm and the concierge walked straight to us without either of us saying a word, he then escorted us to the VIP check in which I thought was a nice touch for the GF's birthday. The VIP receptionist then kindly informed us that due to the circumstances and a previous stay the hotel had upgraded up to a…

The architecture of the building invites every visitor to this place.. Moreover the view it provides from the Skybar of the Gardens By the Bay, Singapore Flyer, the F1 circuit and the city is mesmerizing.. The place gets all the more interesting after sunset with the lights taking the control of the skyline

I booked for a night in MBS's Orchid Suite. From the time, i arrived that had service staff to bring my baggage to the room while i checked in. The check-in staff was very polite and friendly; after finding out i had friends from overseas who would be staying with me, she upgraded me to a marina suite (1 size bigger). The room was significantly bigger and much more spaceous than the original room i had booked. It had a nice overview of sea which was beautiful at night. My foreign friends also felt the same way. They loved the skypark and how the hotel is connected to the shopping centres [Shoppes] and shared that if they ever came back to Singapore, they would definitely come back here [MBS].  Overall, the facilities were good. The staff were friendly and responsive. The room…

Room and service was very good, but for the price that you pay, they could throw in a few extras like mini bar or breakfast. Most people book this hotel for the fact it is the only way to access the infinity pool. Which to be honest wasn't the leanest pool I have been in.

My husband and I stayed at Marina Bay Sands during a part of our honeymoon in June 2015. Of course the reason we came was for the rooftop infinity pool and that was honestly the best part of the hotel. In Instagram pictures, they don't tell you that the hotel is a huge convention center and houses 2,500 rooms. They were at almost full occupancy when we were there, so let's multiply each room by two (outliers being single persons and families of 3-4) and say we and 6,000 other people were there at the same time.  Breakfast was included in our room rate, so on the first morning we went down to the restaurant Rise; there's a huge line. We understand it's for table control and so it's not a complete mad-house, but still, a line to sit for breakfast. Going through the buffet was…

we stayed jsut for one night so just to have exess to the infinity pool and just to try it out.  Our view was towards the "Gardnes by the bay" in floor 34 or so can't remmeber it exat, but it was very high up.  The rooms are nice and tidy, the minibar is filled up to the brim and the serice is top notch but... Everything is a lot pricier (Well ,duh) then elsewhere in Singapore. We stayed for 4 days in one hotel and kept this one for the final day of the trip. The service was similar if not identical (regarding room service and the menu available) yet here the prices were ~0.5-1.5 times higher.   Of course, it is a luxury hotel and a very modern one at that. Despite it costing 1/3 o the price of a 4 day stay in a different hotel, it is worth it. Believe me. The pool, the service,…

Got upgraded to a high floor executive suite with a city view. It was the biggest hotel room I have every stayed in full stop. I could have played football in the room it was so large. It had an amazing view of the city and it was just a few floors below from the pool deck and so was very convenient. The pool is amazing...fantastic views and good resort feel....although it is very busy. Breakfast was included and we had it at the restaurant on the pool deck which had great views too. Plenty of food options but we tended to go to the food court or shopping centre close by. Convenient for gardens by the Bay. Great area for a walk or jog around the marina.

Obviously this is one of the most iconic hotels in the world. The architecture and the design of the hotel is super cool.   At the end of the day, however, you feel like you are in a zoo. There are so many people everywhere that it takes the enjoyment out of it.   We had 2 rooms with access to the club level. Rooms were super nice with great views.   The pool is certainly worth the visit. However, they have construction going on and so there is so little area to use. Additionally they run you through the lower bowels of the place to get to the pool.   Service is just OK. It is not that it is bad, but for the money you pay you would think it would be a lot better. Not personalized at all. Even the club level is really like eating in a regular restaurant. Nothing special.  …

Marina Bay Sands Hotel is hugh and linked to the conference and casino complex. Checkin staff were helpful. We had to wait for our room to be ready but they were quite effiicent. The rooms are spacious with good view of the new garden and Singapore Bay. The roof top pool is impressive but can get crowded. The views are impressive and most people want to take selfies in the pool with their smartphone. So maybe worthwhile to consider a waterproof case in case of accident?

This hotel/casino/shopping mall is a beautiful site to see even if you're not looking to shop or gamble. The building is beautiful and there are many yummy restaurants for all price ranges. Stores are on the pricier side, but worth a look. The casino is well managed and makes for a fun night.

Marina Bay Sands it is a wonderful hotel. Its a big complex with shopping, casino and celebrities chef restaurants. Check in was quick and i could get my room about 12pm. We stay in Orchid Suite, the suite was very spacious and amazing view Garden by the Bay, the decor the room is just average, nothing like wow. The amenities bathroom its really cheap quality, for the price u pay for a suite, you should expected great amenities. The bed was nice and comfortable. The room is clean and good job daily housekeeping. They gave us a nice complementary cake and strawberry chocolate because was my partner birthday, very nice! The breakfast was very good with good selection. The hotel have a amazing gym with incredible views. The pool is amazing, such beautiful view from Singapore, a…

This hotel has its reputation as a landmark hotel. Yes, it is a great design and an engineeringmasterpiece with an awesome pool, but the hotel, shoppes, casino are average when compared to other resort, hotel casino combinations around the world. I stayed in Tower one in a Premier Room. Upon entering the room I discovered housekeeping were still in the room and were disconnectiong an ozone machine from the power point - not really the start I was looking for, then whilst unpacking I noticed that blinds kept openong and shutting by temselves and contacted customer service who said they would send someone up. 45 mins late after two additional calls they finally decided to attend. Time may not be precious to them, but it is for me. Then whilst  continuing to unpack I noticed that…

Room, amenities, infinity pool and everything else is fantastic!. Service was like a 6 star. Chocolate bar was amazingly good. The sights of the bay when in the infinity pool provided an aerial view of the amazing skyline. The weather was hot but the lush water and spa provided a real relief. The shops within this area was also packed with great stores and shops. MRT was just a stone throw to other nearby eatery if needed. Concierge was a tremendous help in guiding us to other places.. must go... Bugis Junction... the hustle and bustle and not too far away from here.

We stayed in August 14th for a few days with my 8 year old daughter.  Pros - Pool on the SKypark 57 th Awesome Staff -  Exceptional they were all professional, prompt, courteous, friendly and very helpful first class all the way. Room- fantastic with a fantastic view we were on the 42 floor our bed was comfy, plenty of storage, bathroom fantastic with all the amenities one would require. TV- lots of channels  Ce LA Vi bar- SKypark 57 floor - food was absolutely delicious pricey as you would expect it to be as it is a 5 Star hotel but I was happy to pay because the snack bar menu was delicious. Try the waygu beef pizza Omg it was so good 27 dollars yes pricey but you won't regret it. Also the calamari yum yum yum...I could have eaten the entire snack bar menu because everything…

This hotel is definitely worth the price. The rooms are huge, we appointed with awesome views. Service is exception and of course the highlight is the Skypark and swimming pool which can only be accessed by hotel guests.

MBS delivered on 'something for everyone' for food, shopping and entertainment, especially for well heeled visitors. It even has an ice skating rink but no takers, an art and science museum and an artificial canal for short rides on a small 'gondola'. I made the rounds of designers' stores with my visiting ladies friends whilst the men played at the poker tables in the casino. I thought that we finished off the MBS trip with a quick visit to the famed pool at the Skypark on 57th floor. We didn't because of $23 fee per person (there were 4 of us) - shouldn't casino guests' family members/ friends be given a pass to go up there while they were at the casino?

Everything is fantastic. Quite pricey but worth every moment staying here. The i nfinity pool is a must-go in marina bay sands..it feels like you're swimming in the air..the room is superb and the centralized aircon is pretty really cool and the bed is worth sleeping for after a long walk in the city..

Just fabulous . The swimming pool is good and the views are to die for . Its worthwhile to pay for club privileges because the food is excellent. After reading the mixed views , we were a bit unsure , but it was amazing . Location is good and being in the shopping mall its a great way to spend time . My kids want to go again !!!

We visited this hotel because spectacular swimming pool and really interesting building. Pool is full every operation hrs,lot of very noisy and no well behavior small chinese choldren/teenegares! Check-in/check-out cery quickly and really profesional,staff very friendly a d helpfull,very attention to our children. Some parts of room was screthed. Room service perfect.

We love the pool - we hate the guests with over 2,000 rooms the only pool is way too small the hotel is living of the hype of the structure consider - the hotel was built by a casino chain so nothing else matters - unless you smoke and gamble - stay somewhere else  However the staff are amazing

It is a different luxurt hotel. You should experience the pool at the top. Very nice scenery from the room. Ask always a higher floor room. You have a chance to see world class celebrities around. Very big rooms. Breakfast is rich. You should try.

I have been to this hotel before and found I had a really good visit. This time me and my partner visited the sky bar for a few drinks while we watched the sun set.  Customer service was good. Make sure you dress smart. Costs were high but what do you expect. It does get quite busy here. We arrived at 7pm and left just before 8pm to watch the light show.  We will return.

Most people came for the world famous infinite pool and I'm not the odd one out. The view from the pool is amazing undoubtedly. Everyone will love the pool and I really think it is one of the most lovely pool worldwide. Since it is so famous, the pool might be operated exceed its designed capacity. The water quality was quite poor on the day I visited (Summer weekdays). Management should take serious monitoring about the water quality. Besides its lovely pool, the room facilities are also important to the hotel. I arrived at 11 a.m. and the check-in has not yet open. I stored the luggages in the store room. Their safe storing service is very nice. They will send all your baggages to your room after you check-in at the front desk. You don't need reclaim the baggages at the…

Excellent hotel. NO need to explain it. You don't need to Orchard or other areas in SIngapore. Shopping center is next to the hotel and casino is also there. All rooms are clean and neat. You can see the garden or marlion from your room. At night, the garden is illuminated and it's so beaitiful. It's nice for couples.

What more can be said - it has incredible views in the day, and at night is jaw dropping with a spectacular display of lights around the bay from other buildings. I have been to Time Square at night but this is by far the most fantastic place to visit. If you get the opportunity to go when a Formula 1 race is on the night street circuit it is out of this world. Even if you don't have an interest in motor sport it will be an experience that you will never forget. Singapore bay in the night is one for everyone's 'Bucket list' you must go !!!!

Amazing hotel you have to experience if you are in Singapore. Of course the pool at the roof top is the main attraction but not only. You are close to a shopping mall, the famous gardens at the bay, the casino, inside shops, laser shows during the evening, ...etc... On top of that we got a very spacious room around the 40th floor with a stunning view on the city. Unforgettable moments.

This was second time round staying here, although this place was still completely as incredible as the first, I have to lower the rating as there are a few gripes (especially for people who don’t like crowds).  For many people the main lure to this hotel is undoubtedly the infinity pool, however, it seemed extra busy (it was coming up to Singapore National day, so can understand to a certain point), the pool was way too overcrowded compared to our last stay there and was hardly any space to move around, you couldn't get a sunbed near the main pool, We literally had to wait until it started raining! It is probably better to go here off peak season when it should be a lot quieter.  There were also some signs saying one of the Jacuzzi's was for "Adults only" but was swamped with…

Out of my 5 day stay at Singapore, I stayed here for 2 nights, just to experience all the hype of staying at Marina Bay Sands! The entrance and the reception is rather congested and not well organised. You need to stand in long queues before you are attended. However, everything apart from that is just magnificent ! The stay makes you feel like you're experiencing something special. The staff is very courteous. And well, the infinity pool.. It's worth every penny you spend at the hotel !! Recommended for a at least a couple of nights on your visit to Singapore.

Wow the scale of this hotel is incredible. It is massive and easy to get disorientated & lost. The pool and executive lounge on the roof is really cool and our suite was beautiful, spacious & had brilliant views. Connection to the shopping centre which gives you extra dining options was great, plus the casino but we did not go in there. In a way the hotel is kind of too big which made it feel impersonal compared with other luxury hotels. They messed up the check-in booking for our travelling companions which delayed us getting into our rooms for 2 hours, but to their credit gave us free drinks and a late check-out on departure which was good service and calmed the frustration. Is it worth the money?? I think we will try somewhere else a little more cosy next time.

this property is simply out of the world.. its gorgeous!! the staff is very courteous and helpful.. all amenities are easily available.. the food is delicious and the best part about the hotel is the swimming pool.. had an excellent experience!!

I was on a Sout-East-Asia trip with my brother and we started off our route with a weekend in Singapore.  The MBS was a choice we made mostly due to the spectacular rooftop and iconic location at the Singapore Bay. The room was of average size compared with other hotels of the same standard. Cleanliness was good - as well as room service and in-room facilities. However, not really outstanding and therefore rated rather average for a hotel of the standard and pricing.  The rooftop with its unique infinity pool overlooking the bay and absolutely stunning view is worth the visit alone. Hotel guests can use it for free - outside visitors have to pay (at least this was the case at the time of our travel). There are 2 restaurants at each end of the rooftop - both with very good food…

This is the hotel you must stay at, at least once in your life, just to tick it off from your bucket list. The building is absolutely fantastic, you can see it pretty much from everywhere you go in Singapore. The hotel itself is too big, the line for the check-in/ check- out is almost like the airport's security line. If you ask me if it's a good value for the money - no. Room rate is expensive, the breakfast is not included, the mini-fridge is on sensors - means you can't remove anything without ending up paying for that, not even to put your bottle of water to cool off. The pool is great, the view and everything. Water in it is pretty cold, I guess so people wouldn't hang out in it for too long. Don't forget your selfie-stick! Otherwise you will be the only one without it ;).…

Checked in but our room was not ready yet but the front desk staff gave me and my boyfriend an upgrade instead!! The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We were only able to stay 2 nights as it was expensive for us but totally worth it!! It's a once in a lifetime experience for us. The infinity pool was incredible as it looks over the Singapore skyline, absolutely beautiful!! Will definitely go back if I have the money!!

Admittedly, I had received a complimentary upgrade but this hotel was fantastic. It has class written all over it and boasts outstanding views of Singapore. The service was exceptional and the rooms were first-class. I'd stay there every time if I could afford it! The big tip is to get to the pool early, otherwise it can be quite crowded. Also, try to check in early, as sometimes this is granted.

True it is a special hotel. The swimming pool is astonishing but that's all you have for that price. Make you wonder does it worth around 400 USD. I visited twice in the hotel and every time I come there is a queue of 20 min to check in and their hospitality is cool and feels like mass production. Never had a nice simile person helping me. So if you really want the experience I would recommend to check in for 1 night and the rest in a hotel like the Park Royal which is in the same price you get an amazing hotel with breakfast and amazing pool.

Amazing location! The pool was amazing too! Bell service and staff were excellent. Can't wait to go back! We are planning again by March 2016! The staff were all professional looking, very friendly and accommodating.

We stayed here as part of a package for the world stamp exhibition (7 days, 6 nights). The hotel staff were super-friendly and helpful in all aspects. You could not ask for better service. The hotel is impressive - the nicest part is the infinity pool on the roof, although it is very crowded most of the time (best time to swim is 6-8 am). The rooms themselves are only fair - no microwave, no place on the fridge to store food, no table convenient for two people to eat at. Certainly not what I'd consider 5-star.  But don't come here for the shopping. Prices in the mall are out of sight. $22 for a pint of ice cream. $60 for a simple hat. Breakfast a minimum of $30 (from the room servive menu - $46). Then there are the Rolex and other expensive stores. I guess if you're a…

Stayed on few occassions. Once it was Mid Autumn Festival and we had a room that faced Gardens by the Bay. Walked over using the connecting bridge to see the beautiful lanterns on display. Great experience. The service staff was friendly and prompt. Breakfast at Sky 57 was great. Love the view, great service and amazing food. One of the best hotel breakfasts.   Other ocassions we stayed like duing National Day or New Year's Eve, we could see the fireworks from our room which had a city view.
