We had 2 nights at the Marina Bay Sands on the 40th floor, with club benefits.  It was a lovely luxury and well worth paying the extra for the club benefits.  It is a huge busy hotel, so don't expect to go there for peace and quiet.  The staff are great and you are very well cared for.

We stayed there one night during a stop over in Dubai on our way to Bali. This building is a dream of architecture and this pool on top is its diamond. If you pass by Singapore you should go there for one or two nights. I wouldn't stay for a longer period because I couldn't afford it but once in your life you must stay there and swim in this incredible pool. Tips: try to get a room on higher floor. Marina view is stunning. On top floor by the pool, you have plenty of possibilities for breakfast/lunch/dinner at reasonable price and quality, with a stunning view.

Stayed in 4369 a Orchard Suite with City View.   Unbelievable view at night particularly and from the bathroom a lovely view of the harbour & gardens.    Lounge area and bedroom separate which was nice.  Bathroom beautiful with separate shower room and separate toilet. Powder room with toilet at entrance of suite.   Very spacious.  Bed comfortable and express guest services I couldn't fault with regard to luggage and printing of documents etc.   The Club Lounge has delightful views and food was delicious and fresh. All staff efficient and attentive.  Skypark has amazing views but the highlight is the pool! Wow!   Adults only area and plenty of towels and beds for All.   Views are breathtaking.  Enjoyed our stay at Marina Bay Sands.  Would definitely return!

Stayed the hotel during the 50th anniversary of Singapore. ..We didn't expect that it'll be chaotic and mad city. However, checked in was hassle free and quick enough were taken into our humble room.  Feeling giddy to try the pool the following day but left dismayed to see that travellers used the pool like a toilet. Saw more mono pad ladies on the pool. No chance you can swim. We give it a missed on the first day. Unbearable to see some guest walking around the lobby wearing their robe.  In terms of bar..ce la vi was spot on... The rest of the hotel staff and services were ace.

We stayed here for our final night in Singapore in December 2013.  Note that there were two check-in points for the hotel regarding which tower you're staying in. Regardless of the number of check-ins, the queue for check-in can get quite long.   Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. We had the city-view which was beautiful at night. Wifi was fast and free. Did not dined at any restaurant at MBS as I'd rather try local food from local joints.   We were given a card for pool access. There were too many people using the pool for photo opportunity than swimming itself, but if soaking in the water and taking in the twinkling lights of Singapore cityscape under the night sky is your thing then be my guest as that's what I was doing!  Great hotel, the hotel also allowed us to…

Im not sure whether I would stay here for a long period. But would definitely recommend even just a 1 night stay to swim in the infinity pool.  You have to be a hotel guest to be able to get to the pool area.  Service is smooth for such a large hotel and with so many guests it never felt it was crowded.  Close to Underground station and Mall.

Excellent hotel staff. The moment my husband and I stepped into the hotel, a staff met us and took over our luggage. All the staff we encountered were outstandingly professional , spoke good English and extremely well-mannered. Two thumbs-up! We had an early check-in at noon and late check-out too. My premier room was good too other than the less than impressive toiletries.  Because the hotel does not have an enclosed private lobby of its own - the lobby is an open public space - it can make you feel like you are in the middle of a fun fair or a fish market. The infinity pool , which was the main reason why I chose the hotel to staycate, was many light years from infinity. We could barely move more than 5 m uninterrupted each time we were in it because of the unimaginable crowd…

Having stayed at many hotels before, this has been one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The customer service is impeccable, with en eye to every detail. Not to mention the facilities were wonderful. Although, finding a sun lounger by the rooftop infinity pool proves to be quite a challenge!  For this mother daughter trip, we stayed in a Twin Premier room (Tower 2). The room was very comfortable, not much different to other five star hotels. However what truly struck me, was how the staff always went above and beyond. It was quite unfortunate that my mother fell ill on this trip and the staff were attentive and catered to our every need. This level of professionalism we experienced (is lacking in this day and age) and it is so refreshing to see such high quality in of customer…

Was here in conjunction with a world stamp expo.  I wish I had read the reviews on trip advisor first.  It is very very overpriced.  Even at the convention rate we got for $500/night for 6 nights.  Fancy schmancy.  Couldn't believe it when they wanted to charge an extra $30.00 for breakfast for a second person in the room .  And then instead of allowing us to eat in a real restaurant in the hotel where the breakfast was much better, better choices, fresh eggs cooked as you wish, nice fresh fruit, they delegated us to a function room in the convention center, where things were reheated in pans as if you were eating in a Holiday Inn Express restaurant (actually that was better).  Absolutely disgusting, in my opinion they ripped off the organizers of the exhibition, and therefore…

Hotel is very good.. Rooms are superb...We have booked 5 rooms and all allotted on different floor !!!! There is no system, that you can stay with your friends, even if you have booked much in advance !!!  Lobby is much much crowded... NO PLACE TO SEAT WHILE CHECK IN !!! There were no proper information while check in that, where can be the Vegetarian breakfast?  Breakfast was superb at RISE restaurant.  Staff co-operative with smile.  There are lot of attraction nearby and also few in same premises..But is is massive...Sky pool is superb but again big crowd.  They should keep some area in Lobby reserved for hotel guest only...

Only stayed for one night because of a stop over. Hotel was super busy and people everywhere  (the whole hotel was booked out) but staff were still friendly and attentive.   Room was spacious with large rooms overlooking the quay and city. Comfy bed and pillows. Ensuite was large and had a separate toilet and free standing bath  Infinity pool was a tiny let down. Only because it was so full and no chairs were available but the drinks attendant was so lovely he saw a chair available and reserved it for us. There was also construction on the top floor but did not impact the use of the pool. Sunset was lovely and the water was a great temperature.  Loads of dining options but be aware food & drinks are not cheap. Im guessing there markets close by to get a cheap meal.  Would…

I have to be honest that i just choose this hotel because of the most famous swimmingpool on the world - guess what - im glad i did! maybe during the day its not so amazing like my imagination before i got there (i thought the swimmingpool is bigger then in reality), but during the evening, when the sun goes down, and sky getting black its really impressive! the city lights looks just amazing! u feel like u are in right moment in right place - and this is the feeling i enjoyed a lot. Delicious drinks! Location is just awesome, hotel is connected to huge shopping centre, u can find there whatever u like. Nice rooms, high standards, huge, with a lot of free space, u can feel very comfortable, like home. Definitely i advise u to go - even just for swimmingool!

If you're not staying at the Marina Bay, you can still access the sky deck to take in the amazing views of singapore. BUT that's all you can do. There is no pool access and the snackbar at the top is rather disappointing. However if you're in singapore it's worth going up there in the evening, the views are breathtaking

Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Marina 2 weeks ago, below is what I thought of the hotel;  Location: Great location, 1 minute walk to the shopping centre where the MRT can be caught too. The shopping centre has lots of restaurants to choose from including a food hall area with lots of little street food style available. There is also a few mini supermarkets to pick up essentials from like water.  The Hotel : Check- in is a mammoth operation, the check in area is super busy and can take at least 30 mins. This isn't necessary the hotels fault as they do have at least 12 people on check in, it is purely down to the size and popularity of the hotel. They do provide  seating in this area so that is always an option. Check-in is meant to be 2pm but we were advised to go back at 12…

Celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at MBS. What a great place to spend some quality time with the one you love. Fantastic hotel at a great location. Definitely worth while spending a bit extra for a club room with city views. High enough to enjoy in-room dining with fantastic views behind the floor to ceiling window.

With 2500 rooms fully booked, a lobby full of rubber necks and non guest visitors, it is easy to excuse a lack of personal service.  I have read a number of mixed reviews in the MBS and I can certainly see why people might complain but it is what it is.... a bloody massive hotel/casino/shopping complex.  So, if you want to stay somewhere for a peace and quite and have people kissing your behind this is NOT the place, but if you want to be in the thick of a thriving hub and dont get to precious about a lack of personal service this is the place to be  The rooms are huge, the pool is busy as hell and the drinks and food is expensive but it is a cool place and plenty to keep you occupied!  In my opinion the staff do their absolute best to please but are being torn all over the…

We know our review (especially in English so I will post it in Chinese too) will have almost no impact on this Hotel but we needed to write it on the hope that we ‘save’ someone from what we experienced.  Our stay was horrible. Bad service, rude staff and rookie mistakes. Countless mistakes with our keys (key cards) not working. From the moment we checked in we got to the rooms (we had adjoining rooms) and only one set of keys worked. The staff went to change the keys but took such a long time we didn’t wait. Again we had issue with the keys not working in the elevators. No, we weren't storing the keys next to a cell phone which one of your staff members suggested the 3rd time we got them 'reprogrammed'. Since we visited the reception several times and handed over key card we…

The hotel is really awesome. Huge and with a very beatiful design. It is a must to visit it but that's all. Don't stay there.  I spent three days early August 2015 in a Club Room with my wife and my two kids The first surprise was the reception. I arrived around 20.00 and I found around 30 people waiting to make the check in. After 20 minutes, I made the check in and We arrived to the room. I was expecting something really amazing and I found a small room with just one bed for four people. I call to the reception and they told me "We are sorry but we are completely full". I had to go to the reception and spent 60 minutes discussing with different people, finally they gave us a room with two beds.  The rest of the stay was ok. The Club Lounge is great (there is not a lot of…

Well located in the Marina Bay area, this hotel reminds you of the big Vegas hotels. If you're looking for a boutique/intimate setting this is not for you. Our room was big and comfortable, but overall the hotel is too much. The roof top pool was freezing cold and overcrowded. If you must stay here, take your picture in the pool and go to other, better options in Singapore.

nice view....everything you want for shopping is there.If you love for photograph, don't mist the sunset on 57 ... Stayed one night   50 th. celebrate  in singapore  amazing view of skyline on city view. I will never fortget.

My wife and I stayed here for several nights on our honeymoon in June, 2015. Although quite expensive, it truly is a spectacular hotel with amazing views and fantastic shopping, restaurants, activities nearby.  The room was spacious, clean and well-appointed. The staff was simply amazing. Since we were staying in the club level rooms we had daily breakfast in the club lounge. Everyone there was friendly, kind and extremely professional.  They have an amazing chocolate buffet which I think was one of the highlights for my wife -- I think I might have gone into a chocolate coma. We also had a surprise cake compliments of the staff to congratulate us on our honeymoon - a wonderful touch.  Concierge was knowledgeable and friendly and helped guide us as well as book restaurants,…

My stay a this hotel was quite an experience, the hotel is so big that you need a map to know where things are. I stayed at the executive floor in tower two, great views, the room very spacious and well presented, and all necessary things that you need were provided. The b/fast is good, buffet with lots of choices and plentiful. The infinity pool is a must, the only bad part is always very full, the chairs seems to be always mysteriously occupied with towels... Also seems that the majority of people only want to take selfies... The positive thing is there is a part of the pool that is adults only which is good. The gym facilities are adequate, and the showers equipped with all necessary. Staff is mostly friendly and useful. The building itself is quite impressive, and there are…

I rated this a 5/5 because it is spectacular. I can't say anything that hasn't been said already. If you've seen the photo's and you want to add it to your collection then you have to do it. I stayed one night and it is what it is - AWESOME. check in sucks tho as you have to line up for ages but after that it's so good. the rooms are brand new still and the view is heaven. All the amenities rock and rooftop bar is as good as it looks and the casino is cool. At the end of the day you just want to get all those photo's and say you've done it so just do it. Then the next day stay somewhere just as good for half the price.

Choosing to stay here on a business trip was a wise move.  The hotel is amazing and has so much to offer.  Aside from heading out to business meetings, you really don't need to ever leave the comfort of the hotel to enjoy your trip.  The rooms are extremely comfortable with views that can't be beat.  You'll be in one of three towers that are all topped by the Marina Bay Sands Skypark that spans the top of all three towers in the shape of a ship.  With an affinity pool and bar, you will definitely want to make a visit to the top to see it.  Bring your room key or you won't get in.  The views are incredible from the top.  The Casino, shops, and tons of restaurants are connected to the hotel via an underground walk way.  So many options you could spend a week here and not get…

Took my mum here during my second visit. She was very impressed. We had a free room upgrade which I expected as I booked two very expensive rooms. It has amazing views but being a popular hotel it's getting far too crowded which I guess can't be avoided but it has put me off from visiting in the future. Far too many girls in the pool taking up space with their millionth selfie.

Amazing Singapore! Yes!  definitely worth every penny. A clean city, relaxing and breathtaking sceneries all over. One of the countries I would definitely visit all over again and again and again... Singapore = never ending surprises...  I love SG!

I've stayed in this hotel 3 times during my visits and the latest stay in May was the worst of them all. My first stay was in 2010 when the hotel was just opened which was really nice. The service was excellent. My second stay was 2014 and it was still ok. However throughout the years, I had noticed that the service is declining. The lobby has become really noisy and crowded. The room is not properly clean and the room service just take forever to arrive. I think they might be understaff but given how much they charge for room per night, I would really expect a lot more from them.

Was a dream to visit & managed too. The room / suite are well decorated, bright & spacious. A trip to the sky pool is a must. soak into the breeze & view with a Singapore sling on hand. The buffet is generous & rich for choices.

I went yesterday to Marina Bay Sands, Beautiful place where we can buy intl.luxury brands of all things.  But, If you are looking for traditional local food, you can find for affordable prices. Try it!!!!

My wife and I stayed at MBS for two nights in April 2015. It certainly lives up to its name of being Singapore’s most iconic luxury hotel and this is unmistakably matched by a big price tag. Well, I guess it was after all worthwhile as what we got were some unforgettable experiences. The suite we stayed in was more than spacious for two adults and its gold-themed furnishing really made us feel like Kings. And of course, the Skypark and the Infinity Pool added more to the sentiment by offering you stunning and unrivalled views of the Singapore city skyline.   In terms of accessibility, MBS is located just above the Bayfront MRT Station and a lot of amenities and tourist attractions are just within reach. To name a few, Gardens by the Bay, Marina Barrage, Singapore Flyer and the…

Yes, it's busy.  Yes, it's expensive.  But the views are breathtaking.  Everything is new.  The shops can keep you busy for a week if that's your bag.  Otherwise there are more than enough things to do within walking distance.  The canal boats come right up to the hotel.  And the pool at the top ... man-made wonder.

I must say the hotel looks awesome from a far...very cool architecture and must be the most photographed hotel in the world! Inside, it feels a little like a big impersonal hotel a la Las Vegas. The 56th floor Infinity pool has an amazing view and is gorgeous and looks exactly as photographed on website except it is PACKED from 8 am until late. Getting a chair poolside can be a challenge, and the pool is really crowded with tourists and selfie sticks. Excellent idea to have an Adult Only section although the poor lifeguard was constantly blowing whistle to get the errant kid out. The roof bars and restaurants shared the view and Happy Hour was very pleasant. Service was good and impressive considering the size of the hotel, and I liked location close to sites, restaurants,…

The view from our room facing the city is to die for.  It was worth the price.  The room is huge with a glass window from ceiling to floor.  We kept the curtains opened all the time.  No visitor can enter the elevator without the guest so an added plus to security.  Infinity pool was great but can use a little shade.  Best to go there early morning or late afternoon. Will be back there and book a room facing the Gardens by the Bay for a different feel.

We recommend staying in this place just for an experience and not for your entire visit in Singapore as it would cost you. The room that we got was nice with a balcony and a view but it was not totally stunning. The shower took a long time to warm that I almost had a very cold shower (not so 5 star at all). As my husband and I were celebrating our anniversary we were welcomed with a dainty plate of chocolates but it was incomparable to the way the Jumeirah Group pamper their guests when celebrating special moments. I particularly requested for a few simple arrangements upon booking but they just ignored it and was not even aware so it had me thinking they were not attentive to the request of their guests.  Overall, we cannot take away from this hotel what we had enjoyed. From…

Yes it can be busy in reception and at the pool, but this is an iconic hotel. It is in a great location and the view from both the pool and our room (36th floor city view) were amazing. Being in the pool on the 57th floor for the SG50 celebrations were a memory that will live for ever as we could nearly touch the planes and fireworks. Both check in and check out wee completed within ten minutes of arriving in reception as there are multiple staff on hand both to take care of luggage and process your room. All staff are very helpful and make you feel special. Bayfront MTR station adjoins the hotel so good transport links, and also large shopping centre (although majority are luxury brand shops and never seem to have any customers) Would happily stay again

The Hotel is great; so many amenities. Walking distance to malls and shops. Pedestrian crossing to assist with movement. Pool is  amazing; right on the rooftop. Restaurants on the roof top as well as on the ground floor. Room service available. Rooms are large and very clean. Very helpful staff. Large array of food  selection for breakfast. Very large space to accommodate people for breakfast. The entire hotel is always bustling with activities. When you first get in there; you wonder; why so many people? This place is so crowded! But then once you settle in; it's a nice place to be.   The Hotel building itself is a masterpiece; quite impressive but then I later discovered that most Singaporean buildings are all amazing skyscrapers. It seems what they lack in terms of land…

Almost rooftop cocktails. Sat in cocktail bar, one floor above observation deck. Worth every penny ( dollar!). For the same cost as a visit to the observation deck and sky walk you can sit and relax with a cocktail and meet fellow travellers. We sat with some lovely ladies from Hamburg who were stating a Mid East cruise from Singapore. Had a wonder around the hotel - people watching at it's best!

The only reason I actually enjoyed my stay at the MBS was because I was upgraded from their standard room to an Orchid Suite, which included a living room, 2 balconies and a view on both sides of the hotel. Other than that, the hotel felt much more like a resort and not like a luxury hotel, which one would expect considering their prices.  Most people are going to go to the MBS for the pool, and I will tell you now, it is really NOT THAT WORTH IT. The pool is always, and I mean always (from the 6 AM opening to 11 PM closing) completely packed with people and their expensive cameras. It is nearly impossible to get a lounge chair anywhere in the pool area and you will have little to no space to do anything but perhaps sit along the wall of the pool and look at the city, which is…

Stayed here with my mum and sister for one night. We arrived around 12noon and checked in early, the receptionist upgraded our room as she had said because we were only staying one night, we could make the most of our time there and allow us an early (and late) check in/out. That was very nice. Our room had one king bed, and a sofa bed for the third person. I found that a bit odd that a hotel such as this one weren't able to provide us with at least a proper single bed, for the third adult. Nevertheless, we werent going to waste any time and went dtraight to the pool. Amazing pool, best pool ever. Cocktails at the bar were delicious, and having an 'adults only' section of the pool was ingenious. I was slightly humoured when the lifeguard would kick any children out of that…

Amazing amazing amazing! This place is definitely getting my 5 star rating. To swim in the infinity pool was on my bucket list and decided to stay for 2 nights as well with a friend in a twin room. The pool was freezing haha (doh!) but the views and atmosphere are amazing. The beds are super comfy with luxury linen and pillows we had the the best night sleep.  Highly highly recommend and will definitely stay again if I get the chance.

This is one of the greatest experience I've ever done! Our Culb-Room was at level 40 with a overwhelming view to the city! Fantastic! The room itself was very big and clean. Everything was there. The club upgrade includes coffee and beverages (snacks) at the club restaurant at level 55. Again, a great view either to the City or Ocean. The staff was very friendly and obliging. Big choice of tasty dishes.   If you miss the infinity pool at level 57, you missed something in your life!

The highlight of this hotel is definitely the infinity pool - simply gorgeous views, even for a Singaporean like me. Needless to say, a lot of my time during my 3D2N staycation was spent inside the pool!  Prior to my stay, I was told that the pool is usually too crowded to swim, but it wasn't too bad during my visit. Of the three sections, one is for adults only and the lifeguards do pay attention to any children who get into this section and would beckon them to the other sections. I was able to swim some laps without disturbance. Over at the two Jacuzzis though, although one is for adults only, there were no lifeguards to enforce this and we often found the jacuzzis packed with children who shouldn't be there but are shrieking and yelling and affecting the other guests'…
its a must visit place...!!!...its like newyork. amazing view of skyline of singapore . fabulous marina bay sands building

The pool in the roof with views over Singapore skyline is breathtaking. I recommend it go there either at last or first hour to avoid overcrowding. The room, even if it´s well equipped, is nothing astounding. Except in the case that you usually move in this range of prices for hotels, I would say that a single night is enough to experience what the hotel has to offer to you…

I travel to Singapore a lot, and prefer to have a room in a hotel with a harbour view, and of the Marina Bay sands; a spectacular structure.  However, a visit to MBS allows you to enjoy the infinity pool, etc. This is worth a visit. At night, the rooftop bar Ce La Vi (formerly Ku de Ta)  allows a night time view with a drink.  The check-in was swift, the room was ready when we arrived (check-in time is usually 3 pm) and while check-out is at 11 am, we were given 1 pm.  We had a premium city view room which was large, well equipped, and allows for a nice view of the Marina Bay area.

Visited the hotel with a lot of anticipation and excitement, because of everything I heard and read about it...but after leaving the hotel I must admit that the hotel wasn't worth a visit!   When we arrived, I felt like arriving on Changi Airport...nobody opened the door and didn't help us with our luggage until we called them...no sign of friendliness and politeness...check-in was like standing in the queue at the airport and the check-in process was fast, so that the next one come to check-in...no sign of a warm welcome...  Our city view room was huge and the view to the city was amazing! Such as the infinity pool which was fabulous! But those were the only positive aspects of the hotel...  The breakfast in the morning was directly next to the reception, so you couldn't eat in…

Stay in the hotel with my parents in May 2015. Booked a room with city-view. They thoroughly enjoy the stay here. Especially the buffet breakfast, the city view from the room and and the infinite pool . They are impressed by lobby and the shopping mall as well.

Stayed in a Grand Club Room which was amazingly fitted out, spacious and the views from both the balcony and the bathroom were breathtaking. The infinity pool was as spectacular as photos I had seen, and the food at The Club was delicious. Check-in was professionally and efficiently handled despite the crowds in the foyer. Excellent location to shops and sights. This stay cost more than our usual budget for accommodation but it was the last leg of a 5 week trip to France, and it was a decadent way to finish off the holiday. I felt very spoilt and it is a stay I will never fortget.

The room is over priced, we were told we would get a bathtub but when we arrived we had no bathtub in the bathroom, we called to change room but hotel was full. Amazing infinity pool and city view but i think that is all you pay for. I have stayed in nicer rooms before for a much cheaper price. Was an amazing experience but wouldn't pay to stay again. Excellent wifi and bed..good location. very clean and tidy and convenient.

On the way back from Maldives, we stopped in Singapore for the two days.  Pro: 1. Rooftop Pool for hotel guests only 2. Good location (subway was located right next to the hotel)  Con: 1. Expensive 2. Buffet (it's was not all you can eat style. Appetizer and desserts were unlimited. But  You only could select 2 main dishes) 3. Too crowded hotel

Stayed for a weekend but I had the time to enjoy all the facilities the hotel can provide. The room was fantastic with views over the bay. The service was OK but nothing to remark, I expected more. Conveniently located next to malls , restaurants and well communicated with transport. If you like keep yourself on fit, do not hesitate visiting the gym with its first class equipment. But the cherry on the top is without any doubt, the infinite swimming pool with stunning views on the rooftop. It really made my stay worthy

Was there for a night stay to watch the national day fireworks. Very fast check-in and out despite the crowd. Room was roomy with a stunning view facing the Marina float. Bathroom was huge, however there was no lock in both the toilet and shower room. Not a problem for us though. Great shopping just opposite the hotel. Overall, great stay!

We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and were very impressed with everything. Given the size and number of people it can accommodate the check in was very swift with the staff being welcoming and friendly. Our bags were brought to our room.  We were in a standard room in the third tower. The room was spacious, clean, very comfortable and had all the amenities expected. We were in a twin room so it had two separate beds. These were slightly bigger than a single but smaller than a double. In the bathroom there was only a shower.  The pool area does get busy which is expected but there is still space and we always managed to find a sun lounger. There is an adults only section too. The view is great. There are also two jacuzzis which are lovely, so hot. One is adults only.  There…

My visit to Marina Bay Sands has to be one of the most iconic experiences ever. The property doesn't need any introduction with its world class facilities. Guests who arrive early, are greeted with an access to the Gym/Shower/Pool area. You can get fresh out there, sit by the pool and enjoy the restaurant or even take a dip in the pool. The infinity pool has its own charm during either side of the morning or evening.   MBS is centrally connected to SMRT and you can actually get down to all the nearby places using that.

Spectacular Hotel, stayed at the presidential suite and the video was amazing. This hotel left nothing out and if you like to gamble, the casino is first class.  If your scheduling ahead, be sure to book Ramseys restaurant. I was sad not to get in but Hide Yamamotos made up for it in spades.   The hotel's roof with its infinity pool overlooking downtown Singapore, what can I say other than it was the best rooftop I've been to, wow.  Location, shopping, restaurants, transportation all in one place, outstanding stay

After paying over the odds and expecting a good experience our check-in started with staff being confused on what tower we were staying in.  After 30mins of deliberating they finally decided on Tower 3 however once we were in the room we had to call the cleaners up to wipe down the sides (juice marks) and spruce up the bathroom from the previous guest.  We only had a one night stay and a short period in the hotel but our bubble was burst from the check in.  The views were great but expected more for the money

Although massive hotels like Marina Bay Sands aren't my favorite, I had this one on my bucketlist ever since it opened a couple of years ago. Sure, the price for two nights of almost a $1000 SPD wasn't something my wallet agreed upon, but the rooftop pool, great gym and ditto room made it all worth while. Also, although check-in time was from 3.00pm onwards, our room was already available at 11.15am, which saved us from wandering the streets of Singapore as hobos for a few hours. Great Service!  Again, if you're not in to massive, busy, large-scale hotels Marina Bay Sands might not be something for you. But if you want a short, once in a lifetime experience, it's well worth the money!

An iconic hotel, made popular by social media and good photographers for its architectural design and the rooftop pool. The service is average, whereby the outlets are overly pricey comparable to other 5* properties in this category. Certainly good for one night stay for the experience only. The quality of the breakfast on the rooftop restaurant is amazing, whereby the dinner in the same place is not recommendable.

My travelling companions and I loved this spot. The Marina Bay Hotel is out of this world. The swimming pool on the roof was crowded, but we made the best of it. We had lunch in the adjoining restaurant, which was Devine. All in all, I would highly reccomend staying there, or just going to the restaurant for lunch or supper.

The facilities are endless and rooms are very nice.  The staff still manage to give a personal service despite the size of the hotel and complex.  Any issues we had were resolved positively and on the whole it was a good experience.

i stayed here a few years ago, so I am sure that things have changed since then, but I will give you my opinion on it.  I think first of all it is iconic to Singapore, so I felt we had to stay at least one time while we lived in there.  My wife was pregnant when we arrived and our room did not have a bathtub which she wanted.  The front desk was nice enough to upgrade us to a suite room at no charge which had a tub in it.  Going to the swimming pool on the roof felt like being a fish in an aquarium.  They let tourists up there, so it was hard to relax with tons of people always coming in huge groups taking tons of pics.  I am not sure if this is the case now, but it was when we went.  The other bad thing about it is that since the hotel stays at such a high occupancy rate, the…

This is easily one of my favourite hotels of all time! From the moment we entered MBS we were treated very, very well. We stayed in the cheapest room possible and it was amazing. The room was very modern and BIG, I really liked our bathroom which also had all the cosmetic supplies you could need. We had a straight view over the Gardens by the Bay and watching the show from high above (57th floor) was pretty amazing.  We didn't have breakfast here, but the food and drinks by the pool were great! We did have dinner at the Ce La Vie on the rooftop, food was good but pricey. It was also a bit disappointing that every customer had to spend at least  80 SGD on foods and drinks to be allowed to eat there. So I would recommend you to go downtown for dinner. As a backpacker, I must also…

First, the hotel must be inundated with gate-crashers because the staff seem to only be there only to keep people out.  Anywhere you go, you will be encountered by unfriendly staff demanding to see a room key.  Each person must hold a room card key too, even children!  Don't bring enough room cards and you'll be sent back to your room to look for the key.  Go to the pool -- show a card.  Gym -- where's your card (I was asked three times!).  But when you need a snack or a drink, the staff are invisible.    Secondly, the pool is the only thing about the hotel that makes it worth going.  If you have the right amount of room cards and can get past their staff, then you can get up there and appreciate the pool, for all of five minutes.  Once the novelty wears off, you then have to…

After doing our research, we had very high expectations for this hotel as the last stop in our honeymoon! Upon arrival, they did upgrade us to a larger room with city views which were just magnificent. I would recommend staying here for one reason, the infinity pool on the roof is an experience like no other. However expect no privacy whatsoever. It is packed. Even on weekdays, there were people everywhere. Chairs with some shade are very few, and if you are as pale as myself, you will burn very quickly under the hot Singapore sun!!!! It is a great location to visit the gardens by the bay, and the attached shopping centre was also a great place to shop. The light show was also amazing, a must see!

We decided to stay here one night at the end of a cruise before returning to Europe.  We really wanted to experience the pool at the top.  The hotel is huge and is confusing and a bit of a circus in the lobby with different check in and check out locations depending on the room type, etc. We asked for an early check in and were not able to do so.  Nonetheless, it was after 3 PM before our check in was available.  We asked for and offered to pay for a late check out and were only granted one extra hour.  The hotel was booked solid, and it is very much like a large convention hotel in terms of the traffic of people.  It does not feel like a resort. The pool at the top is heavily guarded and they check keys and only allow one person per key.  Which is a good thing since many…

If you ever go to Singapore, this is the place to go. Not because it is the best hotel I've ever been to, but because of the view and the gorgeous infinity pool. When the doors of the elevator open on the 57th floor, you just won't believe your eyes.   The downside is the size of the hotel: it is huge. And I mean really huge. If you like peace and quiet, this is not your ideal place. The whole complex is always full of people, and the hall looks like a giant mall. Breakfast was OK, but nothing special compared to other luxury hotels, apart from having to queue to get a seat.   Also, the subway is really close so you can get to anywhere real quick.

I've been staying at this hotel for my business trip and I choose it as it is the landmark of Singapore. As a matter of fact you can only use the infinity pool if you are a guest. Obviously the view is amazing, the pool is wonderful, a little too cold and you can't really swim as there are lots of people taking pictures. The room was big and comfortable, but there was nothing special about it. Conveniently localised between the garden and the mall, everything is beautiful and close by, but awfully overpriced. And I mean the hotel, the restaurants, the clubs, the mall...but I guess it is just Singapore. It will be a one time experience in my life, next time I return I'll choose another hotel for sure.

My second visit to the MBS hotel. I must say that it is much better maintained than those hotels in RWS . Which was absolutely run down when I went for a second visit about two years after their opening. MBS rooms are still pretty new and nice. The mall is extremely big . And there are of course a lot of attractions nearby. The stay is good, but it is expensive. From hotel to food to parking to even bottled water. I guess that is expected , and for me it's a once in a while visit. So I would say that is fine. But expensive still.

beautiful view over the city from the infinity pool. Good and friendly staff and no children are off-limits from other side of the pool, which is nice when u only wnat to relax and enjoy yourself. Can only say the view and service everywhere is great.

This is the epitome of hotels!  As you walk into the main lobby at Tower 1 (a total of 3 towers), you are greeted by a huge, bright and airy atrium.  There are dance and orchestral performances held at the atrium during the day.  Also in the atrium is a lounge and their buffet restaurant, The Rise.  There are 2 check-in areas at this hotel.  One located at Tower 1 and the other at Tower 3.  Elevators in Tower 1 and Tower 3 will conveniently take you up to the Skypark on the 57th floor.  If you lived at Tower 2, you'll have to change to a different set of elevators in order to get there.  One of the drawbacks we've seen is that the floors of the elevators that serve the Skypark are usually wet and, sometimes, with black marks because of swimmers that take the elevators back to…

Nice view of the Singapore Central Business District area specially at their infinity pool but too cold for me. Try a dip @night specially on Saturday you can see some fountains and light show... the rooms are ok. Everything ia controlled on your tv and you can checkout without going to the lobby...

On arrival to the hotel we stood in the queue to check-in. A man came up to us and informed us that we could check-in in the other queue as we were staying in a 'Club' room. When we got to the Club & Suites queue the woman behind the desk literally RAN around the desk to us. To which she proceeded in saying "Can I help you?", my Fiancé replied "Yes, we would like to check in" to which she said "I'm sorry this is only Club and Suite room check in's." We were absolutely flabbergasted! How dreadful of her to assume that we could not afford a Club room.  This hotel booking and the whole day was a surprise to myself as my boyfriend had just literally proposed to me not an hour before. If we weren't on such a high we probably would have confronted her there and then.  When we told her…

I was on a raymond business conference from 2nd to 5th aug,the pool is worth every penny,though food(indian) and service is average. Tip - must go to the pool at night open till 11 pm also the jacuzzi is awesome.

This hotel is top end of luxury. Definitely has the Wow factor. If you stay you must visit the infinity pool at the top of the hotel shaped like a curved ship. Views don't come any better than this both day and night.  It's location is perfect close to the Palisades and the wheel and the artificial gardens.

It was definitively the hotel with the best view I ever stay. Of course that the way you enjoy the view is very personal, you can enjoy viewing mountains, sea or the man creation. In this particular case, being on the pool at the top of the 57th floor and see the whole city "down" when you are on the swimming pool was just great. The service is very good and the rooms confortable.

Wonderful place to stay,nice view....everything you want for shopping is there,so ya just jump in the shopping mall to spend your money,hahahaha....moment of joy that will never be forget how we spend our time together no matter in or out of Singapore....

Rooms, service, ambience, location are all absolutely top drawer.  You won't be disappointed.  Make sure you eat meals on the top floors both dinner and breakfast.  It will be a little expensive, but quality and variety is great.

If this hotel didnt have the pool it would be worthless. The Lobby is not welcoming, the staff are friendly but have so many people to cater for i felt our stay was somewhat unwelcoming.   The rooms are nice we overlooked the gardens, which you can see the light show from. Bit disappointed that our room didnt have a bath tub.

Checked in from star cruise for one night on 29th may 2015 as a grand finale to our tour and was left wondering why we even bothered to go on the noisy and crowded cruise  Check in was super fast and we were allotted a suite on the 46th floor (I think 4664) on the second tower with views of the singapore skyline singapore river and merlion from the sitting room and bedroom windows and the harbour and conservatories of marina bay gardens from the floor to ceiling panoramic windows in the bathroom.  The room was awesome and even the 1900 sq. ft suite we stayed at the Venetian Macau paled in comparison. The furniture, drapings, the bed, the bathroom ..... everything was just WOW. I guess that sums up the room.  We had free access to the club floor and were pleasantly surprised to…

Ok, so I am more of a small-boutique-unique-type-of-a-hotel-person, but of course I dreamed to come to this hotel and make a selfie at the pool:) The water was freezing and there are always millions of people taking pictures. I stayed for two nights and I think I had enough to experience such an enormous hotel. Seriously, when you enter into the first tower it feels that there can be planes flying inside. I really enjoyed my gigantic bathroom and my super king size bed, but I wouldn't call this hotel super cozy. It is definitely nice to experience such a place, but next time I am in Singapore I am staying at a smaller place. Also I think the price is WAY overpriced.

This is quite an experience. The staff are exceptional - but then again that's just the people of Singapore - and the rooms are gorgeous. I was on the 48th floor looking over the Gardens on the Bay and it was a sensational view. The bar on the roof is a great spot for a drink but the pool, although quite amazing, was very busy.  I was here for a conference. If I was travelling for work normally I wouldn't stay here as it is very busy and loud - lots of small children and families. If you are on holiday and want something different then you'll enjoy the experience.

room condition I stayed club room, so it was enough spacious. The bathroom has 2 sinks. If you will accomodate 2 people, you can bathroom easily. Also it has bathtub. Its shower room is situated separately to toilet room.  facilities This hotel is famous for the infinite fool on the top floor. Although you spend time for swimming all  the time, it is not  waste of time.  Also the staff are very nice.  If I go to Singapore again, I will choose this hotel without hesitation.

This hotel is absolutely amazing. When we checked in, the staff were incredibly helpful and evened realised I would be celebrating my birthday during our stay. The gentleman who checked us in organised a fantastic room and cake!!!!! The hotel staff were all so lovely and helpful with helping us organise things such as a trip to the chocolate lounge (which was a fantastic experience in itself). The pool was beautiful and we enjoyed the many cocktails that were served to us with a smile. Breakfast both mornings was fantastic. We were so sad to leave we actually tried to cancel our other accommodation in Singapore so we could stay (unfortunately as it was the week of the SG50, they were fully booked) we will definitely be coming back to stay at MBS

Huge hotel, fast and prompt check in, helpful front desk staff, nice food, nice room, easy access, child friendly and famous pool...My daughter really2 love this hotel and keep me and my wife promise to stay here again on our next trip to S'pore...

My son and I visited in July 2015 and stayed 3 nights at this wonderful hotel.  We booked a Grand Club Room.  The room itself was spacious (the photo's on the hotel website do not do it justice)  It had a king bed and a sofa bed and we still had plenty of room.  The view from the room was spectacular overlooking the river and city.  We had club privilege's which I would highly recommend.  Not only does the Club Lounge supply breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails and canapes but the staff who work there are excellent.  I would highly recommend staying at this hotel!

Whilst the views are impressive the level of service is absolutely not. As a pregnant person they had very little choice for non alcoholic drinks having run out of most and not having a mocktail list,I ended up paying $8 for a soda which is DISGUSTING!

Lovely property which I just had to stay at before we departed for our cruise. Granted it is a little on the expensive side but on par to what you would probably pay for a stay at Crown Casino in Melbourne. All the amenities you could wish for, each staff member more than happy to help and the view from the top is fantastic. We arrived late afternoon and by the time we made it to the hotel, checked in, changed and went to the top it was dark. As soon as I entered the pool and made my way to the edge a series of fireworks were let off - welcome to Singapore! Can't say much more than it is worth it to stay for at least one night

This must be currently THE most exciting hotel/bulding in the world. Jointly with the park etc a truly amazing experince. The view is breathtaking... It has all the things a good 5 star hotel has and we experinced VERY good service. Expensive stay... but all arround good. However, maybe victim to its own success, the crowds are a pain... pool area is great but only just after noon (check out crowed is gonde) otherwise it is unbaearably crowded, same with restaurants, lobby etc... They do many things right... but for a TRUE luxury experience there are simply to many people (or I guess you have to get the Presidential Suite...)

There are only a few hotels in the world that command the attention of a destination traveler.  The Marina Bay Sands has the perfect location and also the most amazing view of any swimming pool in the world.  If you're ever in Singapore, you shouldn't stay anywhere else.

We had a great time at MBS. The breakfast was great and the pool area is awesome. We received a room upgrade which was unexpected with the price we paid. The staff were friendly and service was good to.

We stayed here for two nights on our way through the Maldives and were surprised at just how big the hotel was.  Our room was lovely and very spacious - it overlooked the bay and was wonderfuly to sit by the window and watch the light shows at night.  We especially loved going to the pool level and having breakfast and afternoon canapes and drinks. Overall we had a great stay. We wouldnt stay here again only because its pretty pricy and we just treated ourselves that once for our Honeymoon. BUt would recommend to anyone wanting experience a short stay in Singapore.

Let's face it: you can never go wrong with this hotel. Stunning views from both sides of the hotel - so even if the room is not facing the bay and city, the garden view is just as worth it.   Super comfortable rooms, friendly staff, from cleaners, through concierges, to receptionists.... Shopping centre and casino included. The location quality is out of question. So is the Infinity pool. Wow!

This is great iconic hotel. It is worth going just for the photos alone.  It delivers everything you'd expect. We had great rooms, great views and the service throughout our stay was impeccable. The only downside for me was the location of the breakfast. Being in the main lobby it felt a bit like having breakfast in an airport, with large numbers of people milling around just to walk through hotel or visit the shopping mall. It lacked any privacy or intimacy. There is a dining area up on the top floor which serves breakfast. We were invited there on one of our days as the queue for breakfast in the main lobby was really long. This was much more in keeping with a 5 star hotel. Not sure what the criteria is to have breakfast there but it's worth asking.

We had a lovely stay at the Marina Bay Sands. We had a deluxe room with city view on the 40th floor which was amazing. The pool was very crowded but still amazing. The staff was very friendly as well ! It was a great stay !

This is our second stay here and the first time it was far more professionally arranged and managed, better service and staff. Now it appears the management team has changed as the services were poor, and our rooms had flaws and we also found the best of the hotel, which was the pool, to be rather 'unclean'.

It’s a five star hotel, and the architecture is something out of a futuristic movie. There is an infinity pool on the top of it (57 floors up) and the views are amazing! Everything in my room is brand new, and the power outlets are built to accept plugs from multiple countries (why doesn’t every hotel do this)? I walk over to this control panel on the wall and immediately press all the buttons…the shades go up, the lights dim, the light outside of my room switches to do not disturb, and the tv comes on. (maybe a bit dramatic, but there were buttons that did things and this made me happy) The bed is super comfortable, the bathroom is huge, I love this place!  There is a mall and a casino in the place, and an pretty awesome botanical garden to take a walk through. It is a bit…

Such a fantastic property, great views either side of all towers, we had a suite to share and it was amazing! Breakfast was great and afternoon drinks were fantastic with that view. Staff were efficient and polite in check in. Definitely recommend travelers to stay at least once during their visit to Singapore

Fun and exciting area. Be sure to go to the top of the Marina Bay Sands hotel (the one that looks like a cruise ship in the sky) and have a drink at the infinity pool!  Easy to walk to various areas. Skyline is beautiful

Excellent hotel with great views of the Bay Area. The rooftop pool and deck is an great experience. The casino and the shopping centre gives a great opportunity to spend time. Absolutely thrilled with the experience although this was a business trip!

This is a 5-star hotel, and you can really feel the high quality of the hotel and its amenities and the level of excellent service the moment you enter through the doors. We arrived at 07am and they managed to give us a room immediately, even though the regular check-in time is at 3pm, AND this was during high season. We stayed in a room with city view, and I recommend to pay the extra cost of having that. One thing that surprised me was the high number of families with small children at the hotel.   Overall, excellent service and a very beautiful hotel, give you the luxury feeling for your vacation or business trip.

I stayed in the 44th floor. An amazing view into the sea. The room and toilet were extremely neat and clean. Good free WiFi connection too. The infinity swimming pool was smaller in width than my expectation. It was filled with people taking pics and not with many serious swimmers. However, it was an enjoyable experience.

Actually, our visit startet quite well with a small upgrade from the 5th to the 14th floor. The room was nothing special but clean. We had a view to the gardens in tower 1. At the beginnning we were supposed to stay in tower 3 which confused them apparently in a very negative way. We were waiting for about 1h40 in order to get our luggage. Even three phone calls couldn't help. Finally, the bellboy came with our luggage. They had put it three rooms away and they thought we were not in the room...this is simply unacceptable for a 5* hotel. For such a bad situation, I would have expected at least a drink for free, but the only thing we heard was "we are deeply sorry Ma'am. Maybe it was because we were only backpackers and didn't have Gucci or LV bags...We booked this one night as a…

This was my second time to MBS as I wanted my partner to experience the sheer amazement of the sky park and infinity pool. For some reason now the only way to get in here is to stay at the hotel and obviously this is now reflected in the price! We paid the same amount for a base level room this time as I paid for executive level last time ... The complex itself is amazing with the shopping mall featuring the indoor canal and water feature every brand shop you could imagine to indulge yourself and the food court is huge. There is the casino as well but if you like serenity this is not the place it is constant chaos with so many people checking in and out Customer service is a little short on plus everything you purchase is over priced. Worth a look but def not the best Singapore…

This hotel has an amazing wiew, we got the city side and it was beautiful at night. On the other side you can see the botanical gardens. The rooms were nice but the hotel is very crowded, we saw pictures on the roof top pool before traveling and it looked nice, but when we got there it was extremly crowded, even early in the morning. We went for a short swim and figured that we would have lunch on the restaurant at the top, but you had to dress up so we did not bother. There is a huge shopping centre at the bottom if you would like to go there, also a lot of restaurants.

Stayed here with my family over the National Day Parade Preview to catch the fireworks. Unlike my past four staycations at MBS, I chose the city view this time round in order to catch a bird's eye level of the Golden Jubilee fireworks. The view was breathtakingly spectacular.  What sets MBS from most other hotels where I had stayed in Singapore is its impeccable service. From smiling Miki at the check-in counter, the affable and helpful staff at the Club Lounge (Miles and Mirdy) to the prompt service by Vance at check-out, every one along the way treated me and my family like VIPs.  A great way to spend the weekend, and definitely coming back again!

On arrival my wife and i first noticed the long lineup at the check-in counter. Here and there a hotel staff came by and gave us all kind of wifi keys, and papers to fill out. We did not even reach the check.in counter by this time. I felt like a cow on the way to the slaughter house. Just a number, not a person. Once arrived at the check in counter, the hotel staff did not say hello, good morning or anything like that. Just: "where is your voucher???"  Same thing at the check-out day...no good by no thank you.   The room itselv was OK, but very dirty. We had to call the room service two times to clean up the mess from the previous guests. The minibar was sticky and old juice drops and splashes all over. Also old "Pringles" crumps on the floor.. Also the glass table had a broken…

It is really poor experience here. Not recommended. You won't feel you are guest or having vacation.  - Over capacity, full of people. Long queue everywhere. e.g. you have to wait over 15 mins for seat arrangement during breakfast time. You take another 10 mins to store luggage.  - Strong bad smell in the corridor and room (we need to request changing room) - Staff service is poor, lack of smile and even makes us feel rough. (Esp. restaurant) - The buffet breakfast is full of people. When we sit down, I had to sign the bill within 5 mins (I even haven't taken anything). The experience is really poor. The staff is impolite. - The chef is not providing hotel service. They put the fried egg in your dish roughly. Even turn it over.    Not value for money.

The hotel has a very poor service. We stayed there sometime ago, paid tones and received a different room than ordered. Since in was formula 1 period they claimed unavailability and asked us to notify about the issue next time we want to stay for an upgrade. Now as we try to make a reservation they claim lack of availability 7 weeks ahead and nothing can be done. Thats the general approach; never coming forward towards the guest. No effort whatsoever. Always making it a favour. We try to book a restaurant 6 weeks ahead and they tell us its a subject to confirmation. They make a tentative booking and apparently will notify you based on availability. So if there is a customer they value more you can eat a pizza in the mall downstairs... I could understand if the hotel would really…

I stayed this cool hotel 5days and I went swimming pool EVERY night. It was best night view ever of my life. even better better better than hongkong one. its not cheap tho but I recommand you to stay at least one night! you will not regret.

Stayed here only 24 hours due to price. Stayed elsewhere in Singapore for remainder of Singapore visit of a week. Cost $520 per night for the cheapest room. The infinity pool with spectacular views was the main attraction, otherwise it's just a hotel & not the best of locations. The Shoppes were high end designer so too expensive, no nearby shops for reasonable prices. Room large and plenty of toiletries. Room quiet. Of concern was the black sooty mould around ceiling in our room (room 311 tower 3), rather off- putting & not expected in this fairly new, high- priced hotel, We did not eat at the hotel due to high prices, instead dined at Fatt Choi Express at attached Casino, for $12.80 each we enjoyed generous steamboats, highly recommended. Also a food court at The Shoppes but a…

Stayed at the Marina Bay sands in 2013.  We were booked in one of the club rooms on the 35th floor with a view of the Singapore skyline.... Just beautiful! I suggest you go for the VIP check in since the hotel is always crowded....the reception area at any given time has more than a 100 people. Our VIP check in took just 5 minutes.  Room--- The room was very comfortable. Bed was great and the bathroom spacious You get access to the roof top dining area if you're booking in a club room...  In the evening you can enjoy the canopy hour with Champagne...that's great and complimentary with the club room My only problem with this property is that its just too impersonal. But then again its one of the biggest hotels, so if you're looking for personalized service choose something…

The hotel is amazing fantastic infinity pool and the views are superb. The price is high but the experience is worth it many restaurants close by. I would recommend this hotel for the views and pool and food

Stayed 2 adults 2 kids for 1 night to experience the pool. Free upgrade to the 39 floor. Very busy hotel but check in was fast and staff were very professional and attentive. The pool is amazing and we got our monies worth by going in 3 times , daytime, night time and at 6am . The whole Marina Bay Area is amazing to wonder round and the gardens are really worth a visit

We decided that we should stay at MBS before we left Singapore, so we booked a mid week "staycation" while our apartment was being packed up. We booked a deluxe room and on check-in we were given an upgrade to a simply fantastic room overlooking Marina Bay and the city. The room was huge and the bathroom was absolutely 5 star with a lovely bath and all the trimmings. All the hotel facilities were great and they warned us to expect lines for breakfast downstairs so we opted for in-room breakfast and they brought a table that could be rolled up to the full length window so that I could sit there and admire the view while having breakfast - I don't understand why anyone would not do this and we did it every day we were there. Check-out was superb, there was a queue of course but…

Great hotel, with one of the most amazing pools I've ever seen. The view from the top is simply amazing. The beds are nice, room was nice and the breakfast was lovely. Would have liked to stay there for more than one night. The only downside is the size of the hotel and the price of the rooms.

My family and I stayed for 3 nights in the Orchid Suite. The suite is really big, 100 sqm. Welcome worked very well, Catchup-Service from Airport brought us directly to the hotel where the check-in was made directly in the room. No waiting lines at all as in other comments. Then we went directly to the infinity pool. Really impressing but too many people, all the time! For breakfast we went to the Club, very nice and everything was there. We also tried the afternoon tea which is different than in England, there are just some fruits and sweets. Between 5 and 7 pm, they also serve sandwiches, all for free when staying in a Club room. Overall, you have to see it once but I would not stay here again. Why? Well, I cannot say anything bad about the hotel, it's just to big, to…

Lots of Chinese tourists...It's really overpriced compared to what you get. The room is mediocre at best.   Sure it has the huge infinity pool with amazing view BUT it's always crowded with TONS of tourists. It's like dipping in pee...kinda gross honestly.   But I'm glad I stayed there ONCE. Crossed that off my bucket list.   Tips: If you want to truly enjoy dipping in the infinity pool, go REALLY EARLY. It's completely amazing and that was the only time I actually felt like it's kinda worth it staying at MBS. A lot of other stuff you can enjoy without staying there such as the casino, Ce La Vi etc. The only thing you CANNOT do is pretty much the pool and the room which isn't that cool.

This hotel is amazing. The pool and the view are breathtaking and really unique. Also the gym is on the top and the view is fantastic. I was there for business and I travelled with a group of colleague but it is place that I will visit in the next few years again with my family.  Additional information: I did some massage in the SPA and I can really seggest it. Of course around the street you will find a lot of kind of massage studios that are probably much cheaper, but I preferred the excellent and professional treatment from the hotel. We had also dinner on the restaurant in the top and the food was really good.

We stayed here in Singapore for two nights. Hotel interiors as well as exteriors both are mind blowing.We stayed in the Deluxe room. It had a free wifi.Rooms are very spacious and the major attraction of this hotel is the Infinity Pool, you can actually swim on top of the world.Staff is humble and service turn around time is good.And also to mention you will not get this skyline view from anywhere else. Though the price is little high but one must experience once i lifetime.

The views are great, the rooms are fine, everything is well organised. The prices are high and the attached shopping mall is only ultra luxury so not really interesting. The main issue is that the relaxing areas are very busy so you end up relaxing in your room not at the pool where it can be difficult to get a deck chair or in the bar ( very noisy) or in the main lobby (very few spaces to sit around in). Might be good to expierience it once but do not recommend returning to it

I have been to Marina Bay Sands many times.   It is a huge hotel and quite a piece of architecture.  The pool and observation tower are located on the roof.  If you are a registered guest you have free access to pool and observation tower.  If not a guest, you can pay $20Singapore to go to the observation tower, but no use of the pool.  The check-in can be a slow/laborious task.   Seems rooms are often NOT ready at 3PM check in time.   The que can be long and slow, and the staff will only give a simple 'sorry for the delay'.....no amenities or comps for wasted time.  Buffet dinner in the hotel i$ expen$ive.   $68Singapore dollars to get in.   Found the food only mediocre and not a big choice for such an elaborate hotel!   Minimum stay per night is $368Singapore.    You can find…

This is without doubt one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, the views and experience from the infinity pool are amazing, as is the uber fresh coconut water! The service is super efficient across the board and the rooms are delightful, spacious, clean and well maintained.

I had booked 2 premier rooms with a city view for my partner and myself and my parents who were visiting us in Singapore from the UK. It was for my 30th Birthday celebrations and I wanted to treat my family. So when we were picked out of the queue and escorted to the VIP Check In I couldn't believe my luck! Then we were very kindly complimentary upgraded to the PRESIDENTIAL SUITE(!) on the 54th floor!! Amazing! This was the luckiest day of my life and I cannot thank the staff at MBS enough for such a special time! The staff were fantastic, gave me a complimentary birthday cake delivered to the room, complimentary mocktails around the pool and couldn't be more generous and friendly. Definitely a stay my family and I will treasure and remember forever. Thank you.

The hotel is spectacular, The pool beautiful and everything was superb, and all of that was spoilt by a faulty light that refused to turn of, A pain that had me SLEEPING IN, I had a schedule of going to Sentosa and experiencing fun and delicious food, BUT WHAT HAD I TO DO, with a faulty light, I expect more from this hotel this expensive. Another con, is that this hotel has become overcrowded and isn't as luxurious as before, when I last went a year before this trip

One of my best hotel experience thus far. The view was good and service is excellent. I like the restaurants available there and everything is located nearby. The pool & spa is amazing as well. I will definitely stay again if I am in Singapore.

We had an amazing room in the 46th floor with city view. The room was huge and the view breathtaking.  The main reason to book this hotel was the infinity pool on the roof top. At the pool you only need to watch out not to get hit by a selfie-stick...   We loved the attention and kindness of the staff, which we did not expect when we checked in. The check-in process fitted better to an budget airline than a 5 star hotel.

It is cool to stay in this huge hotel, once. We stayed in tower 3 on 50th floor. Great view and room was clean and nice. The pool is also cool with a great view, but crowded. It is so not personal to stay in these big hotels. But you have to do it once. Just for the tick in the box! The few staff you meet are nice, but you hardly meet anyone. Another good thing is that you have subway just under the hotel. Not a good thing is the check in, huge line! It took ages to get a check in.

We stayed here for two nights at the tail end of a month long holiday.  It was perfect for chilling out and is adjacent all Singapore's new attractions such as the Art & Science Museum and Gardens on the Bay - both of which we spent a bit of time at.  As a family of four we got two adjoining rooms, which gave us lots of space and comfort.  We were up fairly high, with a city-side room, so could avail of the beautiful views and nightly light shows.  The rooftop infinity pool is wonderful, and at 57 storeys has panoramic views of the city state.  The one negative is that this place is extremely busy!  Be prepared for the masses.

It was me and my girlfriend who stayed her for the infinity pool. I would say the rooftop bar beside it was awesome and so is the infinity pool. The water is crowded so i recommend for you to early in the morning.  Service was great and our room was clean. Our room had a great view of Downtown Singapore. I would come back and stay again.

We arrived at Marina Bay Sands on the 23rd of July, to stay over till the day after.  It was about noon, and we were weary from travelling. The reception line wasn't too long, luckily, and we got to speak to a cute and friendly receptionist. She asked us whether or not we'd been to Singapore before, what we'd done travelling, etc. After a short chat, she was informed how our family of 5 was split into two different towers of the hotel. With the swipe of a hand, she'd rebooked and upgraded us to the Marina Suite. It did sound great at the time, but exceeded our expectations beyond measure. Not only was it the kind of suite you only see in movies - the service was great aswell. Emplioyees were tiptoed to assist with whatever needed, and were only a button away.   Here's a link to…

A brilliant hotel, enjoyed the Infinity Edge Pool. Stayed here for 10 nights in September last year, for the Grand Prix. Great staff in a prime location. Rooms were fantastic too. Marina Bay is the perfect destination for anyone who loves the vibrancy of the city

We were surprised by the size and quality of the room, and impressed with the view. The pool was good for a brief swim, but there is NO SHADE, so not good for long stints lazing next to the pool.  They are renovating the pool side restaurant area at the moment so maybe there will be more room and more shade in the future. Pool side was a bit noisy from power tools, but the view was so good that you tend to not notice the noise pollution (and obviously this will presumably be temporary). Some of the pool side staff were great, but others a little too enthusiastic (ie: almost pushy) about asking if you want food or drink. I was really surprised by how large the room and bathroom area was. The bathroom area was actually 3 separate rooms: a Large sink and bath area, a toilet room…

We stayed in a room in Tower 2 with fantastic views of the city. The Infinity pool and the spa on the roof top were just amazing. The views were spectacular. The staff were very helpful and polite. Would love to stay here again.

Our second time staying here and it won't be our last. Amazing pool, rooms, views, facilities and customer service. Every staff member that we have come across have all been excellent - I don't know what other people are complaining about! The only letdown was that the gym has been downsized. I guess there must not be too many people using it.   We were given an early check-in  and the highest level for the premier rooms on level 47 the views were amazing!

The room is nice spacious and well equipped. We felt comfortable. Tower 2 on the 50th floor gave us a nice view over the bay. However a very big hotel thus lack of a personalised service worth of a 5 star and alot of people.The staff taking care of the swimming pool entry need to be more customer service oriented, as they seem to be bouncers sometimes a bit rude.

Besides the rooftop pool the hotel is not that special for a five star hotel. The marina bay sands was a must do for us when we visited Singapore. But to be honest I'd book an other hotel with a fairer price. Breakfast was too expensive as well. Room was okay but the bathroom smelled a little awkward.

We stayed at Marina Bay for 2 nights. The reception we received by the staff was very reserved and distant, but the room was truly beautiful, decorated and equiped to a very high Standard.  Of course, as everyone who books Marina Bay, we were looking forward to a nice afternoon at the pool with spectaculous views. However, it came with many strings attached. It was impossible to find a free sun bed (generally every day after 4pm), the space was very limited, nowhere to sit or put your belongings, pool overcrowded so much that it felt like a free public pool and apart of screaming asian kids (dont even mention the chinese boy urineting at the lift on the floor), there was a drilling noise during our entire stay due to the renovation works at Tower 2. Overall, unfortunately, the…

This is my second time in marina bay sands. The last time I visited it was like 5yrs ago. Comparing it before and now is quite different.  Too long que for check in, alot of people are roaming in the lobby, it doesn't look like a hotel anymore, the ambiance was lost, it looks like more of a meeting place. We booked premier room on higher floor. But in fairness the room is well maintained. The staff are courteous specially the concierge staff. The infinity pool is too crowded also, you'll having a second thought for hygienic purposes, even at night it's too jam packed.   Since, it's still one of the most looked after hotel at Singapore a lot of people would still like to try to experience the sands accommodation but you can get a cheaper five star hotel and a better and more…
Amazing views, however went on Saturday night and had over 40min wait in line to get elevator done.  This was annoying

The hotel is extremely nice and luxurious, the pool is a great experience but i was really disappointed with the service. The staff is not friendly and the service is very slow. I can understand that the hotel is huge and crowded but still it isn't and excuse for having a bad service like no one answers you for what you want especially when our suite was smelling cigarettes, we called the reception so many times until someone came to spray our room. Such a nice hotel should have a great service to have an overall amazing experience..

I had to visit singapore for work purpose. I took a day off to have a look at the famous Marina bay sands & look what i found?! The view was breathtaking i was spellbound!!!  In love with this place. Gonna come with my wife for holidays soon <3 marina bay sands offers the best view of the city

We had no idea that we booked our stay during SG50, and what a wonderful experience and suprise it was to visit Singapore during this time.  We booked a deluxe room online but at check in we were upgraded to the Orchard Suite facing the city and Merlion Park. The suite was absolutely AMAZING!!! We were in Tower 3 on level 51.   The suite had a large bathroom with walk in shower and a seperate toilet. Mirrored hallway. A large walk in wardrobe!! Separate living room area, an office desk in another area and a large area for the king sized bed.   The floor to ceiling windows that stretched the entire length of the suite was incredible for the view of the city, and what a treat it was to watch the SG50 fireworks that night from the comfort of our room. Uninterrupted views and…

The room i got too small but we've experience the pool. The staf so nice. C/in & c/out also no hard. We got botanical view. The bathroom ok. the hotel far from restaurant. Need walk too long. Should hv all promotion room with free breakfast. Should hv kids playground.

Great service. Nice big rooms. Breathtaking views of Singapore harbour. Then the infinity pool is another brilliant experience too. You feel good going into the pool when others who are not hotel guests are cordoned off. We felt very privileged indeed. Highly recommended for at least one visit in your life.

We got room on 29th floor facing garden by the bay it was good view of the garden and the sea at night  one night is not enough if you any one planning for it at least 2 night  view from the pool is awesome spl the sun setting down behind the sky line of city   As read in TA there was no problem checking and check out  it was done with in mins  Below the hotel it has casino and shopping u get everything you need in that mall

2nd time staying in MBS, nothing changed just that the pool area is undergoing some major renovations when i stayed there, its the Jacuzzi area overlooking gardens by the bay. Steam room was also undergoing renovations. Well, better luck next time!   Pool area is crowded, kinda expected it. Staff by the pool were attentive enough to attend to us when we needed the menu, service was pretty good.   Room was spacious, we stayed in a premier room on level 47, city view. Housekeeping was good, requests were attended to swiftly!   Overall it was good!

Stayed two nights in a City view Club Room. Check in was fairly easy although extremely busy. Our room was not ready on arrival, which we did not expect anyway as we were early (11:00am) but our luggage was stored for us and sent to our room as soon as it was available. Our room was 3669 in tower 2, right at the end of the building with a fantastic view over the city and an awesome view of the gardens from the bathroom. The room is very spacious with a TV mounted on a swivel stand separating the bed from the lounge area, 4 seat dining table, two 2 seater lounges and an armchair with ottoman and desk with travel adapters and Internet connection. The bathroom is quite large, twin bowl vanity, large  separate  shower, free standing bath and view to die for. As part of the Club Room…

What i liked best: the pool was really something else and very nice. plus the fact that atleast we got our accomodations at discounted rate. but will never check in there again at full price as we do not feel the value for money   What i didn't like the most: yeah the pool is very nice...
