BUT there was a terrible reek coming from the pool plus the trickery in the mini bar/fridge-Be careful travelers, once you take out the contents in the fridge it is considered used/consumed and will be charged as incidentals. you have to pay an additional $10 for a personal fridge for drinks/food you want to keep cool.  service: Service is just right. not good but not great either room: our room was huge and really nice. Bathroom was huge  & clean. location: great location nice city view from…

our family stayed in the hotel for 3 days. The hotel and the surrounding area  is good but service and the staff at the hotel are unacceptable! the breakfast is nice but very crowded and noisy The  front desk and all other staff are not providing service, whatever you need or ask the answer is always NO. when you pay more than 800USD per night! You can get better hotels for lowers prices, only if you want to see unique pool that's very nice pool. But you have decide by yourself whether the value is right for you. we recommend everybody to skip this hotel and save your money! Please consider whether your money is valuable for your stay in Singapore.

If you like to travel and want to see something magnificent , you have to stay in Marina Bay Sands at least once, just for experience. The pool on the roof is like nothing you have seen before. The view of the city is spectacular. Some people wrote that customer service was very bad. As for us, we were treated very good by all the staff. We were given a huge 1 bedroom suite on a high floor with a fantastic view  instead of a standard room that we booked  at absolutely no charge, because all regular rooms on high floors were occupied. There was a storm at night and we could not sleep good  because of the banging noise to the window. Next day when we told the staff about this problem , we were offered a free breakfast on the roof immediately. They really care about their…

I only went there for the infinity pool, which is amazing and didn't fail to fascinate me ; the view from there is breathtaking! The water is clean and the service is good, the hotel is extremely modern. I'll definitely come back again.

everything was smooth upon check-in we didn't have to wait too long for our room which is a good sign though.of course we came in almost like in the afternoon into our room, we are pretty exhausted so we took a nap and after that we went up to the pool around 5pm expecting that it's not too hot to swim. upon reaching to the top, we were surprised that the pool was crowded really really crowded, but still we were able to find our spot, we sat and relaxed for a while then the skies got dark like it was about to rain. before it rains we decided to have some snacks by the pool. I approached one of the male staff there i was insisting to order food but he was like chasing us away only because it was about to rain. I still insisted but he became rude and showed me his nasty face. I…

Had an amazing 3 nights here at start of our honeymoon. Had an amazing city view from  40th floor room and was very spacious. Rooftop pool and bars amazing , also only place we could feel a breeze in Singapore lol.

Dear visitor to Singapore,  Please consider whether your money is valuable for your stay in Singapore. The facility is quite nice but service in hotel is two or three star class. The reservatiom and front desk are not commucating eachother and brought us a lot confusion.  Non smoking floor is ignored by the guest and smoke on club level floor which you pay more than 800SGD per night. That's you can get for 100 SGD and lesser in Singapore as well. Only if you want to see infinity pool that's very nice pool. But you have decide by yourself whether the value is right for you. This will be my last (third) visit to MBS.  Have a nice day

We stayed at the hotel just after New Years and enjoyed our stay. The room we had was brilliant, nice and high up with great views over Singapore. Facilities in the room were high tech and it was very large, spacious and comfortable. I guess this can be expected from one of the best developments in the world!  Check in was a process though, there are many people staying here and it gets crowded. The drivers coming in to the driveway are stressed and there is a flash of confusion as your bags are taken and you are left to find out which queue of the many long queues you need to line up at. Fortunately we were identified and taken from the queue for VIP check in though if we were to wait longer in the queues like many people would have to we would have been more frustrated. …

one of the main reasons for visiting singapore was to see this pool which is pretty amazing and worth the visit.  never seen so many selfie sticks in my life. the location is quick to the airport and you can walk right out to the cloud forest. the hotel is very nice but staying there is expensive both from the nightly cost and food, etc. I think you could find some cheaper places to eat in the attached mall, but in the end just budget for spending more money at the hotel and enjoy it. its really nice and worth staying there.

Booked a week in MBS but checked out early because we did not find it to be a good value.  It should definitely be experienced because the rooftop infinity-edge pool is astonishing.  You can do that on a day pass, though, and save plenty of money.  We stayed on the club level and enjoyed attentive service with a very good breakfast, fruit and pastries for tea, and a free-flowing cocktail hour.  Although crowded, the staff handled the challenge admirably.  Downstairs, however, it was crowded and chaotic as the hotel was booked to capacity.  The concierge was overwhelmed and a bit brusque but truly it was a sea of people with a barrage of questions.  Skip the dinner on the top floor; the food is nothing special and the prices astronomical.  If you definitely check it out, though,…
The view from the top was very good that is if you can fight your way through the crowds! Expensive for what it was. Use the Singapore  Flyer instead

The best in class hotel with well equipped room,amazing view from balcony, courteous staff, nice bathroom and last but not the least Awesome Pool...Hotel has every charm to keep you busy admiring it. Loved to be here..

Another top place to stay whilst visiting Singapore, awesome views from the roof top pool. Rooms were clean and tidy, possibly a tad difficult to find our room because of the share size of this facility, we found ourselves in the wrong lift of many lifts within the three towers however that was just apart of the experience and besides we got to see more of this grand attraction. Moments away from the casino if you like a bunt or just to watch and soak up the atmosphere. I would definitely like another visit to this establishment as it was on the verge of being completed when I stayed, would definitely advise a stay at MBS it will be a worthy stay even for a king.

... it's definitely too crowded up there even if the view from the pool is breathtaking, particularly at night. Clubrooms are spacious but the club facilities and the food/drinks didn't wow us. Good for a stopover stay but not for a longer visit. Consider it an attraction on your sightseeing list but not much more.

It was good and beautiful pool on the top. It's so beautiful and fantastic! However, our room had some problems:(   The bathroom door wasn't closed and  the curtain was broken :(   After that they fixed it. But not so quick... If there was no pool, it's worthless:( sorr

Booked this for our last night of our backbagger honeymoon, one reason for being the infinity pool, experience and good rest before travelling back home. We came here with backbags but were welcomed as friendly as others. The hotel is of course very fancy and shiny with many high-end stores. We had a room on 42nd floor and it was obviously clean, neat and spacious. Bathrooms I've seen better but the bed and sheets were probably the best I have slept in. Nice view to Gardens by the Bay from the balcony. Breakfast was not included in the room price and we did not bother to buy it separately for its ridiculous price (48SGD).  Infinity pool I must say was a bit of a disappointment. Beautiful and glorious surroundings with a spectacular view, sure, but full of people, kids and selfie…

I stayed here as a treat with my sister towards the end of 6 months of travel. Yes it is pricey but I can wholeheartedly say it was worth every penny we paid. We paid for a club upgrade which included all manner of wonderful extras which really made the experience incredible. We of course got a club room and were able to check in earlier and quicker allowing us extra time to visit the pool. We had afternoon tea at 2pm and then cocktails and canapés from 5-7pm. The title for both of these things do not do them justice, it was like a gourmet tasting session with as much food as you can manage. The drinks included everything from champagne to cognac, as much as you like in the 2 hours. The staff in the club restaurant made the experience even more special for us; Naveen and him…

We had a week here. I wanted to experience the infinity pool.  I have to say. From arriving at the hotel to leaving we had a superb stay. The room was lovely, with a spectacular view over the Gardens by the bay.  Breakfast was amazing. Indescribably amazing. Needs to be experienced...  The pool was great, only drawback was that it was super crowded every time we tried to go.  Checkin and checkout was painless even if it is a huge hotel.  What impressed me the most was the fact that the staff recognized us, and made us feel special.  I gave to mention Mozza, an Italian restaurant. It actually served the best pizza I ever tasted, including the ones I had in Italy. We went back the last evening, and was recognized, greeted like old friends, they remembered it was our last night,…

Modern hotel with great view of Singapore bay. Best hotel for solo, couple and family so far in singapore. You can enjoy infinity pool at the top floor. Best time the afternoon to evening so you can see the sunset from there.   Many places to go if you like night life. Also close by Marina Bay Mall where you can find the branded product and romantic dinner with by the bay view.
What an amazing place. The Marina Bay Sans Hotels tops off the wonders of Singapore. Views right around Singapore and of the ships in the strait.

Marina Bay Sands has to be one of the finest properties I've ever visited. Amazingly beautiful sunset and night time views from the pool. I laid by the pool from mid afternoon till late that night and enjoyed every second of the changing views. Look forward to returning one day :)

Best hotel in Singapore to stay, located in the city centre lots of shopping malls in the close vicinity, club house on the top floor with amazing swimming pool ,breathtaking views from the top floor club. Can enjoy water show in the evening, casino and shopping inside the hotel.

MBS is all about the bragging rights. "Whoo Hoo, I stayed at Marina Bay Sands!"  And I was no exception to this pretense. I rather enjoyed bragging to my friends that I was staying here on the heals of my husband who was speaking at the RSA Security conference in June. I just love it when I get to tag along! This is a beautiful hotel but make no mistake, it’s not for your average Grizwald family vacation. Everything is extremely expensive because it's a business hotel for business travellers who are able to expense a $48 buffet breakfast or a $30 domestic cocktail, $12 plain bagel, or an 8 dollar yogurt cup The hotel's main claim to fame is the rooftop infinity pool, and you've probably seen viral pics of this hotel, taken by professional photographers that show beautiful people…

We didn't stay in the hotel, which looked incredible but very full. But the views from the skywalk at the top are quite simply breathtaking and watching the sunset over the city, and being there when the city lights up is an absolute must for travellers

This hotel is a Landmark in Singapore. We stayed here for 2 nights for a room rate much higher than many other luxury downtown hotels. Check-in was smooth but took sometime due to the number of guests for this large hotel. Service was outstanding. Everything was coordinated very smoothly. My luggage was waiting for me near the room before I arrive. The hotel is directly linked to a shopping mall with many designer stores and variety of restaurants and cafes. The Sky Park and the infinity pool at the roof top are another reason for making this hotel a must-visit. The breakfast is served at the ground floor with wide selection of food and efficient staff to serve a huge number of guests. Marina Bay Sands has its own identity and is highly recommended for a short visit to Singapore.

Wanted to get this off my bucket list and in order to fully experience what the hotel has to offer,  we decided to stay here for 3 nights in our 7 days Singapore vacation trip.   We booked the Garden view primarily for its balcony.   You don't have to worry about the city view pictures coz you will have access to the Skypark Observation and take your city view photos from there.   Our room was at tower 3 in the 45th floor and the views from the rooms were great.  Since the access to the infinity pool and Skypark is at tower 3 it was very convenient for us.   The room in itself is not that special and for me the bed and pillow was not that comfortable but the great view at the balcony makes up for it.   The infinity pool was always crowded on all the 3 nights we went in there. …

This malay guy namely Asyraf is a very rude staff in marina bay sands nearby river boat and casino. First I saw him make face to the customer when customer ask him thats why I as the other one and not him but what he did is he interrupted us and told the lady that she has a phonecall but the lady answered him that nobody on the line then he laughed so he only wanted our conversation to finish then I ask his name and surname. He told me in a very rude way that he dont have a surname. You shouldnt hire this type of attitude to be a concierge because he dont to handle customer, he must work only in coffee shop or clean toilet in dormitory not in this line specially in marina bay sands. I hope you should take action to this matter so that it will not happen again. Please send him…

Stayed here last May 2015. The room is very big with amazing view, bathroom is very nice. Last but not least is the legendary stunning pool! Its the most spectacular pool with spectacular view :) definitely will go back there !

Booked 1 week prior was great that we can get the room with a pretty much good deal in terms of money. Room was good, everything works and the pool was awesome just like what u expected. Spent the night at the bar side the pool with tge skyscrapers view from the top of the city is the plus point. Average points for the food, didn't worth it with the price, don't expect personalized service because they are too busy with bunch of people. U get what u paid, do not expect flawless service.

One of the best, if not the best, 5-star hotel I have ever stayed in! Rooms are spacious, with nice beds and are well maintained. Plenty of facilities for both adults and kids. The room-top pool is a must-go place. Enjoy the excellent view, especially during night time, while you are taking a leisure swim. Service is good, though the staff need to smile more. Lots of good restaurants available; you are spoit for choice when it comes to food. Location is good, being well connected to a train station. Verdict: I'll be back!

I made a reservation for a room for New Years Eve period and had to cancel it five whole months in advance. I am pretty sure, there are lots of people who would love to take this room but the hotel refuses to accept a cancellation and does not refund a penny. I am very interested, what my Singapore friend will find out, when checking on New Years Eve. I am pretty sure, they rented the room again. Nobody wants empty rooms on New Year and in conclusion emtpy tables in the restaurant. That's definitely not what you expect in this league of hotels. Very disappointed !

We arrived to a nice greeting, very speedy processing at check in and the bags were speedily sent up to the room. This was all despite us arriving about 4 hours before check in time which is supposed to be 3pm. We booked an ocean facing room which is cheaper than the ones facing the Marina. Upon placing the key in the slot inside the door, the curtains open to reveal what was a beautiful view so if you're concerned whether to pay extra for the Marina/city view, don't be, the ocean view is also great. Also the rooms are huge with plenty of space to spread out, even with our little one in a roller bed.  The pool is a selfie festival. People clamoring over themselves and others to take the best selfie. Whilst somewhat entertaining, it's not relaxing and of course actually getting…

We were there for just one night and upon walked in to the lobby we were shocked by how many people in there. Some even wearing there bathrobe!!! We were very lucky that we were greeted by a gentleman and escorted is to the VIP check in. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite!!! Walked in to the suite was another shock! The room is excellent. good size with excellent view of the harbour!!! KIds able to run around and having good time! We went to the Infinity pool and there are so many people there that kind of put us off. I guess this is their signature pool and this is a must visit for hotel guests! We done a express check out which is very good. Save our time lining up! When we get home we got the email from the hotel on regards of our hotel bill. We were charge a red bull and…

This hotel is so huge that you can probably get lost the first time you arrive. This is truly one of the best places to stay in Singapore, although it could be a little pricey.  The views is so nice, but the pool area can be a little overcrowded at times. The hotel is near to the Marina Bay Casino, (just downstairs) Room size is great and clean, service was ok...  Will come back again.

If you are to stay in this hotel make sure that you get the Club room access. We initially planned on staying here for the Infinity Pool but this hotel has a lot more to offer. The Club on 55th floor served outstanding food & drinks. In our package, we are also entitled to have b'fast at Sky on 57. We also chose to stay here for we watched the premier of Singing in the Rain at the Grand Theater. Best location for it is just walking distance to the Gardens. Congratulations to the MBS team for every staff made us feel welcomed and everything we asked for was actioned promptly.

We recently stayed at this Hotel. What an amazing experience!! Everything about this place is stunning, the architecture, the staff, the decor.....wow. The highlight for us was the free upgrade to the 54th floor suite which is normally $16,000 USD/night.....this was such an exceptional experience and one I wont forget. I cannot say enough about this Hotel.....it was simply sublime!!

The hotel offers everything you need for a memorable holidays. Food on the hotel is fantastic and the buffet dinner is a must try with fantastic spread . The hotel also offers shopping around the complex and don't miss the award winning pool deck on the top floor with exhilarating view

The hotel has an interesting design, looking like a boat on top of three columns. It stands out from almost anywhere in the city with its modern and unique design. As such, being so huge the hotel room we stayed in had great views of the city and the nightly laser lights show. We payed an extra $50 a night to stay in the city view room, which is regrettable later as you can go to the rooftop and see everything anyway not to mention the fact that you don't spend that much time in the room anyway.  The room overall was massive, very spaceous. The mini bar was rigged, do not touch anything in there at all or you will be charged even if you don't drink it! The most time was spent up at the pool, it was absolutely gorgeous, great views and pool concept. There is plenty of seating…

I really feel that staying at this hotel was one of the highlights of our Singapore vacation. We chose MBS to spend our long overdue anniversary celebration. I booked a deluxe room but did not get the expected room, instead we got something more. Upon check-in, a staff member named Tan Jun Sheng, SJ (Front Office Supervisor) assisted us. He was very friendly and helpful. When I presented the copy of our hotel voucher he took the time to read my requests. I requested for a higher floor to get a nice view of the city. After a short while, he told us that our room was ready and expedited our check-in. The front desk who received us, told us that they upgraded our room for free. We got the clubroom upgrade at the 39th floor plus a city view. Not just that, our room was decorated…

The otel great. Our room was very nice scenery . We stayed on 39. floor. Gardens by the bay was the view of our room and Singapure flayer :) Room very big:) The pool is excellent. But there are many children. The meals were very good. The price of food is not expensive. The hotel is very nice with everything. The staff are very good and very polite. Everything about it helped a lot. I think you should stay at this hotel in Singapore;)

We were here in June 2015.  Location - good. All taxis know Marina Sands. Easy to get around.  Hotel -  generally no complaints about the hotel and facilities.  Il like the fact that shopping is very  convenient.   We would like to bring up an incident where our family member slipped and fell outside the lift due to the wet floor .  This is because some of the guests were dripping wet (from the pool) when they entered into the lift. Its something that the hotel should look into this. Perhaps the hotel could also notify the guests to be properly towel dried  after getting off the pool. We have reported this issue to one of the hotel staff.   The buffet spread is very generous. However, we note that some guests waste food.We wonder how you could stop this wastage.   The reception…

We wanted a four day relax after a month of travelling. Couldn't be happier that it was at this hotel. Staff were always polite, smiling and helpful. Our suite was awesome, HUGE!! with breathtaking views of harbour and city. The pool area although busy is easy to get a spot if you go up between noon and 3 pm. The water temperature is just perfect. It is easy to get around from here as well. There is always taxis and they are inexpensive. Would recommend to anyone.

Great roof top pool. Really huge. Nice view from the pool over Singapore. Breakfast  in the restaurant next to the pool was so so. Room was very nice with great view over a very futuristic park. It is a huge hotel so if you are looking for a cosy place do not go. It is spectacular though.

The rooftop swimming pool like a super market that all the housewives were trying to get the cheapest food from the shelf. In the swimming pool, all the people tried to find the best location to take pictures. You can see no one really "swimming" there, but everyone take their camera or selfie stick to take pic for two or three hours. We tried to stay on the edge just want to enjoy the view of Singapore, however, people tried to push you because they wanted to take million pics on the edge as well. The pool is like Singapore - hard to make you relax.  The water of the swimming pool: SO DIRTY, you can see the dead skin flowing in the swimming pool. It seems no one clean the water, so even the next morning (6am), you can see all the dirty things on the surface.  The room was…

I stayed her in a room with city view with two children, age 4 and 6, for three nights. We had ordered a room with garden view at the internet page of the hotel. However, it was troublesome to order one room for all four. When we arrived we got the explanation that we could have this room with city view with one kingsize bed and a sofa-bed. That was ok for us to sleep on. Should we have a room with garden view we the room would contain two extended single beds. So we kept the room with city view.  The best with this hotel is the infinity pool. The view is spectacular! The children love it! Also the fireworks.  However, you don't get a feeling of being special at this big hotel. When we were there, the hotel was almost full (there are 2561 rooms).  The breakfast had a very large…

Good service, lunch buffet was good quality as expected, the pool was awesome to be up on the sky amongst the skyline.. Annoying that each person needed a pass to gain access. The property is a little overrated but still a good experience.

We had our last 2 night of 9 night in Singapore at the Marina Bay Sands, as great end to our stay.  I would recommend upgrading to the Ocean View room with Club Lounge included as it allowed us to relax and take in all of the views of Singapore with wonderful food. Truly wonderful experience and we will now be staying their on our next return.

For a hotel that is associated with a five star rating it exhibited service that was meager compared that of even a motel. The service was a disgrace. Every aspect of the hotel was not only overpriced but underwhelming. This hotel is nothing more than scam with a boat on top. The level of hospitality (or lack there of) that the staff exhibited was the worst that I have ever experienced. The overcrowded pool was nothing more than a selfie-stick playground that hindered the only complimentary part of the despicable hotel, the view.

First of all, it should be mentioned that if you want to stay here be ready to mingle with people in the atrium who have come to get the perfect picture here.  Yes; as some previous reviews say it is busy and noisy in the atrium but we were only there to check in/out and go to the MRT.  We arrived at 12pm wanting to store our luggage but were able to check in AND were upgraded to a studio suite (very much appreciated).  The check in system is flawless and yes you have to queue but the staff even apologise if you wait 5mins!!!  We were on the 51st floor and had a stunning suite, views and every amenity you could wish for.  The pool was busy but there are sections for adults and children only so not sure why some people would complain about kids being in the pool - they have their…

Let me start off by saying that the manager Dax (forgot his last name) was amazing, he took excellent care and catered to us. My issue was that three people were staying in my room, I paid for an extra bed but to get a key for that third person, I had to pay for that as well. In short, everyone has to get a key in order to enjoy the infinity pool on the 57th floor. There's an area for adults only, and the lifeguards did their best to get rid of the kids but the parents were horrible and didn't obey the rules. There was one kid who stood in front of us, took off all his clothes, changed into his bathing suit while his mother took selfies. Lol! The hotel has lots of restaurants, access to the train station and a mall complete with ice skating and a casino. The rooms and bathrooms…

Grt hotel to be there. What architecture my god. Three 57 storey towers connected by a ship on it. And the swimming pool on the top of it. My god amazing. Rooms are bigger than pan pacific just like the venetian macau.as it is of the same group the property is also exclusive. With all facilities in it and a bathtub in the rooms we stayed it was a grt exp.very expensive hotel but the food is cheaper. They have very good indian food like chappatis heeng dal veg fried rice which tastes deliciously. And to our utter surprise not so costly indian food. Room had all facilities with unlimited mineral water which is more essential. So overall a grt stay and a fantabulous holiday at marina bay sands. A full fledged casino with a shopping complex. Driven a ferrari there which was worth…

We spent 2 nights in MBS end of June. We were expecting to stay in a sort of mega luxurious temple. 1st impression was already negative when, when we arrived for the checkin, we had to queue quite a while, à-la Disneyland.  Then, our room was showed to us. Quite nice, but nothing outstanding. We were very curious to see the infinity pool on the roof top, worldwide famous. Again, massive deception. Trashy impression, too busy, too loud, a little dirty. At least, the view was as expected. The pool area was under construction, hopefully for a good result. Being used to high end hotels, mainly in Dubai, this place is far from the level of its Emirati competitors.

We felt that the outside of the hotel far outweighs the interior.  The external view of the hotel is amazing. However the interior is quite sterile.  The lobby feels like a shopping mall. The club bedroom was nice,  but quite bland. The pool is fantastic but marred by people spending too much time with selfie sticks. We managed to swim lengths though.  The food in the club room was lovely as are the staff. They made sure that we took full advantage of the available food and alcohol which did surprise us. Was glad we paid for the club as we think if we had booked a standard room without all the inclusive extras we would have been disappointed.  We stayed at the Shangri la tanjung aru in Borneo a few years ago and this far eclipsed Marina Bay Sands in presentation and services.…

Many people come here for the pool -- they won't be disappointed. Pool is open from 6 am til 11 pm, and stays open in all but during the worst weather. It's not so crowded in the early morning, then picks up a bit in the late morning. I'd avoid early afternoon as it can be really hot, and the poolside offers little shade. It gets crowded mid afternoon and stays so.  Lifeguard does a pretty good job of keeping the kids out of the adults-only section, so it's not so loud. As expected pool will be filled with tourists toting selfie sticks.  As for the hotel itself, it's quite modern. Rooms have automatic blinds/curtain that draws open/close as you unlock/lock the room door. Beds are comfortable and the bathroom is also first-rate.  Hotel let us check-in early (around 1:30 or so)…

The basic hotel infrastructure is good but the implementation is just terrible.   The lobby is noisey but there are a lot of receptionists so it clears quite fast. The room I was given is on the third storey and faces the expressway and Gardens by the Bay. If you sit on the verandah, you can smell the fumes from the cars. At 6am, after a late night, I was woken up by the loud-hailers from en event at either the Marina or Gardens by the Bay. This is NOT funny.   Everytime we open the door to our room and look downstairs it is teaaming with people. Even for breakfast, the coffeeshop downstairs has a line of people and because of the open oncept, all the noise floats up   The main reason that you would choose to stay here is for the famous infinity pool that has been featured in…

This is an amazing hotel---and def worth paying extra for (even for just one night) just to get into the pool! Staff on check in were lovely!---a young man checked us (no idea his name, but he was just about to go on holiday himself to Iceland). ----really nice manner. We hyad booked this as a treat for our family and it was a wonderful ending to the holiday!

I was at this hotel on business. The room is spacious and very well organized, many electrical outlets, and curtains and lights remotely controlled from the bed side table. The view from the roof top bar is fantastic. One should go there before ten in the evening otherwise there is a line. The infinity pool was somewhat disappointing, rather small and very crowded. The service was very good.

We booked a Club Room with City View for our stay at the hotel and quite frankly, we found the hotel to be very disappointing. It is very much like going to Disneyland. It is a very big hotel and the crowd was simply overwhelming. We queued at check-in, at breakfast time and at check-out ! They even have crowd controllers managing queues at all of the places mentioned  whose priorities are anything but to  treat us like hotel guests. As for the pool, it is extremely busy day and night, and you certainly cannot swim from one end to the other without bumping into selfies sticks and Go-Pro cameras. Oh yes, banana lounges are prized commodities so hang on to them if you happen to be at the pool. As for our Club Room, it is sparsely furnished, and the decor looks like something out…

Staying at the Marina Bay Sands for one night in order to access the infinity pool on the 57th floor was well worth it for us! We live in Singapore so we weren't planning on doing any sightseeing just spending the whole afternoon and early evening at the pool.   We stayed in a club room on the 46th floor with an amazing view of Gardens by the Bay. You can watch the super trees light show from the balcony in  your room.   Bathroom was huge with a very large walk in shower area, double sinks, separate toilet, and a huge bathtub.  Breakfast at the club lounge on the 57th floor was very good and not overly crowded.  The pool was definitely crowded. We were able to check in early and it seemed like a good time to visit the pool on a weekday was between 1 and about 3:30 pm - in…

MBS does a great job of keeping up the standards of the hotel consistently. Clean rooms and impeccable service from the staff as usual. However, removing the free hotel shuttle to/from the airport was a let down.

presidential suite no 5138 has high quality fittings and interiors , media room , personal office, gym, massage room , kitchen ,massive masterbed and kids room with spacious bathrooms ,a baby grand piano, above all the amazing city view from all the rooms from 51st floor. checked in early by 3hours , checked out late by 1 hr ,however the infinity pool was crowded at 5 to 7 pm, express checkout was convenient. what impressed me was i had left my sunglasses behind ,which they found later and shipped back to me in india .we will definitely be back when in singapore next.

Marina Bay Sands is the best hotel I've ever stayed at.  "Never Settle", David Beckham says, and with Marina Bay Sands, you feel like you're far from settling.  The room we stayed at was gorgeous with views of the bay and the city.  The hotel is connected to the MRT which is convenient for getting anywhere in the city.  In fact, the hotel is situated within walking distance to many shops, a casino, and Gardens by the Bay, a main tourist attraction in Singapore.  The best part about the hotel is the infinity pool.  Even though it is crowded throughout the day, you are always able to get your own spot for nice pictures.  Anyone who is visiting Singapore should book at least one night at Marina Bay Sands as the pool with its amazing view is worth the hotel fare alone.  I will…

This hotel is beautiful, and we were even treated to a free upgrade! Great start! The pool is stunning, well worth the view.  I would have given four stars but it's let itself down on the customer service aspect. Once I'd checked out, after settling all bills - they then took an extra couple of hundred dollars out of my account! I've sent numerous emails and a copy of my bank statement but no one is getting back to me. Obviously this has now affected my onward travel and it's very unprofessional from such a prestigious hotel.  So be warned of this if you don't have any extra money to be losing to this hotel!

Have now stayed 3 times at MBS and love the resort with it's amazing roof-top facilities. However must say that on my most recent stay have noticed that the rooms are starting to look a bit tired and with room rates rising are not the same value as they were 12 months ago

Just an amazing experience. The infinity pool was amazing. The food at the club was amazing. The hotel itself was jaw dropping. The views were just divine. The staff were friendly. The location was amazing. The money you spend is worth every cent. Rates are not cheap. No other hotel I have stayed in even comes close to this.

We have visited this hotel as we were attracted by its pool, and by the tropical paradise image that was portrayed on its website. Unfortunately reality was sadly far from publicity, and we faced a disastrously handled pool where management is only interested in thouroughly checking your entitlement as a guest to access the area but then nothing is done to ensure the comfort of guests. The pool was terribly overcrowded by extremely noisy people behaving on the edge of disorderly conduct, without a lifeguard in sight (his chair was empty during the whole time we were there). All beach chairs were taken, either by people or by casually abandoned towels that nobody bothered removing. We managed to take two seats almost outside the pool area and near a noisy ventilation duct, but…

Beware of highway noise, at least on lower floors. The view from the pool is nice, but the pool itself is just so so. You can't swim. Overall, it's a huge hotel but not so nice. I would not rate it 5 stars.

An amazing hotel that is mind blowing from A to Z. Just a great expirience to spend a few days in Singapore and use this hotel as your base camp. In all options it was a perfect stay. There is nothing to comment negative at and the roof top is a must see at night!

Everything was great! The staff are amazing:) the infinity pool is awesome! We love it! If you stayed in the hotel you can access the view deck for free as well. You will not get bored because the Mall is just at the ground floor. Our room was overlooking the famous Garden by the bay😊

My partner and I stayed in Singapore for 2 nights at Marina Bay Sands. This hotel was incredible from the moment we walked in. Short drive from the airport. We had stunning views from our room, the service and staff were all lovely, and there was so much to do and see within this hotel. Restaurants and the bar on the top deck are a must do if it's a special occasion, the food is delicious and the view is breathtaking. We will definitely be back to stay at Marina Bay Sands again.

Everything is big!! Loved our stay here, fabulous restaurants and shopping - loved every minute...The pool -  divine with the accompanying views! Would highly recommend if you want to enjoy the luxury on your anniversary or honeymoon as the rates aren't cheap but certainly worth every cent! Enjoy!!

Stayed here on a stopover to Bali in July '15 - from the moment we arrived we loved this hotel. Yes, it's big and has the feel of a 'Vegas' hotel but it is very clean, very modern and the staff we encountered very friendly. Breakfast was amazing, a lot of choice including, Indian, Dim Sum and there was even a guy carving a shoulder of ham! And the pool at the top......very nice to be in the pool watching the sun set over Singapore! Would definitely return on next visit to that part of the world.

great view at day and night but it's overpriced. I hope the pool open 24 hours because there were so many people and children. The refrigerator has auto-paid system. so if you pick up any product from refrigerator, it will be charged. For your own refrigerator, they will charge $10 per day.

We were upgraded but was not told that the price would be a lot higher (maybe we should have thought to ask as you don't get anything for free).Overall an excellent place to stay. Close to the Gardens which is absolutely amazing.

Ppl from information are polite. .pool on top is great. Service is good for breakfast.nice ppl there too.beautiful view from top. The restauran in 57 floor is great. Kudeta bar is great too. Amaizing place to stay in singapore. Lots of shops too. Walking distance to garden by the bay.

My husband and I spent one night at the Marina Bay Sands last week! It was on my bucket list, and as we were travelling to Thailand from Melbourne, we thought we'd have a stop over in Singapore. We have been visiting Singapore for the past 39 years, and have experienced the enormous changes in what was once a beautiful and charming Asian Colonial city! We are sad to see it has mostly been lost in its modernisation, but it is still a great stop over.  Our room at The Marina Bay Sands on the 48th floor with a glorious view across the city was beautiful! The room was enormous and attention to detail first class! But sadly that's where the attention to detail stops! Arriving at 4.30 in the afternoon, I decided to go up to the pool, to have a drink and watch the sun set! What I found…

I arrived at 12.15pm (Saturday, 11 July 2015) and was directed to go to the Club Floor & Suites check in at Tower 1. The young sweet innocent looking lady manning the Club & Suites check in counter at the lobby is a real b%^**! She refused to check me in by giving silly excuses that no rooms available! Told me to come back at 3pm! I told her I've stayed in many hotels & even MBS many times before and I've never faced this issue. I told her ok - can I sit and wait at the Club Lounge till 3pm? She said NO, I cannot. She told me to go walk around the hotel (I have 2 huge luggages with me).  After 25 mins of being super sweet with her & she continued standing her ground, I left.   I then asked another person in security which other places I could check in for Club guests. Security…

You must stay in this hotel during any stay in Singapore.  It is very expensive, and I did it juts for the pool on the top, but it is so worth it.  We actually got upgraded to an orchid suite for free upon check in, which consisted of this ginormous room bigger than our apartment at home.  The room had 2 bathrooms, a huge living area, a huge bedroom, and a balcony that looks like something out of these reality TV shows you can throw a huge party on...yes, it was that big.  The view was even good on the 4th floor and we could see Gardens by the Bay outside and across the street.  As for the pool...absolutely breathtaking.  We easily found our way up there, to the 57th story, and walked the entire length of the pool, which took 5 minutes from one end to the other.  The pool was…

My second visit and just as special as the first! Great experience to swim in the pool and lookout at sunset is amazing. I love looking at Singapore lit up at night and the rooms (Premium Deluxe) with twin doubles was perfect for us two mums with daughters. Like being in one of the big hotels in Vegas...self contained city! One special 24 hours!

We were upgraded, even though being on our first stay. The room was spacious, had a great harbour view and the view from the world famous pool is gigantic.  Furthermore, this property will frustrate you,   - Overcrowded with mainly asian tourists - overcrowded, loud pool deck - construction going on on the pool deck - massive (!) queues for checking in and out - massive queues for the breakfast  It's a once-in-a-lifetime stay but prices are way too steep when you are not about the view from the pool. Good alternatives would be the SO Sofitel nearby, offering more value for the money (but not the great view from the pool)

The best swimming pool ever on the 57th floor. The staff are unexpectedly good and very helpful. A trip to Singapore is worthless without staying here. You must stay a night here so you can experience the pool and the lavish facilities. The Shoppes is also very good. See the fireworks on Marina Bay at night. Visit the Art and Science Museum too!

Service: average Rooms: good but air conditioning not cold enough  View: excellent (but u ain't gonna stay in the room 24/7 right?) Accessibility: above average Price: look, its a prestigious hotel so don't expect it to be cheap Places to visit (within walking distance of between 5 minutes to 25 minutes): - Singapore Flyer (Ferris wheel) - 10 minute walk - Helix Bridge - 5 minute walk (Please visit at night to capture the beautiful lightings) - Science Museum - 5 minute walk - Marina Bay - 5 minute walk (there is a show. twice a night. check with front office) - Casino - 1 minute sprint (if u feel rich, you'll poorer after that. just kidding.. gd luck) - Marina Bay Sands Shopping - 5 minute walk - Skybridge / Skypool (1 minute, depends on which floor u stay) - Gardens by the Bay…
Excellent! Totally Superb. We really enjoyed our stay in Marina Bay Sands. The infinity pool is so amazing.

We stayed here one night for a staycation to make full use of the facilities.  It was nice that we could check-in before the official check-in time. I didn't like it so much that no one explained the hotel features to us. For example I had to call them later just to find out where and when breakfast was. No one told us that we always have to bring all room keys when using the pool. The guy at the pool entrance actually made me go back to my room and bring the second key. Really annoying, especially because we had a small baby with us.  The pool is probably the most famous in the world. And surprisingly it is completely crowded during the day. Not so enjoyable. We came back in the early morning and it was better. Nevertheless, a nice experience.  It was my wife's birthday and I…

The highlight of this hotel is the location and the pool. If you are in Singapore, definitely stay here for a couple of nights. The pool is a unique experience, the bar at night is great and you have the best view in Singapore! You can also see all the Marina Bay attractions, definitely worth the money! The rooms are standard for a four-star hotel, the best part is floor to ceiling windows with the view of the bay and downtown Singapore. I have really enjoyed my stay, this hotel is an experience in itself due to the views you get. Amazing!

I book the Orchard Suite with City View in Mid. June at Agoda.com for my son's Birthday. When I checked on 15th July, I got the Orchid Suite room on 19th Floor on Tower 1 but was shock when I went into the room, it is much smaller than the Orchard Suite I stay earlier, I complained to Front Office Mgt. and Erricca Tan, the Guest Service Executive was kind enough to change us to a bigger Suite, which is the same as my previous visit on 52th Floor on Tower 3. Everything went well and my family was greatly appreciative with the entire arrangement. the staff is hospitable, pleasant and very nice to meet all our requests. This is a hotel that will all out to satisfy its regular guests. We will definitely be back.

Stayed here in June on vacation. I would strongly recommend this hotel absolutely amazing place and exquisite service... Was a delight to stay and will recommend to anyone staying to upgrade to a club room 😄🙏  best hotel in Singapore for aure

If you don't mind splurging, MBS is a must stay in Singapore, even for a night. Being a huge hotel, expect a long queue to check-in and check-out. A deposit is required and I suggest the use of credit card so that you can enjoy the express check-out at the end of your trip. The room was alright but the view are stunning especially during sunset and sunrise. While the infinity pool is quite popular, it can get crowded at times. Do remember to bring along your key card per adult to gain access the pool and observatory area.  Overall, I enjoyed my stay at MBS.  My full review here: http://lonelytravelog.com/2015/07/12/review-marina-bay-sands-hotel-singapore/

My wife, daughter and myself travelled to Singapore en-route to the UK. We had 3 days there and during that time we visited the Marina Bay hotel, having been to Singapore a couple of times prior to this trip but never visited this incredible hotel. This time we did ! what an experience that was... the views of Singapore from the roof gardens were quite stunning. From the restaurant at the summit you can see the 'Infinity Pool' that is available to the hotel guests... very different ! We had a couple of glasses of wine and a couple of snacks which were excellent but definitely on the dear side. My take on that was ' we were sitting in paradise with a million dollar view so who cares if you spend a few dollars more than you would normally ? ' If you tell the porters at the base of…

We got a room in tower 3, facing the sea. The room was decent size, clean. it had a balcony, giving a very beautiful view of the Garden by the Bay.  The thing to die for in this hotel is the swimming pool on the top.  Otherwise, the hotel is a bit over-rated.

We stayed in the club rooms at around $700AUD per night after ++. So you need to make sure you get your monies worth.   The good stuff........  Transfer was exceptional in a top of the range Merc ($206AUD) it was a special occasion so we splashed out.   Check-in was very easy with VIP treatment. We were met at the door of our limo, and taken directly to our room, our bags followed quickly. We were made to feel very special, passport and credit cards etc all done in our room.  The rooms are extremely spacious and the city view is magnificent. Definitely world class. (42nd floor)  The roof deck is stunning, even with the renovation happening it was just stunning. A little crowded at times but on the whole very enjoyable.   Breakfast in the club lounge (level 55) was faultless and…

Found everything at the hotel average except for convenience for fine dining, casino and shopping for branded goods. They can improve a lot more on their room deco, toiletries and add on the finer touches. Might get a bit crowded sometimes and it doesn't feel as exclusive as the price suggests.

The location is very nice, with great access to a shopping mall and a metro station. Furthermore, the architecture and the view is incredible. However, I didn't like the pool as there were too many people who are desperate to take a photo, and the lobby was also packed with tourists who tries to speak over each other and it was like a chaos. Also, the service was quite poor, as I called for a room cleaning and it still didn't come two hours later due to the fact that there are over 2500 rooms to serve. Definitely worth staying for once, but in comparison with the hotels I've previously stayed like Ritz-Carlton and the Raffles, it's not quite the hotel you would want to spend your time in Singapore. I hope the hotel prohibits photos on the pool and make a chargeable photography…

We picked out the hotel online based on price and amenities without realising just how unusual the design and layout of this hotel is.  It is futuristic to look at and vast inside.    Although we had booked for two adults and two teenage children we were told on check-in that we should upgrade to ensure enough space - which was disappointing though in fairness the hotel helped us sort something out.  The furnishing of the room was high quality and breakfast buffet was a good standard.  Room service worked well.  With its skyline view the rooftop pool was amazing, though don't go there if you like peace and quiet.  Water quality was not the best.  There is a sense of something new and exciting about this hotel, but for us we prefer a more personal touch.

Stayed at the premiere suite for 1 night at the 36th floor. Overall I can say that it met my expectations given the price for the night. The food at the skating rink was pricey for ordinary food. Te room itself was satisfactory. It has a large bed and nice view of the gardens by the bay. Toiletries are adequate. Facilities are good. The pool was not bad. Quite crowded even in the early morning.
you have to go by elevator at the 59th floor and have a great view. But the bar is very expensive. The pool is only available for hotel guests.

We are a family of 4 and have stayed in the hotel for a day and night. We found the staff members very nice and efficient, and the rooms were very spacious. We stayed on the 35th floor of Tower one. Soon after we checked in, we could smell the strong cigarett smell in the corridor and some smell inside the room. I am a person particularly sensitive to cigarett smell and easily get headache because of it. So, I openned the door towards the balcony in the hope the air could get better. Once the door was closed and the air conditionning was on, the cigarett smell started again. I called the express service desk and the person on the line was very apologetic and sent somebody upstairs to refresh the air. The person also believed the cigarett smell must have come from the air…

I didn't stay there however I went there with my family for a drink and a snack to checkout the view and it was well worth the money. As much as it was amazing to look at, I don't think I would like to stay there. It seems a bit too busy and I wouldn't think it would be relaxing. I would recommend going to the C'est la vie bar and having a drink and a snack to appreciate the view! What an amazing place!

Great location, great room. only downside there was construction in the pool area when we were visiting and it was very very noisy and would ruin the whole holiday mood while you're chilling at the pool you couldn't hear yourself think from all the noise. But other than that, everything else was well worth it. get ready to spend LOTS of money if you're planning to dine inside the hotel. Casino is really nice too.

Stayed for 2 nights at Tower 3, floor 37, the view was incredible from the balcony...facing the gardens by the bay....could even see and hear the evening show from the room. as far as the hotel is concerned, honestly, not too happy...there were huge queues for check in, luggage took 40 minutes to deliver to my room, and this was a problem not just with me, but with a few other people in the same tower... the bathrooms were big, but no bath tubs...the toiletries were typically some chinese brand (didnt look luxurious to me!)..went twice to the pool, but couldnt enter..it was like a fish pond! incredibly full.... the sky park is something nice during sunset hours...can have a drink and nibbles outside if you wish..

I stayed for 1 night in a standard room which was very spacious. Although it was only level 11 the view was gorgeous with festive lights show after dark. The shower cabin was huge - you could dance in it. Sufficient lighting everywhere, you can have all lights or only desk light or nigh lights, etc. Views from the pool area are very impressive. Excellent service. I arrived around 8 am and the room was not ready but receptionist registered me, provided advice on where to leave the luggage, suggested use of swimming pool on level 57. At 9 am I received an email that the room was ready. During check-in for the room itself I requested later checkout due to a conference session that clashed with the normal checkout time. The reception lady (I think her name was Vicky) checked the…

If you have been to Las Vegas you have been to the MBS. It’s big, its loud it’s full of middle class families with a lot of kids.  The hotel has 2600 rooms so you would think two people per room or about 5000 guests. NO…..there are 4,6,8 people per room so you have to fight 10,000 to 12,000 people in the hotel.  The wait for the elevators are nightmarish during the basic rush hours. The lines snake into the lobby.  The pool on 57, while it is a highlight and the views are pretty cool, is packed with hundreds and hundreds of people. It is a F…king nightmare. There is not enough chlorine in the world to kill the germs that have to be in that water.  Service is basically nonexistent. There is nothing personal or exceptional about being a guest here. It is pure numbers. You are one…

We stayed here for two nights on our honeymoon and had a lovely time. The rooms were very spacious and we paid a little extra to make sure we got a bay view of all the skyscrapers which was both amazing at day or at night. I think we were on the 30ish floor.   The hotel is huge, biggest I've ever stayed in. You could just literally walk around it for hours. The roof top pool is a must for anyone staying there, with it's infinity views over the city making for some excellent photos, any time of day.   The casino in this place is also a must do. It apparently has up to 25,000 people going through it most evenings and is based on three floors. It has more gaming tables than you can shake a stick at. The minimum bets were £2.50 on roulette and £12.50 on Black Jack. Despite not…

I had an excellent week at the Marina Bay Sands. The hotel itself is a site to behold: innovative architecture and stylish decor. The Rise restaurant was consistently high in quality and the staff were very friendly and among the most attentive I have come across. Additionally, the chef was so helpful with regards to my allergies, personally walking me through each dish at the buffet.  The hotel's location is great with a MRT subway and it is also attached to a luxury shopping mall.  The gym is state of the art and the view from the Skypark is incredible. The infinity pool on the 57th floor is an experience of course, but due to the many visitors enjoying it, it is rather like an oversized paddling pool in which not much actual  swimming can be done. However, this minor caveat…

Stunning (large) hotel with an amazing pool.  Room was great, view amazing, bed superb, staff good, food great.  By far the best thing here though is the pool, worth the stay just for that.    Hotel is quite busy and checkout was a slight pain, with issues with billing.

Place to rejuvenate you completely. Absolutely class beyond compare, in all aspects. Right place for family entertainment, lovely garden side view, clean ambience, great shopping options, continental variety of food stations, & warm greetings by staffs of all departments. For me it was a total VALUE(worth) PACKAGE. last but not infinity POOL no words, all must experience

I've just finished my trip to Singapore and it was great. Singapore is very friendly, clean, expensive country. One of my best experiences was staying at Marina Bay Sands hotel, the most spectacular hotel in Singapore. From the beginning to the end was all great. It was easy to make reservation from Vietnam without any deposit, I got replies very quick and full of detail needs. When I came it was also very welcomed. During my stay, all my request was satisfied with friendly, helpful staff. The most interesting thing is the Infinity Pool on 57th floor. Swimming there is one of the most interesting things to do in the world. Definitely will come back.

The Marina Bay sands could get really crowded and for good reason.  It is very near a popular attraction in Singapore which is the Gardens by the bay where you could visit the Flower Dome and the Cloud Dome.  The highlight of the hotel however is the Infinity pool on the 57th floor, just make sure to go there early in the morning to avoid the crowd.

After arriving at the hotel after our delayed red eye flight we were greeted by the friendly reception staff. The check in was a breeze (8.00am Thursday) and we were over the moon when we were able to check in early and go straight to the room.  We were in tower three on the 46th floor with breathtaking city views. As we opened the door to the room the curtains opened to and revealed the view which I thought was quite welcoming.  The hotel amenities were impressive with a beauty station/work station set next to the window with a fair anount of natural lighting. The kingsize bed was so comfy, the room and bathroom were spacious (with lovely shower gel, shampoo and conditioner provided)   We decided to treat ourselved to buffet breakfast at Sky on 57 (reviewed seperately) then…

After all the hype, my 11 year old son and I were not disappointed. Check in was easy, long walk to our tower but that's due to the sheer size of the place! When we got to our room, the TV wasn't working but it was fixed within minutes. Definitely upgrade to the club room with breakfast. You will not go hungry ever!  Free breakfast, free afternoon tea from 2 to 4pm, free drinks and snacks from 5 to 7pm. Food is amazing and the service is incredible. Would come here again, if we could ever afford it again!

I have chosen this hotel for this wonderful pool. It is really surprise me. I did not regret of it. Highly recommended others choose it for holiday. Except pool, the room is tidy and clean. It is quite a good place to stay.

The rooms are lovely and big and  Well furnished-great air con and television service-attached to a huge designer mall with great Restaurants by world name Chefs. Very very busy which made for a long queue to check in and even Then could only get one of the two rooms-the other not freeing up To 4.30.   Every member of staff We're delightful and friendly with One exception being the lady Manager of the night time buffet Who was non smiling and disdainful -certainly thought her position was 'above us' the paying Guest....infinity pool on 57 floor Incredible....A very nice hotel

It was a grat experiece to be at this hotel because it has one of the best atractions, the infinity pool over 57 floor. I didn't give it all the points when I gade it becase I didn't like that this very big hotel with a lot of people coming in and out, doesn't have a lobby where you can sit in confortable chairs if you have to wait for some reason.

This is the total hotel experience all in one. A wide range of restaurants, great access to shops but the star attraction is the rooftop pool. It just has to be done. Note that if you take a suite you can gain access to the executive club areas.

The pool is amazing.  300 yards + long with one adult section.  Chairs a limited so get there early.  Worth the splurge for the Club level, great breakfast and evening cocktails and appetizers. The room was very spacious with top of the line amenities.

We had a short stay at Marina Bay Sands mainly to enjoy the view and the swimming pool. Hoped it will be great experience, unfortunately it wasn't that great. To be fair, all the staff were very friendly and trying hard to make a good impression. Few main problems where: - overcrowded swimming pool - if that is the main attraction I would think it should be maintained in a way for a guest to be able to enjoy it. It was extremely crowded and noisy, even late in the evening and early in the morning. - there is a construction side just next to the swimming pool on the roof. I do understand that the workers have to do their job but again, I would hope the work is schedule so that the guest can enjoy being on the roof without constant noise coming from just a few meters away. - air…

It was raining when we went to the Sky Park at the Marina Bay but it did not dampened our mood to enjoy the view that was in store for us. Up there and looking at the world below inspire my family to travel more. The one pass ticket was quite expensive but if you will miss going there then you haven't gone to Singapore.

The room was clean and tidy as you would expect and we had a great view from the 22nd floor from tower 2 looking directly over the 'gardens by the bay'. The Mini bar is pressure sensitive and you will be billed for any moved or used items. I recommend calling guess services and paying a one off fee of S$10 for your own mini fridge to stock up on your own food and drinks as we did. Unfortunately the closest convenience stores are a 7eleven at the Bayfront MRT station entrance from the MBS (very very small store) and a Cold Storage in the MBS shopping complex. All are a bit of a walk from the hotel. There is another 7eleven in the shopping complex at bay level and another one at the furthest MRT exit from the hotel. The room air conditioner is linked to the balcony door and as a…

We booked the hotel for a weekend Getaway with the Family, we were unfortunate to experience the Jakarta Airport Fire as we're about to leave, so our flight was delayed by 12 hours. I was in communication with MBS Front Office via email, they were quick to response and understand our situation.  After a very long frustrating ordeal at the airport we finally leave... MBS held our reservation, and was kind enough to upgrade our room!  that helped my family ease back to relax... we totally enjoyed the short trip, the pool was awesome... my kids loved it!! We'll definitely will go back here!!

The hotel is great for business purpose because it is right besides the convention centre, the place to deal with business matters.  Also you do not have to go beyond the hotel vicinity to do such a leisure activities.  Just a trip up the elevator for a sky pool and stunning view bars, or a walk down the hallway to do some gambling at the best casino in Asia.

Generally the stay was good based on the following factors: 1. Good customer service, from the front desk to the bell boys, everyone has a smile on them. You treat them with respect, they will be open to you and assist beyond their service requirements. 2. Great amenities - Skypark, swimming pool, gym and even the hot pool, its all great. Its just that I came across disgusting China patrons who treated the hot pool as a foam bath, but again nothing much MBS can do against unconsiderate patrons. 3. Food - This is a bit challenging to find reasonable local food at reasonable prices. Just note, you can walk down to Marina Square via Helix Bridge and cut through the park, where you will fund abundance varieties of food, drinks and entertaiment joints! Head there if you seek value…

I have visited Singapore on a few occasions along with my wife. It really is a spectacular place and such an ideal place to stopover for a day or two on the way from Australia/NZ to Europe. There are a great deal of things to do and see, hence we returned on more than one occasion.  We have always admired the Marina Bay Sands from afar - it truly is iconic in the skyline of Singapore. This time, we decided we had to stay there - just a one off treat!  Just entering the lobby was an experience - just so lavish and HUGE. We have stayed at plenty of nice hotels and resorts - but this was architecture on steroids. Simply amazing.  The check in process was seamless and we were upgraded to a huge suite - we were delighted.   The suite was sublime - from decor to layout , to automatic…

Beautiful hotel but too crowded. The best part of the hotel is the Infinity Pool which overlooks Marina Bay. We were there for 3days 2nights in July, the weather was unfortunately hazy. Although we were high up in the pool, we couldn't see as far as we thought we would.  The view from our room was stunning, we faced the Gardens by the Bay. Wifi was a bit slower than we expected. Service was great, checkout was a breeze! However, I don't think we would return to this hotel. Too overcrowded for our taste!

this is one of the many attractions that Singapore has to offer. Amazing view over looking all of Singapore from the top of the hotel. While the inside offers variety of stores you can shop at and mutlicultural YUMMY food!

Went following a  visit to the gardens at bay. Was very pretty, and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Singapore.  We did go at night, it was easy to get to via the metro, the Singapore skyline was stunning.  And there are restaurants conveniently right on the bay.

So it's my second time in Singapore this year and this place never fails to amaze me!  It's a must visit place, classy, modern, chic, edgy architecture and it provides all sort of services. I have not stated overnight but I have visited the top deck, the swimming pool, the mall, the park and the outside court. Stunning place!

A must stay during your visit in Singapore. In the heart of the city with world class infrastructure and excellent value for money the Sky lounge and terrace Pool make a amazing place to stay in. With a multi million brands in the mall attached you won't feel like going anywhere else to shop. The sprawling Bay Garden attached is just fabulous. Singapore is best with a stay at Marina Bay Sands. Stay at the higher level. We just got upgraded by paying few extra dollars and got a beautiful city view room at 50th floor. Lovely pool side snacks is also available.

This evening paradise for all kinds of visitors is the most sought after destination.one can enjoy the beautiful sight of sunset,go round the bay and experience the unforgettable moments spent there .there are plenty of places for a good dinner thereafter .as I write this review ,I am happy to record that my son ,daughter in law and lovely 14months old grand son have spent time in marina bay today and have endorsed my experience !what a coincidence

Check in was easy, staff friendly and the hotel was just awesome. The pool was the highlight; breakfast expensive but good. Cocktails upstairs at night were pretty ordinary and exceptionally expensive at $57 for two! We got a late check out which was great. If you book a basic room and upgrade at the front desk it will be cheaper than pre-booking. You won't get the room cheaper on N external booking site either so just book direct if you can afford it. Our superior city view room was about $650 a night from memory.

This high rise is quite remarkable. A little daunting to look at but wow what a feat of engineering. Inside is actually great too. It is big though and you can get lost trying to find your way around for the first day. The pool bar on the top is to die for. The alcohol like all places in Singapore is very expensive. Sky on 57 is pretty special but is ultra $$$$$$. Once in a lifetime view though - superb - and for all its business the service was still good.

Stayed here for one night. We only justified spending the amount of money we did for the view. We stayed in a club room on the 38th floor. Fantastic view, especially at night when the skyline of Singapore is all lit up.  We were greeted by the concierge when we arrived and were shown to the check in area, where there was a special line for club rooms so we didn't have to wait too long.  Club facilities were excellent and the service was great. We checked in too late to have the afternoon tea, but the canapés were amazing and drinks were included too. Lots to choose from.  The breakfast was also incredible. We were told there was less to choose from in the club lounge but we thought there was more than enough.  The pool was ok but very busy. I went for a swim at around 7am and…

We spent welcome eve at beach sand when we reached Sinsapore on April 17, 2015. Most attractive tourist for boating, open theatre, food&drinks, shopping and even viewing! The glittering lights of the skyscrapers reflecting on the bay gives a view of a dreamland. Enjoy, enjoy & enjoy!

Expect no welcome greeting from staff - no one will even bother to open your car door or help you with the luggage unless you go looking for the staff.  Checkin will take a long time as you should expect long queues. You should also expect checkin staff to sometimes be discriminating. Some guests get water asked and other don't.  Rooms are good sized however the showers are like motels in New York and it's the hotels commitment to being "green" they maintain low pressure showers through tout the hotels. I did not feel fresh after my showers.  Air conditioning in this part of the world should have a chilling effect but their a/c s are designed not to go below 20 degree Celsius which is a put off for me.  Kettle, tea bags were missing when we checked in but were duly replenished…

No doubt about it, Marina Bay Sands Complex is one of the most amazing spots to be and visit during a stay in Singapore! The hotel itself is a mega complex with its three towers and multiple shops options, a trully maginificent architectural landmark that will remail forever in your memories, mainly after a plunge in the iconic swiming pool on the 57th floor. Rooms are big enough, very well appointed with all necesary aminities including the extra touch of a 5 stars hotel. I found a little bit dissapointing the walk in shower in the bathroom, where water presure were not as good as one could expect at this tipe of property. Please, no hesitate to book a room overlooking the singapore bay, that will assure you a more memorable stay! Personnel is very welcoming and attentive, just…

Amazing views, scenery customer service. A great experience overall. Just an immaculate structure and of course amazing food beverages and also swimming pools and shipping. Its just a tranquil paradise

We were there for a business conference my husband was attending.  The hotel is large and lovely, very clean, great staff.  Smiles greet you everywhere.  Our room (16th floor) was ordinary by their standards (no upgrade for us!) but very large-sized, great firm bed, lovely bedding, towels, bathroom.  We had a balcony and overlooked Gardens By The Bay.  Was concerned about the casino, but its location is very discreet and subtle, unlike casino hotels in Las Vegas, US, which tend to make the casino very in-your-face.  Has its own MRT station and also huge beautiful mall.  We enjoyed it and were treated well.  The 57th floor infinity pool is amazing---never seen so many people taking selfies in the pool in my life!!  Not scary at all, if you are concerned with that.  At edge of…

Have stayed at this hotel for one night during our trip to Singapore last December during Christmas holidays. Very big hotel with too many guests. Never felt welcome at the hotel. Had to queue up for almost 20 minutes to be seated to have breakfast. The skydeck is fabulous so is the infinity pool. But thats almost all of it. With such high prices, one expects much better services. Yes the rooms are clean & nicely appointed but that is the basics for any 5 star hotel.

The Marina Bay Sands is all that you'd expect it to be, the rooms, the infinity pool, lobby and restaurants make it a worth while stay and kind of the mecca for a visit to Singapore.  The shopping is of course every fashionista with big wallet's dream.

Hotel is great, service is very good and there's a few restaurants and bars to go to within the hotel. Also a shopping centre and casino on campus which along with the rooftop pool means you really don't have to leave the hotel if you don't want to. The pool is the best bit - it stays open until late (11pm) and is stunning night and day. Worth the trip alone.

What a breath-taking hotel!! We stayed in this hotel in Christmas time, I have to say we been well travel around the world and stayed in some excellent hotels, but noting can compared with Marina Bay Sands Hotel. very close to Singapore main attractions, and shopping malls. The hotel lobby was so big you can easily lost. Hotel concierges was extremely helpful with our bags, Check in was fast as we booked club room. the room giving to us was big; light and view of the Garden By the Bay, what a view! The package we bought was including Cocktail buffet; Afternoon tea and breakfast, I have to say noting disappointed us, Foods was great; services was excellent and the view is breath taking as the restaurant was next to the Infinity Pool. THE POOL- this is the main attraction…

+ Obviously the swimming pool!  + The free upgrade (Girlfriend had her bday),  + The premium room with the city view from the main room and the view over the gardens from the bathroom (great to take a bath the view over the Gardens by the bay) + Staff was really friendly.  + Cherry on top of the cake, we could witness the rehearsal of the Singapore Air Force whilst chilling in the pool. Quite impressive!  + Restaurant/Bar KuDeTa. A bit pricey but good value for price, especially when compared to other restaurants in town, which don't boast the same view.   - Check-in/out time, which doesn't allow you to enjoy the pull to its fullest, especially when you book for one night only.  - The crowd. Pool is overcrowded, with kids jumping every where. There is an adult only section but…

It's the best hotel I've ever visited. I've been to more than 15 countries, but this one is the best. Please, don't grudge your money, visit just for a one night. To feel this - is costs that amount. Early Check-in and late check-out without additional paying. They've gave me a card to get to the swimming-pool, before I could get to my room (9AM).

I love the pool in high floor..amazing places...very high class...delicious food..beutiful view..great location..but high price..stunning room,very clean..hoply I can back to spend my holiday in there
